Reviews.Title: “Shoe box”
Reviews.Author: scottmaxted
Reviews.Content: Room very small, 521 No room to walk around bed and no curtains. Blind was broken Dated and in need of a refurb Won't be back

Reviews.Title: “What a shame...”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the hotel looked fantastic! Very smart and full of promise, what a shame when we opened the bedroom door! The first thing that I noticed was that there was no light for the room. Hmmm, yes there was a light switch but no light, not even a socket to put a bulb in, the room was entirely lit by 3 small lamps from the 1950's. But surely this wasn't that bad, as the room was so small my mobile phone could have sufficed to illuminate the whole room. Air con was supplied by a fan (also from the 50's...), and the window only opened a few inches. The bathroom looked nice, however the toilet didn't properly flush and filled to the brim every flush. Both myself and my girlfriend found that by our third night, we had come out in suspicious rashes on our skin where we had been in contact with the bedding. Perhaps the most worrying thing has to be when the head maid, who obvioulsy is only doing her job, helps herself to walk into your room whenever she chooses (in this case early evening...) without knocking. Yes the location is great, just 1 min walk to Tottenham Court Road and 5 mins walk to Covent Garden, but at £100 a night (without breakfast....!), I wouldn't recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in London”
Reviews.Author: gearoidoneill
Reviews.Content: Great location, right at the end of Oxford St, and right beside an underground station - extremely handy!! Stayed on the 3rd floor i think in a "corner suite" - roon was a bit small but understandable due to location. It was a bit noisly but again you have to remember where you are!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms small, hot and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Shellh123
Reviews.Content: Just returning from a trip to London & would not recommend this hotel. The rooms are very very small, incredibly hot and air conditioning is so noisy you could not keep it on while you are in the room . The bathrooms are tiny with no toiletries and beds the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in. On the plus point it is in a great position for Tottenham Court Road but so are many other hotels that I'm sure are better. The staff were friendly breakfast was a good help yourself buffet But I would never return

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Money, I wasted mine, dont waste yours!”
Reviews.Author: tara b
Reviews.Content: If you choose to stay here, don't say I didnt warn you! I booked a month in advance on a £99.00 deal, the usual price for this room was apparently £150.00, the hotel was in a good location for what I needed but there is where the good points end. I booked a Double Room, they "up graded me to a tripped" (now I know your thinking, WOW what are you moaning about), the bed was smaller than a standard double and no way 2 people could sleep comfortably in it, the room was pokey and if you were clostrophobic then neither the room or bathroom would have been good for you. we called reception and they changed our room with no argument, though they were adement I had booked a tripple, ( I didnt, I had teh conformation!) we were polite about it, so we went back down to collect the new key, on approaching the desk we spoke to the receptionist who was sarcasic about the bed size telling us that it was about an inch bigger (it was at least half a foot or more bigger) she also told us that the room used to be a deluxe but they had changed it to a standard. So we were actually looking forward to a better room BIG MISTAKE, if I had a cat and swung it, it would have severe brain damage, the toliet when filling up after flushing made a loud tapping noise and was no bigger than the claustrophobic one we had just left behind, the airconditioning unit was out of the dark ages and made so much noise a jet landing would have been quieter. The window in the room only opened 6 inches and faced a wall. We were not staying in the room, lucky for us we were going out which i was glad of. On returning to the hotel you had to wait for the lift as they were always full up, 4 lifts for 600 rooms! though on the positive side, they were bigger than our room! Once we got back to the room it was still feeling stuffy though we had opened the window (to its full 6 inchs) so we had to have a fan on, it was not until I discovered a heater under the vanity unit, behind a dirty cage that was still on, and you got it! the valve was broken so it could not be turned off, so we had to try and sleep with the fan running all night. My advice, book a Premier Inn, there rooms are 100 times better, you get a King Bed, bathroom with a bath and space to swing your brain damaged caty and poilte staff, I know I stay in enough of them when I travel for work, I should have just booked with them, because they are all the same you know what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: blackpoolmanLytham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliantly located yards away from tottenham court road tube station and a short walk to Oxford street. The room was ok the bed a little small and the deep cleaning left a little something to be desired. Breakfast was good although in peek times could be like a canteen. I used the gym at a cost of £5 and a towel charge is £1.50. You can become an instant member of the casino next to the hotel. All in all a good stay

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn’t object to staying here again, but wouldn’t rush to do so either”
Reviews.Author: BigEd2
Reviews.Content: You enter the St Giles Hotel’s marble-lined reception area and encounter the friendly and helpful concierge, and they confirm that your room is available two hours before the earliest advertised time, and it feels promising. And there are some good things about this hotel. It is very conveniently located, two minutes’ walk from Tottenham Court Road tube. It is clean. The staff are unfailingly friendly and helpful. There is an ironing room, very useful for someone who has just unpacked his dress shirt en route to a formal dinner. And then the irritations start. The “mini-suite” is just big enough for a double bed but although there are switches either side of the bed there is only one bedside light. There is minimal storage and no drawer space, and a large, immobile chair obstructs access to what storage there is. The triple glazed windows do a reasonable job of keeping the traffic noise out but you cannot sleep with the air-conditioning on. The complimentary tea and coffee does not include either decaff coffee or cocoa, so forget about a nightcap. Waiting interminably for the lift from the second floor, I generally concluded that life was too short and went down the stairs instead. The St Giles’ allows its guests concessionary use of the superbly equipped gym at the central YMCA next door. Why does all the literature in the hotel say, and the concierge repeat, the mealy-mouthed formula that there “is a nominal charge for it”? It’s a fiver. That’s not at all unreasonable for a first rate gym in Central London. But you have to guess how much money to take with you, and it’s another irritation. As is the fact that the swimming pool is closed for a fortnight for maintenance work, but they don’t warn you about this in advance, so you roll up with swimming things packed in your suitcase which you won’t be able to use. Yes, I know there is an alternative pool half a mile away, but there is a big difference between having a pool on-site and having to go elsewhere. Breakfast isn’t at all bad (confusingly, having booked room only we were informed that we were entitled to a complimentary breakfast, but I am not complaining) though five somewhat desiccated button mushrooms looked lonely on the plate, and still looked lonely when accompanied by a slight littering of chopped chive. There must be a reason why the complimentary newspapers on offer are the Irish Times and the Irish Independent. I wouldn’t particularly object to staying here again, but the irritations are such that I wouldn’t rush to do so either. Pity, because relatively minor tweaks could make this reasonably priced hotel (£119 a night b&b for two of us) really rather good.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but Great Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: IronstoneIzadora
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night last month for work. The hotel is huge and the rooms are very small, however everything in the room is exceptionally clean. I had a room overlooking Tottenham Court Road which was quite noisy but wasn't too bad. The shower was excellent and the bed comfortable. Staff were friendly; the inhouse Japanese restaurant was exceptional. My only complaint was the breakfast kitchen does not serve toast...

Reviews.Title: “A large hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: thevinnie
Reviews.Content: Are you looking for somewhere in central London that is not too expensive? If so then this hotel is a good fit. The hotel is just steps from Oxford Street and only a bit farther from the London theater district. Staff were very pleasant. The very small room had the basics required and nothing more. Finding a place to open the suitcase, for example, took some time as the amount of space in the room was so limited. While there were bars and a restaurant, the quality of the food was minimal. This is a very busy hotel that could use something of an update. This hotel is best for those who plan to be out of the hotel most of the day and who plan to use few facilities at the hotel. I would stay again mainly because of its location the the relative value the hotel offers in the high priced central London hotel market.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: mickrandy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times, hotel very good and very clean, rooms a bit small but when in the big metropolis your not in your room that often, reception good, concierge service is brilliant, bar stays open late so you can chill a bit before bed. Would recomend this hotel to anyone, very central so ideal for weekends away

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pita078
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located two minutes away from Tottenham Court road station... it couldn't get any more central. Room, although on the small side, had all the necessities (flat screen tv, tea/coffee making facilities, hairdryer, safe) and was clean. For the price we paid, I was pleasantly surprised. Check in was super fast and we were allowed to check in before the official time since the room was available. Breakfast was good, although it felt a bit like being back queuing in the school's canteen :) The only other hotel facility we used was the baggage holding on the last day and everything went smoothly with staff being extremely courteous. Dominion Theatre is two minutes away... highly recommend watching "We will rock you"!

Reviews.Title: “convenient position, comfotable, yet bustling with all nationalities”
Reviews.Author: misswren
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the st giles hotel recently on a weekend theatre break and was pleasantly surprised at the convenient location just off the tottenham court road within easy walking distance to most major theatres , and great choice of restaurants, bars and shops and a cinema just up the road too. The restaurant for breakfast gets very busy , but it manages to cater for everyone sufficiently . There is a large bar where you can order snacks and the atmosphere was very much like a bar in the city rather than a hotel as its very busy with multitude of nationalities. Overall this is the sort of hotel im happy to stay in, if im not spending too much time in the hotel ! It has a convenient position , but be aware just off the busy main road it can be noisy with traffic at night, if you are in bed early , which fortunately i wasnt ! Overall a very good hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Typical London hotel”
Reviews.Author: floatpoint
Reviews.Content: It's a central as it gets; 30 second walk from Oxford Street, 2 minutes from Covent Garden. Expect no thrills, some rooms have been partly refurbished, but most of the hotel feels like it is in dire need of a touch-up. But this is typical for London; if you want a fresh and clean hotel you have to fork up some 250EUR. First night I went down to the reception to get my room swapped at 3.30 in the morning. The reason? The AC outside my window kept me from sleeping (it was broken). But they gave me a new room instantly, so I have no complaints concerning service. So; my ratings is set compared to hotels in other parts of the world. If I would compare this hotel to other "3 star" hotels in London, the rating might have been higher. But I think that when a hotel in London is 1000 times dodgier than a hostel in Berlin, than the rating should reflect that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Brebs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, the hotel is right next to Tottenham Court road station so easy access to tubes/airport etc. The hotel is just off the end of Oxford street. The hotel was clean, our room looked as if it had been recently renovated. The staff were friendly. We used the online check in so we only had to collect our key from the concierge at the main entrance and then straight to our room, no fuss no queues. The hotel also provided storage for our case after we checked out

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money...”
Reviews.Author: Philvincent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The location was very convenient and the hotel was great value for money. I stayed in an Executive Suite on the 9th floor. The room was spacious, immaculate (recently refurbished) and had great views of London. The room had a sofa, double bed and everything else you could need (iron, safe, TV, fridge etc). The bathroom had a large shower and a bath (it also had a built in TV). The breakfast was good and the staff were friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “holiday short break”
Reviews.Author: eagle5517
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel from the 19th to the 23 of march 2012 very good budget hotel clean and tidy room stayed in a double on the 3rd floor .hotel staff very good and very good location for oxford street only 2min walk and soho only a 10 min walk away and hyde park a 20 min walk if you follow oxford street breakfast at hotel was ok i whould stay at this hotel on my next visit to london you will not have to walk far a london show hotel is only 1 min from underground

Reviews.Title: “Good service, excellent location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kshap
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but adequate. Perfect location - mere blocks from the British Museum, close to Covent Garden, around the corner from the Tube. Helpful staff, full breakfast. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and price”
Reviews.Author: stiffydagold
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Giles at the very beginning of our our trip to Europe and were very happy with our stay so we booked it again for the end of our trip. The location is excellent about 150m from Tottenham Court Rd station (on the central and northern line), 1 block from oxford street and has easy access to most of Londons attractions. The rooms themselves are nothing fancy, the decor is somewhat drab but for the location and price this was no concern at all. We only spent the nights in our hotel room so it was not a problem. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay a few nights in an affordable hotel right in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sarabreeze
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for a weekend stay in March based on three main criteria – location, swimming pool and price. The St Giles is a busy and bustling tourist hotel, located in central London. There’s an NCP car park underneath the hotel and guests receive a discounted rate. Tottenham Court Tube station is a 2 minute walk and Oxford Street/Bond Street is 5 minutes away. Covent Garden is a 20 minute amble and there was plenty of people about when we walked back at about o’clock in the morning. There’s also plenty of black cabs about to take you in all directions. Service throughout the hotel was fine enough, efficient and helpful. Receptionists friendly, requests for more pillows, towels were met with ease. I found the concierge to be particularly good, securing theatre tickets at the last moment at a good price. The rooms were a tad on the small side but clean and comfortable enough. Usual bits to be found - safe, TV, kettle, hairdryer. Rooms were well lit but lack wardrobe space/place to hang/lay clothes. Full breakfast restaurant, buffet style, plenty of choice and food good. There’s also three restaurants, a bar and a lounge area but as there’s such a huge selection of places to eat at nearby we didn’t use this facility. There are ‘pay as you go’ internet spots throughout the ground floor and you can also hook up to the internet in your room at an additional cost. The leisure facility is independently operated by the YMCA and there’s an additional cost of £5 per guest per visit. There’s a 25m indoor pool, sauna/steam room, fitness room with equipment and massage & beauty therapy available. We used the various facilities and found them to be good. I don’t think for the location and price that you could go far wrong here, the cost for a two night stay for five people was £450.00 and we consider this to have been very reasonable value for our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margaretafm
Reviews.Content: I have just spent five nights at this hotel and as always I have had a great stay. The single rooms are quite small but very clean and have everything you need. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the location fantastic and the price very reasonable. I look forward to coming back again when I next visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value, clean but plain”
Reviews.Author: paolao
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times over the years, and the main reason is always the same: can't beat it for the price and its location, right in the heart of London. The rooms are clean, on the small size (welcome to London), plain and anonimous but comfortable. I was on my own and this place is extremely convenient and feels safe. Breakfast wasn't included but there are plenty of cafes around the corner (which are better quality and better value than the hotel's own breakfast place). The only big negative: no free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ialsolikeholidays
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a night at this Hotel, it is the second I have stayed there and cannot fault it. The staff are helpful and friendly, the rooms I have stayed in have been clean and smart. The main attraction for this hotel though is its very convenient location, 2 minutes from tottenham Court Road tube station and minutes walk away from Covent Garden and other attractions. The prices are very reasonable too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable for a short stay...”
Reviews.Author: Roddy M
Reviews.Content: I am currently sitting in the "lazy dog" bar and this is probably my least favourite part of the hotel. It does not know what it is trying to be... It ha old skool, cheesy, music, lots of tacky signage and everything just looks a bit rough. The entrance is actually quite impressive and although the rooms are small they have everything that one needs for a short stay. Wouldn't like to stay much longer than a night or two tho... The location is fantastic though... Staff everywhere, except lazy dog bar, are polite and professional with the best customer service without a doubt being offered in the casino.. :/ Overall not bad and quite reasonably priced too...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Americk
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for my stay in this hotel. Wonderfully central. I found the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: simba1945
Reviews.Content: Staff very good great value £90 for two including great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “good location for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: MohammedJaffar
Reviews.Content: good location for business travelers, close to the train station & asda shopping mall, can't ask for more in this place..

Reviews.Title: “First trip”
Reviews.Author: happyhols1971
Reviews.Content: First trip to London with my daughter.we found hotel to be very convenient for underground travel or theatres.room was spacious and provided all that was needed.high standard of cleanliness too which altogether made an enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine for a London central hotel and a short break”
Reviews.Author: NickyCumbria
Reviews.Content: The Ritz it aint, but then this isn't Ritz prices. I have stayed at the St Giles before. There is everything the traveller needs. Only a few minutes walk to Tottenham Court Road and Goodge Street Underground Stations. Cabs almost constantly outside and busses on Tottenham Court Road too. Easy to walk to most main attractions, or indeed find a "Boris" bike and cycle if you dare. I was warmly welcomed by the Reception team. There is a convenient bar and food to match appetite and pocket. Small but perfectly fine rooms, mine was clean and probably just decorated. Slightly annoying habit of putting spare loo rolls etc, out of reach of the loo! A bit tired in common parts, lifts much in demand at peak times and very noisy fan above the window, so had the window open for a while which was noisy. However, I had walked so far and the bed so comfortable, sleep wasn't difficult. Do use the concierge facilities if needed, very helpful and saves a lot of time and effort...Lots of restaurants handy in Charlotte Street especially, and this is only a couple of minutes away. Enjoy ! Oh and there is car parking opposite, but its pricey...

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast! Soho fun!”
Reviews.Author: Cutebugtravels12345
Reviews.Content: First of all the breakfast was AMAZING! Eggs, meats, cheeses, yogurts, fresh fruits, tons of juice options and coffees! The concierge service was amazing! They helped with every single detail including helping us receive tickets at discounted rates and giving us maps and suggestions on what to eat and where to go! This hotel is all you need - clean and comfortable- place to sleep, shower and get back to London sight seeing! The location was in the heart of the center of London however it was a bit of a walk from the tube- but Only a few blocks from a double decker bus hop on hop off pick up so that made it much more convienent. Also there is a large YMCA connected to it- but you do have to pay about $5 to go every time. Its very nice! No wifi. You have to pay to use their computers per minute.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: felice25
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in February with two grown up children. The location is the bestest ! Nowhere can beat it. Very clean, good-sized rooms by London standards. Helpful, professional staff. Average English breakfast. No lighter continental alternative which is a pity. Never had to wait for lift for more than four minutes and that only in the so -called morning rush hour. Price was very good value. It was our first time but certainly not our last

Reviews.Title: “Not bad......but.....”
Reviews.Author: barthart
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Perfect for a short stay. Staff were polite and helpfull. We were told when we booked in that unfortunately they didn't have any standard double rooms so we would have a free upgrade to a de luxe double room - I then pointed out that it was a de luxe double room that I had actually booked !! The de luxe part was good and consisted of a separate room with a comfortable double sofa, table, TV , dressing table and a miniscule wardrobe.The shower room was small, but did seem to be quite recently modernised. It would however have benefited from some sort of shelf to place our soaps / shampoo etc. The bedroom part was so small we had to walk sideways between the bed and the wall to get in and out of the bed !! We stayed here a couple of years ago and had a standard double room, which had plenty of room round the bed. There was quite a bit of noise from outside, but this is due to the location. If you want the convenience of the location, then the noise bit from the street goes with it - can't really complain about that. Whereas its corridors and bedroom were tired, they were clean in fairness. Overall - great position - staff good - clean. The rest is reflected in the price - if you want a bit more pampering than merely basic, then stay elsewhere but I suspect it will be more expensive. I thought it was a bit pricey, but that is probably down to city prices and location. We would stay here again, based on location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, it's central London so of course the rooms are small for the price!”
Reviews.Author: IanMakinson1
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I didn't check the reviews before booking this hotel as it was just for a business trip and I was running out of time, after reading some of the reviews I was worried because a lot of people were complaining about small rooms.  Well I had a double bed en- suite room & paid £96 for the night, that was good value compared to what else available and although the room was on the small side they are quite adequate, perfectly clean & the bathrooms are fine with good showers and lots of black granite. Only down side I could find was that there was no shaver point in the bathroom. There's no air conditioning either, or none you'd want to turn on because it was so noisy, but then it's also in central London so there's going to be noise one way or the other. The location is excellent though as its just around the corner from the British museum, Oxford street & Soho is only 5 minutes away too.  I only realised after the second night there that I had actually visited the place nearly 30 years ago before it was the St Giles, I'm sure it used to be the central London YMCA back then which would explain the small rooms & the excellent health club facilities linked with the hotel for a small fee, I think run by the YMCA

Reviews.Title: “Well placed good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandie89
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location for visiting London if you want to be able to reach Oxford Street and the theaters around Leicester Square. Its within easy reach of Tottenham Court Road tube St and not far by taxi from Kings Cross Station. We booked tickets and an overnight stay via a theatre booking site and could not have been happier. The room was small but clean and offered the usual amenities, including a hair dryer, kettle, TV etc. The bathroom was tiny but nicely finished, the only disappointment was a luke warm shower. Breakfast was continental or English with plenty of food, but the restaurant area was a bit like a canteen with slightly over zealous clearing staff practically removing your plate before you'd finished but at least there were no dirty plates lying around and the area was clean. Be warned you cant get into your room until 2pm but you can check in and leave your bags with the incredibly helpful concierge service. The hotel bar is as usual expensive we had a glass of wine and a jack daniels and that set us back £14 but the noise from the bar is carefully managed as when you leave you cannot hear it within the hotel. Check out is 11am which with breakfast running from 7.30 to 11am is managable. Overall I would say it was worth the small room and luke warm shower to stay in the location.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed december 2011”
Reviews.Author: Hayleykg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my partners birthday and the location was very good, just at the end of oxford street and easy to find. Restaurants and pubs nearby, rooms a little small and could do with decorating. Had a problem with the light wouldnt work was told someone would come up but didnt so had to tell them again and we then figured out the problem however no staff had came therefore bad service on that front. The staff were a little rude waited to check in and stood for a while whilst staff talked away. I was expecting more considering I had paid over £100 pounds without breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Katherine--xxxx
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Great location, very close to Oxford street. Easy to get to- Tottenham Court Road tube station is a short walk. Close to nice restaurants, convenience stores and shops. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite, concierge staff were excellent when we asked them for directions and information on tourist attractions etc. The bedroom was clean and tidy, perhaps a little bit smaller than most budget hotel rooms, but this was fine. Theres a built in wardrobe so theres plenty of storage room. I would absolutely stay here again, I did a lot of research before booking and it was one of the cheapest hotels in London, definitely excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Jillian D
Reviews.Content: While my room was quite small, that didn't bother me because most of my time was spent out in beautiful London! The staff were incredibly friendly and the morning breakfast buffett was absolutely delicious and very filling! The real seller of this hotel is the location...minutes away from everything I wanted to see....including the theatre district! Clean, great food, friendly staff...love this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: jmacl03
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights from 29th Feb. Booked show and stay. A busy hotel. Reception staff very pleasant. The room was adequate although a bit warm. Bed comfortable. Undisturbed nights sleep. Good shower. Breakfast was self service and very good. Sets you up for a days sight seeing. Location is excellent. Easy walking distance to theatre land or Trafalgar Square. On leaving, the doorman was extremely helpful. He went to the main street to flag us down a taxi cab and helped us with luggage. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a reasonably priced central hotel in London. I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again should I return to London. Travelled from Highlands, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Only plus: location”
Reviews.Author: pjdq
Reviews.Content: I can imagine tourists appreciate this hotel for its location. However, I stayed here on business and did not appreciate the hotel at all. It started after check-in: I couldn't use the elevators as there was a fire alarm, but hotel staff in the lobby encouraged me to use the stairs 'as it was probably a false alarm'. I did consider going up the stairs, but the staircase was very narrow - and flooded by hotel guests coming down because of the alarm. I decided to wait for a while until the chaos cleared. Once in the room, it was really small - even for London standards. Two things I really didn't appreciate: there wasn't a power outlet in the bathroom and the windows had a type of blinds that could not be completely closed. As I went to bed I also realised that - being in the so-called 'West Tower' of St Giles - my room was looking over the very busy Tottenham Court Road. This meant a really bad night with a lot of street noise. I couldn't wait to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Central London”
Reviews.Author: EastCliffCottage
Reviews.Content: Just needing somewhere to sleep for a night, I didn't want to pay £200 for a room. However, I didn't want to stay in a basement in South Kensington either (thats what you normally get for £80 in London) St Giles Hotel was a pleasant surprise. I paid £85 for a room (incl. breakfast) and got a perfectly adequate nights stay. Nothing 5 star about it, but if you want 5 star the Dorchester or similar can be easily booked :-) Overall, the staff were friendly, check-in efficient and the rooms clean and tidy. Breakfast was OK, don't expect a full english. If you normally use a Travel Inn or similar, check this one out as an alternative. Well recommended for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Rack em and stack em”
Reviews.Author: john_ecko
Reviews.Content: This hotel took ages to locate our reservation and finally gave me a room on the first floor. The room was a decent size and clean. this hotel is in a decent location with Tottenham Court Road underground station a few minutes walk away. A clean place to get your head down but its a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brianita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Giles overnight on the 21st Feb. with friends. We had tickets to see We Will Rock You at the Dominion (excellent show!) and decided to make it a shopping / theatre trip. Our booking was made through www.activehotels.co.uk and we opted for Deluxe Rooms as the price differential was so small. When we arrived at the hotel we found we had been upgraded to Executive Rooms at no extra cost. Even though we arrived at 12:30pm the rooms were ready and had adjoining rooms with interconnecting doors (we had not requested adjoining rooms so this was a pleasant surprise). The rooms were on the 10th floor so we had wonderful views over London. Complimentary tea, coffee and water in the room. Plenty of towels and very comfortable bed. Bath robes also provided. The rooms had air conditioning which allowed you to set the room temperature for your own comfort. A further surprise was as we had been upgraded to Executive Rooms breakfast was included. This was served in the Hakuba Restaurant - choice of full English or hot selection cooked to order in addition to cereal, pastries, juices etc! We had driven to the hotel and there is an NCP Car Park underneath the hotel which if you speak to concierge before you leave is at a discounted rate. We found all staff to be helpful and yes the lifts (4 of them) did tend to be busy in the morning but this is a large, city centre hotel! Did not have to wait more than a couple of minutes for the lift! Have experienced worse! All round a very enjoyable stay helped perhaps by the upgrade (I normally use activehotels.co.uk to book hotels and this is not the first time we have had an upgrade). Would certainly stop at the St Giles again whether for leisure or on business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: sunshine85NorthWales
Reviews.Content: We got the tube to 'Tottenham Court road' from Euston took less than 5 mins! The hotel was easy to find a 5 min walk straight up the road and it was the 2nd avenue on the right hand side. There is a theatre as soon as you come out of the tube station on the street, currently showing we will rock you... Lots of shops right outside the hotel! Appearance from the outside wasnt anything special although the reception area was lovely. Freindly, helpful staff on check in. Information staff were rubbish, they were all foreign and when you asked directions and information on a map they couldnt help! There was a bar with sports showing on the tv to the left of reception that was open till late and a coffee shop above. Check in was quick and easy, but we had already booked online with laterooms in advance, we just paid the balance £197 for 2 nights and got the key to our room. We were staying on the 3rd floor, the room was tiny and as for the bathroom it was impossible to dry yourself in there it was so small! To be honest the room did have everything we needed, we werent in it long as we were out sight seeing etc. Shower was good, very clean... For a cheap stay, in a great location this hotel is perfect! Dont recommend if you want a nice hotel room to spend time in...

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying again.”
Reviews.Author: Amy290909
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to St Giles hotel in london on 24th Feb 2012 and we were highly dissappointed. The room was tiny & we had the worst nights sleep ever due to a hard creaky bed & rubbish pillows. After a day walking round London & being 6 months pregnant a good nights sleep is essential. Because of our lack of sleep and back ache we did not enjoy our second day in London. We will not be returning to this hotel in the future, you would get more for your money and a better night sleep at a premier inn.

Reviews.Title: “Prison camp”
Reviews.Author: roylewis1
Reviews.Content: What an awfull hotel the rooms and the bathroom are so small with tiny narrow windows it reminds me of a prison cell. not one English member of staff . The dining room is like a school canteen. Location is good but that's all I would not stay again a travel lodge would be more comfortable and half the price

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: nan088
Reviews.Content: we stayed at st,giles hotel for one night it was ok,but there was eight of us.one room was ready so the rest of us had to wait.food was over priced,it cast us for hot dogs and chips 18.00 for two,the lifed was very slow and when it got to you it was packed so the stairs was quicker,but otherwise had very nice stay.p.s very noisey at night did not sleep well

Reviews.Title: “Good location, disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: Chrisfromthenorth
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the St Giles hotel, London, for one night on business. Location wise, it couldn't be better. Just over the road from Tottenham Court Road tube station, and only 15 minutes walk from Covent Garden. The building itself is not good looking at all, a horrendous piece of architecture, but the reception area is okay, and I was beginning to think that things were looking up. The room was a twin, wasn't very big, but for one night on business, it was fine. Clean and comfortable. The bathroom was stupidly small. It's amazing how they fit everything in there. Breakfast was a complete nightmare. I hadn't booked breakfast with the room, so was informed that it would be £9.95. Pretty much average for hotel breakfasts, so I agreed. When staying in a hotel, breakfast is usually a fairly relaxing experience. Take a seat, order some coffee and a couple of rounds of toast and peruse the menu. NOT in this hotel. It's self service so you have to grab a tray and then queue for anything unto 20 minutes in order to get a hot breakfast. On the way to the hot food I passed a tray of croissants, bread rolls, cheese, ham etc. After grabbing some hot food, I made my way over to the juice, only to be told that there wasn't any orange. Okay, coffee then! Then I looked for a table. The place was packed and people were having to share tables, which were packed in so tightly and I had to get up and move at least four times to let other people leave the table or get to a seat. My hot breakfast was a bit of a letdown, so I decided that some toast would have to do. After walking around looking for toast, I asked a member of staff, who informed me that they 'don't do toast'. What? A hotel that can't provide toast at breakfast? Instead I was offered croissants or a bread roll! Not quite the same thing. The only way that I can describe breakfast is that it's like a busy service station. Too many people, no where to sit, and poor food. Never again! The hotel itself is fine. Great location and okay rooms, although it needs some serious updating. And the lifts are very slow. Expect to meet a lot of people marching down the stairs on a morning, after having waited what feels like an eternity waiting for the lifts to arrive. I would stay again, but only on business, and I'd take a walk down the road and find somewhere else to have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for shopping”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetSyndrome
Reviews.Content: Im going to start off by saying you get what you pay for; this is one of the cheapest hotels in the Oxford street area of London. So don't expect the Ritz for travelodge prices! I stayed in a single room which is very small and fitted out a bit like a cabin on a ship. It had everything you need and is clean but dated and the furnishings are a little 'tired' looking. The shower room was tiny. This meant the room became a little stuffy, and the window only has restricted opening. Breakfast is self serve and to be honest a bit of a cattle market. Mine was included in the room price, but even so there are plenty of good coffee houses within a minutes walk so I'd skip the experience and head out. What makes this hotel good is its fantastic, enviable location at the end of Oxford street and within walking distance of Covent Garden. Personally, I only use it for sleeping in, so I can put up with slightly lower standards in a trade off for convenience to the main shopping areas. If you want luxury, don't come here. If you just want a clean bed to sleep in near the shops, this might be for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Angela N
Reviews.Content: Just back from stay at this hotel. Fabulous location, not overpriced, helpful staff, room clean, comfortable beds, good breakfast. Will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathyIreland30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in February. The hotel has a great location and is very easy to find. Tottenham Court Road tube station is only a few minutes walk from this hotel which was perfect for us as we do alot of tube-hopping when we visit London. The rooms were a little bit on the small side but the beds were extremely comfortable and the room was very quiet. Bathroom was also small but very functional with a great shower. The only complaint I had was that the lifts were very slow and sometimes when they arrived they were full. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel as it is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “London Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Diane R
Reviews.Content: Didn't enjoy the stay in this hotel one bit. The room was tiny, the hotel would not rectify the mistake of room booking so we had to stay in a twin room with 2 very small beds in a small room with very small cushions rather than pillows. Staff were not helpful and the breakfast was poor - the hotel was very busy but had the feeling we were cattle as opposed to guests!

Reviews.Title: “St. Giles Hotel & Leisere ClubLondon”
Reviews.Author: Jalooka
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to London and we found it to be as every bit expensive as people had said. With that, we found the St. GIles NOT to be very expensive and for the location we just could not find a better hotel. Great central location with wifi, walking distance to most tourist attractions, souvenir shops, restaurants and nightclubs. I personally found the hotel to be a bit older and not as impressive as some of the others aesthetically speaking, but the wood panalled walls and desk were a very nice and elegant touch. For the price and location we highly recommend this hotel. The staff was very helpful giving us tips on were to go for shopping or dinning, using the concierge name helped us get a table without waiting even when the restaurant had a 30 min. waiting list! I don't recommend using the London Black Cabs however. One drove us around the block when we were trying to make the changing of the guards at Buckingham Palace in time. We missed it and we ended up paying for a trip around to the back of the hotel. Good luck arguing with them either, as we found out this is a nasty little trick the cabs tend to play on tourists. The cleanliness of the hotel in my opinion could have been better. Upon inspection of the room I found the sheets to be crisp and clean with the bathroom smelling of bleach which I'm not complaining about so I did like that part. As with most European hotels there was no A/C unit so we had to open the window which was nice but being in central London street noise into the early morning hours was a bit of an issue. Overall yes I would stay at this hotel again but steer away from the cabs and just use public transportation. The bus drivers are very forgiving for tourists and go pretty much where you need to anyways. For rates and availability on this hotel just go to www.Jalooka.com. "Would Jalooka That!"

Reviews.Title: “Fab London location”
Reviews.Author: RosCork
Reviews.Content: Second visit to St Giles and even better than previous experience. Hotel couldn't be in a better location, one minute off Oxford Street, 30 seconds from tube. Staff are nice, concierge in particular are very helpful and friendliest people we met in London. Several nice restaurants on site and bar with nice atmosphere. Also swimming pool, health club, coffee shop, casino. I was visiting London with my Mum and had booked a twin room. I asked if it were possible to get a double bed for my Mum when booking and this was provided at no extra charge. We in fact had a fab room with a separate adjoining room/alcove where my single bed pulled down from the wall - once down it was a proper single bed and exceptionally comfortable. Rooms are tiny but spotless and with everything one would need. I would in particular recommed our room (743) as we each had our own little bit of space and privacy and it was also a quite room. The hotel in general looked refreshed and cleaner than on my last stay in 2008. All in all, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not Over Priced, great location”
Reviews.Author: deepvaid
Reviews.Content: Found that London can be a bit of a Nightmare for hotels. Lot of Hotels have extremely small and out dated rooms. My one at St Giles was not big, but was great for me, I had a double, but single occupancy. Clean, with new amenities which was appreciated. The location is fantastic, right bythe tube and a supermarket very close by. Would definitly stay here again. Only down side was the lack of seating to cope with all the customers at Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lo_shamano
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel situated just a hundred mt from the tottenham curt road underground station, situated in the center of london you can go out by night and find a club or a pub only walking a few min , it has nice and clean room with a beaoutifoul view from the higher floor, you can go to the swimming pool and the fitness center just pushing a button on the hotel elevator. I reccomend it to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend with the girls...”
Reviews.Author: Therese M
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have stayed here twice, in January and November of 2011. The first time we our room was extremely small, but we really didn't mind. The second time we got a much bigger room located on a higher floor. It was so amazing to watch the sunrise over London from our window! This hotel is great for a girl's weekend in the city, with lots of shopping and drinking. For a romantic getaway? Not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - shame about the rest...”
Reviews.Author: dianeuk111
Reviews.Content: Firstly, you cannot fault the location of this hotel, five minutes walking distance from Oxford Street, 15mins walk from Covent Garden - most excellent. Swift and efficient check in / out. However, from there on in it significantly goes downhill fast. The corridors are old and tired - a labyrinth of corridors, all tatty and in need of recordation and new carpets - ASAP. My friend and I stayed in a twin room for two nights and although we weren't in them long there were extremely claustrophobic. Again decor and carpet need lots of attention. We stayed at the rear of the hotel and on the Friday night we got no sleep at all - noisy bar or club downstairs that went on through the night - boom, boom, boom noises constantly... Breakfast is a complete joke - I appreciate we stayed the weekend before Xmas 2011, however it was so overcrowded I wished we'd not booked breakfast and eaten out. The large breakfast room was completely self service once you'd entered, and the stations with the food were so inadequate - my friend queued for a cooked breakfast for over 20 minutes and having still not gotten sight of the front of the queue decided against it... So much of the food had run out and was not replaced on either morning. Waiting staff did nothing but clear tables, hardly any replenishing took place. Our first morning we were saved by having a croissant (remind me how much we'd paid for the room including breakfast) and a coffee. Our second no croissant in sight even though we were in the room for 30+ minutes. Finally, whoever heard of a hotel that didn't serve toast at breakfast??? I stay in a fair amount of hotels on pleasure and business - in this country and others, and not once has there never been toast!!!! You even have to pay a fee for each bag left with Concierge (!?!?!?!?!) - thought this wasn't a budget hotel?! I'd give this a wide berth until they've addressed a number of fundamental issues...

Reviews.Title: “Average - okay at St Giles”
Reviews.Author: McKitties
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at St. Giles a number of times but this was the first time for a while - and nothing has changed. It is a hard review to write because some things are good and some things are less so. The location is superb, it is at Tottenhem Court Road tube station and the top of Oxford Street. The lobby is impressive, marble and very well presented - it looks like you are staying somewhere very classy. You also have access to a swimming pool - and you can tell because the smell of chlorine overpowers reception. Check-in was quick and easy and staff excellent. The negatives are the rooms - they are small (average I suppose for London) but they are dated (tv's are quite good), carpet and sheets very old fashioned and carpet in room and in halls is torn and frayed. It was, however, clean. Overall I would not say don't stay at St Giles, for its price (I paid £90) it's more than acceptable for London and for work or if you are only going to be in the room for a short time or a few days. However if you are coming for a week or so or are looking for a romantic stay with a bit of style I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “theatre break”
Reviews.Author: JACQUELINE866
Reviews.Content: just back from st giles hotel and have to agree with other reviews about the size of the rooms ,very small. hated using the old fashioned bathroom and thought the carpet in the bedroom was old and dirty. All in all wished id paid extra and went to a better hotel, did not wish to return to my room after a day out sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Never Never Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: WhenAreWeThere!
Reviews.Content: I will not be back as have no desire to stay in a small cupboard again. Room was the smallest I have ever stayed in. Lifts were a joke - waiting a long time every trip. Breakfast was a horrible experience and felt like in a prison! I can find no reason why anyone would want to stay at this hotel. I will not be back! Not the nicest area of London. Look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location and leisure club”
Reviews.Author: Agy2000
Reviews.Content: Honestly saying, there are two good things to be said about this place. It is the location and the unique access to the Central London YMCA Club – any guest of the hotel is allowed to use all the facilities in this gigantic leisure and fitness club for a nominal fee of five pounds! You are supposed to pay for it at the hotel reception desk and then you only need to use the hotel lift to get to the YMCA club which is located just in the basements of the hotel. I recommend a swimming pool with two types of sauna just next to the pool. Well, since I was regularly going to the club and having a shower there I was lucky to avoid using my room’s bathroom – tiny with an old shower and peeling paint… The room was tiny too, one of the smallest single rooms I have ever seen! But I would not say it was not clean. It was clean and have all the necessary equipment except the internet which is accessible but not free (10 pounds per day). Still, I would come back there because all the inconveniences are compensated by the location – just in the heart of London.

Reviews.Title: “Two night stay...”
Reviews.Author: imehufc
Reviews.Content: Room 432, if I had known it was so noisy and draughty I would have brought my tent and pitched it at St Pauls! Saying that the hotel is in a great position and the shower was great, but breakfast was very average, no toast!!

Reviews.Title: “Two night midweek stay Central London”
Reviews.Author: shell983
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin room and a single room by phone direct with the hotel. On arrival we were pleased to find the single room was upgraded to a twin. The rooms had single beds and tight on space for two people but adequate for a short stay. The rooms were on the 5th and 7th of 9 floors so it was nice and quiet being high up. Rooms were very clean, beds were very comfy. Bathroom was small with a good hot shower. One room had a blocked shower tray but this was fixed the same day after reporting it to the very polite and friendly reception staff. The concierge service was excellent providing transport info. Breakfast was good with lots of choice from continental to full English. I recommend the croissants and the scrambled egg.( no fried egg or mushrooms). Nice little cafe in raised front lobby area. Fantastic location a short walk from British Museum, round the corner from Tottenham Court Rd Tube, lots of buses to all tourist spots. The no.1 took us to and from the Aldwych Theatre on the Strand in less then 10 mins.I highly recommend this for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Service- Night in from the snow”
Reviews.Author: missyceltic
Reviews.Content: My mothers late birthday treat with my cousins & friends could have not had a very happy ending all due to being stuck in London, coming out of the theatre and finding ourselves in the heavy layerd snow fall. Although it was a lovely suprise with a few hidous giggles it took us all by suprise. Living just a few miles away in Kent, the taxi ride home, was becoming a nightmare. We walked for 20mins trying to get shelter as taxis were taking an hour or longer just in Covent Garden to be arranged due to weather conditions. My nan and my aunts were in their early 70's but getting them into the warmth was priority. I rang my husband to try get him to find us a place to stay but having managed to walk around we came across to the St Giles a big hotel with a very helpfull and politefull door man Dave whom met us on arrival, my aunt and i went up stairs to try ask for a room or beg that they would put us up for the night knowing prices for a Friday was to deter us away or just being told no rooms, however a big saviour at last as one of the young kind hearted gentlemen; Shihab on his way up to the desk greeted us. I was tierd and cold and although a bit rudley asked if he could help us only knowing he was the night manager through the warm conversation by offering a room. He did what he could, as we waited patiently least in the warmth reasured by the security man Bart that Shihab would be more then going out of his own way to arrange a room for my elderly nan & friends and kindly assisting to finding the rest of us a close room at the My Hotel just the opposite road from the St Giles and putting in a plead for the prices qouted. So thank you. We took what he had presented us with & i must say we was delighted at being able to be provided of such delightfull service in the middle of snow struck London. You could never tell when in doubt, you would recieve such hospitable warmth like we did, but it sure gave us a roof over our head away from the cold snap.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: classicbird
Reviews.Content: Just returned 4/6 Feb. Went there with my husband to see we will rock you great location 3 mins walk away which was quite handy, as we left the theatre it had snowed. The hotel is really close to the tube station so thats a plus. Check in went well even thou i had forgotten to print of my reciept got my e mail up on my phone no problem. Having read on tripadvisor about the lifts i e mail ahead and asked for a low floor i got the first floor and a recently refurbed room. It takes a while to get used to the set out and after 2 days i still did not find the stairs although i did not look to hard. As the lifts were ok and we were always lucky, by the lifts is a vending machine with chocolate crips soft drinks and beer, this was great for late night munchies. Did not bother to unpack as only there for 2 nights, was surpised to see in the bathroom only 1 hand towel and 1 bath towel for the two of us also only one pillow each had i unpacked would have found extra of each in the wardrobe , found them the next day. The room is possibly the smallest ive ever stayed in but it was clean as ok for a couple of days would have asked for a larger room if staying longer. Also found the room a little cold had the heating turned up full and because of the snow not warm enough but for all the time we were in the room not too much of a problem. later we walked to covent garden took us about 30 mins ate there walked back went to see the show, after the show went into the hotel bar for a night cap the service was very good Had a good night sleep no noise either inside or out. Breakfast went down just before 8 no problem got seated straight away and yes because it is self service has a bit of a canteen effect and like others have said miss a bit of toast, but i was happy enough with the choice, fruit, yogurt, pastries, cold ham and cheese, boiled egg, jams, cerals, bread rolls and the hot choice of scrambled egg, sausages,bacon,has brown and beans, left me full enough. This day walked to leicter square again about 30 mins. That night slept better having found extra pillows, breakfast next morning fine again no problem ,checked out by leaving the keys in the box on reception and made our way home. Would i stay again yes but as i said good for a couple of days and would recomend it on those conditions

Reviews.Title: “***Fab hotel great location***”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer G
Reviews.Content: Stayed in St.Giles on the 20th to 22nd of January . We had booked 3 triple rooms as there was 9 of us in our party . !! The staff upon arrival couldn't have been more helpful , they helped us with our baggage ( which we had alot of ) . The rooms were cosy with one double bed and a pull out single bed , suited us all fine , no complaints :) ... Would like to say a big thank you to the staff on the concierge , the were so helpful , very polite ,... The bar and restaurant in the hotel are fab , staff very friendly . the buffet breakfast in the morning was nice , fast service . . It is situated in a great location just a 5 minute walk to Oxford street and a ten minute taxi journey to the west end . We will definitely be back to stay here and we have recommended it too all of our friends and family .

Reviews.Title: “St Giles Hotel, London”
Reviews.Author: 179Steve179
Reviews.Content: Didn't start the weekend too well as we arrived at the hotel to the news that we didn't have a reservation (booked via a Theatre package on line), but this was quickly resolved. Great location!! Small slightly out of date room. The room could do with a drastic update. The wood pannelling is out of date and in the bathroom there was mildew on the edge of the shower tray and the shower head dripped. Breakfast was good with a choice of continental and english but no toast !! Towels weren't changed daily and we had to ask for this to be done. Other inconsiderate guests were rather noisy returning to their rooms in the wee hours of the morning but, even though the hotel was just off of Tottenham Court Road, you had little sound from traffic and the hustle and bustle of a big city. Would stay there agin for a weekend but no longer.

Reviews.Title: “NORTHSOUTH”
Reviews.Author: Caroline L
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Great value for money!! Would of loved a bath instead of a shower!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect with really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Aston1601
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a comfortable size, were very clean and smartly presented. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, and when we got stuck in the snow at Tottenham Court Road and the central line started to experience severe delays, the concierge Miguel still made the time to organise a car for us to get to Liverpool St in time for our last train. This was despite us having checked out that morning, so were not even really guests at that time. The people couldn't have been more friendly. We also arrived at the hotel for check in to find out we'd accidentally booked a double instead of a twin (I went with my mum) and they changed us to a twin without any trouble or charges. This good service is extended to the Lazy Dog bar next to reception, where the bar staff are keen to help and provide table service in a reasonably priced and smartly presented environment. It was a good place for a couple of drinks before bed close to the room because we had an early start the next day. I would really recommend the hotel to anyone, the price is excellent for where the hotel is, and the rooms are warm (once I turned the heating on which you can adjust to your personal preference), clean and comfortable. I'll definitely be staying again next time I'm in London, and would be more inclined to stay in London after a night out now I know this hotel is here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jetta202
Reviews.Content: Rooms kinda small but clean handy and great location

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but poor quality”
Reviews.Author: PHR67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located just a few steps off Tottenham Court Road and two blocks from Oxford Street, as well as the British Museum. Unfortunately the rest is not so good. My room was very small, with peeling paint in the bathroom, and mildew stains in the shower. The breakfast is served in an environment that strongly reminds me of a loud high school cafeteria. The only plus, apart from the location, is that you for five pounds can get full access to a gigantic YMCA facility next door with pool, gym, fitness classes etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Laurits M
Reviews.Content: We stayed on There for four nights, smal rooms but we did not need more. Service on hotel was good, and you got an cofee, bread or fruit in the morning. We ate breakfast out of hotel, Nice location you could walk everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsey M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights with my elderly mother. I was a little concerned as quite a few of the reviews I had seen on trip advisor had been awful! I asked for a quiet room and was given a newly re-furbished room on the 8th floor. It was on the small side but more than adequate for a two night stay, clean and smelled fresh. I found the staff more than helpful and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: BredonDave
Reviews.Content: I often stay here when in London. The location is excellent, right next to Tottenham Court Road Station. The quality of the rooms is also very good and I have always enjoyed the breakfast. The staff are OK, pretty average for London, and the hotel is reasonably clean and tidy and has the advantage of a swimming pool, though I have never used it. I have found their admin to be a little shoddy. Nearly everytime I stay here there is a problem with the booking and before I check in I am usually bracing myself for an argument at reception. To be fair to them, this has not always been their fault but I never seem to have any problems with other hotels and I do stay in a few. None-the-less I will probably stay here again next time I visit as the value for money is excellent for this part of London, though not all of the rooms have air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, great value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: flynn1812
Reviews.Content: We returned to The St Giles Hotel in January having stayed here in July last year. In July we booked a double room which was at a very favourable rate of which i cant remember. Anyway, the room we had was quite small, with only a little room around the bed. But it was clean and served the purpose for what we wanted. This time, we opted for a twin room and again was lucky to have got a rate of £90 prpn inc tax. This time our room was more spacious than the double and we booked this on the basis that twin beds would need more room than doubles and upon entering the room were proven right. So, apart from getting a great rate and being in great location for our needs (being close to the gay scene in Soho) if you are a couple and don't mind sleeping in separate beds for a few nights, might we suggest you book a twin as you will probably have a little more room. Another suggestion, the lifts can be slow at times so a room on a low floor might be worth thinking about and using the stairs might be quicker. BTW, we dined at the Ledbury and The Square on this visit, check out our reviews here on Tripadvisor...

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stop over”
Reviews.Author: soozywoo1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the St Giles on January 30th as part of a theatre break deal. Check in wa quick and easy and the staff friendly and helpful. Room was small/compact but clean and functional. Tea/coffee making facilities good. Lovely constant hot water and the bed comfy. Although in the centre of theatre land we had no outside noise keeping us awake and I slept well. Concierge was very helpful - nothing too much trouble. Late night bar very lively but nice for a nightcap. Breakfast - although the restaurant is much like a school canteen it is clean and tables are cleared promptly. We ate at 9.30 - no major queues plenty of seating space and lots of choice. We've done overnight theatre stays on a few occasions and this would be my hotel of choice. Right in the heart of the West End and does the job at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break”
Reviews.Author: juls70
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near Tottenham Road underground and in a great location for shopping. We stayed for the weekend over the new year and paid a reasonable price. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. There were very tolerant and always happy to help. The facilities were great and the leisure complex attached is great value for £5.00. The room we had was comfortable, clean and great for the two of us. We would definitely stay again and a big thank you to the staff for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Not great - but good if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: doscal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the last minute as I was going to meet some friends in London. I knew I wouldnt need to the hotel much so I went ahead and booked. Wow - i booked a single room...it was arguably the tiniest space I have ever locked myself into...however, saying this, it did contain everything I needed during my stay... There were problems with dirty carpet and bathroom was minute but, it served a purpose. All in all, it wasnt worth £74 a night... probably around £35... and as for the brekky, forget about it... its horrible. The coffee tastes of smoke (yes smoke!), the sausages are disgusting, the orange juice tasted like diluted juice with too much water, there was no proper Britich / Irish bread - the breakfast is a complete no go..! The good thing about this place? Its a terrific location but perhaps too central... its difficult to sleep in in the morning given its proximity to traffic, crowds, loud noises etc. Stay here if you are on a low budget, if you have a few quid, stay somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but central location”
Reviews.Author: FenitViking
Reviews.Content: The location is great - turn left and you are in Oxford Street/Soho Square in less than 5 minutes, turn right and you are at the British Museum in less than 5 minutes. The rooms themselves are tiny but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but manic”
Reviews.Author: Sharonslinn
Reviews.Content: Looked really nice online so booked for a couple of nights to go to the \theatre and Christmas shopping. Fab location for all theatres and shops, really central and near to underground. Room was tiny though, would have a like a bit more space - and this was before we went shopping !!!! I was really dissapointed. Breakfast the following morning was like a mad house !! No structure at all, it was a free for all, get a table where you can, if you can - as most were full, then queue for breakfast and drinks. Not the best start to what was going to be a busy day of shopping. Food was good though to be fair. Got back to room after shopping for hours, tired and in need of a shower and a rest, to find room had not been serviced. Complained to housekeeper who offered clean towels, we decided to make the room up ourselves - not happy with this even though the housekeeper apologised. All in all, great location, rooms small but adequate, service average, breakfast service poor but probably due to time of year - food was good. Would I stay again - No - Even though it was a busy time of year, I expected better for the centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Uk2011uk
Reviews.Content: I stay here for two nights at the end of January. Check in was quick and easy and our room was clean and roomy enough. The bathroom was small but fine. The location of the hotel is fantastic and a good base for exploring the city. We didn't book for breakfast but there was a very long queue in the morning! Also we had to wait ages for the lifts as the hotel was so busy. Overall, I would definately recommend the hotel for those who want a reasonably price mid range hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Short break in London”
Reviews.Author: coverdrive356
Reviews.Content: Booked very last minute to get in some Chrsitmas shopping in early December. My advice - don't leave your Christmas shopping so late! It was manic - the hotel was busting the shops so busy and public trnasport a nightmare! My room at the hotel was very well decked out but very small. The bathroom was excellent but the rest of the room very small. Their is a YMCA next door for those wanting a gym and a pleasant surprise was the breakfast which was good value. Overall a good expereince but far too busy and a bit cramped for me

Reviews.Title: “very handy”
Reviews.Author: vegas123Gibraltar
Reviews.Content: great place to stay if you want to go shopping without having to get the bus or unerground right on the corner of oxford street !! staff are lovely and only to willing to help with anything you need a lovely clean and comfortable hotel only one thing rooms are a bit small

Reviews.Title: “great location rooms little small but okay for couple of night.”
Reviews.Author: katieallix
Reviews.Content: stayed here for my 21st. rooms basic but it's what you pay for. amazing location. hotel has 700? rooms so little noisey and constant.

Reviews.Title: “Needs completely refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: evanssindri
Reviews.Content: Good situation, room tiny shabby and not too clean, staff didn't know what they were doing, gave wrong directions to our room, grudgingly made coffe on return from theater, breakfast was canteen self service style - awful and no toast! all served on a try like a greasy cafe, all in all, a very bad excperience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, breakfast and staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: therocks2008
Reviews.Content: As others have said I have to agree that the bedrooms are small, but such a little price to pay for the fantastic location. We have just come back from 10 days at St Giles, and we didn't want to leave. A special thank you to the lovely girls in the exec breakfast room, they only enhanced our stay!!! We will most definitley return, thank you to everyone at St. Giles!!!

Reviews.Title: “trip to london”
Reviews.Author: wydellsouthyorkshire
Reviews.Content: wenty to london for weekend on the train from doncaster found it very easy no driving hotel central.we had travelld down to see the lion king unknown to us it was rememberance weekend what a weekend,the lords mayors parade was on lasted ages all the lovely floats,then the marines were doing a sponsered run,then the lovely atmosphere of the rememberence day,the hotel was central,it was a very busy weekend, but well worth a visit on the rememberence weekend

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: PhillipK_7
Reviews.Content: Stays here for a week every January. The best thing about this hotel is the location; it is located next to Dominion Theatre and Tottenham Court Road Station, just next to Oxford Street. Very convenient for almost anything in London. The single rooms are tiny but clean. Breakfast is barely decent, but they don´t have toast. On Saturday mornings you might have to wait more than half an hour to get seated. There´s a good gym and swimming pool, but you have to pay a small fee to use it. The wifi access is a complete joke, and a bad one as well. I paid 45 pounds for one week access, and what I got was a very sluggish network. To make things worse I could only access it from the computer I bought the access from. So, no code which you could use for your other devices. There are also far too few (and too small) elevators, so during breakfast-time you can just about forget getting down with the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “GROTTY”
Reviews.Author: Matthew Y
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011 as part of a theatre package for my wifes 40th Birthday.Although brilliantly located near Oxford Street ,the thrill of London and the hotel stopped at the reception desk. This hotel is VERY VERY tired and could do with a complete refurb.Rooms are dirty and no bigger than a shoe box, laundry and towels resemble "cream crackers" and the breakfast can only be described as the worst motorway service station platter but worse.AVOID!.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely placed..............”
Reviews.Author: NCX
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean; rooms old (4th floor) but reasonably well cared for; breakfast - self service, canteen type setting and arrangement (they don't have toast!!!) - very functional, not all that inviting; postion - bang on (bottom of Oxford St just off Tott Court Road). I stayed a couple of nights and will be returning later this month (unless i can find somewhere better at the price!). You could do a lot worse than stay at St Giles......................

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: jaytay
Reviews.Content: When I checked in there were 5 staff and one customer at the desk. One member of staff was attending the customer, two were on the phone, and at the Executive check in two young ladies stood chatting. Eventually one of them looked up, beckoned me to the desk and checked me in whilst she continued her gossip with her mate. She barely glanced at me, I was given no instruction about any of the facilities, time of breakfast etc, they couldnt get rid of me quick enough. Not a good first impression. Room, I had a double for single occupance, small, reminded me of being in a caravan. The bathroom was tiny, no bath just a small dingy shower. Attempted breakfast but room was packed and tables were on top of each other, queues everywhere. No chance of a relaxing breakfast so quickly abandoned that idea. Stayed 2 nights, didnt enjoy the experience, a colleague booked in at the same time was woken by a fight outside his room at 2am. I was booked in by my company, I am returning to London this week and was again booked into the St Giles. I have moved my hotel to one nearbye.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one night but definitely no more”
Reviews.Author: 3boys
Reviews.Content: Room s are exceptionally tight. Adequate but could have been larger. Ice machine ran out more often than not. Too many students making the place rowdy and noisy. Lifts are grossly insufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good value busy central London hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Daz793
Reviews.Content: St Giles hotel is a large busy hotel, popular with tourists and business visitors requiring a good value hotel in central London. It is just off Tottenham court road close to the tube station on the central line close to British Museun, Oxford street, st Paul's, covent garden and so on. The rooms are a bit on the small size but very clean functional with tea making facility, TV, hair dryer and so on but a bit tired looking. I enjoyed the breakfast which offered continental and full English with lots of fruit and cereals. This is a good value no frill hotel that I use when on business, with access to the west end, but if you are looking for a high end hotel it's not for you!!

Reviews.Title: “So many things need changing”
Reviews.Author: Linsta78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Giles hotel as I was attending a meeting in central London. I come to London around once a month and am limited to cheaper hotels by my employer's budget. I've stayed in a few hotels in the area which are roughly the same price per night and they are generally acceptable. The hotel is big and very busy, which you would expect for a hotel which is so well positioned. I was allocated room 729 which I knew was a twin room. When I got in to the room it was really warm and smelled stale, so I looked for the air conditioning controls, only to find that there isn't any air con, there was a fan in the cupboard, but all of the plug sockets were so far away from the bed I wouldn't have been able to position it anywhere useful. Another thing I noticed was that the room didn't have curtains, it had some venetian blinds inside the two panes which made up the window. The blinds did nothing to keep out the bright blue light which was outside my window, which made my room really bright (it looked like there was a sunbed on directly outside my window). As my room was positioned near the lifts I expected noise, but wasn't prepared for the relentless noise well into the early hours. Every time a lift comes to the floor it chimes loudly like a door bell, not once, but 4 times (although one lift chimes 6 times - I know this detail because I was kept awake until roughly 2.00am listening to it). Why the lifts have to do this I really don't know, I find it hard to believe that I am the first person to complain about this. The doors bang quite loudly on some of the lifts too which is irritating. The bathroom was very small, but functional, there is a huge amount of storage space in the room too, so I imagine if you are in the room for a long time this would be a bonus. I had breakfast included in my room rate, I went down for breakfast at 6.30am, so I could try and beat the rush which I have read about in other reviews. Breakfast is really basic, not much selection, but what was there was of ok quality. Bit surprised that there was no toast though. I think looking at the other reviews of this hotel it is the luck of the draw whether you get a good room or a bad room. I'm not prepared to risk getting a room like that again, so I definitely won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 1Sheermadness
Reviews.Content: Being just off Oxford st & Tottenham this hotel is great for getting to all the West End has to offer. The room was on the small side, with little room around the bed. The shower room was also tiny. Overall it was a little dated but clean & tidy. The heat was a bit too much but opening the window sorted that. Hotel reception was good & check in smooth.
