The bar attached to the hotel was a bit grubby, with loud music & service without a smile. Hotel casino was a nice late night edition.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for short trips and business”
Reviews.Author: 64robert64
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the St Giles Hotel I did find it really perfect for the position rooms are very small and a bit noisy but clean. Prices are good Lift are really slow and it takes ages in the morning and late afternoon to catch them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the rest is very average”
Reviews.Author: djelf
Reviews.Content: As I stay in London often I see many different standards of hotels. Everything about this hotel is average. The beds are ok, the shower is hot (no bath), the breakfast was filling. It is a hotel in desperate need of a re-furb. My room had no curtains and the decoration was cica 1975. BUT... if it is just somewhere to stay in the heart of London then it is ideal. Close to shopping, rail and tube stations etc. Loction 10/10... the rest 5/10

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to be busy in London and need a good base this is for you!”
Reviews.Author: jamiea3
Reviews.Content: The St Giles hotel is ideally located right at the crossroads of the shopping on Oxford Street and the nightlife of Tottenham Court Road, Soho, Covent Garden and Leicester Square. It is also really handy for the British Museum. It is also practically on the top of Tottenham Court Road Underground station, this gives access to both the Northern Line and the Central Line. In a few years, 2017 I think, this will also be really close to the new Crossrail Line that is currently being build. This is not a laid back hotel by any stretch of the imagination, you know that it is a big hotel as soon as you walk in the reception area. Having said that there has always been enough staff on hand to check you in swiftly. The rooms vary in terms of size, if you book a single room the room is really, really small, however if you book a bigger room then there really is plenty of room, i.e. you get what you pay for in terms of size. The hotel has a really cool bar on the ground floor, not the cheapest place to drink, but does give you a feeling of being in the buzz of central London. Many hotels have vending machines and ice machines on each floor, however this is the only hotel that I have ever come across where you can get cans of larger from these vending machines which I think is a really nice touch if you get back to the hotel and want an ice cold beer in your room. Just one thing that isn't a bad thing, but that you probably need to be aware of is that the breakfast is not what you might expect. It is very much like a mass canteen and is probably the only part of the hotel that lets the rest down. I think that they have to run the breakfast like this because of the size of the hotel. As I say, this should not put you off visiting, but if you're really into your full English breakfast this will not rank amongst the best you will have ever tried! The prices for the St Giles are usually fair, especially for it's location. It is not what you would call a hotel with the personal touch and you could feel like you are one of many many people staying there. Sometimes though if you're busy shopping, sightseeing, eating, drinking and taking in shows you really just want somewhere to rest your head for a few hours whilst you and London rests.

Reviews.Title: “Back again and again...”
Reviews.Author: Runeberg
Reviews.Content: We have been back to St Giles, off Tottenham Court Rd, many times during the last 20 years. Why? Mainly because it´s reasonably cheap, and it´s central both for shopping, restaurants and entertainment. It´s big and busy, but service has improved a lot in those 20 years. We usually stay in an executive suite as many of the standard rooms tend to be very small and cramped. This time we had a twin room, spacious as far as workspace is concerned (see below), but no free wifi; high up, so no noise from the street or the construction work on the new underground station. Here I´ll just list the drawbacks of this particular room: only one bedside table; almost impossible getting into bed on the window side (both of this because of lack of space); not enough luggage space if you´re staying more than 1-2 nights and have two suitcases +; light in the bathroom insufficient for make-up etc. The breakfast is good, and one can use the YMCA swimming pool next door for free. There´s a good Sainsbury´s just across Tottenham Court Rd, as well as a chemist´s. You walk to Leicester Square or Covent Garden in ten minutes easily. Along New Oxford Street there are a number of good restaurants/ cafes (5 min walk). The area is full of computer & camera shops. I´m sure we´ll be back again, one of these days!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: johnboy102
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights early January. Yes the room is not the biggest, but bed was comfortable, shower worked well, breakfast good, location outstanding. Have rebooked for wife's birthday later this year.

Reviews.Title: “feel at home at the st.giles”
Reviews.Author: wabushtraveller
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for the past several years since it was recommended by my Brother. Its the perfect location for a visit to London for the things I like to do. Near the theatres , soho, oxford street. I grab my camera and its a pleasant day walkabout to trafalgar, buckingham palace, big ben and so many sites. Its adjacent to the tube. In the evening a mere stroll to restaurants and theatres. The rooms are small but for the amount of time I am there, it makes no difference, I dont visit London to stay in my hotel room all day. The bar and restaurant are fine for when I need them. I've had pleasant help from the staff..and yes the elevators can be slow but thats because its always so busy because so many people stay there, and many are repeats like myself or are there on recommendation of others. I have recommended this to many people and everybody has thanked me, especially when you consider the price ..a great value for your money .I travel a lot , all over the world.Places like St Giles make it possible for me to make affordable trips ..i.e. i get to travel more often .I'll be back in a few months and cant wait...

Reviews.Title: “Nice holidays during New Year 2012”
Reviews.Author: LIDIA7
Reviews.Content: Was there with teenage daughter and really we have no complains about the hotel (only the elevators are a bit slow). Service we got was ok. Everybody complaining about the size of the room I would calm down. They could pay more than 100Eur per night and maybe get something better. But I have experienced more expensive hotels in central London and already being very disappointed with really small rooms (and even only 70 cm wide bed!). Well, back to St Giles: Concierge immediately help us as we step inside the hall. Check in was quick and with no problems. Room (we used twin room in one of the middle towers) - for the central London located hotel can't imagine bigger as this. Room was nice, two normal size beds, with good quality mattress. Bathroom, small but clean and nice smelling. Room and bathroom was nice cleaned every day. Also there is tea&coffee heater, sugar, milk, tea&coffee bags every day. Stuff was very friendly. Who want to buy something extra food or drink can do it cross the road in a market. I would recommend this hotel to everybody who want to stay near West End, few minutes from British Museum and very close to many points of interest in central London. We spent very nice 6 days holidays there and last but not least - New Year's Fireworks was amazing :-)

Reviews.Title: “Anything lacking is made up by the location.”
Reviews.Author: TracyWhitby
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on a few occasions now and on all occasions have felt I have had value for money. The location is brilliant. Rooms are small and quite basic but adequate for a cheapish centrally located hotel. Breakfast again adequate. Plenty of choice I did miss toast though. There are a lot of things which could be improved but overall it is a fair price for an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “St Giles STOLE MONEY FROM MY CREDIT CARD”
Reviews.Author: Marianna C
Reviews.Content: Seriously, DO NOT stay at this hotel. Two days after i left, my bank informed me that they ILLEGALLY CHARGED MY CREDIT CARD WITH 400 GBP. I try to contact them, i talked on the phone with three or four people from the hotel, i sent five emails , I faxed them and they were just keeping me telling that " you need to speak with my colleague" . They refunded 300GBP, and and they just STOLE they rest. 100GBP STOLEN FROM ME BY THIS HOTEL. worst travel experience ever, especially for the way they treated me and ignore me. Of course I plan to sue them.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: lindielou22
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the St Giles Hotel at the beginning of December 2011 with 3 friends. We had 2 twin rooms. The rooms were small but clean, comfortable and had everything we needed. Breakfast was very busy, but that's to be expected from a busy West End hotel. We would definitely stay here again. I think it is a value for money hotel and those who have complaints about the size of the rooms, breakfast etc should pay for a more expensive hotel if they have too high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anth_Spiteri
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is very good indeed. Very close to Oxford street and Tottenham Court Road, with Tottenham Court Road station just 1 minute away. Further down the road is Piccadily. Breakfast is quite good. One person room is rather small. However having all the necessities.

Reviews.Title: “dont go!”
Reviews.Author: wendy a
Reviews.Content: Arrived to our pre booked standard room, which was tiny, dirty and very overpriced. Staff were helpfull in trying to relocate us, you get the feeling they do it a lot. Eventually had to pay for an upgrade to have any room half decent. It is close to the tube and the dominion theatre so as a plus you dont have far to go to get to the major attractions. We saw a travelodge furhter down the road, next time i will go there!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel in the centre of London”
Reviews.Author: Wehr
Reviews.Content: Had a minute single room. However it was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was adequate, although the breakfast room was more like a canteen than a Hotel restaurant. Having read some of the reviews, I was expecting the worse, therefore I was not expecting too much ! I would certainly use again if in London for up to four days. 50 yards from Oxford Street and 300 yards from Tottenham Court Road Tube station. Certainly better than some of the low budget Hotel chains. Next time will certainly use the Spa. This must be one of the best fitness centers in the area !

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the Boxes for short stay in the West End”
Reviews.Author: Twowires
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the St Giles on numerous occasions for our annual theatre trip. We use the St Giles because it has fantastic location for our needs and is good value. We have never had a bad stay here and I wanted to add my comments to praise the hote, in light of more negative reviewsl. Always check you get the excellent value buffet breakfast included, we did not ,one year and missed out,getting Coffe'n Go instead (our fault). This year we checked in at 11-45 am with no problem. Yes the rooms are not massive, but what do you need for an overnight stay. The bed is comfortable and there are extra pillows. There is a kettle for a reviving cuppa and no problem getting extra coffee, milk etc. The bathroom was large enough and very clean, with a powerful hot shower. We were warned at reception that breakfast would be busy around 9 am and to avoid that time if possible. We went a little later and had no problem. The hot food is cooked fresh and an array of options on other items, including fruit, cheese, ham, cereal, etc, to satisfy the multi national guests. If you start your day hungry, you are an extremely fussy eater. You can leave your luggage at the concierge desk for no charge( we always leave a small tip), if you want to have a stroll round central London. You are a few steps from Oxford St, Covent Garden and the West End. It's only a 10-15 min stroll to Trafalgar Sq and then on to all the other main tourist attractions. Check out the various hotel booking sites on the internet for a few mins and you will always get a good deal on the St Giles. It always ticks the boxes for our annual theatre trips.( by the way- go to the Leicester Sq ticket booths, for half price or less, theatre tickets)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and not as bad as I thought after reading these reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Jack2955
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews on here I was not looking forward to our stay but I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised! The location of the hotel was amazing and the rooms were fine! Yes, the rooms were small but for the amount of time we spent in them it was perfect! The bathroom was new and very clean! Breakfast was good, lots of choice and it was all fresh! We would definitely stay here again, don't be put off by all the bad reviews on here!

Reviews.Title: “Accomodation Size on St Giles Central London”
Reviews.Author: larbakium
Reviews.Content: Stayed on this hotel for 2 day stay. Found the hotel quite nice and more than enough for what I needed. The relation quality/price is good, comparing to other hotels in the area. Location is the big plus here. It is very well located. Staff were great, nothing to point out. The worst for me was the room size. It is very small. I got a double room and still its very very small. I haven´t measure but I would say its 4sqm, and the toilet 1/3 of this. So very small. Apart from this I only use it to sleep. But if this would have been a relaxing trip and to enjoy the hotel I would have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “terrible!!! do not go”
Reviews.Author: francesca b
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, dirty and smelly. After complaining the manager told us they were full.They gave us another room, old and small bathroom, very small room...we were 3 in this room and we didn't have space to move or to open the baggages. They told me we payed for a 4 stars hotel but ST Giles is probably a 2 stars hotel...breakfast awful,service less than a zero... The only nice thing is the location...but do not go!!

Reviews.Title: “The people staying in the hotel let it down!”
Reviews.Author: rainbowsue0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip on 14th December, booked by the company. I got an impression of crazed activity in the bar off reception, and shrieks of laughter every couple of seconds. The receptionist was obviously stressed and polite but distant. I think she was surprised when I smiled at her and said thank you. Plenty of lifts, and an ice machine in reception- plus points for those! The corridors were a bit maze-like but smelled of fresh paint so I thought it looked hopeful that the rooms had been refurbished. My room was on the second floor on a side branch of the main corridor and was through a fire door that screeched every time it was opened- which was frequently throughout the night. A bit of oil might do it good. The room was small but had been refurbished and was clean and tidy. The wooden surrounds around the bed and wardrobes looked fairly new and unmarked. The bed was comfortable ( I was in a twin) sheets were clean and had been changed. Pillows were fine. The television was a smallish flatscreen on the wall. Perfectly adequate! Tea and coffee, yes..again, fine. Hairdryer under the table..no trouser press, which was a bit of a minus. The shower room was newly refurbished, clean and tidy, no faults there. The only thing was the towel was too small. I'm little so just about managed but anyone over 5'2 would struggle! I didnot like the fact that there is no room service in the St Giles. When I am away on business I am alone and do not like eating in a restaurant on my own. Well, I had to on this occasion and the noise downstairs had put me off going into the chinese restaurant incorporated into the hotel. The bistro similarly looked frantic. This was only early in the evening. So I opted for the in-house Italian restaurant. I was glad that I had. Very peaceful, calm service, lovely Italian waitress who took her time and the trouble to talk to me about the food. The steak that I had came with a lovely salad and fries which were fresh and crispy- just too many of them for me! She went a step further at the time for dessert and when I asked about icecream with espresso, she said that the soft icecream that tehy served was no good with coffee on it, but she recommended the hard Italian icecream with expresso coffee on it. I have had them before but this was honestly the best one I have had in my life. Delicious! back to the bedroom. All was well until it was time to sleep. the traffic noise was minimal than kgoodness, but the noise from other guests returning to their rooms was loud and disturbing. People let their doors slam, they called upon their neighbours with bangs on the door and loud talking. Obviously these people had no manners. In the morning, all was hectic downstairs and I could not face struggling to have a civilised breakfast in that atmosphere, so I skipped breakfast even though it had been paid for. Would I stay there again? I might, and if I do, I'll go to the Italian restaurant again..and take my own breakfast and earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “My little Box”
Reviews.Author: Woolfords
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited London for a special birthday occassion. A meal and a show at Ronnie Scott's Jazz Club and an overnight stay in a centrally located hotel - supposedly 4 * Ronnie Scott's fab worth every penny St Giles Hotel - depressing and tatty One room split into two Lumpy mattress Pillows fit for the bin A shower that leaked water all over the floor because the shower curtain was not wide enough. Noisy air conditioning The only good thing was the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, low standard”
Reviews.Author: bubbel
Reviews.Content: Best possible location, very easy to get around, and best shopping next door. Rooms are very small and not up to date.... Shower: slow and dripping but clean (and a hole in the wall as the plumbing was a mystery, short pipes???) Breakfast feels like something you would get in prison and coffee HORRIBLE but the location made me forget all those small irritating things. Also very reasonable room rates, and very friendly and helpful staff. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: mandyd67
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the money, room was small by everything you needed, fantastic breakfast only missed the tomatoes on the full English, hotel is in the perfect position for theatre trip or shopping, very close to the tube, will use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Jeny-F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a theatre break was a good location for the show, Oxford Shreet and the train starions. The only bad points are that the rooms were quite small so can be a bit tight when both getting ready and that if you have more than 2 strands of hair the hairdryer will be no good, as you are better of with a towel. But I cannot complain about the location or the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Friends1031
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews we were not sure of what to expect, however as always we make our own minds up. We arrived early on 12th December for a two night stay (approx 12:30) and check in wasn't until 2pm. The receptionist asked if we had any preferences to which we said if possible could we have a refurbished and quieter room. There was going to be a slight wait for this room to be ready and so we were able to leave our luggage with the concierge. Check in was quick and when we got to our room we were pleasantly surprised. We were given room 508 on the 5th floor, the room had been renovated and had everything we needed (see photos). The room was compact however this suited us, everything was to hand - after all who needs a massive room with lots of unused floorspace? The bedroom had a double bed, x2 spare pillows were available on the wall unit as were x2 spare towels. The carpet was new and freshly vacuumed.There was also a small flat screen tv, electronic safe, kettle with tea, coffee, milk & sugar, fan and also a hairdryer. Everything was immaculate and very comfortable.There was a handy window with privacy blinds (this was great as the room did get a little warm from time to time). The bathroom was refurbished and had a bath and powerful shower, liquid soap and shower gel was also provided as was a shower cap and plenty of loo roll. There were a couple of big mirrors that were handy for getting ready to go out. There was also a full length mirror on the back of the room door. Each day we went for breakfast early and then came back to the room to get ready. After leaving the do not disturb sign on the door (correct way round) we were not hurried to vacate. The first day we left the room at 9:30am and the day of leaving 9:45am. Each floor had a handy vending machine, surprisingly the goods were not that expensive, 50p for crisps and £1 for water, there were also cans of alcohol and fruit drinks available. Breakfast was from 6:30am, we decided to get there early and beat the rush. The buffet style presentation comprised of bacon, sausage, hash browns, beans, scrambled eggs and rolls & spread. There was also cereal, croissants & jam, grapefruit & ham - more than enough to set you up for the day. If you get there early there is plenty of seating which is not crowded. Beverages consisted of fresh orange and apple juice and tea and various coffees - all self serve and unlimited. What we liked was the unobtrusive staff - they were very friendly and helpful when you needed anything. We did also take advantage of the coffee to go on the mezzanine level - lovely frothy cappuccino for £1.50. Check out was 11am on our last day - really quick check out and we left our luggage with concierge again until we got our train. The helpful concierge even hailed us a cab to the station. There is no actual charge for leaving the luggage - this is totally voluntary and more than deserved by the staff. I can only think that the bad reviews are from visitors that did not get a quiet refurbished room, the staff were great and we cannot fault the service we received. Would recommend this to anyone visiting the capital.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: jakmissba
Reviews.Content: The position of this hotel is ideal for sight-seeing. We asked for a quiet room so were on the 9th floor overlooking the frontage. The room was very small, but well appointed and adequate for our needs. it was immaculate and well decorated. The bed was comfy and the shower-room, again tiny was quite adequate. There were smaartly dressed polite helpful doormen and concierges and all staff were very polite and helpful. The 2 criticisms are that the bar area on the ground floor is too small and noisy when busy andthe buffet style breakfasts were much too canteen-like. This WAS a youth hostel and one can see why it is like it is, however for what we paid and wanted we can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean, comfortable and cost effective”
Reviews.Author: mattnchar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Giles for 2 nights on the 4th and 5th December. We had booked at the Comfort Inn, Edgware Rd but walked out after seeing the disgusting state of the Hotel. The St Giles was ideal. Situated right next to Tottenham Court Road tube station, it is an ideal base to explore central London and for shoppers it is around the corner from Oxford St. The hotel was clean, the staff were professional and it more than catered for our requirements. We were worried that the Hotel would encounter major noise but there was no problems whatsoever. If you are looking for a simple, affordable and centrally located hotel, the St Giles ticks all the boxes. We stayed on the 2nd floor overlooking a quiet street and the room although small (where in Central London isn't!), was clean, modern and airy. It also has a leisure facility, bar which has SKY Sports and a casino on site. We will almost certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and not overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Kalbrau
Reviews.Content: Very decent for the price given its Central London location. We had a slightly oddly shaped room as it was in one of the corners but it had everything we needed and the staff were helpful and courteous. Would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So Central”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Just back from stay at St Giles. Location could not be better for us ie sight seeing,shopping and going to theatre. Right beside tube and bus stops. Get daily ticket for zones 1 and 2 for £6.50 per day. You can also walk to most places from here. Good choice of places to eat nearby and not expensive. The type of dining we do on a city break is more of a food pit stop than sitting over food for hours. Rooms are basic but everything one needs on a city break are there, shower ,tea/coffee facilities, hair dryer. On day of your departure luggage can be left in a secure place for all day ,if required at no additional cost.I left a small tip for this service. Only downside for me was access to lifts. Because of number of floors they are nearly always full..

Reviews.Title: “Fab location & staff”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolMouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room which although it was on the small side, it was very clean with comfy bed & pillows. Shower was good. Room noisey at night due to location by Tottenham Court Rd & lacked good double glazing. The staff were amazing, so polite & helpful. We ate both nights in hotel, Italian restaurant served great food, lasagne £8.95, Chinese was similar price, with great food also. Hotel charged us only £1 per bag to keep bags after check out. This is a great hotel for the price & location. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in central London”
Reviews.Author: soulies
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Saturday night - good value for money in a very central position. Room was quite small, but more than adequate for a 1 night stay. No problem with noise, but we were on the 6th floor. Breakfast was included in our deal - good choice of hot & cold dishes.

Reviews.Title: “great location,just what the doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: beverley s
Reviews.Content: just returned after having 3 fab days for my husbands 40th,this hotel was just what the doctor ordered,fab value for money,breakfast £9.95,everything you wanted was available (except toast)the rooms were a little small but we were out all day so it was fine(room 112)the bathroom was very small but have to say was the best shower ever used very powerful and water was piping hot,and thats a first for a hotel with over 700 rooms,location could'nt be any better right in the heart of it all,soho,covent garden,buck palace,trafalgar square,picadilly,theatre land, all a stones through away,we went to see les miserable,it was breath taking,one to put on your must see list,over all we thought st giles was great value for money,and we will defo be returning and recommending it to friends and family,judge for yourself,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the money”
Reviews.Author: ElleBee32
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel as part of a theatre break I was nervous of what to expect after reading some truely awful reviews. However, I was more than pleasantly surprised. On arrival at the hotel just after 2pm we checked in swiftly and easily, despite the girl checking us in hardly raising a smile I really don't care, she did her job swiftly and efficiently and that's what counted for me. We were given a room on the first floor and found it easily. Upon opening the door I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. We had a twin room at the back of the hotel which was immaculately clean and smelt fresh. The bathroom was also sparkling and although there was no bath, we hadn't gone to London to spend hours soaking in a bath! The beds were very comfortable and the linen clean and crisp. There were tea and coffee making facilities in the room for a hot drink when you came in from a long day/night in London. There is a flat screen television if you want to watch a bit whilst relaxing in your room. I was also pleasantly surprised that there was a massive, well lit mirror above the dressing table, under which was located a good hairdryer meaning it was easy to blow dry and style hair without having to stretch to other mirrors or have none at all which so often happens at other hotels. I found the temperature of the room to be perfect for me, however if it was too warm a large, quiet fan for you to use. In the morning we went down to breakfast around 8.30am and yes, it was very busy. However there were plenty of places to plonk yourself down for a quick breakfast. The breakfast was nothing special but perfectly edible. Continental wise there were croissants, rolls, preserves, yoghurts and three types of fruit. Hot food was limited to Bacon, Scrambled Eggs, Sausage, Beans and Hash Browns. Perfectly acceptable for a 3* budget hotel. If however this isn't to your taste there is a Cafe Rouge and a Garfunkles literally two minutes round the corner which both serve breakfast. Upon checking out we asked if we could leave our luggage and it wasn't a problem. Not sure why people were charged £1 per item, we were not charged at all. The concierge who organised the left luggage was cheerful and happy to help, as was the girl who checked us out, very smiley and extreemely professional. The location of the hotel for the price is absolutely fabulous. About half a minutes walk away from Tottenham Court Road tube station, The Dominion Theatre (Currently hosting the absolutely brilliant 'We Will Rock You') and Oxford Street. During our visit we saw the musical 'Wicked' at the Victoria Apollo and would reccomend to anyone, an absolute spectacle! For those on a budget it is absolutely perfect, and for those who complain all I can say is you can't have a champagne lifestyle on a lemonade budget!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in the UK”
Reviews.Author: Ian W
Reviews.Content: Well I was unfortunate enough to be booked into this Central London Hotel for (thankfully) one night. Quite simply it is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, anywhere. The room was dirty, I would not have wanted to walk on the carpet barefoot and there was a large chunk of enamel missing from the bath. Please bear in mind this is a central London hotel, literally in the heart of the shopping district. When paying Central London prices I expect a few things to come as standard - as they do in EVERY other hotel I have ever been to. These are: Free wifi both in the hotel and in the room a selection of coffee, tea and hot chocolate with a few biscuits in the room toiletries to be provided such as soap, shower cap, razor and toothbrush, shower gel etc double glazing that WORKS... I had to clean the bath before I used it and was still wary of getting in due to the chunks of enamel missing. The standard stuff like a few sheets of notepaper and a pen/pencil by the phone was also absent. There was a note stuck to the wall in the bathroom stating that toiletries could be purchased from the vending machine by the lifts on my floor. I looked and it only contained a few bars of chocolate and some cans of beer. There is an ice machine but its on the ground floor and nothing was provided to carry the ice up to my room. In the end I didnt bother. Somehow they manage to block the London-wide free public wifi signal forcing you to use their own very expensive service. The rooms in the pictures on the hotels website are certainly NOT rooms in this hotel. They might be in one of the other hotels in the chain but definitely not this one. The air conditioning was far too loud so had to be kept off the entire night leaving the room extremely hot. There were no curtains on the window. The window itself was double glazed so I mistakenly thought I would get a peaceful nights sleep ready for my meeting the following morning. Despite the window being firmly closed I was awoken at 5.30 the following morning by very noisy traffic and shouting outside. I should not have been able to hear any of this, especially considering I was not facing the street and I was 5 floors up. The breakfast the following morning was a cheap disgusting hot buffet. The scrambled eggs were completely flavourless and the bacon overdone. Again, in Central London I expect my breakfast to be cooked to order not a help-yourself affair with every other guest breathing and coughing over the uncovered trays of food. I had a very unfullfilling breakfast which made me feel sick afterwards. If the room was clean, the bathroom repaired and the breakfast cooked to order, the facilities would be just about passable in a small town outside the city, maybe somewhere on the coast. Not in central London. The room was tiny, maybe 10' x 10'. This might be ok for a single room but mine was a double. One final gripe, the water pressure was so low it took me more than half an hour to run a bath. I will never again trust the rooms shown on a hotels website and I will certainly never be staying in a St Giles hotel group hotel again either. I did make a complaint but it has been ignored. Very, very poor.

Reviews.Title: “DONT EXPECT MUCH”
Reviews.Author: plymouthmolly
Reviews.Content: What can i say about the St.Giles in London we arrived Fri 2nd Dec at 13.00 our room was not ready but we expected that because booking in was from 14.00 fair enough, on our at 15.15 return we handed over the slip of paper we had been given at 13.00 thinking this would not take long WRONG it still took the reception another 10mins to locate what room we were in the only thing i liked about booking in they have a barrier system and nobody can push in front of you. the room we had was very small on the 6th floor you could not open the window very wide to look out over London due to the room only being small there was only a shower which is ok if you did not want a soak in the bath,also sometimes you were waiting a long time for the lift. the breakfast room I found was like siting in a works canteen also the waiters not very helpfull. just a tip also on your last day when you book out of the hotel our Train was not until 15.00 so we left our suitcase in the left luggage they charge you £1.00 for looking after your case other hotels I used they have never charged me before so on a trip to London make sure you don't spend all your money keep £1 for that service. me and wife had a fantastic weekend and if you are booking a weekend away for a show you must see GHOST THE MUSICAL fantastic but pick another Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: halfagaragedoor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel and found it to be perfect. We found our twin room to be a good size for the price, especially as it had a separate sort of annexe with a door leading to the bathroom. The room was very clean and comfortable. Check in was easy peasy and very quick. The room wasn't ready as we were earlier than the check in time stated on our reservation, so the excellent concierge service took our luggage whilst we went off to enjoy ourselves in Covent Garden. After a good night's sleep, as the hotel was surprisingly quiet, we had our excellent buffet breakfast the following morning. Limited choice for the cooked breakfast, but piping hot which is very rare for a buffet breakfast. Nothing was greasy, and it was all very fresh. The breakfast room had plenty of empty tables and all tables were cleaned as soon as people left. We checked out, again very easy, with no problems. Then for a nominal £1 we were able to leave our luggage with the excellent concierge again, whilst we went off to enjoy the British Museum. When we got back to the hotel to pick up our luggage, the concierge hailed a taxi for us (right outside the door of the hotel) to take us back to the station. Could not fault this hotel in anyway. Great location, great service, all for a great price. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irish85
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the end of November and booked a deluxe room. The romm was good with a separate seating area with tv, fridge, safe, teamaking facilities and aircon. Bedroom and bathroom were small but we expected this. We arrived early from our flight and when we asked if we could drop our bags reception checked and found that our room was ready so they booked us in. We were surprised to find that the price included a full cooked breakfast in a private restuarant. Location is perfect next to Oxford Street and within walking distance of theatres, museum etc. Would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “St Giles is what it is, a fair 3 star in a fab location.”
Reviews.Author: kiteman7246
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a large group on business for three days. Very easy to find, just a couple of minutes from the Dominion Theatre on the Totenham Court Road tube (now re-opened) or from Holborn. Rooms very very clean but most of our group moaned on about thiers being very small. Were were short of towels and coffee but after a chat with reception they were brought up in minutes. Bathrooms tiny but hey you don't live in them. Good shower. No toiletries you can "steel" but a bottle of generic soap supplied...stuck to the wall and shower cubicle. The room was typical of a 3 star, oakwood paneling anddecor which could have been any hotel any place. Compact, yes but very clean. This is a very very large hotel and you will battle for a seat at breakfast if you are not early enough to beat the old folk on bus tours staying at the hotel. Get to breakfast early, you have been warned. Food was fine but no toast or fried eggs or banannas...bummer. Fair selection at breakfast but not extensive. The food that was there was good enough for me. Buffet style for continental or full english...I had both. To pay for full breakfast is £9.99. Some used the small onsite shop. Reception is always very busy in the morning but if you are checking out you can just drop your key in a box and go. Concierge was on hand 24/7 and answered all our questions, though a smile would be nice. We arrived early but we were able to leave our luggage. The hotel has a small shop selling hot and cold drinks with sandwiches and snacks. The rocky road cheese cake was fab. The £2.98 special of a drink and a cake was handy. Enter the hotel, go up a few stairs, then turn hard right up another small set of starirs and its next to the loo. VERY useful as its open to the pulic and it's much cheaper and quieter than the surrounding tourist trap cafes. For £5 you can use the impressive sports centre of the YMCA as the hotel has its own entrance. Very nice 25m pool and loads of gym stuff. Some classes. They have lockers for £1 deposit. I have two major beefs with this hotel. 1. the lifts take forewver to arrive. Most times I just took the stairs. 2. our party had two people per room but they would not issue a second keycard or allow us to leave our keys. This caused us MAJOR logistical headaches as our group often spilt up and on many occasions a person was left waiting for the other to come back. Staff - the cleaning staff were always polite. The reception staff were to the point but without personality. Watching them do thier job from the chairs in the small shop it was clear they had to "process" large numbers of guests and they often worked long hours, but a smile costs nothing. Location - a couple of minutes from Oxford Street and the British Museum. Right in the heart of shopping. Other guests - Due to its size the hotel seemed to attract its fair share of touring groups on buses and many internatioanl groups. pretty much as you would expect. Would I go back...yes. London has far more crappy hotels than good ones and this one was ok for the travelling person on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: sillydilley
Reviews.Content: Worried a little about this hotel after reading some reviews on here. Emailed hotel asking for a room above floor 7 & at the back of hotel. When we got there they hadnt recieved the email, anyway we were put on 4th floor but room at the back of hotel. Room was fine, didnt find it noisy, there is a fan in room if u get too hot. Only complant i will mention there was always a wait for the lifts & were usually full. This is a very busy hotel & breakfast is a nightmare with the amount of people i would reccomend a late breakfast to be sure of actually getting in, food plentyfull but was a queue for the cooked food.. Will use again

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Bernice3
Reviews.Content: The location is good. The room we had was tiny. We hardly had space to move around in a twin bedded room. My roommate had to squeeze along the side of my bed to get to the one cupboard we shared for her clothes. To use the drawers for her underwear was so awkward, she shared the drawer with the bible on the small bedside cabinet. On using the tiny shower cubicle I tried to alter the temperature of the water and almost scalded myself - once you're in there, there's nowhere to dodge out of the way while you get the temperature right. In the restaurant there is not a teaspoon in sight - just plastic things to stir your coffee or retrieve the tea bag from the cup. On the plus side, it is clean and the concierge were friendly and helpful. The impression you get on arrival is let down by the rest.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, clean and friendly for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Laura H
Reviews.Content: myself and a friend spent a long time looking for a hotel in central london for a reasonable price, this ticked all the boxes so we booked a twin room for 2 nights. i was a bit concerned as a lot of the reviews were poor. however we had a pleasent suprise. we got there early and checked in with no problem, as we were early we were able to safely leave our luggage in the hotel (free). its not a grand or posh hotel but for £200 for 2 nights in a twin room - it was friendly, comfortable and clean and the rooms were big enough. we had coffee to go option in the price which was fine - a drink, pastry and piece of fruit. location was about 2 min walk from Tottenham Court Road Tube so was great for accessibility.would def stay again and reccommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Could not sleep”
Reviews.Author: Lauren J
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice,clean and in a great location. The windows are not sound proof and I did not get a wink of sleep. The streets are soo loud and London doesn't sleep so neither did I! Did not enjoy the pillows either they were thin and uncomfortable. housekeeping woke me up at 8:25am and I didn't have to check out until 11am so I wasn't happy after a terrible nights sleep to be disturb at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, great location”
Reviews.Author: GaryShrewsbury
Reviews.Content: Stopped here on business. It's in a great location and by London standards its reasonably priced. Service was fine, room was clean and because the window was wide open when I got there not too hot (unusual for London hotel). About the only negative was that virtually every chair in the bar had ripped seats - otherwise hard to fault

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt return”
Reviews.Author: jason_kayleigh
Reviews.Content: This hotel does have a great location central to most things. But the rooms were dated and are very small and extremely hot and you couldnt leave the window open as the latch was broken.The bed was certainly not a double more like 3/4.Again the bathroom so very small felt very claustrophobic in the shower,taps leaked all the time and only one bath towel was left.I was a little let down as the pictures on their website looked lovely!It was nice and clean though.We put a do not disturb sign on the door and staff still came in!Our day of departure staff woke us up knocking the door at 8am asking what time we were leaving-so rude, when you dont have to vacate until 11am.Breakfast leaves alot to be desired it was like a cattle market we had to return twice until we got a table.Maybe a reservation system would be good?They do not serve toast first time iv ever seen this in a hotel and only one type of egg scrambled.Very disappointed and few staff members were very rude.Next time i will stay on the outskirts and travel in to the centre would rather a nicer hotel like the crown moran.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel centrally placed for all attractions and shopping”
Reviews.Author: zoggie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in this hotel It is in a great location a few minutes walk from soho and oxford street, it is 50metres away from the underground and 50 metres away from the Dominium Theatre which was a bonus for us as we were booked into a show there. Unfortuately the first night we didn't get much sleep as there was so much traffic noise we were on the 6th floor on a corner of two noisey streets.The room was fine and had been updated although the bed was a bit soft. We asked to change the rooms the next morning, which they did straight away the receptionist was very helpful and understanding. We were put on the 9th floor where we heard very little noise for the rest of our stay although the room was ok and practical it could have done with up dating and a lick of paint but was clean.The buffet breakfast was average but there was choice.All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but very noisy outside and inside, rooms hot with window closed.”
Reviews.Author: Mcbottters
Reviews.Content: Rooms quite small Hot when window closed No bath only had small shower Very noisy inside and outside Excellent location for theatres and shopping Very clean Staff feiendly

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rubbish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kazza940
Reviews.Content: We had to wait 15 minutes to check in while the new girl made several mistakes. We were told we had been upgraded but as our room was the smallest we had ever stayed in I don't see how that was possible! We stayed 3 nights and if it hadn't been for the location we would have moved. Oh - and the shower was cold every day despite telling reception. Not great people!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...pity about the beds”
Reviews.Author: Izzadora
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Giles last night and are now in New York paying for having not had any sleep at this hotel. The place itself is good, the restaurant food was lovely and good value for money. The beds and pillows were awful. This was worse than a travel lodge and that's saying something for basic. It's a shame but would not stay there again on that basis.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Palmakedonka
Reviews.Content: Before booking into this hotel, I had read awful reviews in the net. Given the perfect location, especially when you have a small kid and need to be central AND reasonable in price, I was sure I would give it a try. So I learned from the reviews and made sure, they booked me into a renovated and quiet room. Therefore my experience was positive and I will be using this hotel again during my next trips. Yes, the entrance of the room is tiny, the door doesn't open widely, as well as the window, which is small and doesn't fully open. The bathroom was nice and in order (black tiles). Small TV, water cooker plus free coffee/tea, safe. I declined from breakfast since there are lots of coffee shops and supermarkets around, so no experience with that. I also had a coffee in my room before I left in the morning. There is a nice bar in the hotel, and the fitness club below the hotel. Entry is 5 LE per person, you can buy tokens from a machine and then use the club with the hotel towels. Pool is quite cool, not advisable for kids (yes, I tried ;)), it's a sports pool (of course in a fitness club). All in all, try this hotel, make sure you get a renovated room and accept, that for this location and price, the room HAS to be small and a bit old-fashioned. Just don't expect too much. For a few days, it is absolutely fine and in 1 minute you are on Oxford Street, or in 5 min. at Leicester Sqr.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Derbyclarky
Reviews.Content: Myself & four friends stayed at the St Giles mid November for a shopping/show/dinner weekend for a birthday. We found the staff friendly, the breakfast plentiful, the rooms small but comfy & the location fantastic. The ONLY negative was the room got extremely hot, we had the heating off & had to open the window during the night which cooled us down but let in a lot of noise. I would receommend this hotel for a short stay & definately stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central to London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathandDen
Reviews.Content: Stopped at this Hotel Sunday 20th November for one night - very helpful staff, check-in quick and easy - good and not expensive restaurant's / cafe's within the hotel complex together with a Spa pool and gym (cost £5 to use the Spa). Breakfast was very adequate for a Bed and Breakfast Hotel and the turn-around for clearing the tables and service was very good. All the staff in the Hotel were very friendly and efficient. Rooms were small but had everything you could need and want from toiletries to T.V. and tea/coffee making and a safe. Very good value and would recommend it to anyone. The Hotel is situate at the corner of New Oxford Street and very Central to all the attractions - 2 minutes walk to the British Museum (free entry) and within walking distance to Covent Garden/Soho/Theatreland etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Central London”
Reviews.Author: dizzymonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother on a cultural visit to London for her birthday. I thought the price was pretty good considering the usual rate for hotels in central London. The hotel is quite basic but you get what you pay for. The location is excellent expecially for the British Museum, China Town, the Underground station right practically right the doorstep and the whole of the West End at your disposal!! The room was quite hot but it was understandable for such a large building plus there was a fan provided so it wasn't too bad. Overall the cleanliness was to a good standard but it would have been nice to have real teaspoons instead of little plastic stiry things which melted inhot water! (silly little details but my mum and I like a good cup of tea so it was noticed!) Reception staff were efficient (not very talkative) but check in was fast and smoothly done. We were pleased by the ice machine located on the ground floor by the lifts but slightly disappointed WIFI is not free in the hotel as it was measleadingly advertised on the site I booked through. We had dinner in the Italian on site restaurant and on the whole were pleased with the food - it was quite basic but value for money. The bar at night was quite lively which was nice, they serve the drinks at the table so you don't have to stand at the bar for too long. All in all it was a pleasent enough hotel and we were pleased with our stay here. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “St Giles Hotel, London”
Reviews.Author: Scottishfamily4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times. Very large hotel, rooms small but comfortable. Good central location although beware Tottenham Court Road Northern line station closed at moment. Greatest asset is the YMCA Gym and swimming pool in basement, £5 charge for use of large facility.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in heart of London”
Reviews.Author: Helen L
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old daughter and I stayed here for a sight-seeing/ theatre/ museum/ shopping trip. We found it to be an excellent, central and great value place to stay. Staff, especially the concierges, very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. We had a twin room on the first floor at the back (Room 180) which was perfect. Amazingly quiet at night as not on the main road. (I imagine rooms at the front might be noisy.) Compact but clean and tidy room with both bath and powerful shower. Great all-channel TV which impressed my daughter! Another reviewer had suggested having breakfast in the Cafe Rouge round the corner rather than in the hotel. This was a lovely suggestion and the staff there were very welcoming (and the breakfasts delicious). Trafalgar Square, Oxford Street, British Museum, lots of theatres and restaurants all easily walkable. But also a stone's throw from Tottenham Court Rd underground and on good bus routes. (We took the No 24 - virtually outside the hotel - to Camden Market and back for a great day trip.) Would definitely stay here again. A great, good value hotel allowing more to be spent on London's many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Have been charged twice”
Reviews.Author: Sam c
Reviews.Content: I have booked a room for friend using my credit card asking the receptionist to just secure the room. My card and my friend's credit cards have been charged, This happened on the 25th October. I have sent 2 emails, called 8 times , My friend twice to get refund. They keep promising and nothing. We are the 19th November and still nothing. So I am reporting this incident everywhere about this hotel. Twitter, facebook,which magazine, touristic sites etc..

Reviews.Title: “St Giles on business trip”
Reviews.Author: MelAEP
Reviews.Content: Was a bit wary by the other reviews with this hotel but when we got there was very pleasantly surprised. The double room was excellent and the bathroom and shower were spotless and really modern. The hotel room had plenty of storage for clothes etc. and a digital safe in the room. Flatscreen TV with plenty of channels, hairdryer, plenty of towels & pillows and the staff were very helpful. Rooms were warm but a fan was provided. Traffic noise isn't too bad if you don't open the windows at night. Overall very pleased and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hot room that smells damp”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: Travelling on business, when I get to my hotel I just want to relax. The room was small and stuffy and very hot with no air con. A slightly damp smell too. I think there a probably better options in a similar location for a similar price. Try the Radisson Kenilworth just round the corner. Much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good every time”
Reviews.Author: spinneySouthampton
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at this hotel several times , rooms although not the largest are well appointed with all you will need for an over night stay ,right by tottenham court road tube ,on the door step of we will rock you show ,this hotel is very well located .20 mins walk will get you to other theatres restuarants etc. if an offer with your booking book the breakfast a self service job , very busy at times ,food hot and plentyful , the hot servery could be bigger to speed things up a bit. otherwise the £10;00 they charge is a little steep only because off the self service cafe enviroment , this is not a relaxed breakfast affair ,its a bit fast paced and noisy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Staff 5*, other NOT NOT worth the money”
Reviews.Author: grandhotelpark
Reviews.Content: First of all all my congratulations to most of the hotel staff...they were great!! Chinese male receptionist kind ands patient, a waiter at coffee shop above reception(think he said he was from Albania ) great and pleasent and at the end-a portugueese doorman, best of all. And that is where my kind words stop. The hotel has so small rooms and I supose it is ok but only if you are alone. The bathroom was ok . The pillows were so so small and they smell bad.It was not possible to open a window( only a little), the main light did not work but only thethree small once so I needed to light up all of them to see.....The hairdryer did not work...only if you would keep the red button all the time. The guest directory is full of informations on how hotel is not responsable for lot of things and they do not guarantee for lot of them, but I never found , for example, how to call from room to room???!!??? Aha, the breakfast, poor and like you are in a hostel, even worse ....the food so so not good... All in all , I would recommend it only to somebody who wants to be in a Centre of London and does not mind the food and accommodation....

Reviews.Title: “Doss house”
Reviews.Author: ChazAFife
Reviews.Content: From the outside and at the reception, the hotel looks fine, but the illusion ends there. At reception, I was greeted by a rather surly chinese woman, who barely looked up , handed me my key, and informed me that I was on the third floor. Got to my room and couldn't believe how dark and pokey it was. The decor was wood-chip wall to wall, the furnishings were from the 1970's and the bed had a distinct sag on it. The carpets in the room and hall were so filthy I didn't dare walk on them without shoes. The only concession to the 21st century was a wall-mounted flat screen TV which was so pootly fitted that they hadn't even attempted to hide the cables which ran back to a plug and socket perched precariously above the desk and mirror. Breakfast ranked amongst the worst experiences I have ever had. The choice for cooked breakfast was dessicated bacon, some cheap sausages, plastic scrambled egg and a potato and onion "rosti" which was swimming in grease. The layout is terrible - everything is everywhere and the experience/decor is what I can only describe as a second-rate school canteen.....I got in and out as fast as I could. Apart from location, there is really little positive ti say about this hotel and at £135 for one night I can't even say you get what yuo pay for......terrible, avoid like the plague. I won't be back under any circumstance.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: ajs1307
Reviews.Content: Ok this is really simple to review. It's in a great location for shopping, nightlife and theatres and by using booking websites, meant we got b&b for £50 pppn. Absolute bargain! Overall, this is ok but as you imagine, in a central location like this it has a massive turnover. Therefore everything looks 'well worn' and a bit battered and tired. The rom was ok but small but hey we didn't go to stay in the room all day. Athroom howecver was large modern and spotless. Breakfast resembled a staff canteen and again, everything was a bit battered but clean. We're staying here again next month but won't bother with breakast. I'd rather go to a Costa/Nero etc. In summary, this DOES represent xcellent value for money for central London. If you're seeing a show or doing xmas shopping you won't get better vfm or location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, very reasonable priced”
Reviews.Author: Yorkiet
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a theatre package deal, and have to say I was pleasantly suprised. Great location for central london, so easy to get to from the tube station, and a quick and easy check-in. We had a twin room, which was quite small but still ample room for two of us to be comfortable in. Very comfy beds, and it was clean and pretty quiet considering it was central London. There was plenty of storage space in the room, and the bathroom was nice and clean. Breakfast was included in the price, all you could eat and plenty of choice, and no queueing for anything. As we had to check out at 10am but weren't leaving London until late afternoon they let us leave our luggage there, which was easy to leave and easy to retrieve again. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Price”
Reviews.Author: TravelBunny1991
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here for a weekend in july 2009 and returned in August 2010. I found it to be great value for money, the rooms were clean, breakfast was generous and tasty. The location is fantastic, in walking distance of the theatre district and picadilly circus. It isn't a five star luxury resort but it certainly doesn't cost as much, and if like me you just want a base from which to explore all day, then it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “if u have to stay here then its ok”
Reviews.Author: jeans-r-us
Reviews.Content: this is a large hotel next to the tube station the location is very good i have stayed here a few times over the years and the hotel is ok and thats it full stop.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced central hotel”
Reviews.Author: mogsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here beginning of November 2011. We used it as a base for shopping and the Theatre This hotel is basic however it ticks all the boxes as its very central for shopping, theatre.and the sights.Yes I am sure ther are alot better hotels in London but we paid £211.00 for a double room for friday and saturday. The room was clean plenty of hot water and it served its purpose.It has Tea & coffee making facilities as well. The double room was small. A twin room is alittle larger. This was our second visit to this hotel. I consider it was value for money considering the hotel prices in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy room, great breakfast, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Jayne H
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the St Giles Hotel and Leisure Centre end of 31st October/ 1st Nov 2011. Its a lovely modern well run hotel with great facilities, very nice spacious and comfy rooms, nice restaurants and was reasonably priced for a 3 * hotel. Its in a very central location near the British Museum. The staff are all very professional and helpful and speak excellent English which is a novelty in a London hotel. I do have arthritis and some minor mobility problems and getting up and down the stairs at reception and to the self service restaurant was a struggle but I was offered the wheelchair lift (which I declined as I managed ok if slowly). We enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone on business or a shopping, sight-seeing or show break. There were lots of French families with children so its obviously good for families too. The food in the self service restaurant (and the decor) is very nice and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms with no sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: Sabum
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms with no sound proofing at all, thus giving a feeling of no privacy. Staff were polite, but overall the quality of the accomodation was poor. Only recomend if on a tight budget and not going to spend any time in room. Resturaunt does not do toast at breakfast - strange!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SteHallsworth
Reviews.Content: I have stated here several times on business and have never had any reason to complain. The staff are polite. The rooms are small and fairly clean, but are very tired and dated. As with the rest of the hotel, I feel a refurb is overdue. As this is a busy hotel, you can sometimes hear other guests moving around the corridors, which is irritating. Also, make sure you hang your DND sign if you don't want to be woken up by housekeeping! Overall, good value for money considering the area, however it is nothing special. Great if you just need somewhere to sleep for the night.

Reviews.Title: “fairly good for short visit”
Reviews.Author: simester
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel fairly good, for a short visit , as usual the room s are small but, hey ,thats London and thats usual. the breakfast room is unpleasant so id avoid that and as there are so many good breakfast places nearby ......One thing though is that the lifts are always busy so if your staying on a high floor, i hope you dont suffer from clautrophobia

Reviews.Title: “Very average trying to look good and failing”
Reviews.Author: Elena Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 3 times already, mostly because of the location. But I decided that this time is my last time. I had enough. It is bad value for money. Its one of those cases when an average hotel tries to look better than it is, and fails miserably. First of, my booking was messed up. Twice. I had to call twice to correct it and when I arrived I found out the second part of my booking was still messed up! I'm very tired of the staff that just isn't qualified for their job. When I was checking in, I specifically asked for ai quiet (very light sleeper) non smoking room (as I have allergies), and a good view. I get to my room and guess what I get - first room down the hall from the elevator, the noisiest place! and I open the door and guess what - strong smell of old cigarette smoke and the view at the wall! I go downstairs to change the room and the guy who checked me in immediately disappeared as soon as he saw me. The other girl immediately gave me a room on a different floor (ask for 7th, it was renovated, unlike 6th). On my second part of stay I had an Executive double. The only good thing I can say about it is the size of the room. Everything else is... There is no single drawer in the room, or a proper shelf for clothes or underwear or cosmetic stuff. I guess they think foreigners don't wear underwear and don't need a discreet place for tampons (sorry for being so blunt, but I'm so mad!). Its just stupid! Cheap plastic in the bathroom instead of tile, smell of sewer, tiny sink, cheap plastic shelf thingy where they put the hotel provided shampoo and other stuff, a shelf for the shower itself that doesn't stick to the wall, a very old blow-drier and the list goes on and on. Seriously. If you call a room executive double and charge the money you charge for it, have the decency to furbish it as such. The room where I stayed at the beginning of the trip, a simple double, had this very old blow drier that is stuck to the wall of the bathroom, very loud, very broken, very sad... And non existent sound proofing. The door is heavy but I was woken up every morning by the knock on someone's door at 8am with loud words "housekeeping". The elevators are a joke. They are programmed in such a stupid way it will take you ages to wait for it and then ages to get to the floor you need. The only good thing about this hotel is location. But there are much better and cheaper hotels in the area. Seriously. I tried to get used to this hotel for a while, but I just had enough. It was my last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: candice2411
Reviews.Content: Me and my mum stayed here for a girls shopping/theatre trip and wanted a hotel with a car park and very central. However we know that is hard to find in London unless you pay alot for it. But this hotel was great, basic rooms which are quite small but clean and comfortable for our stay as we were hardely in our room. The bed was comfy and it had a tv with all the main channels which was great! Come out of the hotel, turn left and a sainsburys is there so you can get abit of food shopping or grab a paper, then head further down the road and your at oxford street! I couldnt fault this hotel however if your looking for luxury, expensive, big rooms it isnt for you. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: sujjay
Reviews.Content: Hotel was adequate and breakfast fine with enough variety to suit all. Its very big and reception was quick and professional. Our room was good and relatively clean - we asked for an upgrade for double glazed windows as we were told it is very noisy - met people who had not slept for the noise. As previously stated its very near to lots of sites. Walking distance to Leicester Square and Covent Garden and in other direction Oxford Street etc. The waitresses were a bit too quick at whipping away plates and cups when you had not finished which needs addressing but overall for one night it was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: patfleming
Reviews.Content: First time staying here. Excellent value and great location. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, but not really nice”
Reviews.Author: Karsten W
Reviews.Content: It is a big hotel with many small, dark rooms that are not really inexpensive. One plus overall: very nicely situated...close to many sites; even in walking distance. The Dominion Theatre is next to it which offers one of the best musicals in town: We Will Rock You.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: hjerteCph
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights in October, I have stayed at the hotel before last year. It is a very average hotel, but the location is really good. We stayed in a twin room, it´s very small, but it´s clean, the carpet seems a bit worn out and maybe not so clean. One very bad thing was that the room was extremely warm, and we could only open the window a little bit. I will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average. Lovely desk staff but rude breakfast staff.”
Reviews.Author: Xxdellstarxx
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel as part of a thompsons sport group. The hotel seemed nice our room wasn't ready but they did there best to get it ready for us. The room was really small and they where hammering in the room next door. The room was so warm and the windows hardly open. What I didn't like was the breakfast. I appreciate it was busy was the weekend at half 8 so I was more than happy too wait my turn I say down at a booth type table I pulled a seat do my boyfriend could sit opposite. A member of staff ran over and pulled the chair away and spoke to me like I was 7 saying I could not put a chair there. I shrugged it off and went for breakfast. I went too get hot breakfast and went for the spoon, I dropped ONE bean and one of the kitchen staff where disgustingly rude and snapped at me too put my plate closer, when I did he looked at me and and said it doesn't matter now it's been done picked up the bean and threw it into the kitchen. I'm sorry I dropped ONE bean and was spoken to disgustingly. I was do upset I proceeded too check out early! I was too embarrassed to complain.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Declanf04
Reviews.Content: Its as simple as this, Location is quite simply second to none, on the doorstep of Oxford street, Yes the rooms are small and the Desk staff are far from helpful but when you are going to central London, Its for Theater, Bars and the buzz of the city, its not for a quiet relaxing weekend, For a simple hotel just used for sleeping then YES, for a nice relaxing time in London then NO, but for us it was great, just for the Location

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in Ace location”
Reviews.Author: hexaminer
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel. I stayed on business and found it to be clean and sufficient room. The hotel is very central for the West end and attractions. Breakfast canteen style - cheap and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hammarby
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Small rooms but that doesn´t matter! Nice staff and ok price for staying int the middle of where it all happens! It´s a nice place and the standard is what it use to be in London. But I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. rooms not that big a deal!”
Reviews.Author: markfeet
Reviews.Content: So the rooms are quite small. not a problem for me. great location. decent staff and service. good price for central London.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here ! Simple as that !”
Reviews.Author: kateycon
Reviews.Content: On arrival at reception, the staff member was quite surly, not a good start, but never mind I thought, it's not personal ! The key did not work on arrival at room and I was told I was doing it wrong, I'm 48 and capable of flashing a fob at a door ! The tiny single room was very basic, and the bed was ok, the bathroom tiny with the most enormous step into the shower. The worst thing was the breakfast arrangement, it is more expensive to buy online than in the hotel. It was, as others here have said, like a school dining room, with long queues for everything, You collected a tray for a self service buffet, very poorly laid out, not enough tables, if there is two of you, unless you left your belongings on chairs while you waited in the queues (they admit it can be 20 minutes queuing !) then you would have to take turns to eat ! Madness ! The food was very poor quality too. The lifts were crazy, with people waiting for ages at peak times, because people were so fed up they were cramming into the overcrowded lifts, to the pont that several times people had to get out so it could move. Just dreadful, they just cannot manage the amount of people they squeeze in there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, added bonus of a free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Onourjollies2011
Reviews.Content: Rooms are reasonably small but the lounge area made up for it. Not enough lights in the room amd no air con which was needed even in october. No double glazing so it was a bit noisy. Clean and tidy plenty of towels and a great lovation. Staff are friendly also.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot but bit rough around the edges.”
Reviews.Author: timvs
Reviews.Content: A very last minute stop so was lucky they had a room, though staff on desk could have been friendlier. It's a bit of a labyrinth through the corridors but once found the room whilst it was hardly cosy in its smallness it was functional. The shower wasn't the best in terms of cleanliness but decent otherwise, and luckily I wasn't interested in the view as windows were a bit mucky. Clean room elsewhere though. Bit friendlier on check out and didnt take breakfast so can't comment but for the location it's ok for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Anarchy at Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: proyle
Reviews.Content: Mobbed from the minute we arrived until we left. Room was OK, small and rather hot with no aircon and it was to noisy to have the window open. when trying to get to sleep noise from lifts was annoying, it must have been pergatory for those with rooms next to the lift shaft. Breakfast was like a primary school canteen with long queues, too few tables and very sad food. The hotels was full of tourists as its situation was good for shopping [ Oxofrd Street ] or visiting the theatres in the west end.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: Stayed at St. Giles as a part of a sports package for a game at Wembly. Room was so tiny suitcase had to be stored in front of exit door. Shower had no water pressure and no hot water, forget washing hair. Mold in shower tile and on shower curtain. Room was on 11th floor and street noise was so loud could not sleep. Hallways are so narrow could not pass with suitcase when maid cart was out. Toilet did not flush and when we reported it were promised service. Had to go to lobby or next door to casino to use toilets. At check out still no service received. Breakfast room is very large but bread rolls were cold and stale, orange juice was watery and sausages were inedible (had to spit them out). Breakfast is served early (6:30am) so we were able to eat before leaving for early flight. Hotel is not handicap-accessible (flight of stairs up to lobby area where lifts are located) and elevator to advertised 12th floor and rooftop was out of order with a "will be fixed soon" sign during entire stay. Not at all close to Wembly so not a great choice for any sports packages, ie. two tube rides with over an hour travel. Beware walking anywhere near the front door of the hotel, impossible to breathe with a constant crowd of smokers directly blocking the doors. They have a touch key system in which the key cards must be expensive since the key card has a 6 inch x 1 inch plastic fob attached with a warning about charges for lost key card. Very inconvenient to carry in pants pocket. So relieved I had chosen another hotel for the previous part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: spc1
Reviews.Content: Many of the previous reviews have summed it up pretty well. It's a hotel aimed at the mass tourist trade. The decor is a bit worn and the rooms are normal for London - small and poky but typical of the area. The bed in my room was broken, so I asked for a room change and this was granted without any hesitation. Full marks for that. The second room was a slight improvement on the first, except that the fan was extremely noisy as a bearing seemed to have worn out. The lift doors at the far left hand would not shut properly, leaving the lift stranded on the ground floor with people (including myself) in it. A bit scary for a minute. There is an ironing room, which was very handy. I wondered how I would get an ironing board up in the bedroom as it was so small, but this was not necessary. If you use it make sure the iron is clean. Someone had melted some material onto the iron and I had to rub it off once the iron heated up. The breakfast experience was awful. The dining room, whilst large, was crowded. I had to queue to get a table, and when I managed to sit down the food was poor. The coffee was weak, the "orange juice" was orange water and the sausages were very cheap, overcooked rubbish. As for the rest of the food, well I can only say that this was a one star experience. Any tourists visiting London from another country please do not think that typical English food is normally anything like this. However it was obviously not all bad - The concierge was helpful; the hotel was packed with people, and there were lots of smiles and laughs, so a lot of people were obviously enjoying themselves. If you want a hotel in the centre of London, near the underground railway network, in close proximity to the theatres then this will probably suit you. If you are a business person, or looking for a carefree romantic weekend then my advice is to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “ENJOYED BREAK”
Reviews.Author: summerhousechic
Reviews.Content: hotel changed a little from last time there,5/6 yrs except breakfast area now beautiful restararaunt .-food excellent in itallian restaraunt room a bit on the small side but comfy beds.decore in toilet dated needing refreshed here and shower replaced.although corridor newly painted AND flooring new .SO MAYBE WORK IN PROGRESS. would still go back wouldn.t put me off as last time room was bigger and new so maybe only a blip.what you see is what you get. bar busy and great!!

Reviews.Title: “Even for the money - I wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Pellaz-CA
Reviews.Content: The location is fairly good - and that's the best thing this property has going for it. It's quite worn out - best way to describe our floor and room was like a college dorm that was past its prime - decor along with a slight odor. The place was obviously a favorite for tour groups as it was very full. We were able to check in/out quickly, even though it was busy, the desk staff was helpful. The coffee bar was just too busy, so we opted out of the free coffee offer (no coffee maker/etc. in the room) and bought our own on the street - the concierge was mobbed. Neither of those are deal breakers for us, you just have to wait your turn - but we wanted to get out and roam about... Bottom line, if you are looking for a romantic weekend or a comfortable stay with modern ammenities - don't book this property.
