If all you are going to do is crash in your room and you require fairly cheap accomodations - then go for it - it makes sense. Our goal was to have a fun weekend - fast and furious - shopping during the day, catch a play and stay out to the wee-hours & sleep till' we rise - so it worked out ok. We are heading back to London in three weeks and chose not to stay here again (actions speak louder than words).

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynne W
Reviews.Content: Bedrooms a little on small side but clean and beds comfortable. On arrival we were not satisfied with the first room as there was a very noisy fan we could not turn off. we were quickly installed into another without fuss. After spending the evening out we returned to the lively bar before we retired for the night. There was a party atmosphere and mixed age range. Staff served at table so no queueing for drinks. Our room was on 7th floor so were not disturbed by noise from the bar after we went to bed. we were woken by noise from the street in the early hours when the clubs turned out, but sleep with the window open, it was soon remedied by closing it. I can't comment on breakfast as we decided not to et before we left but can comment on bar snacks that were tasty if a little pricey. I would definately stay again as location is perfect. But not for more than 2/3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, too expensive for the quality”
Reviews.Author: klinika
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for London, especially for West End shows, and shopping. Hotel is not bad, but service is too slow, rooms are tiny, and beds are not quite comfortable. This hotel would be great if the room was priced somewhere around 60-70 GBP per room, but as iti s double than that, it is not such a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Andie00196
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Very near a tube drop off point from Heathrow airport. About a 5 min walk from Oxford street and a 10 min walk from the best theatres. Everything you need within walking distance. Large hotel, rooms somewhat small though considering the size of the foyer. No air conditioning however rooms provide a large fan which works very well. Reception staff not overly friendly, still not exactly ignorant either. Very nice chinese restaurant downstairs and Italian one above foyer too. Internet access was handy as well. Swimming pool and sauna, and if you wanted you could have a facial or a massage which was well documented in the rooms guide. All in all, this hotel was good value considering its location and also considering the fact that nothing went wrong! Highly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but unbelievably noisy!”
Reviews.Author: lilibet42
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, a Saturday, for a late birthday present. Yes, it is a superb location especially for the British Museum. However, I agree about reception. Very unhelpful. I went down and asked politely if we could have some decaff coffee sachets, she did not seem to know what I meant and just said NO! The room was on 5th floor and perfectly OK and very clean but it was very hot as it was sunny and there is no a/c. The Concierge were much more helpful and did provide us with decaff coffee. BUT the big problem is the noise!! The windows were double glazed but did not shut out any of the street noise at all. Usually you can hear the sound get quieter as soon as you shut the windows but not here. The noise was awful. All night there was shouting and yelling and sirens sounding. Luckily I had a small radio with ear plugs and just plugged them in and listened to classic fm ALL night which did not shut out the noise but helped me not to focus on it. Never again. There may be rooms away from the street or, if you can afford an executive room, it may be different. We did not try the bar or restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Ambrose1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a whistle stop London theatre fest and the hotel is ideally situated for theatreland. However, this is not the place to stay if you want a place to stay with charm, character and a warm welcome! Checking in was a soulless experience - the member of staff we dealt with hardly looked up from her computer screen and so we weren't off to the best of starts. The chirpy chappy at the concierge desk next morning made up for it though - he managed service with a smile, which goes a long way in my book! Our room on the 6th floor was small but clean. Breakfast is an experience akin to a large High School cafeteria - and the menu limited if plentiful. The St Giles is a clean, handy place to sleepover in the capital if you are on a restricted budget and want to be centrally located - just don't expect any frills or ambience! It may also be worth pointing out that there is some construction work going on around the nearest tube stop, Tottenham Court Road, so not all services stop there at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Popular "hotel machine"”
Reviews.Author: Ragnhild
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very large, and very popular. However, it is a hotel machine, and the reception area is totally chaotic at times. Reception staff not particularly friendly, some of them seems to be pretty sour, but it varys. Chaos by the elevators, so don't be in a hurry. Problems with the electronic keys, we had to go down twice in two days to get the key "re-charged" as it didn't work when we came in again. We had a executive suite, and it was ok. 28 sq.meters with a double bed, living room area, and large bathroom. Some will probably react to the frosted glass in the window between the living room and the bath room, and also the frosted door to the bathroom. The room had good AC and a fridge with complimentary water. Nice cleaning. Ate a great meal in the Italian restaurant on the arrival-day - friendly staff and great food. The breakfast was served in a separate place for executive rooms, and it was never crowded, the food good, and the staff was really friendly. Will probably not stay here again, because of the logistic problems they seem to have when it comes to reception area and elevators, and the constant crowd that was there. But, if you just need a place to sleep, this hotel's location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but shoddy hotel with comical staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsFussbags
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as a business trip. Reception fine, room tiny and bathroom likewise. Middle of the night I smell tobacco smoke. Could not tell where it came from save for through the airvents. At a loss about it but it was very strong and unpleasant. Made the mistake of eating in the restaurant as it was a corporate do. What a nightmare. I have never eaten such a poor meal. Soup was seriously like water with bits in and the waitress managed to pour it all over my jacket and down my back as she attempted to pass it to another diner!! The rest of the meal was just so awful that I went to bed starving gave breakfast a miss and had a croissant on the run from starbucks. Not a great hotel, adequate at best, dreadful food but in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Threadbare carpets but friendly service”
Reviews.Author: AngelaBax
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is brilliant and the staff were very accommodating and friendly - which is not always the case in London! The hotel seems to be a favourite with tour groups which makes it crowded most of the time. The rooms are really small (not unusual in the UK). The carpets on the 7th floor were really worn - a renovation is long overdue. BUT I would probably stay here again as it is in the budget price range that is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last weekend, simple message AVOID, AVOID, AVOID ! The only positive to report is the location the rest is terrible. Breakfast was a joke (you cannot even get a slice of toast !!) rooms tiny decor old and tied and the staff either don't care or or are so badly trained they don't know what to do. Reception is a joke and when you have the cheek to complain they just shrug and ignore you and then we get to the cost, you get all this "wonderful experience" at a premium rate and that does not even include entry into the leisure centre for which you have to pay £5.00 PER VISIT !! NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is tired and in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: nanadod_11
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is quite good as right by the Tottenham Court Road station and the shops in Oxford Street.However the hotel is extremely tired and in desperate need of refurbishment. The check in staff lack personality and are rude in their approach. We were passed from pillar to post with one girl looking at us as if we were aliens! The girl that finally dealt with us was very nice but one out of four is a poor ratio. The first room we were given smelt so we requested a change. The next room smelt exactly the same... assuming they would all be the same we accept it. The rooms are very small as was the bathroom. When the shower was on the rest of the bathroom was soaked. If you want a good nights sleep I would not suggest this hotel as extremely noisy. If you open the window the traffic noise is unbearable. Breakfast was very good. The concierge was also very helpful. Considering the price of the hotel compared to a Premier Lodge I think it is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Might be a good location but thats where it ends”
Reviews.Author: Keane79
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on a shopping trip to London. The girl at reception was lovely and the location is excellant but thats where the good ends. The room was awful, Old, Cold, and very very small. The Bathoom was tiny. Wont be staying again

Reviews.Title: “st giles one night stay”
Reviews.Author: johnybadluck
Reviews.Content: Great location room ok nothing special reception staff dont understand when a booking as been paid in advance good job the manager was their to sort our booking out as the reception clerk told us we had not paid when we had.Fair price for a fair hotel will stay again. Breakfast very good.Very noisy at night and early morning outside.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: LHR2LAX_8
Reviews.Content: I too was a little apprehensive about staying here based on some of the reviews. I chose it because of it's location and it's cost was very reasonable. Check-in was easy, receptionnist pleasant and effecient,we arrived around Noon hoping to at least stow our bags, but the room was infact ready. We were on the 9th floor. Room was clean and functional. No smaller than other central city locations I have stayed in. A nice view of th BT tower. The exhaust fan didn't work, so first time the shower was used the room did get a little steamy! Lifts were no great problem, there were tea making facilities and the flat screen tv worked fine. I would certainly stay here again. The rooms could be a little warm during the Summer, as I didn't see any evidence of air conditioning, but in London I doubt it would be a deal breaker. For the money I thought this place to be a good deal. I didn't take the breakfast option, as there are many cool little places to explore in the vicinity. If I was paying 300 GBP a night as an average cost I would be disappointed but for the value we received it was great deal.

Reviews.Title: “very cold”
Reviews.Author: abbigailEngland
Reviews.Content: Booked for two nights but checked out after first night. Dont know if the air conditioning in the bathroom was broken but after a luke warm bath(NO HOT WATER) and cold air blowing all night we were both frozen to the bone all night. We got up very early as we could not stop shivering . The room was otherwise very clean but small, and the breakfast o.k.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: robert M
Reviews.Content: Our hotel hadn't been cleaned. The carpet was covered in bumps and looked like it hadn't been shampooed in years. The woodwork was pretty shoddy. The divan bed bases were torn and were very shaky. The shower room was a hole in the wall, the tiles were covered in mould and all the seals were pealing off. This is supposed to be a 3 star hotel. we couldn't get to sleep due to noise from extraction fans or heating systems. Breakfast was basic with what looked like powdered eggs. The milk machines were broken and mugs were wet on the trays.

Reviews.Title: “Bathrooms need upgrade and cleaning!”
Reviews.Author: Anne D
Reviews.Content: Stayed in single room on 5th floor. Bedroom was small but sufficient. Bathroom was terrible. Stained shower tray. Light replaced and connector of wires covered with tape exposed to view. Layer of dust and scum on sink pipes. Cleanliness leaves alot to be desired. Staff contact minimal-busy hotel so not alot time to interact. Food what one would expect in hotel that busy.

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: cement12
Reviews.Content: good central location, rooms basic but comfortable drinks making facilities hairdryer.on arrival reception staff friendly and informative. if on high floor lifts can be a pain.breakfast food good but finding a table hard, especially between 8.30 and 10am.tip; find a table first before you get your brekky and for those who like toast there isnt any.we were there for a show(mamma mia) absolutly brill.Anyone going for a london experiance must visit the ice bar in mayfair.... awesome,also champagne bar at st pancras station. all in all this hotel provided everything you needed. would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good pit stop in central London”
Reviews.Author: jaczc
Reviews.Content: Since 1999 I've stayed at the St Giles if I can't find a good London hotel deal anywhere else. The location is fantastic just by where Tottenham Court Road and Oxford Street meet so I can walk to all the shops, bars and restaurants. The rooms are basic but at least you know they'll be clean and the price is good. Its a good bedroom factory. Counter staff and doormen are always friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for your London city break - but don't stay next to the lifts!!”
Reviews.Author: embojones
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the St Giles for 4 nights and, overall I'd say that our stay was a very good one. OK, the rooms are a bit on the small side but ours was clean and tidy and well prepared every day. At the end of the day, the chances are that if you've stayed here you're only going to use the hotel as a base for your shopping / sightseeing / business so you'll only be sleeping / getting changed there anyway! You'll certainly struggle to get a better location with Oxford Street less than five minutes walk away and some fantastic restaurants in Soho only five minutes on top of that! What I would say is make every effort to have a room that is situated away from the lifts! We were iniitially allocated room 532 which was great - until about 3am the next morning when it was obvious that the herds of drunken elephants trampling noisily past our room on their way to and from the lifts were going to continue doing so for quite some time - and so they did!! Next morning we got in touch with reception and told them our tale of woe. I would suspect that this was not the first time they'd heard this tale as they allowed us to change room with no hassle at all (I would have to say that I found the staff to be very helpful at all times) . After that, a great stay was had!!

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in London”
Reviews.Author: jamesavfc
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a long weekend in London and stayed at the St Giles Hotel. The location could not have been better. Although we did buy a ticket to use the tube, due to its location this was not needed, as all the places we wanted to visit were within walking distance. If you are taking a theatre break then this hotel couldnt be better, We took th option which included breakfast which was plentiful. In fact we could not find fault at all. The only negative point was that they charge £1 per bag if you would like to leave your luggage following an early checkout! Would recommend this hotel for anyone spending a short time in London.

Reviews.Title: “st. giles review”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller59
Reviews.Content: Location brilliant. Staff very helpful. Found the continuous music in the bar too loud, therefore went to other bars in the vicinity

Reviews.Title: “A PAINFUL EXPERIENCE /FALSE IMPRESSION”
Reviews.Author: LelahScotland
Reviews.Content: For all visitors coming to London, Do not book into this Hotel. A very false impression of warm welcome, swish facade, porter to greet you, belies the very basic accommodation this hotel provides. Rooms are tiny,box style, fitted out with open plan wall mounted fitments, no drawers space, and one has to be very careful when walking past this unit due to danger of head injury. Window of approximately 18 inches wide, no daylight as you are facing a concrete section of the building, so can see no skylight. Ventilation poor, noisy from main road traffic and noisy revelers, so no sleep. A three night break left us exhausted. Do people know this was previously the Youth Hostel of London. Now redone up as a glorified hotel or hostel! Cost of over £100 per night, a very expensive hostel. Breakfast for over 700 guests, a nightmare experience, cafeteria with massess of uncleaned tables, took ten minutes before finding a clear table, machines for coffee, juice, milk and queues everywhere for food. Worse I am sure than Butlins Hokiday Camp, or indeed as my brother commented, worse than his experience of the Military Barracks. Bedrooms poorly serviced. Central to theatres and British Museum, but unfortunately this did not compensate for the overall dreadful experience of this hotel. Concierges helpful and polite. Would not reccommend this hotel. TRISH

Reviews.Title: “For the price in the West End, its a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Comedinewithmegalway
Reviews.Content: We (my partner and I) decided that a trip to London was in order. We wanted to stay in the West End and so I stumbled upon this hotel thanks in part to Ryanair. We checked in, no problems. The room was very average but at £100 a night for the two of us, we weren't complaining. The room was clean and quiet and that's all we really cared about. I don't see the point in spending £250 a night when I'd rather spend less on a hotel and go see a couple shows and have dinner! So thats what we did. If you book this hotel, please have realistic expectations otherwise you'll be disappointed. It's lovely, the location is incredible with a Starbucks right around the corner, good restaurants, close to soho, 1 block away from the tube station, I mean, what else do you really want in the heart of London? This place is great for couples or small groups who don't need shiny, new amenities, big T.V,'s or robes and slippers in order to enjoy themselves. We liked it so much we've booked another trip in December for the craic. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good break”
Reviews.Author: Charles H
Reviews.Content: Room clean and comfortable. Excellent location. Food very good Overall Hotel was ideal for our visit/

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: maddox66
Reviews.Content: Very good location. On the downside rooms are small but for a short stay they do have everything required.

Reviews.Title: “Our 25th anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kirkwallian
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, ideally located for the West End. Our room was very small and we would not been very comfortable for a longer stay than the 3 days we were there. Breakfast was very nice and had a decent choice of cereals etc. We would certainly stay here again, but would upgrade to a bigger room. Tha staff were very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “rooms too small, staff unfriendly, noisy, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Laphroaig47
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times already. The rooms are small, as in most London hotels but the difference struck me ven more this timee as I moved to a Marriott the next day where my bathrom was about the same size as the St Giles room. Check-in is always a mess. Queue up and wait 20 minutes is just not what customers accept anymore. Unfreidnyl staff, taking the phone andhandling all other matters while they check you in, resulting in an even slower check-in process. A friend of mine spend 20 mintutes waiting to check in and 20 minutes at the check-in desk. Breakfast is horrible. Somebody has thrown blocks of cheese on a plate, one of the guests asked for a fried egg and was told to take boiled eggs instead. The breakfast room has no ambition to be cosy or inspiring, this is just a place you want to get out of as quickly as possible. In the rooms there is a lot of noise from the street. No mini-bar. Staff in the bar downstairs have that dollar look in their eyes. The waitress was very friendly but I overheard some comments from the chef about a couple that had just ordered their diner and they had to pay before they got served, the manager insisted on that. Horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: simba2109
Reviews.Content: Good reception staff very friendly. Good meal in the Malaysian resturant. Room clean quiet, a bit small but reasonable price. Would go again, great location.

Reviews.Title: “girlie weekend”
Reviews.Author: macrascals
Reviews.Content: Went with 3 friends and had two twin rooms on 5th floor.Rooms were bigger than expected after reading other reviews,plenty of room for 2 of us to get ready.Bathroom small but adequate,good hot shower.Rooms and rest of hotel were spotless,breakfast good,no problems getting a table.All staff were polite and friendly eventhough the hotel was extremely busy. A special mention to the breakfast staff who were very efficient at clearing tables and re stocking food,crockery etc,although they seemed overworked.We stayed Friday-Sunday and left cases with concierge on Sunday so we could go to Covent Garden,this only cost £1 each.Woken up early due to nearby building work,but nobody goes to London to stay in bed!!A bit noisy outside at night but it is central London,but no noise inside the hotel.Location great about 15min walk to covent garden,tube 2 minute walk,5 minutes to oxford street.We booked a package through superbreak which included tickets for wicked which was fantastic.We also has afternoon tea at Charing Cross Hotel for £19.95 which was lovely.Avoid the hotel bar-extortionate prices!!All in all a great hotel for a short break.If you want somewhere clean to sleep and shower would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty handkerchief in the bed.”
Reviews.Author: elsamorgado
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 day stay in London where I attended a conference. The choice of this hotel was based on location and on some favorable reviews I found in Tripadvisor. But I was very disappointed. Upon arrival I found a dirty handkerchief (see photo) between the bed cover and the sheets. I called the reception and the person in charge came to my room. He apologized a lot but was unable to spontaneously offer a solution. My requests for a bed change or a room change were denied. He said the hotel was overbooked and at that hour (around 10 pm) the housekeeping services were unable to provide clean sheets and the bed change. He offered me a free breakfast for the next morning. I did not accept his offer because it did not address my problem. One last remark, internet access only if you pay. Even in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Central location but night long police and ambulance sirens.”
Reviews.Author: alpman
Reviews.Content: This is a busy hotel in central London. At night the streets are noisy and unfortunately the noise makes it up to highest floors making for a broken nights sleep. Stayed for 6 nights and they were all bad. Rooms are small but functional. Breakfast had a good choice but the cheapest sausages they must be able to buy. Overworked staff seemed permanently fed up.

Reviews.Title: “A Basic Hotel with Few Home Comforts”
Reviews.Author: SIRNED
Reviews.Content: When I came to check this hotel out before visiting, the latest review I found was for 2009! In this case, I thought, I would prepare a detailed update. When I come to upload mine, suddenly there are 100’s of reviews, all of which in one way or another agree with what I found. It is a large concrete monstrosity in a very central position. Reception, on arrival, seemed busy but efficient. I asked for a room with a bath rather than a shower and this was provided. On reaching the first floor, I was guided by signs through the smoke (illegal) filled warren of a corridor to a bunker that was to be home for the next three nights. On entering the room I found there was one small 4’ x 2’ approx window which did not give enough light to find any of the switches or lamps despite it still being daylight outside. After struggling to find a lamp and then locate its switch, I managed to find two switches camouflaged on the door jamb, immediately inside the darkened entrance. One illuminated the bathroom and this allowed me to find other room lamps. To this day I did not discover the point of the other switch. Like many hotels, good lighting was a missing luxury. By far the best lit area was the bathroom, which was not that much smaller than the actual bedroom. It contained the promised bath and was ideal for anyone less than four feet tall! The modern trend of not supplying toiletries (allegedly to help save the environment, but actually to cut hotel costs) was abundantly clear. There were two shower caps and both the basin and bath came with soap dispensers. These were designed by a rocket scientist as the liquid soap would fly across the mirror (from the basin) or down the entire length of the bath from the other pot. The trouble was that this was fixed at shower height, so no good at all for those wanting to use the bath. This was most unsatisfactory. Once the lighting in the bedroom had been located and switched on, one waited in hope for a reasonable level of illumination which, sadly, never arrived. I felt pleased that I had not brought a cat to swing now that I could see the room. The cramped room was, or seemed, clean, as did the bathroom. A double bed indicated that the room could be shared by two people. I would challenge this. The room contained no cupboards, mainly, I think, because there would not have been room to open the doors! There were shelves (see photo) and a one foot wide space for hanging clothes, which was actually difficult to reach, even without a door, due to a large (for the room size) 1960’s style chair and its close proximity to the bed! Tea and coffee facilities were provided, as was a sort of air conditioning, (switch found on the second day due to the darkness) and the first floor window could be opened a crack, but is recommended only for deaf people and had to be shut at night if you were to sleep in the reduced, but not eliminated, street noise. The howl of emergency sirens could be heard quite well, even with the window closed. A fan and safe were provided, both of these were good points and there was no extra charge. A small TV is glued to the wall above the shelving, just below ceiling level. This made the only viewing area from the bed. I could not find a radio. The TV came without instructions or lists of channels available. It seemed like Freeview. Many channels suffered from pixel break-up and it took ages to flick though just a few of the channels. The bed was lumpy and basic, but seemed clean. There are IKEA lamps either side of the bed. One had an unreadable PAT certificate, whilst the one on the other side, which was faulty, had no visible certificate at all. The breakfast was quite an experience. We were warned on arrival that it could get busy around 8.30 am. I arrived just after opening time (6.30, good for business people) one morning to find it half full. The cooked choice at breakfast was a poor introduction to those not knowing what a full English breakfast looked like. The room key card actually calls it a ‘European Breakfast’. I reckon that the sausage could have almost passed as vegetarian, it was dire. The rest was passable but it was the same every day, no changes at all, other than ‘take it or leave it’. The bread rolls were of poor quality and there was no bread for toast. Most other items were acceptable. It was self service and this seemed to work well when the place wasn’t too busy. This is a large basic hotel which seems mainly used by busloads of tourists and people up for shows and or short work periods. My stay of three nights was more than enough for me. I noted that some people had booked rooms for a honeymoon. There is probably little hope for that marriage! It is one step up from the very basic hotels that have become popular in recent years, but you pay quite a premium, but if you want somewhere central for a couple of nights in central London it would pass as OK, but don’t use it for a special occasion!

Reviews.Title: “so close to everything”
Reviews.Author: dimvel
Reviews.Content: in the center of london, so close to oxford st and soho, but small rooms

Reviews.Title: “good overnight in london”
Reviews.Author: 32rose
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here one night so we could enjoy the musical 'Ghost' at the Picadilly Theatre.It was in a very good location for all of the nightlife and for shoppijng the next day! Staff were friendly and we could leave our luggage with the concierge whilst we visited nearby Oxford Street.The rooms were quite small but very clean and comfortable - all you would need for an overnight stop in the heart of London.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but not as bad as Travelodge/Ibis . Location is excellent !”
Reviews.Author: sybiltheswan_11
Reviews.Content: On arrival to the hotel I was pleasantly surprised . Lovely reception and easy check in . Room was fine . Clean , decent bed , flat screen tv , small shower room . I normally stay in nicer hotels to be honest but this was more than adequate . The location of the hotel was excellent , very close to the tube station and very central easy walking distance to Covent garden .I would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Safiren
Reviews.Content: We went to London to see Much ado about nothing with David Tennant and Catherine Tate, wounderful play by the way, and wanted a hotel close to the theater. The location was good even if there was a lot of roadwork close by. The room was OK for one night, but I would advise you to ask for a room on a high level. We had breakfast included otherwise it wouldn't be worth it! Go out and have breakfast instead.

Reviews.Title: “great location in heart of london”
Reviews.Author: AlexMykhaylyuk
Reviews.Content: hotel is located in just few steps from Tottenham Court Road station and Oxford Street, 5 mins walk from Covent Garden - so it's fantastic location for shopping, musicals, fine dining or whatever you'd like to do in London. rooms are compact, but well-equipped and clean. long breakfast from 6:30 till 10:00 with good choice. surely can say that plan stay there for the next time.

Reviews.Title: “midrange hotell”
Reviews.Author: Kali1975
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel, with average room size. Clean and really sentral. Breakfast was awfull,-save your money.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Rhonna M
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel for my honeymoon having booked a double bed room but to be told i was given a twin room after 15 minutes they finally gave me the smallest dingiest dullest room that they had after going back to reception to complain the room that i booked online was advertised in reception i explained to the receptionist that that was the picture i booked and was told :well you didnt expect to get that one did you: well for your information St Giles yes i did we were finally given another room which was slightly better than the first but still a diappointment. To make matter worst was the hot breakfast buffet what a joke your choice sausage bacon scrambled egg potato rostti and beans I aske could i have fried egg was told no so i asked for some toast where i was rudely told madam i am not hiding anything if its not out here then we dont do it. On our last night stay we were woken up at 3am by some German tourist kicking on our door and shouting what a joke the hotel was if it wasnt 3am i would have gone out and shook his hand but it did take the hotel security over half an hour to remove him, not only am i leaving this reveiw but i will be sending one to the hotel as it was the worst place i have ever stayed in and will never advise anyone to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Well placed and well priced”
Reviews.Author: jobeninca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Giles earlier this week and chose it mainly because of its' proximity to the theatre I was visiting that evening. The hotel is about one minute's walk from Tottenham Court Tube station and is really easy to find. The room was quite small, but very clean and well appointed. If you want somewhere to stay in the middle of London and don't want to pay a ridiculous price, then this would be a good place to start. There is a big reception desk, so no queues checking in and out and the staff are really friendly. My only two complaints would be that the pillows are bizarrely small and also that there always seemed to be a huge number of people waiting for the lifts, but these are small points from a picky traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Blatant profiteering by management- very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KandKMcG
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through booking.com on Monday mistakenly for that night. 3 minutes later (to the second) realized genuine mistake, phoned booking.com who amended the booking to correct day Tuesday the next day, confirmation e-mail, so far so good. Received a phone call from hotel Tuesday stating a no-show for Monday, no reservation for Tuesday. Despite me saying I was in afternoon meeting hotel had zero interest in helping me resolve, appalling customer service, essentially saying my problem, Ill have to fix it. In the end hotel invoked their 24 hour cancellation policy and since was booked and cancelled within 3 minutes for the same day I had to pay for 2 nights. Fully understand policies are there for a reason but seriously no way they can argue that due to my cancellation they could not sell room that night. Really frustrating and customer service was non-existent. If you want decent customer service Id stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “We will never return.”
Reviews.Author: oliver1786
Reviews.Content: We booked in February before we knew the Rugby league cup final was on.Now Im no prude,but to hear middle aged woman,men and young kids swearing at 05.45 in the morning was not quite what I expected to hear outside my cell door.We complained next morning and to be fair to the staff they tried to move us but with it being Bank holiday we would have ,and I cant believe this have moved to a even smaller room,I didnt think it would be possible,obviously was a Tardis.The breakfast room reminded me very much of when I went to Butlins in the sixties not something I would like to repeat.Still, it was an experience(not to be repeated)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but some things need improving”
Reviews.Author: Ph1leasFogg
Reviews.Content: I went to the St Giles as part of a package option, so I'm writing this bearing that in mind. The room itself is nice, clean and, understandably basic given the amount we paid for our trip. However, there was no air conditioning which makes it difficult to sleep in Summer, even with the window open, when the temperature is hitting 24 degrees centigrade and above. The bathroom is nicely laid out, but because there wasn't an extractor fan, the room would mist up when you had a hot shower. The range of breakfast is very much as you'd expect from a City Break hotel with a choice of cereal, Continental breakfast or English breakfast. However, the hotel may wish to loil at who provides their sausages as they are a little bland. All in all, a nice hotel IF you were on a package deal like I was.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Odd_Bergen
Reviews.Content: Very good location if you plan to go shopping in Oxford Street or Soho area, both within walking distance from hotel. Close to metro "Tottenham Court" and easy to get around. Very nice view from the room and restaurant. Fair size of the room compared to other London hotels. Brekfast was good, room clean.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: 8rage
Reviews.Content: Tiny room with twin beds, even tho a doublebed was requested (they refused to change or do anything else to make up for it. The smallest bathroom I've seen in my life, I could hardly fit on the toilet. Dreadfull breakfast. Nothing fresh! Hardly a selection at all. I've seen far better school cantines. VOMIT in the staircase and maintanace work at the floor above us! Stay far away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for exploring London”
Reviews.Author: MRG76
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is it's greatest asset - only a few hundred metres from Tottenham Court Road tube station, you can soon get to most London landmarks in good time. Just by walking for a couple of minutes you can be at the British Museum and Dominion Theatre. Currently the area has a lot of building work and disruption due to the expansion of the tube station (it will soon be linked to the Northern line improving the connection north-south), but by the completion in winter 2011 it should result in a new open space and an improved appearance. I agree with some previous comments on the length of time it can take to get to the upper floors (I was on the 11th), especially when parties book in and put pressure on the four lifts. My room was fine, not as confined as I imagined, although the bathroom was compact. But it was clean, and more than sufficient for a short stay. Breakfast was a straightforward self-service cafeteria style, and I was glad to see the start time of 7am on a Sunday meant I could get out into the city early. Overall a good stay, and combined with a good deal through the internet, I was happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “top draw locality”
Reviews.Author: prentonputter
Reviews.Content: we had heard some positive and some negative reports about this hotel so we went in a bit apprehensive,let me tell you it was superb ,we walked to all the attractions we needed to see(20 mins),west end show,houses of parliment,westminster abbey,harrods,london eye,only blip is room clean n tidy but small,breakfast brilliant whatever you want,staff are so freindly and helpfull,also london museum 5mins away

Reviews.Title: “Good location - quite OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: EllenChr
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times - mainly because of the location. With only about 200 metes from the tube station at Tottenham Court Road, and nearly on Oxford Street and just two blocks away from the British museum, it is a perfect location for shopping and culture. The rooms are quite nice, but the double beds are a bit narrow. The rooms can get a bit stuffy in summer, and the windows don't open very wide - but fortunately they have got a fan in the room, which helps. The safe works, the flat screen TV has a wide range of channels and the coffee/tea making facilities gets you coffee in the morning. The hairdryer is not very good (bring your own) - and the elevator capacity is bad. In the morning you can expect to wait for quite a long time to get down to the lobby. The WIFI-charge is a bit steep with 10 pounds a day.

Reviews.Title: “Fits the bill nicely”
Reviews.Author: keithamos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, rooms not roomy,but if like us you need somewhere to sleep, then this is fine! We went to see We will rock you, at the Dominican theatre, which was just about a hundred yards from the front door of the hotel! Perfect. The travelodge is a little further, but shop around, you will find rooms cheaper, and possibly more spacious. Oh, and the coffee2go option is good!

Reviews.Title: “I do not reccomend this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Alessia1979
Reviews.Content: I went to London on August 26th with my partner and of course we wanted an hotel close enough to the city center, so St Giles seemed a good choice. I regret now not to pay a little bit more but go into a decent hotel! Our room (if it can be called like that....) was on the second floor (nr 268); having two bags we wanted to take the elevator but it was broken or unavailable at that moment, so we took the stairs which were dump, dirty and full of electric cables and garbage! So we arrived at the second floor, we approached the corridor that smelled of garlic/smoke/stale air; as soon as we opened the door of the room a horrible stink of sweating feet assaulted us so we went straight away to open the window which could only opened a tiny bit! The room was a panic room, so small that we couldn't move! The bathroom, tiny as well, but the worst thing was finding hair in the shower! The cleaning crew did not even change the used soap we left on the sink, they didn't throw the garbage away and didn't read the DO NOT DISTURB tag on the door and barged into the room while we were in bed! During the night we woke up because drunken people were shouting in the corridor, knocking on doors and trying to get into the rooms! We called the reception and asked to call upstairs and sort the situation. Nothing! And the next day they didn't even bother to apologize for the troubled night! I think people should deserve better when they pay 120£ pp! I advise people not to book with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate!”
Reviews.Author: 1973kec
Reviews.Content: Before staying here I was a little apprehensive due to the negative comments I'd read about the hotel, size of rooms, cleanliness, breakfast bar etc. However I was very impressed with this hotel - we stayed in a twin room which although quite small, was nothing like the shoebox that some people had led me to believe it was. There was plenty of storage space and hanging space for clothes and it didn't feel cramped or claustrophobic at all. We had a bath and shower in our room which was a bonus as I'd heard that all you got was a shower cubicle. The bathroom was very clean with clean towels and complimentary toiletries. There were a couple of loose tiles in the bathroom but that was a minor thing and didn't detract in any way from our stay. We stayed here for 3 nights and each morning we were down for breakfast before 8am as I'd heard about the problems with space etc. Judging by the amount of people there, they had heard about it too but we had no problems with getting a table. Food was good and staff were friendly and helpful. The only negative thing I'd say about the hotel is about the lifts - there are only 4 serving a 700 room hotel which is clearly not enough. On our checking out day we had to walk down the stairs with our bags from the 6th floor as the lifts took ages to come, and when they did arrive they were full with people going down to breakfast. The beds were excellent, much more comfortable than my own at home! Only problem we had was it was quite hot so we had the windows open all night on the first night and I had problems sleeping due to the noise. This was remedied the 2nd night as we kept the windows closed and used the fan supplied in the room to keep us cool. Overall then, great hotel, great location and great value for money. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous.”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: Small, pokey room, worn furnishings, uncomfortable bed, basin loose, blocked, taking 5 minutes to drain. Shower so small you could hardly move. We did complain and eventually got a slightly better room. Breakfast facilities extremely bad. Dirty crockery & cutlery. People pushing to find a seat. It was more akin to a badly run holiday camp. Leisure complex not part of hotel so there is a fee for using it. I normally do pretty good when booking hotels online, but got this one badly wrong.

Reviews.Title: “we will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: cpmachin
Reviews.Content: Just had a three night stay as my daughter was in a nearby hospital for an operation, My Husband and I couldnt find any fault at all, very clean comfortable rooms very good breakfast buffet and friendly helpful staff. The location is very good too with shops and restaurants nearby. We found the hotels Italian restaurant had wonderful food and also found a spaghetti house restaurant a couple of roads away which was brilliant. If we had of been staying as a leisure break it would have been even better but as we were there in a somewhat stressful situation ie:daughters op, then Im glad we stayed at St. Giles !!!!

Reviews.Title: “If location is your priority, St. Giles is your man!”
Reviews.Author: Morgan068
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with quite a large group for two nights. The location is excellent: very close to the tube, British Museum, Oxford Street and just a short walking distance from Covent Garden and Trafalgar Square. The rooms themselves are fairly basic and on the small side (particularly the singles) but comfortable, clean and in perfect working order. We found the staff to be efiicient and pleasant and any requirements we had specified regarding food (gluten-free / diabetic etc) had been catered for without having to remind them, as so often happens in other hotels. There are several lifts but trying to get down to the ground floor at breakfast time was a bit of an endeavour (10 min + wait) so something to keep in mind if you're in a tearing hurry to check out. Having looked forward to the full English breakfast, I was a little disappointed to find that they don't either toast or fried eggs, but other than that the food was fine (we ate there in the evening too). Nice bar just off the lobby, perfect for relaxing with a late-night drink. I would definitely stay at the hotel again, most of all because of the freedom it gives you in terms of location.

Reviews.Title: “Pokey!”
Reviews.Author: NickyGriffiths
Reviews.Content: Rooms very small for double, no bar fridge, or room service,self service breakfast was included if you wanted to scramble for it when everyone else was there. No air conditioning in rooms, lift did take a long time to get to the 11th floor, sometimes upto 5 mins!! then got stuck in lift, doors jammed on us trying to get out, then wouldn't open for 5 mins. Staff were very helpful, and if there was a problem fixed it straight away. Restaurant food in the evening was beautiful, bed was made everyday, was nice to come back to. Shame the rooms were too small. Ideally situated, not far from Covent Garden, Oxford Street!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel will def be back”
Reviews.Author: fredbarny
Reviews.Content: hotel was very clean rooms were nice as when in london your not in them much.Breakfast was lovely all you can eat sets you up for a long day.Hotel very central

Reviews.Title: “Drilling at 9.30am???”
Reviews.Author: Alisuea
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister have just stayed in this hotel for a weekend break. Although the hotel was nice and the location was great we had some sort of work being undertaken in the next room to us!!! Drilling started just before 10am on Sunday morning and just after 9am on Monday. Drilling right into the wall by the beds. Not very nice and no one informed us this would be happening. I realise work needs to happen at some point but surely it could have been sorted a bit later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for ;)”
Reviews.Author: tiinalm
Reviews.Content: An ok hotel with a good location close to shopping, theaters and the all essential tube (Tottenham Court Road's station practically around the corner). A lot of nice restaurants within walking distance. We stayed three nights in a twin room up in the 6th floor. The room wasn't too big but it was clean, though there was some what weird smell probably due to the carpet. No A/C in the room (there was a fan), so had to keep the window open all the time. There was quite a lot of noise from the street and humming from ventilation machines, so ear plugs will come handy if you're a light sleeper. It's big hotel, so if you're in a hurry when leaving, it's best leave enough time for the check out procedures. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. All in all an ok experience and ok value for money. Could stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Small room!”
Reviews.Author: pickers9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip, the location was fantastic, handy to enjoy Londons attractions, the food was good at breaksfast, simple typical hotel breakfast but good value for money. the bar prices were reasonable, and the check in and out speed and service was quick and efficients. Downside the room if you book a single could be tiny, My colleague a 6ft4 bloke had us laughing about being able to sit on the loo and turn the TV channels over on the other side of the room at the same time. I had a very small single room, shower cubicle tiny and JUST enough room for the bed and furniture......Would stay again but even without family would consider booking a bigger room or making sure the hotel check me into a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate given the location”
Reviews.Author: rsk14
Reviews.Content: Given the location of this hotel, it is very adequate. The bathroom and showers are tiny, so if you are overweight, it is a bit of a squeeze! There is only one plug, so if it is warm and you need to use the fan that is provided, you can't use the kettle or any other electrical device! The breakfast is fine, but can be very busy at times! It is very well situated, with the tube and restaurants and shops very close by. It is fine if you want somewhere reasonably decent in a central point in London, it is good.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU LIKE THE ROOM THE SIZE OF A JAIL CELL, YOU WILL LOVE THIS.”
Reviews.Author: ernrich
Reviews.Content: This hotel came with a theater package for Priscilla, Queen of the Desert and was a good price for both. But this hotel is a DUMP. The rooms, with no A/C, are smaller than a jail cell, the bed was lumpy, and the small bathroom had a black tiled shower with no light. Forget it if you dropped the soap!!!! The staff is all Eastern European with an " I don't give a damn" attitude. Breakfast, if you want to call it that, is served in a steam tray/metal table/linoleum floored room with massive mobs of tourists milling about. In the bar you have to pay for drinks each and every time, no running tabs here. Could not wait to leave. Never will darken the doors of the St. Giles again. The good location does not save it. Stay away. ~Rich

Reviews.Title: “excellent position”
Reviews.Author: valerie4135
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in a great location to see the rest of london. rooms were quite small but perfectly adequate breakfast was good but you need to be there before 8am to avoid long queues staff were very helpful and pleasant a good hotel at a good price

Reviews.Title: “GOOD PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: 2156Michael
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotel in central London and find this one of the best for value. The reception staff were very pleasant and accommodating, the room, although small, was adequately equipped and very clean. The double bed was comfortable. There was only a shower (no bath) and the bathroom was very small but, there again, adequate. The only problem that I met was the long queues for breakfast on the days which I stayed. I am unable to stand in queues due to a physical condition but I was unable to alter my booking which would have allowed me to eat at nearby cafes. I wrote to the hotel following my visit explaining the problem I had experienced. I was quite surprised by the extremely rapid response by the management who went out of their way to alleviate my concern. Customer service in this respect was admirable and I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: greycat045
Reviews.Content: The hotel has 11 floors and is so busy it seems a bit impersonal , but as we only stayed 1 night his was fine with us. There are only 4 lifts so waiting times seem a bit lengthy. Our twin room on 7th floor was small but had everything we needed including a safe and proper hairdryer and was really quiet. We ate out, but restaurants, and bar seemed nice as was the option of 'breakfast to go' from the coffee shop. The location was great as only a short walk from Tottenham Court rd Tube or about 10 mins from Googe st tube. There were also plenty of restaurants within walking distance and didnt take too long to walk back from Regent St area. I think if we visit London again in future we would choose this hotel again as the location is so central

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE!!”
Reviews.Author: LINDA O
Reviews.Content: We booked a doube for a honeymoon weekend with theatre ticket included, it was not cheap, reasonable cost BUT we found the room very small & noisy. Yes the location is good but I would not recommend. The duvet was tick and really a winter version. Breakfast was in a very hectic canteen style place. We had to pick up food on a tray & find a table. Really a horrid experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: sloping_fungus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in August 2011 with a family member. Booked a twin room on recomendation from a family member who has stayed here before. On arrival there was no problems checking in. The room was a little bit of a let down. It was divided up into two separate areas with the beds and tv mounted to the wall in one room and the desk, wardrobe and bathroom in the other. Just didn't seem very usable if you wanted to dry your hair and watch tv at the same time! Also there was two windows that only opened a tiny bit and NO air-conditioning. Not the best for a VERY warm weekend in London. Although there was a fanit would have been very loud to leave on all night. We did not avail of the breakfast or dinner in the hotel, instead opting to head out for it. We used the coffee to go area once for a sandwich which was nice but nothing fancy. We used the bar at nighttime after being out for dinner and a show. It was ok but nothing fancy. Seemed to be busy enough but one thing that Bugged me was when you got your drinks or food you were made pay for them straight away, no option of having a tab to buy several and pay at the end. Just seemed a little rude. Also when they gave you back your change it was on a blue tray which of course must be collected so therefore making you feel like you should be leaving a tip every time.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poyzberg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 15 minute walk from Euston Station. Towards the end of Tottenham Court Road. Check-in was straight foward. We were given to single rooms on either sides of the lifts. My room was 431 which was by the lift but you couldn't hear them. My room I think was a renovated one as it was different layout and style to that of my friends. It was facing Great Russell Street. So i could open the window at night and not be distribed by the traffic nosie outside. The bathroom was small and compact and had a shower curtain for a door, the sink was in the shower and there was no space to put your toiletries. But overall was very clean. The bedroom was an okay it had plenty of space to move around with a leather chair and vanity table, there was a big fan in the room. There was no actualy wardrobe in the room only a space with a few hangers. There was a couple shelf's to put things on. There was tea/coffee making facialties in the room as well as a room safe. My room compared to my friends had plenty of plug sockets while there was only two in the whole of theirs. The rooms were service daily. Breakfast was okay it buffett style with cereal, fruit, cold meats and hot english breakfast. We went down just before or around 8am and could find a seat fine, it was quite quiet at this time. As are train was late in the evening, we kept are luggage in their store room for the day for free. The hotel was oppsite a Sainsbury's, in close walking distance was Tottenham Court Road tube station, Oxford Road, SoHo and Leicester Square.

Reviews.Title: “great location for shopplng and theatres”
Reviews.Author: dubrover
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for three nights at the end of july and found it to be a great location for shopping and theatres.oxford st right around the corner and all theatres and locations such as leicester sq , piccadilly circus and trafalgar sq within walking distance.As for the hotel itself our room was small and very warm (no air con) but adequate for our needs, so if shopping and theatres is your thing this hotel is a good place to base yourself

Reviews.Title: “Hectic, but central at a good price”
Reviews.Author: bothsidesnow
Reviews.Content: There is nothing subtle about the St Giles. A beast of a place towering over Oxford Street and Tottenham Court Road, you don't stay here for subtle charm or the Olde World English Experience. But for location and comfort at a reasonable price it would be hard to beat it. Rooms are small but well equipped, you'll be amazed everything can be crammed into such a small space. I had a room at the front on the busy road which was fine with the window closed but deafeningly noisy when open, and with no aircon (only a mini portable fan) you kinda need the window open. Breakfast was rather like taking part in a rugby match in an office staff canteen, but the range of full English breakfast should set most peaople up for the day. If you're only in London for a couple of days you don't want to spend any more time than is absolutely necessary on public transport, so stay central, and the St Giles ticks that box. But do ask for a room at the back away from the road!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Lansdownwind
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for theatres, shops etc. all within walking distance but the room was very small. When we entered the room we got a strong smell of body and foot odour so had to open the window qucik to let in some fresh air. The carpet was very worn and the decoration was very shabby and in dire need of a refurb. We had twin beds and one of them must have been broken as it rocked and made creakling noises if you moved and felt it would collapse at any moment. The extractor fan in the bathroom didn't work so after a shower the room was full of condensation and very hot. There was no air con only a desktop fan and the window was small and only opened halfway so room was very hot. The lifts, although there were a few of them, were very slow, often didn't work and were always full We used their cafe for a quick snack and found the choice of sandwiches to be limited and tasteless. They'd obviously been hanging around a long time as the tomato had made the bread soggy. If you want somewhere just to lay your head for one night whilst you see a show or something then this hotel will probably do but no more than that. It wasn't that cheap either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joannie2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the St Giles Hotel in May 2011, this was a special break away to celerbrate our Wedding Anniversary. We stayed for two nights bed and breakfast, and found the staff very helpful, especially for directions as it had been a long time since we had been in London. This trip was through Superbreak and it included a threatre trip of our choice,we went to see Dreamboats and Petticoats,FANTASTIC SHOW on the Friday evening and Saturday we went to see Jersey Boys. again FANTASTIC SHOW. We can be certain we will return there very soon, as we love the Theatre Shows and this Hotel is so convenient as most are walkable no need for the tube ! The hotel is very clean and could not fault any part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes up for this average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluearmyMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: If you do not mind small rooms (with a painfully slow set of lifts) then this is the best place to stay due to location and price. Just around the corner from Oxford Street and Tottenham Court road tube station it really is a great place to stay for the price. Breakfast is excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dolphin3802004
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a long week-end stay, May bank holiday. I had booked theatre tickets for my husbands birthday and wanted a central hotel in London. This hotel is on Tottenham Court Rd, it is in a perfect location for almost anywhere you wish to go in London, without using public transport or taxi's, it has restaurants and a coffee lounge, so you don't have to go looking for anywhere to eat if you don't feel up to it, it is just a 2min walk from the tube, really couldn't be better. The only thing I could find fault with, and thats if I wanted to be petty, is the rooms are a wee bit small, but then you only sleep in them, they are clean and well equiped

Reviews.Title: “Low Key London”
Reviews.Author: mistermanCumbria
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for very basic accommodation and somewhere to rest your head and wash and shower then this place is perfect... The Hotel is nice and generally clean. Maybe a little dated but nothing that would put you off! The rooms are a tad on the small side, but it has all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay. Some of the rooms have had new bathrooms installed so try and request one if possible. Only exec room have AC, although the rooms all have fans in them to help cool down which is well neededin the summer as the building tends to get hot! Location is amazing, literally 2min walk from Tottenham Court Road Underground which will take to all of the sight seeing parts of the city... I would stay at this hotel again but would definately opt for the more expensive option of having an executive room, just for those added creature comforts :-)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: simple0119
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a standard room - which was satisfactory for our needs as were out for the day & only used room for showering & sleeping. We were on the 4th floor so the noise was not an issue. Breakfast not included in our booking and we ate in a nearby restaurant - there is so much to choose from at reasonable prices. Travalgar Square is a 20 minute walk away & Big Ben, Westminister etc... about a 40 minute walk. The National Museum is just a 5 min walk & loads of theatres. The Dominion Theatre which shows We will Rock You musical is literally beside the hotel! Highly recommend going to see if you can get reasonable tickets - £25 each we got seats for!

Reviews.Title: “Very central and good price”
Reviews.Author: etravelsdublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in June and was my second visit to hotel, compared to most hotels in central london its very affordable and very central. 15 min walk to leinster square and just off oxford street. room is basic but was fine and clean with television. we didnt have breakfast. the bar was nice and we had some drinks here. if want somewhere central and safe at good price i would recommend. it is not very plush.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: AMVikesaa
Reviews.Content: Ive been working in London as a guide and knows a lot of the hotesl around this town. My first choice everytime I go back with friends visisting, will always be St. Giles. And that is because of the excellent location. From the hotel you can walk to almost anything; covent Garden (one of my favourites with narrow interesting streets on the way), trafalgar Sq., Soho, Leicester Sq. Bloomsbury, etc, etc. And you are just a couple of minutes away from Oxford Street, where the buses passes by along this treet all the time, so its very easy to get around without the use of the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: HondoHondo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for the one night with my in-laws so we could go to a London musical and it was all fine for that. The hotel is very conveniently located, right in the middle of everything in central London, and we spent a great day roaming around the city, visiting museums and having lunch out. We were able to walk from the hotel to the theatre, enjoy the performance and walk home again with ease. The rooms were small but comfortable, and the beds were fine. Breakfast in the moring was buffet style and extensive, and it was very tasty! The bathroom was pretty poky though and the hot water seemed to be stuck on a single setting - either v hot or off. Also being in central London there was noise from traffic through the night but that is only to be expected. Overall, for a visit to London for business or a quick tourist trip, I would say this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Staff”
Reviews.Author: DeckYork
Reviews.Content: I haven't even stayed at the hotel but they have treated me completely unreasonable. I booked to stay over today 27-29 July and 20 minutes later I realised I couldn't cancel my previous hotel, despite calling the hotel and talking to the manager they decided to still apply a one night charge, even the web-site I went through Booking.com tried and failed to get them to change their mind. The staff were rude and unhelpful and glad I am not staying there. If that's what they are like before you get to the hotel god knows what they would be like in the place.... Derek W near York

Reviews.Title: “OK if you're on a budget and want to stay in the very centre”
Reviews.Author: JanStenberg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at St Giles a few times now and the experience is always the same: A very small room but functional, a shower, a small desk where to work and a bed where to sleep. Most of the time it's quiet at night. I have never had the breakfast, I always grab something on my way out. The location in the very centre makes it possible to walk to many of the interesting places in 10-20 minutes. The room rate is great for London.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent Location and Room”
Reviews.Author: Rondotcom1
Reviews.Content: For one of the best locations in the West End of London, this is a good choice. Walked to all theatres and all casual shopping. Very convenient to Tottenham Court tube station almost at door. Good restaurant for breakfast on site. Thought I paid too much for a 5 night stay but management surprised to find a note in the room inviting us to enjoy a complimentary full breakfast each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional and well located”
Reviews.Author: muznju
Reviews.Content: Most of the other reviews cover my comments: the location is great, the price is reasonable for London and you are able to get some good deals through Hotels.com and Expedia. The rooms and public areas were very clean. There are four lifts, but during the morning peaks there were more guests using the concrete stairs as the lifts were very slow. We had four rooms in total for a Saturday night on the fourth floor and there was no air conditioning in any of them. The slender corridors were very hot and the rooms required the window to be open - which inevitably brought the London noise in to your room. There were fans in all the rooms so they do try to help with the problem. We had one single room on the front of the hotel and I will just say it was 'compact' - but sorry I have to put 'tiny' for the bathroom. Breakfast was OK. It was busy (09:00 on a Sunday morning) and laid out like a school canteen. It was a buffet style on a hot plate so you could have a hearty portion but there was a lack of variety compared to other hotels and the addition of pastries would have improved it for me. Staff were not super helpful, but they were busy, but a smile now and again would help. Would I stay again? probably for one night because of price, cleanliness and location - likely to go elsewhere for breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BjoernOslo
Reviews.Content: Very good location at the corner of Oxford Street and Tottenham Court rd. Subway 50 m and walking distance to Leicester Sq, Piccadilly Circus, Trafalgar Sq and to shopping at Oxford St. Breakfast is simple/few options, and you can get more value for money buying it elsewhere. Casino entrance from reception area, and fitness center (not used this time and availible for a fee). Rooms are OK, little small as was the bathroom, but we were not in London to stay in our room :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice-recommended”
Reviews.Author: trailtramp
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel on business. The room was comfortable, spacious, had every amenity necessary for a nice stay - the room was not lavish by any means, but very tasteful and modern. A tea kettle, coffee, tea and biscuits were also offered. I was on a high floor and did not have any problems with street noise. I was able to crack the window to get some fresh air ( nice as in some modern hotels the windows are sealed shut). If I had to complain I would only say that the bathroom sink was quite small and awkward to use. I did not have the hotel breakfast- so unable to comment on that. The location is extremely convenient - just a few minutes walk from Tottenham Court Rd tube station, and Oxford street. The hotel has pool and gym facilities -but I did not try them either. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, pity about the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bolulu
Reviews.Content: I stay quite frequently at this hotel for one reason only; location. It is hard to fault the central london location, handy for shopping, shows & many attractions are walkable. Breakfasts are good & food plentiful, however, if you want to eat before 9.30a.m. be prepared to wait for a table & use your elbows at the buffet stations. It is packed! A post 9.30a.m. breakfast visit recommended. My principal complaints here are that the rooms are terribly cramped, walkways are narrow & staff are pretty much universally disinterested in their guests. Be that as it may, balancing negatives with price & location, I would certainly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Mama Mia! love being here!”
Reviews.Author: denisjimenez50
Reviews.Content: I went with my friend on our second visit to the St. Giles hotel, london. I can say it was as good as the first time we went. It was my friends birthday and we went to see a show, Mama Mia. Because it was my friend's birthday I wanted to make it special for her, so I got in touch with the staff at St. Giles and explained to them and asked if there could be some flowers for her in the room when we got there. We communicated by email. They were brilliant, and asked me what I wanted, gave me a price list and asked what colours. And sure enough there in the room were these beautiful flowers waiting for her with a card in a nice big vase. The staff are so lovely there, so helpful. The rooms are spotless, the beds are very comfortable, and no matter where you walked around the hotel there is not a speck of dust or rubbish anywhere. It's in a great location, with a 24 hour sainsbury across the road, a boots chemist too. Round the corner is a cafe rouge, Garfunkels which are both great to have a meal in. Staff lovely there too, couldn't do enough for you. If you go on line on 2 for 1 you can download vouchers which is great to have a saving, especially if there are a lot of you. We booked the show through last minute. com and they are very good too, so easy to use and instantly your seats are booked. We had brilliant seats and a brilliant price. I think if you are stopping in London for a few days, the St. Giles is the best place to go, its great for value for money, it's central so oxford street is just around the corner and all the shop to drop is there. I hope this helps you decide where to stop. We would stop there again hopefully next year.

Reviews.Title: “surly and aloof reception”
Reviews.Author: catehamphire
Reviews.Content: we got this hotel as part of a package when we went to see Take That. great position a few steps from the undergroud and it looks good as you enter. the greeting we recieved was less than ordinary though. there were lots of staff but they seemed disinterested and the young lady who served us was surly and aloof. we had to change room because the first one had a terrible feel to it. the breakfast staff were lovely and attentive and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not so good on the inside, still great value though”
Reviews.Author: BANKBEN10
Reviews.Content: I stopped here for two nights whilst visiting London. Located a 15 minute walk from Euston Station and sixty seconds away from Oxford street/Tottenham Court, it is in a very good location for seeing most of London's sights. The room was a double, but on the small side, big enough for a bed and a small walkway down each side. It was summer and blazing hot, but there was no air con in the rooms, and my biggest gripe was that the room smelled very musty. The bathroom was ok, but there was no toilet brush and the toilet bowl was dirty from previous guests, the shower worked fine however and the shower curtain seemed brand new. Wi-Fi was availble in the rooms at a cost of around £5 a day, I am 22 years old and have lived most my life with internet and hundreds of free wifi spots, so this seemed extortionate to me, i was very dissapointed. The hallways were quite cramped and during roomservice times you'd struggle to get past the carts, even sideways. They did do a thorough job of replacing all the sheets and towels however. We only used the hotel as a base to explore London, so we didnt spend a lot of time there, the only interaction we had with the staff was check in (We got stuck with a trainee, a little slow but very polite- we all have to start somewhere) and check out. where a helpful gentlemen walked to the next street to hail us a taxi. Overall I would say the hotel was great value for its location, not the nicest I have stopped in, but you get what you pay for and at £115 a night smack bang in the middle of everything, I was pretty happy with my overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “small, old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: primuldak
Reviews.Content: I had one of my worst experience at this hotel. Extremely small room together with old furniture made my vacation a total mess. No air condition. The safety box was damaged, the ice machine from lobby doesn't work. A lot of tight corridors and doors between us and our room...look like a fire escape instead of hotel

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: phvk
Reviews.Content: You don't find luxury here, but St. Giles Hotel offers good value for money and is a very decent place even when compared to double or triple priced alternatives. Location is excellent. Service was good. We used the luggage room on the day checked out, it's a lot cheaper than leaving luggage to a railway station. Rooms were clean and faucets, showers etc. worked fine. We had two twin rooms, the other was small and the other ok. I'll may well stay here again and next time I'll know to ask for a bigger room at check-in. Weather was cool during our stay, but if it is hot, then you are out of luck, since there is no air conditioning. There are plenty of cafes nearby for breakfast, so we did not go to hotel breakfast. There was a rush hour in the morning at the elevators, but that was not too bad and not a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep!”
Reviews.Author: lisac_9
Reviews.Content: I think I would have slept better on a bed of nails located in the middle of the M25! My room was tiny, sheets and bathroom had someone elses hair still on it. My room was right next to a corridor and the tiled floor meant I could hear footsteps all night. Also the windows let all the noise in and I think I got about 2 hours sleep. Wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ArcariPicinisco
Reviews.Content: Rooms very small, but clean. This is an excellent location if you want to walk in central London. Situated at top of Oxford Street and 2 mins walk from Tottenham Court Road tube. Plenty choice of restaurants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: 18gceltic
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival was welcomed by a miserable face on reception,then we entered our room which to say was basic would be giving it a compliment ,behind the light in the bathroom was disgusting it looked like they only cleaned where was on view added to the fact that we paid £109 without breakfast it was a pretty rubbish stay

Reviews.Title: “what do people want”
Reviews.Author: julie2855
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay in this hotel and after reading recent reviews was getting very worried, but I shouldnt have been. It fit the bill for a short stay in the centra of London. What else do you need great location, clean room, plenty big enough to shower, change and sleep, comfy beds and we found staff friendly. Good selection at breakfast. Like I said ' what do people want' would stay there again when next planning a short stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: Yummy1966
Reviews.Content: In brief, lovely greeting from front of house. We arrived before 9am but they found us a room which was a bonus. Location was brilliant, 50m from Dominion Theatre and Tottenham Court tube station. Sainsburys, boots, burger king, cafe rouge all within 2 minutes walk. Rooms very small, bathroom minute, tiny shower tray with only curtain so wet floors regularly!! Breakfast was included in our trip but optional purchase for £8 seemed pretty reasonable for London. Finally, if you go there, listen out for that really naff lift music...

Reviews.Title: “Basic clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: fightingfit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in July 2011 and got what we felt was a good price. It worked out cheaper than Travelodge and Premier Inns so we thought we'd give it a go. (Less than £300 for 3 nights over a weekend). We knew we'd be out most of the time, so would literally just be sleeping and showering in there so all we needed was somewhere cheap, clean and comfortable in a central location. The St Giles achieved all of these things. It is a basic room and is pretty small with not much of a window but I will say it's very well designed so all the space is used well! The bathroom was nice for the price too. It's definitely a step up from a Travelodge/Premier Inn if that's the kind of price you're wanting to pay. The lobby is fairly average and the halls are a bit like an office building but you spend a few minutes each day using these areas so who cares! Service was fine - not overly friendly, not rude! We didn't have breakfast but our friends have before and queued 20 minutes and were less than impressed so I'd give it a miss unless it's free or virtually free! There's a Sainsbury's two minutes from the door we just went and grabbed something from there. There's also a Starbucks & Cafe Nero less than 5 minutes away. The hotel is just off Tottenham Court Road so is in a perfect position for seeing all the sights.
