The tube station is within a couple of minutes and Oxford St & Soho are less than 5 minutes walk away. I sometimes worry what the area will be like at night but this was fine, we came back at around 1am some nights and there were always cars and people around. Would definitely recommend for anyone on a tight budget looking for somewhere in central London that's clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: lors241278
Reviews.Content: Hotel very nice, centrally situated 2 mins off Oxford St and the Dominion Theatre, Tottenham Court Rd tube also 2 mins away, easy walking distance to Covent Garden, Soho, and other sights too! The staff are very friendly and helpful, left out bags because room wasnt ready and also when we checked out as were staying the day in london, small concierge charge of £1 per bag. Breakfast is buffet style so eat as much as you can! All in all a top wknd away and will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, central location”
Reviews.Author: whitewineandguinness
Reviews.Content: Located just off Tottenham Court Road- so great if you are planning a shopping or theatre break. Check in was very slow, the receptionist's took forever & after waiting around 15-20 mins (at the desk!) we discovered they had only checked us in one room out of two! Apart from this mishap, the rooms were clean and comfortable. Tea & coffee facilities were available. There was no natural light in the room which I didn't like & There was quite a bit of noise- but I suppose this is to be expected in a city centre hotel. Overall, for an overnight stay I would recommend this hotel based on it's location & cleanliness. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great!!”
Reviews.Author: newasiaman
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was extremley easy to find just two streets away from Tottenham Court Road tube station it wasnt great! From the outside the hotel looks good and the facilities all stack up well but once inside it a whole different ball game! The reception staff were far from friendly not even breaking a smile, not a great welcome! we were however able to check into our room early of which was a bonus as we were attending a function and needed to freshen up and change. Our room was a twin as i was travelling with my sister, it was extremley small and had the tiniest window with no curtains, no bath just a shower cubicle, it actually reminded me of a travel lodge room, very basic and pokey! The breakfast was a Coffee to Go, this was a piece of fruit, a hot drink and a bacon or chesse roll of which the roll was hard and stale! The only good point for us was the location as it was within easy reach of our destination and easy to get back to Euston on the tube, we could also walk into Covent garden within 10minutes. i dont think i would stay again as i am sure there are plenty of other hotels that perhaps reach a better standard than this one!

Reviews.Title: “Robbery. No curtains, tiny rooms, noisy”
Reviews.Author: ziggystarburst
Reviews.Content: Other reviews rate this hotel highly because of it's location. It's in a horrible cheap part of London centred around discount stores and takeaways. Yes it's ok for theatres etc and tubes but you can stay in covent garden RIGHT IN THEATRE LAND for almost the same price. The cells, sorry rooms, are very very small. The window was about 2ft wide with no curtains so in July the morning sun wakes you around 4 am just before the 5am delivery trucks start. The weather wasnt warm for the time of year but the rooms were very very hot so staying in a hot spell would be grim. There is noise throughout the hotel you have road noise from tottenham ct road which is busy all night or the Clunk of lifts and extractor fans if you stay at the rear of the block. The whole feel of the hotel is budget and you can see they have tried to save pennies everywhere. Beds are tiny I'm 5'8-9 and my feet were hanging over the bed. The mattress was thinner than the pillows! If you can get this hotel as part of a theatre package in the winter it might be worth a go but for a 1 night stay it's worth spending another £10-20 and get a really good hotel. I stay fairly regularly in london and this was the worst hotel I've stayed in for years.

Reviews.Title: “Simple stay inn”
Reviews.Author: laslei
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in the center of the city witch is a good thing.. couple of things that i must complain about is that its noicy from the street.. and internet/ wifi theres no free internet or wifi.. and its expencive 5 pound for an hour on wifi.. internet i dident even bother to check out because there was some elucive information about the price.. otherwise the room was ok.. dont get youre hopes up.. housekeeping was good. very helpful personal

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: Toongirl1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family for a 2 night stay. Rooms are very average but probably on a par with most London hotels in this price range. We had a very small double room which was extremely hot during the day and night, no air con but they did provide a small desk fan. You can open the windows to a certain degree however its far too noisy at night and you wouldnt be able to sleep. I wouldnt say it was the cleanest hotel the rooms were slightly grubby and in need of updating however the bedding and towels were very clean indeed. Only other criticism is the lifts !! they are a nightmare. There were 4 very small lifts and we were on the 3rd floor. Unfortunately you will have a very long wait to come down from your room as they are always full up by the time they have been to the upper floors and on the day we checked out we waited 10 minutes and ended up taking the stairs with our luggage Overall an average hotel however the location is superb being close to Oxford Street and within walking distance of most of the other attractions. Would definately stay again but would request a room on a higher floor due to the lift situation and probably pay a bit extra for a more up to date room !

Reviews.Title: “Great value London hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobles21
Reviews.Content: Great London hotel - smallish rooms but very clean and well equipped for that short stay in the city. The best thing is the amazing location - just minutes away from the underground, Oxford Street, Covent Garden, theatres etc - all easy walking distance - would highly recommend for that reason alone and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: nic110470
Reviews.Content: the hotel is ok,nothing i can complain about,the location is brilliant,not far to the theatres and all the sights,didnt need the tube. I have stayed in a few travelodges and this is not better,room is smaller than average,nothing special,very tiny bathroom,anybody large would not get in the shower. breakfast is ok,canteen style restaurant,busy but efficient staff in there,no toast though which i foulnd odd. check in was swift but again not overly friendly. would stay again if the price is right if not would much rather stay in the holiday inn bloomsbury.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EireDodo
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay will stay there again..only 1 complaint service in restaurant was bad starter and main course came 2 gether but the food was fab !!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - central location”
Reviews.Author: Smubby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Giles hotel for one week and enjoyed it very much. It is a large hotel with 700 rooms. The bedroom was small when comparing it to American or Canadian, but it was quite adequate for our purposes. The bedlinens were snowy white and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was quite modern with black marble tiles and the water pressure in the shower was excellent. The hotel was very clean. Breakfast was provided every morning and although it was listed as a continental breakfast it was actually a full buffet breakfast serving eggs, bacon, sausages, beans and potatoe pancakes. There was also fresh fruit, rolls, cheese, ham, yogurt, sliced peaches, many kinds of cereals and a vast array of juices and hot beverages. What more could one ask for? There are several restaurants on the premises and we were particularly pleased with the one called Il Grasso which served delicious Italian food and wines. We made a point of congratulating the chef. Not only was the food excellent but the prices were very reasonable. There are also several pubs very nearby which also served good "pub food" again at very reasonable prices. Since we wished to use the "tube", we were very glad that the subway station was just around the corner. We purchased am Oyster card which made our travels very economical. At times the subway cars were very crowded, but that is all part of the fun of being in a new place. Be prepared for a lot of stairs as not all the stations have escalators. Also remember to swipe your card again as you are leaving the station. The hotel had concierges who were extremely kind and polite and who could make arrangements for you or give you advice on various tourist attractions. One small criticism...we had asked for a wake-up call on the morning we were to leave. We did not receive that call. Fortunately, my husband had his alarm clock with him as a backup. One other criticsm... there was access to the internet, but it was VERY EXPENSIVE. All in all, we were very pleased with the St. Giles hotel and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, good facilities, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: lindi3
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are very very small. We were told we'd been upgraded and we did have a bedroom plus a small lounge but both together were smaller than an average hotel room. However this should not put you off if you're looking for somewhere clean and central. It was certainly worth the money and was perfectly situated, just behind the Dominion Theatre with good access to the Covent Garden area and Oxford St shopping areas as well as transport links. We did not take breakfast so I can't comment. Staff seemed friendly enough. The only thing I would say that's negative is that there were some comments overheard about lack of security in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Clean, room very small”
Reviews.Author: vaughan15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent trip to the theatre - a treat from the family for our birthday. Had a twin room in the newly refurbished 'East Tower' - it really was the smallest twin room I have stayed in, but it was on the quiet side of the hotel so slept very well. The staff were very friendly and the choice of restaurants was very good offering a 2 course meal (Italian) with a glass of wine, a beer or a soft drink for just £12.50. Breakfast was included and there was plenty of choice - cereals; continental; meats; cheeses; full english - pretty much everything. Very good value for a central london hotel being a short walk to main shops in Oxford and Regent Streets and of course the theatres. Perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Maxio5
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on a recent business trip and although the location of the hotel is good - just by Oxford Street don't stay here if you want a good nights sleep as it is very noisy not just from the traffic but from other guests, the walls are paper thin and nobody seems to know how to close a door when banging it will do! i did ask for a quiet room and was given a room on the eleventh floor which maybe the party floor as people were coming and going all night.The room its self was in badly need of refurbishment ,very hot and the bed lumpy,bathroom grubby and towels like sand paper

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KrisBC
Reviews.Content: Been reading reviews for a while about this Hotel as I had it booked for my wife's 30th so kept checking in. I had understood from the reviews that the rooms were small so I took a punt and decided to upgrade to the Executive Double Room. Firstly, I would definately recommend this option. We had a separate living area with table, a huge bathroom with LCD TV panel in the wall with Bath and Shower. The room was clean and looked out towards the BT Tower (not the most exciting view but couldn't complain) and we had bath robes and slippers included with an LCD panel TV next to the seatiing area in the bedroom. In addition to this we had a note on our bed explaining that as an Executive Room occupant we got to eat in the Executive Breakfast lounge (which is just the Hakuba restaurant underneath the hotel) but this is a cooked to order breakfast with service and it was a great add on which we never expected. Next the Location: simply couldn't ask for better. The other reviews will concur this too. A few steps to Tottenham Court Road tube station, 5 minutes walk to Covent garden and Jamies Italian restaurant which I highly reccommend, 1 minute walk to the Dominion Theatre where we seen We Will Rock You, 5 minutes walk to Oxford Street, all in all, cracking location for those wanting to get out an about on your feet! After a night on the town you can go back to the Lazy Dog bar downstairs which is open until 2am and you don't even have to get out your seat to get a beer as the waitress will spot your down to your last sip and come over to offer you a new one! Hope the review helps anyone thinking about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marrmrrs
Reviews.Content: Only stayed it this hotel for two nights and have to say the location was perfect!.. In the middle of Theatreland and some fantastic eateries BUT the hotel was of a poor standard for a city centre London Hotel... On checking inn the staff were friendly and helpfull but the room was the smallest room i have ever stayed in. The bed was lop sided and the matress was in dier need of replaceing. The carpets were threadbare and the furniture was old and badly marked in places. The bathroom was the size of a telephone box and was old and poorly fitted and the grout round the sink and shower needed replaceing. The television only worked on certain channels and when it did it only worked for a few minutes before the picture broke up and it became unwatchable. The price included a cooked breakfast which cold and was dry. The coffee was fantastic and that came out of a machine. They have a speedy check out which we took advantage of as i could not wait to leave this disappointing hotel.... Word to this hotel... Re-invest some of the profits!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Location to Theatres, Shops, Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: ASWY
Reviews.Content: My wife & I had a 3 nights stay at St Giles which in our opinion was ideal. If your reason for being in London is to visit the West End, for shopping along Oxford St and the surrounding streets and indulging in food and visits to the numerous attractions, you can't go past St Giles. The room on the 8th floor was comfortable although it could do with some renovation/upgrade to improve the presentation. Ask for a higher floor room, if available, as this will reduce and/or eliminate any noises coming up from the street level, given that this is a busy strip around St Giles. The teams at the front desk and concierge were ever so helpful (as you would expect). We had a problem with accessing our room with the keycard and a front desk staff attended to us right away when told of the matter. No waiting and this is important when one had just checked in and trying to unload the luggage. One downside at the hotel is the small lifts in place and during the peak periods in the morning, any guests on the lower floors tend to wait for a relatively long time to get into a lift to the lobby. Unless one is keen and fit, one may resort to using the stairs which we did on two occasions. St Giles is ideally located with easy walking distance to Tottenham Court station, short walk to the open top city discovery bus route (blue line) and steady stream of cabs outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sharonGalway
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for an overnight before a conference. I was wary about booking it, but it wasn't expensive and located just 10 minutes walk from the conference venue. The room itself was very small, but adequate for a single person - but I don't think it was a single room. Check-in took a bit of time, and was late in the evening, so I was tired. However, there was an excellent menu available in the bar, so I didn't have to go wandering the streets of London for food. I didn't avail of breakfast, because I knew there was coffee at the conference check-in. I would recommend this hotel for it's central location. The staff were helpful. The room was clean and the shower was good. I didn't spend a lot of time there.

Reviews.Title: “makes travels lodges seem spacious & luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: stowy
Reviews.Content: As a group of colleagues visiting London for an evening function we were a little concerned being booked into an independant hotel. We had low expectations, and I had upgraded to a deluxe room as with my partner. Very unnecessay channeling of guests through airport queuing system at desk. whole entrance totally inappropriate for wheel chairs witnessed twice in 24 hours. Our bedroom was 6' wide, hardly move around the bed, the shower room was tiny, the towels small and rough. There was a mildewy damp smell. our opinions were echoed by all. Those who had breakfast said it was like a noisy school canteen. Really nothing positive to say at all.

Reviews.Title: “I hate it and hope I'll never be back”
Reviews.Author: sallybeckwith
Reviews.Content: The suggested title for a review is "we loved it and we'll be back" ... now take a second look at the actual title. Lets start with the positives. I was staying here on business so the main priorities is work through the day, then social on an evening. This hotel was within walking distance of the office, and it is also within walking distance of Oxford Street and other touristy areas. Now for the not so positives. First impressions are lasting ones, the foyer was dirty and the reception staff were rude, undertrained and unwelcoming. The breakfast room is set out like a school canteen, often with dirty plates / stains left on the tables. The breakfast itself costs £7 and is basic. The majority of mornings I have eaten the cereal as it comes pre packaged and looks like the only edible option. There is fruit available, if it is fresh is rather questionable. There is also a full english option available too. The hotel does have a swimming pool and gym facilities however there is a £5 surcharge, which is rather steep for the facilities available. The rooms them selves are small, dated, hotel and either smell of smoke or dust. The rooms do not have air con but you are provided with a fan. To cool your room you can open a window, but as the hotel is on the corner of oxford street and totenham court road the noise from the streets are 24-7 so is unadvisable. The bathrooms are small and as per the rest of the hotel could do with a lot of TLC. Personally I was pleased there was a small group of us to dine with on an evening, as I would not have felt safe walking to restaurants or near by areas on my own on an evening.

Reviews.Title: “O.K.”
Reviews.Author: Rosehill11
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent for visiting the West End and Soho. Our room was a standard twin, which was small, but ok for a 1 or 2 night stay. We appreciated the fan provided in the wardrobe as the window only opened a few inches. Breakfast was reasonable value and better than we expected. We had no wait but can imagine that weekends could be quite hectic. We found the concierge very helpful. Would we stay in this hotel again? Yes for an overnight stay, but not for longer.

Reviews.Title: “A total dump - awaful rooms, cramped, noisy - like a prison”
Reviews.Author: StarrOxford
Reviews.Content: I was disgusted by this hotel. I stay in a lot of hotels for work and although I would like perfection have learnt that most hotels have their faults. Well this hotel only has faults. It is expensive for what it offers - because it ought to pay you to stay there! The rooms are a DISGRACE. They are cramped, falling apart, with mouldy bathrooms and horrible worn out furnishings. The windows are awful and believe it or not I had an upgraded room! Having seen the feedback on tripadvisor I had asked my company to get me a larger room so they sent confirmation that I would have the superior room! I was supposed to be in the room with my husband and we wanted room to keep our bags and do work! There was no room just for me! And the extra space was a horrible horrible annexe leading to the bathroom - a bit like a junk room space. And the bathroom - I will post photos but it was mouldy and tiny. The room was noisy - you could hear everything in the corridors and the clientele was noisy and didn't care about talking at three in the morning. But then why would anyone have any respect in such a horrible hotel. The corridors seriously look like a the back corridors of a hotel not the public areas. A friend I was meeting, a Londoner, said that he was suprised I had been put there because it had been a YMCA - believe me - it still is! You can do better than this in London. Don't stay here. I was woken in the night by the noise, burst into tears and had a mini-existential crisis - it was that depressing to be in this hotel and frankly rather scary. There is NOTHING to recommend in this hotel at all. I didn't even stay for breakfast - but shook the dust of it from my heels and had wonderful porridige in the charming Quakers Meeting House where I had my meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault this hotel at all...”
Reviews.Author: greekguy10
Reviews.Content: I know writing a review 10 months later isn't too helpful as a lot could change, but i thought it may help some people looking to book this hotel for this summer like i did last year. Where to start... firstly, the location! It is a superb spot, less than 5 minutes walk from the tube station Tottenham Court Road and literally 5 minutes from Oxford Street (perfect if you're into shopping... like my girlfriend!) We arrived at the hotel around an hour earlier than the check in time, however they said we could still check in as our room was ready. We booked an executive double room on the top floor, bathroom was amazing, room was very nicely decorated and finished, maybe a little on the small side. But to be honest, you're not going to find a massive hotel room in London unless you're prepared to pay over the odds. We literally only spent half an hour in the room before we went out and then an hour getting ready before our meal. We ate at the chinese restaurant located on sight. The food was TO DIE FOR!! It was absolutely gorgeous!! After a long day of walking, eating a chinese with a nice cold cider was the perfect end to a wonderful day! The staff were very friendly and helpful, we did not need to complain or bring something to their attention as everything was just as we needed. The concierge was quite happy to look after our bags for a fair few hours the next day because we had to leave by 12 and our train wasnt until 6.30... something that was very helpful: didnt quite fancy dragging my clothes around on a boiling hot day walking the whole length of regent street and oxford street (both walking distance from the hotel) I honestly would recommend this hotel to anyone! The facilities are very nice, the hotel is in a great location, and for the price... its a pretty good deal. One word of advice is i would recommend getting an executive room as the room wasn't the biggest, so i could only imagine what a normal double size room would be like!

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Duguni
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to stay overnight with my daughter. I booked a twin room costing £101 for the night on a special promotional rate. All started well with an excellent greeting at the door and easy early book in. All went downhill from there. We were apparently in a superior twin room but if this was the case I dread to think what the standard room is like. It also smelt like someone had been smoking in there before us - or maybe it used to be a smoking room. Either way - our clothes smelt like we were smokers. On the afternoon I decided to use the pool only to be told that there would be a charge of £5 each for the privilege and had to use our room towell. It was a lanes swimming pool which was hardly any good for my 7 year old who wanted a bit of a splash around. Total waste of money. Our deal included breakfast but we were told it did not when signing in on our departure day - we insisted that this was not the case and were allowed to go through only for someone to come and find us and tell us it wasn't included while we were 'enjoying' breakfast - how embarrassing! And all this only to have it confirmed at reception on departure that we our breakfast was indeed included. Overall a great disappointment and for what we got this was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it!”
Reviews.Author: Peppacain
Reviews.Content: I like the 2 reviews below was made to stay at this dump while on a training trip with work. My room was small, hot, dirty and smelly!!! The shower was a hole in the wall with very little room to move around in. The breakfast was nothing to write home about! They dont even do toast! What kind of hotel does not serve toast??? and all the cups are dirty, The coffee is cold even though it came straight from the earn! My door didn't lock, the window bearly opened, the walls were so thin you coudl hear the people next door, above and below. Reception staff were very undertrained and ignorant, The bar was overpriced and nearly as dirty as the rooms. I would advise anyone planning on staying here to change their mind and pay a little extra to enjoy their stay. The very sad thing is work have booked us up again here for sheer entertainment (i'm sure)

Reviews.Title: “The spearmint rhino hotel”
Reviews.Author: cumbrian_08
Reviews.Content: I would advise anyone booked to stay here to seriously re-think their options. Dont be fooled by the price, you are not getting 3 star quality not even 2 star quality. Pay a little bit more and get a hotel that is safe and clean. I was forced to stay here on a business trip and it wasnt a pleasant experience. To sum it up... the rooms are dirty, small, hot and very noisy. The window opens a measly couple of inch so dont expect any fresh air. The walls are like paper you can hear everything. They dont even have constant hot water. Breakfast is like a school canteen its a fight for a seat. The croissants are like rocks, the orange juice is powdered, the only good thing is the kelloggs cereal (something sealed you can trust). The area is pretty dodgey, quite a few suspicious characters and "working" girls hanging around. The staff dont listen and dont care so dont even bother complaning they wont do anything. You would be better of saving your money and camping out in regents park. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Happy Camper”
Reviews.Author: jen_kane11
Reviews.Content: For those of you who would like to opt for the prison experience then St. Giles Penitentiary is the place for you. St. Giles features welcoming stone beds, a filthy bathroom (if you're lucky enough to get a bathroom), and a pleasant ambiance of drunks, traffic noise and crime, but don't worry there is a big enough window to jump out and land on the construction site below. I just hope my luggage is stil there when I get back from work.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: AlakRattan
Reviews.Content: I travelled to London on business for a week in August last year and stayed at the St. Giles Hotel in central zone of the city. I may say that the location is perfect, as the hotel is set near Oxford Street, Charring Cross Road and the Tottenham Court Road and underground station. The reception zone is nice and all the people working there were very polite and helpful to me. I was accommodated in a nice double room on a lower floor, which I found rather small in size but very clean and I was not waiting for the elevators. I was happy to find out that I had a view towards the London Eye, which was a bonus. My room came with breakfast, which was tasty and I had a good choice of dishes and fruits. Sometimes at evening I had a drink at the hotel bar, where I met some other travellers from all over the world, mainly people on business, but also leisure time travellers and families also. I was disappointed I had to pay for the internet used. In most of the hotels I have been to this service is free of charge. On the other hand, the price for the room was very reasonable providing that you are in the center of London, near the main shopping street and close to the business district as well. All in all, I can say this is a good hotel and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “good break, fab swimmimg pool”
Reviews.Author: visualise
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple of times so know what we are getting. fantastic location. use of the gym, pool sauna fab. room a little small but clean and comfortable fit for purpose as not in the room much. tv, tae/coffee facilities in rrom the bar is friendly or there is a casino over the road and a pub round the corner. breakfast can be manic but selection is very good. staff are very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: LisaWebb123
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as an optional extra as part of a theatre break package before looking at reviews on here, and I was quite worried when I saw what was written. I shouldn't have been. Being my first time in London I was worried that it would be difficult to find, would be miles from any of the sites, would be horrendously small and noisy. Although it was small, and our room was a tad noisy (being located above the hotels extractor fans, and it was so hot we had to leave the windows open), it became just a base and somewhere to fall asleep. It was within walking distance of many major sites, and we managed to cover Madame Tussaud's, Buckingham Palace, London Eye, Aldwych Theatre all in one day without the need for tube travel! The hotel was very easy to find (just a short walk from both Tottenham Court Road and Goodge Street tube stops) and had a coffee shop, bar and restaurant on site - the 2 former of which were good for purpose, but after dining in the breakfast room on a morning we decided to skip it for an italian meal later in the evening as it had quite a cafeteria feel! All in all, it was a fantastic hotel for location, although the rooms themselves (and the dated decor within) let it down a little bit. I would still recommend it as a base for people wanting to see the sites, after all how much time are you really going to be spending in your room in the capital?!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location, well done St Giles.”
Reviews.Author: lincsdave
Reviews.Content: Looking through the reams of reviews for central London Hotels, we finally decided on St Giles because of its location for Theatre Land and proximity to the nearby Tottenham Court Road Tube Station. Whilst it was a tad more than I wanted to pay I was also conscious of the numerous 'small box rooms' being bandied about by other reviewers and as a guide per square metre was given for each room at this hotel I knew what size to expect. Let's say we were not disappointed! Even better, on arrival we were upgraded from a deluxe double to an executive double at no extra cost and another lovely twist, free breakfast thrown in as well. Ok, so now we were really happy. But what was it like realistically? The room was a good size, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was a really decent size (which for my frame is always a plus) and it WAS CLEAN! Evening meal was spot on being as cheaply priced as anywhere else we had checked out through the day and breakfast consisting of everything from cereals to continental to full English was as good as anywhere else we had visited, which included continentals in various areas of Europe and the especially good one in Venice. The staff were ALL extremely friendly and helpful and the facility of being able to leave our luggage on day of checkout (at no charge) for collection after we had spent a day visiting the sites was a further bonus. Well done to ALL at St Giles. You made our short break a great success. Thankyou - and yes we'll definately be back. R&J

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: AndyA43
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel for us was the location - more or less central to all the London sites worth seeing. Given the location, the cost was value for money. Initially we were located in a room opposite some construction work, the noise from which was unpleasant. We complained to management and were immediately transferred to another room and even upgraded. The upgrade meant we were entitled to breakfast in the restaurant rather than the buffet breakfasts where you serve yourself. The service at breakfast was excellent. The room was always tidied up and spacious for two especially after Europe accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: stephjayne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend just for one night on a hen weekend, we went to see mama mia and its about a 20 min walk to the theatre from the hotel. And 2 mins walk to Oxford Street We had triple rooms a double bed and single, and there was enough room for 3 adults. lots of tea and coffee to make up. There was a fan in the room but still had to have window open as it was so warm, which meant it was very noisy so did not get much sleep. Breakfast was good there was queues but one of us got a table while the others queued up, it was eat as much as you want. The only down side was the lifts, only 4 for a very big hotel and i think while we were there one was out of order. Coming down to check out on sunday morning we had wait 20 mins for a lift! But i would stay again as the location is so central and the price was very good we paid £140 for a triple room and that included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “WASTE OF MONEY - Worst suite ever”
Reviews.Author: BottmanFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Thursday 12 May 2011 in a suite on the 8th floor. The suite was more like a shoe box. You could only just walk around the bed without banging your feet. I stayed with a business partner and we were both very disappointed. Paid £185 for one night excluding breakfast. When we complained to the reception all they said was 'that was the type of room you have booked' (IT WAS A SUITE, NOT A SHOE BOX) The reception staff made no attempt to move or remedy the situation. And, the hotel has a casino next to reception, but you are not allowed in if you don't have your passport or photo driving licence. Not much good if you traveled from Sheffield by train. Rude staff, poor hotel, avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelpro231
Reviews.Content: Location is what makes this hotel. Could use an update for the interior since it appears they last had one in the 1970's. Also, if you stay in the summer please note that air conditioning means opening the window (only 6 inches) and using a fan! The rooms are small; but since I don't spend any time in the room except to sleep it was fine. No real closet space but I pack light. If you are an early to bed person please note that you are in a busy nightlife area. Fortunately it rained on Friday night (I was to leave Sat) so I got a good nights rest. Shower is good; sink has the old fashion separate hot and cold faucet. Did not eat breakfast so can not comment on the food. There are plenty of good restaurants in the area with breakfast specials so no need to worry. I would stay again since it is close to where I want to go without riding the Underground. I would classify this a an inexpensive, no frills place to put your head at night. If your into high end luxury where they fluff your pillow at night this is not the place. This is fine for those who want to spend their money on the sites.

Reviews.Title: “By far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Kermit80
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune recently of staying in the St Giles Hotel, I was staying on business and had a single occupancy room reserved for myself. The room was the size of a cupboard with a make shift bathroom, I use the term 'bathroom' lightly as it was infact a toilet cubicle with a shower built in to the wall cavity. The cleanliness of the room was poor and the overall feel of the hotel was tired...........very tired with a strange smell of stale food in the corridors!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keighra06
Reviews.Content: We were a bit dubious about this hotel after reading the bad reviews but we couldn't have been happier with it, the rooms are small but perfectly clean and definitely an adequate size! Location wise the hotel couldn't have been better, easy to get to from the airport and a perfect base for everywhere in London. Right at the top of oxford street too and in 5 mins walking distance of soho! Staff were very friendly, only complaint was the coffee in the bar downstairs! otherwise nine out of nine!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stay on strategic location”
Reviews.Author: reistu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again (before in April 2010). This time we were lucky our room was on an exterior side of the building so we had a better view for the window. Most room have a total lack of view. The building itself is very ugly, a real seventies style concrete monster. The location next to the subway station Tottenham Court Road and walking distance to Oxford Street en "West-End" region does it all. (Bath-) Rooms are small, even the double bed are ( 1.40 x 2.00 m), but still sufficient for a weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - comfortable for city breooak stay”
Reviews.Author: Magsf
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the St. Giles for a 3 night city break. Arrived about 2 hours before check in time and our room was ready for us . Excellent location just off Oxford Street. Our room was at the back of the hotel overlooking a small side street, so very little traffic noise. Room a little on the small side for 3 of us, but clean and comfortable for the length of time we stayed in it. Very good breakfast served each morning. Hot and cold buffett. Found staff very helpful especially Concierge. Would definitely stay there again on a return visit to London. Margaret Fletcher Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Super location, small rooms, horrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Heidigr
Reviews.Content: Super location for shopping on Oxford street and easy access to the sight seeing busses and the tubes. Very small room with only 3 clothes hangers... breakfast was like I imagine it to be in a prison... loud, cantina like, walk araound with bricks to collect your scrambled eggs from large trays, thin coffee, lines everywhere and not enough tables for all the guests. We quickly decided to have our breakfast at a nearby cafe - eventhough it was already paid at the hotel. Try Cafe Rouge just around the corner - that was a nice and good experience. Friendly staff, perfect service, nice bar, The Italian restaurant at the hotel served a decent meal at ok prices. Also here the staff was friendly. Same location as at breakfast by the way. The spa/fitness/pool was closed for renovation during out stay... the pool was one of the reasons why we picked this hotel in the first place...

Reviews.Title: “Good standard of accommodation, clean comfortable rooms, good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: JohnV19 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good standard of accommodation with clean comfortable rooms. The breakfasts were reasonable hot and cold food. The concierge service was good and helpful. The evening food menu is very limited and was disappointing. The location was very Good for the theatres, oxford street, and the british museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , not much else....”
Reviews.Author: FalcyG
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights. After an initial "mix up" with our booking upon checking in (in which the staff were very unhelpful) we made it to our room. The room itself was quite small and very dated. The hotel is 1 min from oxford street so the location really is the best thing about this place. If your looking for simply a place to stay close to all the action and you can get it at the right price, then the St Giles is more than fine. But if your'e looking for good service and a nice looking or spacious room then go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “central location - reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: shelleyNorthWales
Reviews.Content: check your towels are clean before you use them/ expect to pay for internet even with own laptop

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: food_fancier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2 rooms. It was the hottest Easter on record and we were on the 12th floor. In a word, it was HOT. The room had a fan provided, which was no where near enough to keep us comfortable. To have air con was an extra £50 per room per night. The room was tiny, barely enough for double bed, wardrobe and dresser. The bathroom was clean but again tiny. For 1 double and 1 single for 4 nights cost £700+. The rooms were made up daily, the water was hot, the shower was adequate, towels clean. To use the gym would have cost, and part of the YMCA and not really part of the hotel. I would not rate the hotel higher than 2 star, but the on the upside, the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “My go-to in London”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: Surely the best located budget hotel in London. 5 mins walk from Leicester Square, 2 mins from Oxford St and in the very heart of the theatre district. The rooms are more than adequate; comfortable beds and decent size bathrooms although the vast size of the place means there's always a lot of traffic in the corridors and the long waits for the lifts. Really like the breakfast - good range of hot and cold food, a minor quibble would be the unappealing room and the prevalence of guests who arrive down in slippers (hadn't really seen that in hotels before). Breakfast room doubles as an Italian restaurant by night and there's a Chinese eatery adjacent to the lively bar downstairs. Always buzzing with activity, this hotel is perfect for a weekend break to London

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Spirokm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was friendly but we found the room very small , The bar prices were expensive .Best value was the breakfast £7 eat as much as you like continental/English. The surrounding area was a bit dodgy at night as all types of shady looking charecters gathered outside the tube station.Very handy for the main theatres 5 mins walk to Shaftsburry avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated for West End break”
Reviews.Author: fairysugardust
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I spent 2 nights at St Giles Hotel for a weekend break in London. After reading some of the reviews we were slightly concerned but when we arrived at the hotel it was lovely. The check-in went very smoothly and our room was ready for us. Our room was clean and had all we needed including hairdryer, coffee/tea facilities, air conditioning, TV etc. We didn't eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the restaurant/bar facilities. The hotel was situated right in the middle of the West End and it was perfect for us. We took a bus to Camden Market which was so straightforward and the stop was virtually outside the hotel. A perfect hotel for a London mini-break; we would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “your travel agent chose badly”
Reviews.Author: designertrip
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the St Giles a couple times while leading a college learning abroad group -- I would never book it independently. The hotel is dingy, crowded, inadequately serviced, and pinched for space. The corridors and elevators are dark and too small, and this applies to the rooms as well. For a hotel with 700+ rooms, the four small elevators will keep you waiting and waiting (and if someone in the lobby pushes the call button while the door's still closing, you'll be caught in an endless and frustrating loop). If you're on floors 11 or 12, expect an elevator transfer, and yes, more waiting. The breakfast room is a zoo. Long lines, mediocre food and scarce seating will greet you unpleasantly.

Reviews.Title: “Seedy, Nasty, No Thanks”
Reviews.Author: Steviesquash
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times on business, as my other colleagues like it because its handy for the office. If I had control of booking the hotel, the St Giles is NOT where I would stay!! Rooms are dark, dingy and dirty and if someone told me that they hired rooms by the hour - I wouldn't be surprised!! (They don't) Beds are old and very soft. Bed linen is some of the worst I've ever experienced. Rooms are odd shapes - due to the architecture of the building and the windows only open a small crack. Some of the rooms I've stayed in have good views - London Eye etc, but others don't. The bar downstairs attracts a mixture of clientele - I wasn't a fan. Didn't eat here ever, due to the fact that you are in Central London, there is a wide choice. The lifts are very slow and small, and they have an ironing room which isn't particularly inviting to use. All in all, I've only stayed here because I've had too. If I had the choice, I'd find somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: lch10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on recommendation from another family member and was totally delighted. Close to the tube station, close to Oxford Road and within walking distance (if you're willing) of several other London highlights. We were upgraded to an executive room- staff at reception were quick, curteous and very helpful (as was the concierge). Breakfast was in the Japanese restaurant, again staff were fantastic. The cooked part of the breakfast was a little "minimalistic" but for someone like myself who prefers continental, I was more than happy. Unfortunately we didn't get chance to use the leisure facilities, but this is just one reason why I would be tempted to return. We went to the hotel bar a couple of times, and really enjoyed the busy, lively atmosphere. Really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and very good value”
Reviews.Author: Rockcliffe8
Reviews.Content: Wanted a hotel central for visit to London Palladium. Couldn't have asked for better at the price. Simple room but clean and comfortable. Short walk to Oxford Street etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs a major facelift”
Reviews.Author: RockyandSusie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only. The room was small and the bed was a small double. It was very warm and we couldn't easily get the temperature down. The breakfast was fairly good but was served in what can only be described as a cafeteria. Not a great experience, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea121008
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a hen weekend. 10 of us stayed overnight in 5 rooms. Rooms were good, one of them was a little small. It was very hot in the rooms it was noisy when the window was open overnight but we were in central London. Breakfast was fine, plenty to eat shame that it was struggle to get a table.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Brenda1066
Reviews.Content: A few friends went together, asked for rooms together and were given all over the hotel. Shared room with my daughter and it was very small. Although no smoking allowed in the Hotel the room was over come with it. The window only opened slightly and the queue at reception meant I didn't want to waste my time reporting it. Bar area dark and dismal, the resturant for breakfast was worse than the motorway services. Just like a shcool canteen. Only 4 small lifts not adequte for the amount of rooms, found many people having to use stairs, even with suitcases. Conciege very helpful, only goood thing!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location / Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scranton19287
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent with easy acces to the underground and plenty of shops, pubs and resturants. Concierge staff was very helpful. Front desk staff struggles with basic English and basic customer service. Room was awful. Zero ventilation. Window opens about 5 cm and drowns the room at all hours with noise from fans and compressors on the roof many floors below. Room was HOT, 5 degrees C outside and 25 degrees inside, with the window opened. Forget about life safety as there are no sprinklers in this highrise building.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room but to hot.”
Reviews.Author: loisEastSussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on friday night had an executive room on 9th floor. Room was very spacious and clean,the bathrrom was lovely and large as was the shower. However room was far to hot an aircon did not seem to be working, called reception twice but no-one ever came to fix it. Breakfast was good in the Japanese restaurant, table service so no queing. Location is excellent. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and free upgrade!!”
Reviews.Author: LBB86
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in The St Giles, and for a second time it was pleasant. The staff are really helpful and the guys on the door help you with your luggage. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a Roof top executive suite, which also included breakfast in the japanese restaurant in the morning with table servive, rather than the buffet restaurant. We were going to the theatre, so went to the Japanese restaurant inside the hotel which was gorgeous and had a great pre-theatre set menu. The room had great views over the city and was near to Oxford Street and the theatre. It was clean and well manitained. I would definately re-visit the St Giles for a third time!! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: johnevangr
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely small, more like a corridor, only 4 ft wide. The location is handy for the tube at Tottenham Court Road, but because the window wouldn't shut properly I had a lot of noise coming in from outside traffic. The lack of carpet in the outside corridor meant that other guests made a lot of noise coming and going as well. Hence sleep was a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “run, run away.”
Reviews.Author: SydneySider86
Reviews.Content: Not only would I not recommend this ‘hotel’ to ANYONE, I would actively stand outside the establishment and warn people about to check in to run, run away. In the 3 weeks prior to staying in this hotel, we had stayed in 8 hotels of the same rating, all of which cost less. We were skeptical from the start as to why we had to pay upfront, as this is usually only required to secure a discounted rate, but agreed, as we had no other option. I now realize why this was insisted on, as we definitely would have insisted on a HUGE reduction in our final bill if we were to have paid after the farce that was our stay at St Giles. Of a plethora of unpleasant experiences, these were just some: 1. Reception staff were slow and unhelpful on every occasion we dealt with them 2. A call from our room to reception (at approximately 7pm) to inform them that the cleaner had not left toilet paper when the room was cleaned went unanswered 5 times. A subsequent call to the concierge to ask what the deal was ended with us being put through to the reception again! Really helpful considering this was the problem in the first place. And yes, this sixth call also went unanswered. 3. The hallway carpet was ripped and stained with what looked like chewing gum. 4. Our room’s toilet was broken and wouldn’t flush. This was fixed, and a bent, laminated note apologizing for the defect was left in our room (this left us with the impression that these defects must be quite a common occurrence in order for laminated notes to be necessary). 5. The safe in our room was also broken. A complaint to reception about this went unactioned for our entire weeklong stay there. 6. 3 of the 5 TV channels in our room were too fuzzy to be watchable and the other two alternated between being fine and fuzzy also. 7. The window in our room wouldn’t open more than 10cm due to the great planning of putting the TV in front of it. This was lucky in a way, as some sort of LOUD buzzing generator was just outside and sounding like a helicopter. Great fun, as you can imagine. 8. The housekeepers knocked on the door at 8.30am – several times. Surely a system where you leave you keys at the front desk when you leave your room would allow the cleaners to know when guests had left their room and prevent them from interrupting guests attempting to have a sleep in on their holiday? 9. The ultimate catch was that, as our room was not air conditioned, we needed to leave the window open. However this meant we were kept awake by the generator. Ended up having to sleep with earplugs in order to get any sleep at all. Very relaxing I’m sure you’ll agree. 10. A long one, but a perfect example of the inept customer service on offer from St Giles. Two Internet kiosks in the lobby sat side by side. My friend and I went on these at the same time (note that this had to be paid for, whereas internet was offered for free at all other hotels we stayed at). My access was fine however my friend’s would not allow her to click through on many links, the timer simply counted down and the status bar read ‘done’ although the page had not updated at all. We went to speak to reception about this and the manager told us abruptly that nothing was wrong with the Internet and that the problem was due to the fact that she was trying to access online banking. Once I pointed out to him that at that very moment I had just completed mine, he pretty much accused me of lying, saying that online banking could not be completed in the hotel for security reasons. I pointed out to him that my screen was in fact still logged into my Bank’s Netbank but he ignored me and continued to insist that online banking could not be accessed. I pointed out that surely this is the main reason that hotel guests would want to access the Internet during a holiday but he again insisted. I ended up becoming so frustrated with this man that I had to leave and go back to my room, as I was very close to loosing my temper completely due to the fact that he was not speaking logically. After being refused her money back for the defunct computer, my friend then jumped onto my computer and was able to complete her online banking also. 11. The lifts were ridiculous. The lift from reception was always packed to the point that you could be buried in the armpit of a fellow guest for much of the trip, something I do not wish upon anyone. The line for the lift often spilled out of the lift lobby area and into the main reception area. Getting the lift down from your room meant a wait of about 10mins, and once the lift did arrive it was often full and you would have to wait all over again for another. We ended up walking up and down 7 floors of the fire stairs several times as it was quicker and less traumatic to the nostrils. 12. Despite paying more than any of the other 8 hotels we had previously stayed in (all of which included breakfast), breakfast was not included – although by the look of the overcrowded breakfast room, that was a good thing.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Bamber Bridge, The Red Rose County
Reviews.Title: “Noisy, small, uncomfortable, unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: La_Bamber
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms (even the deluxe), very noisy, very hot and we couldnt turn the radiator off, and the pillows were virtually non-existant. I only encountered the staff on check out (my wife arrived a day earlier than me) but I found them surly, rude and unhelpful. The breakfast was very poor too, much better is available round the corner in McDonalds at half the cost.. It would probably be ok for one night if you were in London for a shopping or theatre trip but for anything else I would avoid like the plague, especially if your visit is for leisure and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to oxford st.about 1/2 mile from theatre area”
Reviews.Author: Chuff98
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2nights quite abusy hotel but central for theater area and shops.breakfast was ok pity no toast though

Reviews.Title: “very central but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: angisouthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends for just one night Friday 11th March as we were going to see The Jersey Boys. The hotel is very central to everything and very easy to find from Waterloo. We were given rooms 503&504. The rooms were the smallest we have ever stayed in and as both my husband and my friends husband are very tall manouvering around the room was quite difficult. Having said that the rooms were very clean and the showers excellent. The staff were also very helpful.The worst problem was the noise. We were situated on the corner overlooking Tottenham Court Rd opposite Sainsburys who had a food delivery at midnight. The noise level of the metal crates being crashed off and on the lorries was so loud and went on for at least half an hour. Also the road itself isalso very noisy with all the sirens and people shouting. We all had very little sleep. I do not know if it is quieter at the other side of the hotel but I would not like to have spent anymore than one night in that room. Breakfast was on offer and was quite acceptable although we did have to queue a while. We probably would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms and a bit smelly”
Reviews.Author: Dave_House
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location but the rooms are very small and a little smelly. The food was ok but nothing great. The pool and gym were very good and well maintained. It was not a bad hotel But I stayed for 3 nights on business, and I did not find the room relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great for large groups”
Reviews.Author: PeelGirl83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a group of over 30 women for a hen do recently. Having stayed here before, I knew that an opinion of the hotel could have a lot to do with what room you are allocated. This wasn't a worry, we were only staying one night. We just needed a clean bed (all twin rooms) and bathroom. The location of the hotel is as good as it gets for what girls want - Oxford Street, the theatres, bars and somewhere to eat. Especially because we were only there for 2 days/1 night, it was important to not spend too much time travelling around (believe me, when there's 30 odd of you, this isn't so easy). This is why people keep going back. Unfortunately, the quality of the hotel isn't great. It is a large hotel, so there are long waits for the lifts (needed if on the 8th floor with a big suitcase), a queue for the canteen style restaurant for mass produced breakfast and lots of noise from other guests at night. The cleanliness is a bit dubious, I was pleased our bathroom was clean though. However, there was a not-so-nice-smelling damp stain on entering the room, we suspected from the bathroom. The room wasn't the largest by any standards but was fine for a night. The beds were clean and mine was quite comfy. The bathroom was small but nothing unusual there. I would recommend to anyone to take their own bath towel, the postage stamp size towels don't hide a great deal! There were spare towels in the wardrobe but these were only slightly bigger. Also, take a hair dryer if you use one. My friend discovered that the air is not warm enough to dry hair but the actual dryer heats up enough to burn your hand. Overall, if going to London for one night again, or travelling with a group, this hotel would be ideal. It suited us perfectly for what we needed. If part of a romantic break though, I'd book a Premier Inn instead. If you have booked this hotel, don't worry. It's not amazing but it's not terrible either.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest hotel room I have ever seen. Good location though”
Reviews.Author: EWX
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, ideal for access, but the room I had was really a converted broom closet. Would not suit a couple or a longer stay. The six hours I spent in the hotel was sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel Gr8 location”
Reviews.Author: trauma37
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at St Giles several times now and recently took my daughter for a midweek break. Hotel is very clean & very friendly Rooms are very comfortable, TV, coffee & tea facilities and a free safe in room. Hairdryer & clean towels also in room. We stayed in second floor over entrence side very quiet windows double glazed had a lovely relaxing time. There is a swimming pool and large leisure centre at an extra cost plus a casino. Some people have slated this hotel looking at some reviews I personnally would recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotel is very central, walkable to many theatre and shops. Has a good range of breakfast for all nationalities and there is always a taxi outside!!! Try it ..

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL FAB LOCATION!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladybird77mu
Reviews.Content: I have been at St Giles many times since 2001 and I feel like at home everytime I stayed..staff is so friendly and the rooms are comfortable and very clean for even family with kıds...breakfast is basic but everything is so much tasty at the buffet...I love to spend the time at the bar ..there is lots of people from other countries that you can meet up..Oxfort streett is just 10 mınutes away by walk for shopping monsters like me ...Whenever I go to London St giles is my second homee...I loved being there....

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: NathanBall
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the St. Giles hotel from Wednesday to Friday and wasn't expecting much. As we approached the hotel, it looks great from the outside and as good in. We were given a room on the eighth floor and although it was nice yet basic, it was quite small. We put that down to being at the end of the row, but it was still small. We also found that we heard most conversations next door and people walking directly above us. This was quite annoying! Our rooms were cleaned to a high standard and towels were changed. We booked bed and breakfast and as it's advertised continental breakfast we wasn't expecting much, but we was wrong. The selection was fantastic. Everything from croissants and coffee to full English and as much as you can stomach. It was all fresh and delicious. The hotel location was perfect, literally 3 minute walk to tottenham court road station and 4 minutes to Oxford street. Overall, very pleased and when returning to London, I'll book again.

Reviews.Title: “If you just need a room, this is it”
Reviews.Author: Jimmyservis
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel. In a great location! Slap bang next to a tottenham court tube station you can ve anywhere in London in minutes. The hotel rooms are small, but probably standard for London! Rooms are cold and breakfast is poor! The location makes this hotel! We would stay again in this hotel for a sight seeing trip!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: lancashirewillow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located. Rooms are reasonable sizes for Central LOndon. Issue is the noise level. On floor 1 over front entrance. Generator going 24/7 noisy road outside and windows not keeping any sound out at all! Not a great place to stay for business as so little sleep due to constant traffic, banging and even voices from the street being audible. I travel a lot and this is noisiest hotel I've ever been in. Breakfast is European buffet of poor canteen style. Same room doubles as Italian restaraurant at night which is also poor. Might be writing this grumpy at 6 in the morning, but that's because this place is too noisy to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: EJames25
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times but this time I feel the standard has dropped tremendously since the last time I stayed. First of all I had paid for breakfast they tried to charge me again for all three of us. The single room I got was absolutely disgraceful I have a bigger cupboard at home. The dining room is so full we had to queue for ages for breakfast we couldn't tell anyone because I didn't find anyone who spoke English. I always recommended this hotel but I definitely wont in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts, would I recommend, yes and no”
Reviews.Author: Dextrasol
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly and efficient staff, especially the chap who sweeps the pavement outside the Hotel entrance in the mornings. But, the room was tiny. The T.V. reception was poor. The T.V. remote only partially functioned. The sound insulation, both inside and outside was awful, and being central London, it was very noisy. No heating control in the room. But - great location. Couple of minutes walk to Oxford Street, Charing Cross Road, Tottenham Court Road Tube station. I stayed for 4 nights which I wouldn't recommend, but you should be okay for 1 or 2 nights if you're in London for a bit of shopping, sight seeing and a show.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: viccij
Reviews.Content: Booked for me as a valentine treat break to London. Read reviews and waited to see with own eyes ... Location is fantastic literally fifty yards from Tottenham Court Road tube and easy walking distance for Covent Garden, Leicester Square, British museum, Theatre land, Soho etc really mean walking distance as I am a walking woose! The hotel has a concierge and large efficient reception. There are 3 restaurants, a bar and access to the attached Gym, sauna etc. I cannot comment on any of the restaurants or gym as did not use these facilities. The bar was nice was table service however this was expressed in London prices. The hotel is large, almost 700 rooms, ours was a deluxe occupying a corner of one of the wings, it consisted of a small double bedroom, very small shower room and small sitting room with setee, TV, kettle and wardrobe. The rooms were very clean and with windows closed pretty quiet. Faults - no over head lights so putting on make up tricky. Flip side only blinds within windows to block out light , no curtains so wake early if so affected! We did not have breakfast included in our deal, Hotel offered for £7 extra. We breakfasted each day at Cafe Rouge turn left at end of road and a few doors down, very pleasant. The only other comment is regarding the lifts rather slow trying to get downstairs. Overall experience very good, service good,location excellent and value for money excellent. Would we stay again? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: aebc92
Reviews.Content: The first thought i had of this hotel, whilst entering, was wow! The reception area is posh and welcoming. The corridors are a bit shabby towards the room. I was very worried about this hotel as heard there were rats in the corridor. I can't see how this is the case! We stayed on the 8th floor and i doubt rats would go that high up... the corridors aren't the nicest, but I doubt there are rats there. The room was a bit small but for a city hotel that's expected. The beds were very comfy, the TV had a lot of channels which was nice, and the bathroom was nice and most importantly clean! There is one thing that is a disappointment with this hotel, that is the breakfast. There is a large room for it, and a lot of staff. But our table wasn't clean where we sat. The food was very disappointing.. all me and my friend ate was a bread roll and a croissant. It is a shame because the hotel is very nice and the location is perfect!! Even though the breakfast wasn't what we expected.. we would definitely consider staying at this hotel in the future when we re-visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Hotel not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: 33traveller44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not that bad! I am fussy and was worried after reading other reviews. The rooms are not that small. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Complimentary tea and coffee in rooms which is always a bonus. Breakfast was sufficient. The only negative comment is that we did have to wait for a lift - especially during peak times. Excellent location for Covent Garden and Oxford Street. Tottenham Court Road tube station is opposite the hotel. Concierge staff were exceptional and we did not have to pay to leave our luggage for a few hours after check-out. This is not the Ritz but for location I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulusss”
Reviews.Author: SteveOxford
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a 1 night stay not expecting much. What a great hotel in the centre of London, the best we have ever stayed at. We were upgraded to an executive suite at no extra cost & thrown in a fully cooked breakfast, but the room was to die for, faultless, spotless, modern, all the facilities at hand. Next time I visit London & I do it 3-4 times a year, I will certainly stay here. Great food, great area, friendly staff. The only reason that the sleep quality was marked 4 is because we are not use to sleeping in a big City were thing happen all night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but that was it!”
Reviews.Author: brandon48
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for its location but we paid £90 per person. The room was tiny. The lighting was terrible, even in the bathroom. It was hard to put my make up on. The window which had no curtain was small and opened up onto a brick wall. The tv was up really high and not even teaspoons with the cups, just stirrers. I work in a Travelodge and the rooms are double the size and you can see what you are doing. Much better value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: iFrank
Reviews.Content: Last week we have spent two enjoyable nights at this hotel. It is very central, a minute away from Tottenham Court Road Station/Oxford Street. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Staff was helfpul overall. Asked the concierge for info re taxi service to Heathrow Airport (The Piccadily Line was not working to Heathrow last weekend). In a couple of seconds, the concierge on duty calculated a bill of £80 (reaching Paddington Station by taxi and then onwards to the airport by express train)! He said he would be able to find a taxi at £50. Eventually we were have found a taxi service (very recommendable) at £30! Bakc to the hotel, the only complaint we have is when one comes to use the lifts. There are four lifts but used continuously. So much so that we (as did other patrons) often used the emergency lifts. Also, we noted a long queue of people waiting to enter the El Grasso breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “speaking as we found”
Reviews.Author: di1310
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for a two night stay on a trusted friends recommendation so it was somewhat worrying to read some of the reviews posted lately. We arrived on a very busy monday afternoon to a long queue for check in however the efficient staff kept the queue moving. Elisabett? gave us a geniunely warm welcome and had us checked in in no time. We took the lift to our room 676 and first impressions were good the lifts and public areas all clean and tidy. Our room was in the east wing and yes it was small but absolutely spotlessly clean. As we only intended to use the room to sleep and shower in the size wasn't an issue, cleanliness far more important to us so no complaints so far. The bathroom was small but again cleaned to a high standard the shower was good with lots of hot water the towels pristine white and fluffy. The room didn't have a view but again not important to us there was tea/coffee making facilities, hairdrier and flat screen tv. The bed was a standard double but very comfy made up with snow white sheets.All in all, after worrying about all the negative reviews, we were more than satisfied with our room. The only noise we heard during the night was that of thoughtless guests who make noise returning to there rooms but this happens in most hotels! Location was brilliant within walking distance of the landmarks, shops and theatres with a Sainsburys central shop across the road. Breakfast was a slight let down as the breakfast room had a bit of a " canteen" feel to it very busy and you had to search for a table, however the extremely hard working staff soon cleared and cleaned tables and kept things moving well. There was ample choice of cereal only one type of bread roll, cheese and ham, croissants but no pastries there was sausage, bacon, hash browns etc available and again the efficient staff worked hard to keep all toppped up. All in all the St Giles provided us with a very enjoyable stay and we have absolutley no complaints at all .

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Central Location”
Reviews.Author: barbiegirlWakefield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Giles Hotel on the 19th February. Check in was a bit chaotic and we did have to wait an hour to get our room. We had booked an executive room and eventually got our keys at 3pm. We were dealt with an employee called Mark, I think, who was very good and offered us coffee while we were waiting for our room to be prepared. Our room was very nice on the 9th floor. Not quite as large as I had expected, but all the facilities promised were there. We had breakfast in the executive breakfast room which was excellent. There was a good choice of cereals etc and a lovely freshly cooked breakfast. The staff were very nice and efficient. All in all, after a bit of a dodgy start, we really enjoyed our stay at this very central, really busy, hotel. I think we would stay again if were going to a theatre in the near vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely clean rooms .....”
Reviews.Author: angelina132194
Reviews.Content: I was a bit wary about staying here due to the mixed feedback - however I am glad I ignored their advice ! This hotel is in a great location, next to Tottenham Court Road tube station. We were able to check in much earlier than 2pm, and our room (deluxe room) was fine. It was very clean and all amenities were presented well. I can understand that the rooms would be tiny if a standard room was chosen, however the small lounge area with the deluxe option was definately worth the extra £10 ! The bathroom was slightly small, but it had a great high powered shower, but hey its central London! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the consierge service was a bonus. One tip I would give is the cleaners are rather keen to get the rooms cleaned nice and early in the morning - so I would get your 'do not disturb' on the door the night before ! I would definately recommend this hotel to people on a sightseeing trip to London, and will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Find a better deal than this!!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaUofI
Reviews.Content: You can find a much better place to stay than this hotel which is in a great location walking distance from Trafalgar Square and the British Museum, but has TEENY rooms, no curtains with HUGE SPOTLIGHTS all around the hotel which shine right into your room!! We'd never stay here again. Out a bit farther is the Rhodes Hotel Bed and Breakfast near Hyde Park - great deal and includes breakfast, much nicer rooms and esp. nice bathrooms, and much prettier area. Close to Lancaster Gate and Paddington Station tubes.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: LAJEdinburgh Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: My single room was small, but perfectly adequate. The soundproofing was good, giving a good night's sleep. And the location for theatres, the British Museum and shopping is excellent, with great transport connections to other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, room not as website”
Reviews.Author: SezW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights the location was fantastic! A stones throw from Oxford street and 10 minute walk from covent garden. My partner was disappointed with the size of the room, we had upgraded to an executive room and although it had everything we needed it was no more executive than a bog standard premiere inn. The main thing I would say is if you are clostraphobic do not book an executive room, the standard lift only goes to floor 11 & beyond this u use the executive lift, this was a squeeze with three people and not big enough to turn around in! Breakfast was lovely the first morning however poor on the second with our boiled egg and soldiers turning up hard boiled, also choice was limited. We ate in the Chinese restaurant which although nothing to look at served lovely food. All in all we had a great time but would choose another hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: Jordan1988
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great!! Very close to Oxford street, the British museum, the west end, and the tube is really close!! The rooms are small and poorly light very dark!! Lifts were slow, and stair case shabby!

Reviews.Title: “Gret location, not good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meluia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right off Oxford Street, so very handy for shopping, West End and sightseeing. Rooms are very very small, carpets need a good clean, Sink and shower were very grubby - yellow scum stains in both. Bathroom is miniature hard to get in and close the door. Only 1 power outlet available, very poor lighting in room. Room very warm no way to adjust heat and window faced another wall so no air coming in there. Lifts were so busy we were 20 mins waiting at peak times for them (with an injured party on the 11th floor so stairs were not an option) This hotel is fine if you just spend the minimum amount of time in it - great location.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: louisePerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my two children and a friend. We had two rooms on the 6th floor adjacent to each other. The hotel location was ideal, two minutes walk from the underground. Both rooms with twin beds were small. There was also limited space in the bathroom. A previous reviewer commented that the hotel was far too hot. I have to agree. It was very uncomfortable, so much so that sweat was constantly running down guests faces. I tried to open the bedroom window to cool the room but upon doing so a nauseating smell entered the room. My guess is that we were situated right above the kitchen extractor fans. The smell of fish and stale fat was was revolting. We were unable to locate a temperature control in the room so had to sleep with a noisy fan which consequently disturbed our sleep. We paid 250.00 UK pounds per night for this room. The hotel is so busy trying to get the lifts is a joke. After waiting far too long, we always ended up going down the back stairs to reception. This proved problematic when we had our heavy luggage. The dining area of the hotel was like a free for all, works canteen rather than a restaurant. It was far too hot. So much so, we began to feel unwell. We struggled to find seats and wandered around aimlessly in the hope that someone would vacate their seat. The food was average, rather plain and tasteless.
