On a positive note, the reception staff were very efficient and polite and the conceiege staff were fantastic, going out onto the street and hailing a taxi for us and holding the taxi car door open like a true gentleman. Upon having to vacate our room at 10am we requested our luggage be stored for a couple of hours. We got charged for this service. Over the years, I have stayed at many hotels throughout the world and never have I had to pay for this service previously. Would I recommend staying at this hotel - most definately not!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, bit pricy...”
Reviews.Author: travelconsult44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Giles twice on my last trip to the UK, just before Xmas and just after New Years 2010. My first stay I stayed in a single room which I dont recommend. I may as well have slept in a shoe box - the room was tiny, the bed even tinier (Im an average height 20 year old girl and my feet were hanging over the end) and I could barely stretch my arms out either side of me in the bathroom (forget about the shower). It was also quite noisy at night (but I suppose that has to be taken with a grain of salt with a hotel in this location). My second stay I upgraded to a double room which was a huge improvement - I definitely recommend paying that little bit more for the upgrade. The room was much bigger and the bathroom really nice - quite modern with a large shower/bath. It also wasnt as noisy I noticed. The bed was really comfy too. I would recommend this hotel (just dont go for a single room). The reception staff were really friendly and efficient, the bar downstairs was pretty cool and decently priced, and the location is excellent. I love the Bloomsbury area and the hotel is like a 2min walk from the shopping on Oxford St and about 5 mins from the theatres of Shaftesbury Ave. While the price was a little high, it was definitely worth it to be so central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “TO HOT”
Reviews.Author: ronaldgreen
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay in this hotel My wife and l went for a show break 3 days the hotel lobby is nice staff are well dressed and helpful nice lounge the hotel is far to hot throughout heating should be turned down l overheard so many guests moaning about how hot it was and how they told managers but nothing was done our room was so small l couldnt walk around my bed my wife and l have travelled all over the world and never seen such small rooms the loo was very smelly we had to keep the door closed evan then the smell got into our room like an old pub loo it was so hot in the room we had to sleep with the window open the heater control didnt work so couldnt turn it down seems this was the same in all the rooms the bar was ok £5 per pint breakfast was ok cheap qaulity fare but well cooked and plenty of it the location and price is were this hotel comes up trumps its close to soho west end and oxford circus we paid £103 per night thats good for london l would go back but for one night only not the place for long stay

Reviews.Title: “Covers your needs for a central place to sleep perfectly.”
Reviews.Author: larsena
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small, but the beds are great! Combined with the central location and very reasonable price given that this is very central, an easy choice! I return here every trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: heyholetsgo61
Reviews.Content: Was a great hotel for a family with 3 teenagers . Got a big room for the kids and a smaller one for us, and it was great located on 1 st floor. Quiet and great beds. Close to everything in london...shopping..theatre...pub...restaurants. Very helpful staff and the people working at the bar was very friendly. Will absolutly stay here next time we visit london.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but missing the attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: soundbites30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location is excellent with all of central London in easy reach thanks to Tottenham Court Road tube station literally on the hotels doorstep. There is plenty of shops, restaurants and bars locally which gives you the chance to escape the confines of the hotel should you choose. I stayed in a standard double which at £139 per night wasn't overly expensive for London but certainly isn't the cheapest. The room was very small with a fully built in wardobe, cubby holes for clothes etc including a desk with chair , the problem was the TV was above all the built in storage meaning that when seated at the desk you couldn't watch it. There wasn't enough room for anything else other than the bed & the 2 bedside cabinets so no occassional chair or seperate table. The room was clean & functional but lacked basic expectations for a room of that price. It had soap & shower gel but no moisturisers or shampoo or conditioner, it also lacked biscuits with the tea coffee facilities and didn't offer any food that could be delivered to your room, all stuff I would expect for £139 per night. On 2 occassions I ate in the chinese restaurant (Lazy Dog - I think its called) located just off reception and the food was very nice and the service brisk, however on the first night and despite leaving my credit card details at reception I had to abandon my drink to go to reception with the waiter as the restaurant couldn't put it on my room tab, only to arrive at reception to be told it was fine! The breakfast was ok and offered a variety such as cereals, english breakfast or continental fayre but again similar to other areas it was lacking that extra little bit, for example the cooked breakfast didn't offer mushrooms, tomatoes, eggs (other than scrambled) or black pudding, the continental consisted of 1 type of cheese slice and 1 type of ham & other than a bowl of apples there was no fresh fruit to speak off like you get in other quality hotels priced at that point. Also everything is self service including toast & coffee. Best point about the hotel is the location, least favourite point is the value for money in relation to what you receive.

Reviews.Title: “I would n't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: undercon
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Next to a metro station (Totenham Court), next to Oxford street (shopping, walking etc), within a walking distance to Picadilly Circus, Oxford Circus, Leicester sqr, Covent Garden. BUT... The rooms are the smallest I have ever stayed in. You cannot imagine how small. If someone wants to open a bag the other one has to be on the bed or in the toilet, that is also small, very small. You could say that this is a hotel for Hobits. Only Frodo would be comfortable in such a room. When I asked for a bigger room they showed me a plan of the hotel and explained to me that I had the bigger room of the floor. All the others are even smaller. Also the heating was not working properly and instead of fixing it they brought us a carrying heating device that we put in the plug (one of the two that this room has). As a result the room wasn't heated properly and we could not charge both our cell phones because we only had one plug. Finally when we asked for an adaptor to charge our phones they made us buy one from the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: ricardojhs
Reviews.Content: Poor reception staff. Steps up to Reception with no alternative to carry cases. Awful dated concrete building shared with YMCA. So-called double room tiny, claustrophobic, poorly furnished and equipped - all very dated and inadequate. Blind would not close. Grubby chair and carpets. Ancient TV with no picture just snow. Paid £91 through Expotel which seems a rip-off given how dreadful the place is. And they have the cheek to charge £6 per hour for wi-fi when now it is free at many other hotels. The worst hotel I have stayed in for a long time. Would have filled in their feedback form but that was missing from the folder. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Too buisy, but not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: veniceflat Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really small but quite confortable, reception and concierge are professional, breakfast is good in a very busy room... trouble to go to Leicester Sq. for the work in progress. It's hard to say if I'll be back at the St. Giles..... could be...

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but good value”
Reviews.Author: orchardflower
Reviews.Content: On the positive side this hotel has an excellent location right in the heart of London and you couldn't get a more central hotel at the price. On the negative side the rooms are VERY small and the hotel is desperately in need of renovation. If you're not going to spend much time in the hotel then it is perfeclty adequate but it is very far from luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: docdyson Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: It's an adequate hotel. Well situated. Reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “cold shoe box”
Reviews.Author: minicooper032
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the last 2 nights on a theatre trip. room was like a box room swinging a cat couldnt be done. although the room was clean. it was freezing cold so had to get a heater from the reception. flooded the bathroom everytime you had a shower. 3 stars no. if the rooms were as nice as the reception you would be well pleased. breakfast was plentiful and lots of choice. when i was told this hotel was previously the YMCA the basic rooms dont look like much has changed. location was brilliant walking distance for everywhere in London. next time i think I will go for the Premier room.

Reviews.Title: “delighted by 'service of magic'”
Reviews.Author: swiszlip
Reviews.Content: to gurantee my worries i had been overlooking reviews on many hotel forums & trip advisor so i decided in the evening before the day of my arrival after from sweeden to call the hotel directly i got through to hotel switchboard the lady was confusing & told me to hold on & passed me through to reception a male receptionist picked up he sounded very delighting & helped answer all & yet detail many of my worries, he even confirmed my room booking & number of nights also explaining about the range of breakfast available as mine was coffee 2go which is petty, little & very not stomach full, had i not notice but all thanks to him he assured i can opt for full european breakfast surved as a buffet & kindly put this on his system as noted as my request so for breakfast all i had to do is turn up at the times & either post or pay at breakfast room.. had i even had time to thank him as the day of my arrival i arrived i was checked in having awaiting just a short few minutes in the que after coming out of one longer at heathrow one young lady surved me & sent me on my way, she kept stuttering & waving a pen through her her, very un proffesional nor polite but the asian guy serving a till next to her who spoke clear english was more polite, outstanding & very helpfull showing how to reach the room, what to look out for & using the key its the card not the long plastic which holds it.. i moved up to my room & after overhearing the guy i manged to get in to my room it was a superior twin i was told & down a long walk way the hotel is sub massive needs a modern makeover as the hall ways look like a walk down a old building the room has no cieling light just desk lights & lamp light.. any how i left my bags & went down on my way i noticed the reception staff the same guy was still their ajoined by his manager both who smiled & greeted people walking buy & watching movement sound creepy but they were monitoring the peak flow of a lot of people coming back like herd of people i was looking around the asian receptionist 'Shiab' was very communicative & constructive he asked whether i was ok & i was he helped people into lifts & made sure that flow of people moved quickly, he quickly also went back to help the que in reception at many a times & some guest coming in could here talking about him & his greatness.. whether he is a senior member or not his attitude, calmness & creativity ensured a great presence of warmth i felt personaly or to others at the recieving end of his skills during a few drinks in the bar which is lovely, viberent & you meet loads of guests i wondered for the ladies & again the person was downstairs helping a person with ahmed the fun & very friendly person on the concierge meet & greet they pointed & recommended together great places to go to & how i can get along around places i mentioned the heating in my room did not work properly ahmed & shiab got that sorted as i found stagering to my room late in the morning back from the bar. the following nights i found to overcome many of my difficulties with exceptional help from shiab best settling many of my queries.. if ever u need anything i suggest him as a future source of help & his manager steve the hotel was a warmfull, friendly & very loving place especially the night staff ensure a great atmosphere & work very hard.. i enjoyed my stay exceptional thank you to these staff & i shall be back with along my friends :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mickv11
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for theatre break.. Location is ideal, close to many of the theatres and night life but only a minute from tube station and many bus routes. Very busy when we were there (midweek). Breakfast area not the most appealing although staff couldn`t be faulted. Actual breakfast was fairly basic but well cooked and plentiful. Our room was fairly small but was okay for a few nights, probably more suitable as a single. Fitness facilities appear very good if that way inclined

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: CHB2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for business. Rooms small, breakfast very minimal. Staff unhelpful. The conference facilities were a joke. Small conference rooms, bad lighting and not properly trained staff. A video screen was set up instead of a projector,- making it impossible for the participants to read the power point presentations. Nobody on site were able to handle the equipment or turn it on properly. Conference staff did not show up before 10 minutes before start, no coffee the first day, and no lunch. Apparently a booking mistake had occured placing 60 people in one 35 square meeter room, causing a lack of air. When we asked for a projector we were told that this couldn't be arranged. Conference person also refused to lock up a group room we had ordered even if it was available due to that the booking personnel had made a mistake in setting the time a bit later during the day. Will not ever ever go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Good Gym - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpenCov101
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveller and stay there a lot (months) mainly due to the "good" below ! The Good:- It is next to Tottenham Ct Rd tube. The Gym (owned by YMCA) is excellent. The Exec rooms which i usually stay at are good. It is clean and quiet. Very nice staff in the exec breakfast area Exec check in is useful The Bad :- All Non Exec rooms are TINY The standard breakfast is OK if you want cereal :) The service (reception) is hit and miss. The lifts are a joke !! Stay away from the rooms near the lifts and lower floors. To be honest - I would recommend this to others (i am using this hotel for a personal visit in a few weeks)

Reviews.Title: “very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: theatrefan46
Reviews.Content: I had already booked - and paid for - one night at St Giles as part of a Theatre break package THEN read some awful reviews on this hotel! I sent an e-mail to the hotel outlining my concerns and requesting a clean, quiet and high room.......ALL my requests were met and I found ALL the staff we met from Reception to the Dining room at breakfast were polite and helpful. The location of the hotel is perfect for Theatres - we enjoyed 'Grease!' I would recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Corina82
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a twinbedded room for a shoppingweekend and after reading different reviews I didn't know what to except, but I was happy with my choice for this hotel. It is a very large hotel, and the main reason I would go there again is the location. The highstreetfashionshops are just around the corner and also Covent Garden is within easy walking distance. Tube just a few steps from the hotel. For this pricerange in the touristcenter of London, this is certainly a good value hotel. The room was big enough, and the streetnoise was not too much. Only we had a room near some sort of ventilationsystem, so that was noisy during the night. Shower was hot but small. Bed was ok, but offcourse not very very comfortable, but in this pricerange this is ok. The room was also clean enough, but also not very very clean. At least no dirty stains or whatever, so that's also ok. Used the breakfastbuffet, and that was also ok, enough choice. We were a little to early but our rooms were ready. And when checking out, you can leave your luggage free at the congierge. When you're looking for a very central hotel for a normal price this hotel is ok for you! But if you can't stand the noise and looking for a very very comfortable and very clean place don't go there. But remember that it's central London and that the standard there is different. And for this location and for this price it's hard to find a better deal I think.

Reviews.Title: “Location for sure...pot luck with bedroom allocation. We were very lucky”
Reviews.Author: trip
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I think we were lucky to get the room we did. We had e-mailed the hotel prior to arriving asking for a nice room. We were in room 754 and we had one of the biggest rooms on that floor according to the room map on the back of the door. I really think this would be an entirely different review had we got one of the rooms which appeared to be half the size of ours. Check In : We arrived at the reception desk at 11.30 and our room was ready. Pleasantly surprised. We reminded the receptionist of our room request, she said to go up and take a look at our room and that if we were not happy to come back down. This sounded very reasonable so we took our bags to the lifts and made our way up. Lifts: Worked fine for most of our 5 day stay. The only time they are slow is when most of the hotel wants to use them at the same time. There are 700 rooms and 4/5 lifts. Otherwise they were not a problem. The Room: Pleasantly surprised on arrival. Bathroom is small but the shower was great to be fair! Plenty of hot water every time. We had enought storage space for all our stuff, and a small tv on a stand in the corner. It was more than adequate. Our only problem with the room and our stay in fact was the in room safe. It wasn't working from day 1 and despite numerous requests was never fixed. We put our cash etc in the hotel reception safe the 1st time but we didnt bother doing this for the rest of the time. Luckily we got away with it. The room was clean and our sheets were changed every day. Towels weren't a problem either. Location: As all other reviewers say, this one has it. Outstanding location. Would I stay here again? Absolutely, but I would ensure I got the same room, not one of the smaller ones. I think this is where the majority bad reviews come from. People paying same money as us 100gbp per room per night and getting allocated a box to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Used Condom found on hotel room floor.”
Reviews.Author: PAULDOB
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room, and they are very small. Have everything you'd need for a short stay, but very pokey. I checked into my room and was rather disgusted to find a used condom on the floor by my bed. Do they not clean their rooms? I was moved to another room (no upgrade offered, barely a word of apology). Although cleaner, it faced on Tottenham Court Road. Sounds of revelry and traffic were heard through the night. Great location, poor service. Rooms adequate but small. I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “A decent priced hotel in a perfect location for London "newbies"!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarzahop
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here during a 36 hour (extended) layover from Heathrow. We just wanted to take some time to explore London and St Giles was the PERFECT place to be for this! We were centrally located to the tube station, within easy walking distance of one of the on/off bus tour stops, and within easy walking to the major Christmas & shopping sites. As for the hotel, don't be scared away by the negative reviews. Check in was easy and quick, the hotel lobby & amenities were nice, and my room was clean. The room was small, but we used it as a crashpad-- obviously don't stay here if you like to lounge about in your hotel room & want to watch television for hours on end. But, if you're looking for a decent safe hotel in a location convenient to theaters, shopping or sightseeing, this is an easy, inexpensive choice to make!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent value, modest and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: blue_sky_fire
Reviews.Content: St. Giles is located just off Tottenham Court Road near the junction with Oxford Street. The tube is only a few minutes walk away and you are within easy walking distance of all the shops. If you know your way around central London by foot reasonably well then Leicester Square, Covent Garden, Soho and attractions like the British Museum are all within 5-15 minutes walking distance. The rest of central London is also very easily reached by tube from this location. The area in which the hotel is situated (Bloomsbury) feels safe enough as London can be an overwhelming place if you aren't familiar with all the crowds and a city that never sleeps. If you want a hotel in a quiet and chilled out area then St. Giles might not be for you with it being just off the Tottenham Court Road. There is discounted access to the gym and pool next door but we didn't have time to try the facilities as London has too much to offer. The room we stayed in was modestly sized, decorated and furnished (nothing luxurious but nothing off-putting) and it was also clean as was the bathroom. It was also warm and comfortable. I wouldn't have any issues with staying at St. Giles again if the price remains competitive.

Reviews.Title: “An Hotel with lots of smiles, thats what you get when you stay at St. Giles!”
Reviews.Author: denisjimenez50
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to London for a few days before Christmas to do a bit of shopping and go to the theatre. We decided to stop at St. Giles on the recommendation of my friend who had been before. From the moment we came out of the taxi to the moment we left the staff were so helpful. They were extremely polite at all times, and nothing seem to be any problem to them. The hotel was beautiful, very clean and looked so inviting on first glance. The rooms were good. We shared a room with two single beds and it had an ensuite, although a little bit small but it was okay for us. It was very clean and the maids came every day to change the towels and clean rooms. The hotel was in the right location for us, just round the corner of oxford street where all the hussle and bussle was going on, but you couldn't hear anything from our rooms. The Dominon theatre was just round the corner, and so were cafe rouge and Garfunnkels where we had a lovely meal, and breakfasts in each! There was a lovely restaurant in the Hotel its self. It was a japanese one, where we had a lovely Christmas dinnner Japanese style and the waiters were so friendly. All in all we had a funtastic three days there and would recommend to everyone that St. Giles with a smile is the best hotel to stop a while!!!

Reviews.Title: “An absoloute rip off!”
Reviews.Author: rebec89
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend booked the stgiles a month early before our shopping visit, we booked on the phone and the reservations lady seemed friendly and asif she knew what she was on about. We had never stayed in london before and when we saw this hotel online we thought it looked lovely as we had searched through the pictures, thinking this is what we will get! Little did we know it would be so different! So we made our booking for 2 nights, the reservations lady gave us a price of £135 for both nights i thought it wasnt right so i made my boyfriend call back and double check, and we were given the same answer a TOTAL of £135 for both nights. We were extremely happy and couldnt wait to get to london. We travelled for almost 3 hours from portsmouth to london and arrived around 9:30 in the evening. When we got to reception was when the problems started.The lady at reception said its £135 PER night, the reception staff seemed asif they didnt have a clue how to deal with our complaint about being given wrong information. we were told we had to pay for the 1st night and speak to reservation in the morning. So we decided to pay for the 1st night and do so. We checked in got our key and went to the lift. The corridoors and interior of he hotel were very nice, but our room was something else. We got in the lift and were on the 9th floor. We struggled to find our room as it was right in corner behind the door we were holding open, So if u were to walk out of our room door and someone was to be entering the corridoor you would get smacked in the face! When we opened our room door i physically couldnt help but laugh. It was the size of a box and looked like something from the 1960's. it was very basic, a bed a kettle a tele and a phone. All of which were dated! NOTHING like the stgiles websit photos. We payed £135 pound for this room which personaly i wouldnt pay £35 for. So we werent happy at all. But in the morning we spoke to reservtions about the booking and the room. They couldt do anything apart from lower the price and upgrade our room but i was still £109 which frankly we couldnt afford. We basically got fobbed off and were told the rate we had payed was too high! but wouldnt give us any money back. So all in all. Reservations - useless, Manager - useless, Room - RIDICULOUS, Value for money - NOT IN THE SLIGHTEST, Location, Brilliant. I wouldnt reccomend this hotel to ANYONE NOT EVEN FOR THE LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but perfect”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteTravels
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room was small - looked like a cruise ship cabin. But it seemed recently redone with nice classy clean and simple fixtures and furniture. They managed to effectively maximize the space and keep all amenities in tact. There was a coffee maker and plenty of tea and Nespresso packs, hair dryer, great shower, plenty of lights around the room and a clean and comfortable bed. If you don't want to hang out/entertain in your room and just want a convenient, clean, safe and comfortable place, this fits the bill. Also, I did not notice any outside noise at all and had a great night sleep. All this for what I thought was a very reasonable price in London.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, but hotel feels unsafe.”
Reviews.Author: moccamocca
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for two days in November. The location of the hotel is good, just off Oxford street- close to Tottenham court Road tube station. I was looking for a budget hotel in London- I arrived early and was told to come back some hours later, the first room I got was stinking of old cigarette smoke and there was noisy work going on from the floor beneath. The kind man in the reception changed my room within two minutes when I complained. The hotel is HUGE- and there are plenty of people in the reception all the time. I cannot quite imagine that security(is there is any) can get a good picture of who walks in and out of the hotel. There are also many rooms on the floors, and unfortunately as a solo traveller it is designed in a way where sometimes you get a feeling that someone with not good intentions could hide. The elevators also goes very slowly, and I couldnt find the staircases so I felt this was very uncomfortable. The hotel-rooms are small, but if you are on a budget, and with someone the hotel might be ok. I would rather look for a smaller hotel- or pay a bit more to feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Do not bother”
Reviews.Author: JudithChalmers09
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tiny and very very dated. If you want to relax then this isn't the hotel for you, if you purely want to get your head down for a few hours after a night out then its ok. Location is central however that obviously means noisy too. Restaurant is poor as is the bar. Shop around, there are much better hotels in London for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location rooms basic”
Reviews.Author: bigbearIreland
Reviews.Content: location of this hotel is its main sellng point. right in the west end.close to oxford st and theatre land.on the negative side rooms small and very basic.single room only barely room to walk.however very competive on price. for location alone id recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Tired Looking Hotel - Tiny Room - still in the 1970's”
Reviews.Author: MarkW17
Reviews.Content: Use this hotel for location only.. Its right in the centre of everything.. however other than that avoid.. its very tired looking 1970's decor compliment the tiny cramped rooms.. peeling paint, dirty mould in the tiny shower / toilet area, fuzzy tv (only basic 5 channels), and still cigarette burns in the duvet cover (shows how long since they have been replaced).. all add to the rather sad characteristic of this hotel.. which I sure was a top notch hotel in days gone by. At average price at approx £110 per night.. (room only), I think next time I will get a far better chain hotel, with the cleanliness space and quality.. (at less money), and endure a 5 min tube ride to the location. This hotel survives entirely on its location.. (Unless of course the seedy 1970's themed, scruffy style hotel is for you..)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, location.”
Reviews.Author: duckymarsh
Reviews.Content: The price was cheap, the room was tiny but this hotel is in an amazing location. 30 Seconds walk to the Tube and many stores etc. As i said the room is small but the hotel is fine. The lifts were slow so ask for a lower level room (if you need to take the stairs). I would stay there again but it was only me in the room so if you're traveling with two try one of the bigger rooms. I didnt see them but i was told that they are bigger. Hot water was constant (unlike other London Hotels) but maybe in summer it could get hot. No A/C in the room i was in but it did have a portable fan and a heater. The window did open for air circulation

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel if possible”
Reviews.Author: john1977Manchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business due to many other hotels being fully booked – it was very poor. The room was scruffy, cramped and dated with a bizarre layout. TV was small with poor signal and very limited channels (1-5 only). The hotel website mentions that guests have access to the gym in the basement but don’t make it clear that you have to pay £5 to use it – they might as well say you’ve got access to any gym in London where you can pay on the door! Bizarrely I found the feedback form from the previous guest in the room which had been left in the hotel guidebook – they were scathing and you’d think the hotel would try to make sure the next guest didn’t see their feedback…. Very poor. one plus point is the location - but you'd be better off finding a park bench nearby to sleep on....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, room size was a bit of a shock..but hey, it's London”
Reviews.Author: MelissaJadeL
Reviews.Content: I booked St Giles hotel because I read alot of good reviews about the place. After reading all the rave reviews I expected a bit more than what we got. I think we paid around 110 pounds a night for the room. I recommend printing out a map to help you navigate from the tube station to the hotel as we were lost for almost half an hour with our luggage. It's down a side street in the main shopping street. My boyfriend and I had never been to Europe before and had only traveled around asia. For anybody who has been to asia you will know that for $150 a night you can stay in an amazing 5 star hotel with buffet breakfast included. I guess we were expecting our room to be alot bigger than it was. We were a little shocked when we arrived in our room and the bed literally filled the room. There was a tiny tv up in the corner and a little station where you could make tea/coffee. The shower was probably half the size of a normal sized shower and the curtain would blow in and stick to you while showering. The bathroom floor would flood too. The breakfast was a pastry and piece of fruit per day with the choice of an orange juice or tea/coffee. It's called 'coffee2go' so you can't sit down if one of the 4 small tables and chairs are being used. I think that for a hotel with such a great location in London its good value for money. I think I would have preferred to stay a little further out and just catch the tube in to where I wanted to go and have a bigger room. I found one of the staff members to be a little bit rude but for the most part they were friendly. Not 'go out of your way' type of friendly, just pleasant to deal with. If you've only traveled to asia before then be prepared for a shock when you see the size of your room and the breakfast. If you're a seasoned Europe traveler and are looking to stay in central London then this is the place for you. Oh I forgot to mention that it has a great leisure center which we joined for only a few pounds for the week. Theres also a supermarket across the road and plenty of pubs around if you are looking for something to eat. Enjoy London!

Reviews.Title: “great location...hotel very standard”
Reviews.Author: lochte
Reviews.Content: The location is one of the best in London if you like the club scene and like to shop. The hotel itself is like a airport, crowded, noisy and not very clean. The elevetors are old and most of them are all the time out of use. We had two false fire alarsms during our stay and nobody never told why? But it was a mess in stairs. Our room was in 12th floor so not street noise and nice wiev. Although so small and the bed is just too narrow for two. The staff is neutral but the guys in concierge are just great. Thanks! For a reasonable price and great location i recommend this. But when your budget is better try other options.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vostro1700
Reviews.Content: We were on a shopping weekend and stayed here for its location near Oxford St. (the only positive thing I can say). The rooms are tiny and dated with little to none light but a bedside lamp ridiculous1 for two people staying in a room its to hard tomove about.The TV is very old and you can only watch 1 hour and an alarm goes off and shuts down. We ate in the restaraunt and I found hairs in my food when we told the waiters about it their response was ''how long has it been there'' nothing else was done. Without doubt the worst place I have ever stayed. A DUMP AVOID

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location to stay , if you want to shop in Oxford Street”
Reviews.Author: Hamzaraj
Reviews.Content: When I am in London, I always do some shooping in Oxford Street. I used to buy very few things because the bags were a nightmare to carry on. Now that I have disovered St Giles, I can buy as much as I want because the hotel is very near and I leave the bags there without having to carry them with me all day long and I dont spend time coming-going at the hotel ( again because it is very near). Also, the area is very close to other attraction like Madamme Tusaud etc. If you plan to have a short visit in the UK and you want a perfect location to stay, this is the one. All though, I dint like the rooms as very small and old furniture. The food also was very expensive at the hotel, so dont even bother to try it. I suggest this hotel to all persons that intend to shop in Oxford Street and also dont intend to spend time in the hotel. I have found a great deal using booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for the West End!”
Reviews.Author: rainbowbirko87
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here in September 2009 on a weekend break in London to see a show in the West End, my mum and I were so impressed with the location and price of the hotel that we decided to stop again. With a tube stop just 2minutes away (Tottenham court road) and the majority of theaters in the West End within a 15minute walk it is the ideal location to get anywhere within London. The rooms come equipped with everything we needed, an en-suite with a shower, a kettle, adequate lighting, a comfy bed and a tv it was ideal for a busy weekend where we would only spend time sleeping in the room. At a very reasonable price, with breakfast the following morning included it was a bargain and we shall continue to stay there for our weekends away. The only two criticisms I have are the lifts seemed to be playing up whilst we were there and no one was really doing anything about it, and the hotel does have a slight smell similar to a retire home. But it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: downing1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my mum and I as we were going to watch a show. I was a little worried about it becuase of some of the reviews, but once we got there it was absolutley fine. The reception area is nice and roomy and the staff are friendly. The rooms are basic, but perfect for a few nights stay, we had tea making facilities, plenty of clean towels and the bed was comfortable. The hotel is situated in a great position, just minutes away from oxford street and a 15-20 minute walk from many of the theatres. We ate in the Marquess of Angelesey pub, near the Lyceum Theatre, which is definatly worth a visit, friendly staff and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveller, don't book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: libergp
Reviews.Content: The only wi-fi connection is in a lounge area by the reception. Slow Slow Slow and very expensive. People working in reception seems to be trainees, all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: brits
Reviews.Content: My 22 yr old daughter and I stayed here for one night. Beds - comfortable Cleanliness - very good Breakfast - wide choice - go early as we did as it does get busy.

Reviews.Title: “Central, that´s the only good thing”
Reviews.Author: Yukuhnkuhn
Reviews.Content: Everything starts when you enter... just the look is like a mass tourist hotel and you feel like you are just a number, not a client. Check in was okay (friendly and helpful), the elevator: mid 80s, slow and only 4 for a 12 story building!!! and if you are unlucky you have to change the elveator to go to the top floors (wasn't my case). At the room door, the key doesn't work... and there you have to go back down 7 stories (plus waiting for the elevator), once in the room it smelled of damp, the bed looked like an IKEA one (nothing against them, but in a hotel!!!), the bathroom was good. The room was a "prefered"... and don't want to know how the regular one looks like... All-in-all, I would never send even my worst enemy here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hjerteCph
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in October with my mother. We were both pleasently surprised, from a lot of the reviews it sounds like it is a terrible hotel, but it is ok. For the price and in this location, I think it is just fine. We stayed in a twin room, it was simple, but ok and clean. Location is ideal for restaurants and shopping, just around the corner from Tottingham Court tube station, so it is easy to travel around London. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, great location, rubbish breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jimbarr01
Reviews.Content: my stay at this hotel was a pleasant one, clean rooms and nice bar in hotel but do not take the breakfast if you are staying here. there was no fried eggs and no toast, the sausages looked like they had been reheated 4 or 5 times and the beans were rotten.( you have been warned, get your breakfast outside of this hotel )

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jonmac666
Reviews.Content: I have seen some poor reviews for this hotel but for the life of me I don't know what people expect. This is a good hotel with a great location in the centre of London. OK, it is not exactly 5 star accommodation but then you don't pay 5 star prices. It could do with a refurb, and the room was quite small, but then who visits London and spends all their time in the hotel room? The buffet breakfast was good, although I would advise leaving it to after 9:15, or before 8:00 as it got quite chaotic in between. All in all I would stay here again as the location was great, the staff helpful and the room very clean. Perfect stay for visiting London and theatre land.

Reviews.Title: “Room is not good enough”
Reviews.Author: firtreecott
Reviews.Content: Great location but drab, drab, drab. Dismal room looking out through a slit of a window onto noisy Tottenham Court Road. If you're out all day, then OK, but it is drab and I really wouldn't want to spend a week here. Dinner in the Italian restaurant was fine and so was breakfast, but I ate early for both meals and avoided the groups. Great value for money for this part of London, but does it have to be so dark and dismal?

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modern and not too expensive...”
Reviews.Author: mast01
Reviews.Content: St Giles has a very central location, most everything you want to see as a tourist in London is within walking distance, and it´s also very close to a subway station. Rooms are small indeed, but my experience is that seems to be an issue with some London hotels that are a lot more expensive as well. Our room was clean, none of the problems reported by others here, the bed was comfortable enough and there wasn´t much noise heard from outside despite the central location. St Giles is a huge structure with many rooms and quite busy, so it can be a long walk from elevators to your room, and you may have to wait for a long time for an elevator as they are. But apart from that, this is a good hotel for this price range and location. I would stay there again, and try the swimming pool and fitness center - at additional cost though.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Best Avoided”
Reviews.Author: idewar05
Reviews.Content: Having been booked in here by business contact, I was dumfounded to find my room was small and less than clean. both beds had 'time-served matresses which threatened to engulf anyone either sitting or lying on them. Sleep was almost impossible, there was only tepid water for the shower and a dangerous, broken wire basket had been left in the shower which was a hazard if unoticed. Management have yet to repond to complaint!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Reboppa
Reviews.Content: Most American tourists might not be used to European accommodations, most being smaller than U.S. hotels, but what the St Giles lacks in space they certainly make up for in service! My husband and I were treated to some of the friendliest , warm regard we've ever been. The staff of the hotel, particularly the concierge desk and Steven the night manager were as delightful and helpful as can be. WE'd like to commend the owners on keeping such gracious employees. The mezzanine staff were so friendly and delivered scones , clotted cream [ our new addiction ] and jam with smiles and conversation. The front desk was wonderfully helpful especially on the day of our departure, the concierge staff made us feel wholly welcome and by the time we had to leave felt like old friends. We'd like to thank them all for a terrific stay and say hello from " the friendly couple"! We've passed the word on to all our traveling friends. Warmly, Rebecca Parris and Paul McWilliams

Reviews.Title: “Don't ignore the Italian!”
Reviews.Author: Faeforfar
Reviews.Content: All the reviews on the site reflect the truth of the St Giles-it's in a great location but there are some major issues lwith room size and room comfort.However having stayed there on numerous occaisions in 2010, I would suggest that anybody who finds themselves at the St Giles gives the in house Italian a try! Excellent! Great service great food and good value. Yes, it is in the same location as the bizarre 'Bus Canteen' breakfast hall-but the place is transformed on a night time! Really! Also,the pool down stairs is great! £4.00 or thereabouts to use this facility whilst you are staying at the hotel is money well spent if you are staying more than a night.

Reviews.Title: “like most review stated, ok hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: musumekiller
Reviews.Content: pros: close to bus line and metro, great price, easy access to all train stations, great food deal within 5 minute walk, near opera area, close to china town if you are asian, Sainsbury supermarket is just 1 minute away, staffs are pretty friendly, next to casino cons: small room, ac is bearly working (at least there is a fan), small tv with limited channels

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fool by the pictures....”
Reviews.Author: peachncream
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night relating on the good reviews of this place... Well here is what I can say about it: 1) Yes, the bedroom are clean, pretty big and....well let's say that the conciergerie people are cool Now I took some pictures so you can judge by yourserlf, so I don't get too subjective but seriously if you have a few more pounds to spend (I said i you had..'cause this hotel is already pretty pricey right??!!...) go somewhere else... But please booking website, stop lying to costumers telling this is a three or four star hotel when it's just a seventies building where nothing as been changed since then..(don't get me wrong I like the seventies but when it was actually the seventies). Otherwise It's ok!

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge here we come...”
Reviews.Author: DisneyMumma
Reviews.Content: I swapped my usual budget stay at the Travelodge for what I thought was a very good "deal" on a lovely little hotel near Oxford Street for my London course this week. How wrong could I be... I was shoved in what can only be a corner wardrobe with the barest of Windows probably just for legal requirements if nothing else. The room is dirty and doesn't look like it has been dusted in a while. I would like to think it's a one off, however from what I have seen in the corridors and other communal areas me thinks not. I'm getting a little itchy even thinking about sleeping here tonight. The TV (circa 1980) is bizarrly attached to what seems like the ceiling so don't even think about trying to watch it from anywhere other then the furthest reaches of the bed. That is of course if you can work it, because giving you controls where you can read what each button is for is most definately not allowed. I think I shall be heading back for my trusty cheap, reliable, CLEAN travelodge in future.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, but not much else”
Reviews.Author: ocanada1973
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location of this hotel, right in the middle of the theatre district and steps from the British Museum. But the service is something else, indeed. Housekeeping is terrible, never delivering the right number of towels, taking my washcloth and not returning it, not cleaning the bathroom floor. When I called down to get assistance with these problems (and I was polite), one desk person told me she didn't know anything about housekeeping (and didn't offer to find out or transfer me); another told me they were too busy and it took 3 hours to get the towels. There are too few lifts for the number of rooms, so waits are long and the lobby is a mob scene. Staff in the breakfast room are either surley, or zombie-like. When I asked a young woman working there where the bathrooms were, she told me there weren't any. There were, which i discovered later, right outside the breakfast room door. The room is small, which we expected, and dreary, which it wouldn't be difficult to remedy if they cared, the window is tiny, there is no air conditioning. There is no WiFi in the room, and it's expensive to pay for it in the common areas. Good lighting, though. It used to be a YMCA, so I understand there's a nice pool. All in all, it was an unpleasant experience, and next time I'll look for a nice B&B - I see highly rated ones in the area that are better priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shopping and theatres”
Reviews.Author: jhughes382
Reviews.Content: Our double room was very clean and the hotel well located for our stay after a night at the theatre but the room very small and the decor a little tired. We stayed on the 10th floor and the lifts were small and infrequent so took a long time to get to and from the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad experience..”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie_RSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights. Front desk seemed friendly, but could not attend to my complains about my aircon that was not working (three complains in total). Otherwise, good hotel and I would like to believe that what happened was an exception than the rule; I will hesitantly recommend it due to other positives it offers; such as the location, room sizes, views of London (stayed in the 13th floor).

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, but front desk not pleasant”
Reviews.Author: DeanandMelania
Reviews.Content: Contacted hotel prior to making reservation to ensure we would be able to check in early as we knew it would be a long day of travel 20+ hours. I informed them that I had have hip and back surgery and would need to rest. Upon arrival we were told that their "computers were down" and could check no one in even after I explained my situation and provided my confirmation page. Yet they were still able to check people out. They told us to check our bags with concierge and come back in an hour. Which turned into three (3) hours and magically at 1400 we were finally checked in. This delay definitely messed up our day as we were only in london for 1 1/2 days. Room was quiet and comfortable. Nice water pressure and very clean. Concierge was fantastic even during tube strike. The front desk was never personable, friendly, or helpful. Price for room was a little high when we booked it but upon arrival we were given free breakfast. Price is expected as it is London. Bar in hotel. Friendly staff nice selection of beers and wines.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short visit”
Reviews.Author: APietrzyk
Reviews.Content: It is a huge hotel with more than 700 rooms. Located very central, near to Soho and Oxford Street which is a perfect start spot for a short shopping / weekend clubbing trip to London. The reception area is prepared for servicing more guests at once, which despite the large number of guests allows the whole process of check in/out pretty to run smooth; moreover the hotel is prepared to store a large number of luggages of those guests who will be leaving London in the late afternoon hours. It isn't very luxurious or spectaculars place, be definitely recommendable because of the good price and a great localisation.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the location”
Reviews.Author: chrissylob
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from one night at the St Giles hotel i was very happy with the location of the Hotel as the last time i went to London i spent £50 pounds in taxi's.We came down for one night for my birthday on the 4thOct and booked a show We Will Rock You i couldnt believe that the Theatre was just round the corner.That meant we could go out shopping all afternoon then we got back in time for a meal in the Hotel we went for the Chinese that was very nice,then slowly walked round the corner for the Theatre.The breakfast was included it was a full english and more to choose from the only trouble was that the coffee in the urn had run out that was because we were late coming down for breakfast (9.30am) but the machine was working.All in all i would recommend this hotel we paid £121 pounds i think that was very good.We are Birmingham people and we got the Virgin London Euston train from New St at 11.30am and got it back on Tuesday 12.03am i booked it on the Mega Bus site for the grand total of £8.50p i think we will be doing this again VALUE FOR MONEY.I like to pass on tips to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location.......”
Reviews.Author: BigStuNorthumberland
Reviews.Content: Having read the very mixed reviews on this site I wasn't sure what to expect when I arrived. Check in was very good, quick and recepionist polite. The lifts were no slower than anywhere else I've stayed. The room wasn't massive but was more than suitable, bathroom ideal very clean, good clean towels. Also on arrival in the room it was nice to sse a note saying as I'd booked an executive room this now included breakfast in the executive dining room. This breakfast was very good, with a choice of cerial, toast, pastries, fruit, full english. Located less than 5 min walk to the tube and not to bad to walk to a lot of the central London attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, a cheap B & B would have better decor”
Reviews.Author: DebsinWilts
Reviews.Content: Isn't it depressing when the bedroom at home is 100 times better than this hotel? Very disappointed, rooms are very small, reminds me of a 70's hostel, cheap, tacky MDF everywhere. To be fair, they have tried with the bathroom but the quality of the workmanship is shocking. The pedal bin in my room has multiple stab marks in it - the carpet and beds have seen better days. There is no central light in the room so they are dark and dingey - get me out of here!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Martin166
Reviews.Content: Yes rooms are basic and small but you are in Central London and this is what you get for a 3 star hotel at these prices. It's value for money, within walking distance to everywhere and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “unexpectedly good hotel after reading other reviews”
Reviews.Author: susan_wilcockson1
Reviews.Content: we expected a poor hotel, our room was dated but spotlessly clean, staff pleasant and efficient. Breakfast which was included was adequate for our needs giving good choice, but busy in dining room at certain times. Location was ideal for shows, restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Lucie_World94
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for I night before our flight, we thought considering the price it was good.It is only a few mins from the high street (which we did not find intimidating at all), a good Whetherspoons for food and also 24hr ASDA. The staff in the hotel were very polite and helpful. We left the car in the hotel car park for 2wks, you park your car and take the keys with you so no one moves it to an offsite compound. The bus for the airport is literally 2 mins away and runs from 03.38 till 01.28, so almost 24hrs. The bus No.is 490, and costs £2 each way.When you return through arrivals the bus stop is just out of the doors to the left, bust stop No 6, then bus No 490 back to the hotel. It is very simple and convenient. The rooms are very simple but ours was clean and had everything we needed. If you want a 4 or 5 star hotel then pay the money, you can't expect a Hilton when you have only paid for Travel Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “awful stay at st.Giles”
Reviews.Author: avrilireland
Reviews.Content: Arrived with 3 friends on sat evening, when checking in they told us they had double booked. We booked this hotel in April! they took 30minutes to find us suitable rooms. Eventually offered us 3 rooms on 3 different floors, which we declined. then they eventually gave us 2 double rooms on 2 separate floors, which meant we had to share beds. the room was a kitted out to suit a person with a wheelchair although very small and claustrophobic it was kept clean. the next day we were moved out to our twin rooms, which were worse again. bathroom dated, tiling grouting gray and unpleasant looking. the room was stuffy and very warm. the window could only open out a small way so no air could get in. The pillows on the bed were awful feather pillows. i felt i couldn't breath in the rooms and hated every second of being in them. the front desk personnel were very manic.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stopover”
Reviews.Author: Magtrav
Reviews.Content: Located by Tottenham Court Road, the hotel is well placed for the Northern Line, a walk into the city sights and easy access to theatreland etc. My single room was not tiny, was well appointed,and had a most attractive, spotlessly clean shower room. For a one night stay with full breakfast, I thought the £90 cost was reasonable, as London must surely now be one of the most expensive cities in the world. The Reception staff were welcoming (and I observed how patient they were dealing with visitors of many nationalities) all with ready smiles. Good to see, as this is not always the case in many British hotels nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Poor standard of hotel, did not enhance our stay at all”
Reviews.Author: NickyL40
Reviews.Content: This hotel was sadly disappointing, despite its quite central location to the West End. The room was very small and poky, the carpet was dirty. Cooking smells were very intrusive through the open window. The towels were small and very worn. The noise at night was very disruptive from the street below (which I appreciate is not the hotel's fault). The only redeeming feature was the breakfast which was very sastisfying, although as vegetarians, there was a limit to what we could choose from the cooked breakfast. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central hotel for shopping and going out in Soho”
Reviews.Author: chrisweger
Reviews.Content: The St Giles is the perfect hotel for a shopping trip to London. Close to Oxford Street, Covent Garden and Seven Dials as well as Soho, it's perfect top shop and drop everything off, and go out in Soho in the evening. Rooms are tiny, though, and not state-of-the-art, but prices are cheap for the loaction. There is supplementary breakfast, but I'd rather go out to one of the places like Pret a manger or Starbucks that are close by. The good thinhg is that you can have acccess to the YMCA gym (with pool) in the basement for one or two pounds extra.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: oldtrout69
Reviews.Content: Close to the tube, shopping, everything that anyone could ever need. Resturants/Bar/Cafe onsite - marvelous. My room was quiet, had coffee facility which is great! Bed Comfy - Staff members very approachable

Reviews.Title: “they debited 2 cards and it will take 10 days to get my money back!”
Reviews.Author: lizwoodfin_1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived i was told the had to swip my card even though the room had been paid for by my son! Its their policy! But they took £110 from my card even though the room was £95? They said thats policy too! When i got home i couldn't understand where the money had gone, i had to call my bank who are looking into fraud...... The Hotel say it was a mistake - a mistake i might add that will take 10 working days to go back into my account and the guy i spoke to toady was laughing like it was a joke - i hung up on him in the end! Even though the hotel is situated in a good spot - our twin room was tiny - no air con and the TV was out the ark... Never go back.....

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly Average”
Reviews.Author: mrs_slink
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location for central london shopping or entertainment. However, I really wouldn't want to stay here more than one night and I certainly would not stay here for a relaxing stay! Hotel staff are welcoming and friendly but this hotel has seen better days. It's like a rabbit warren and the rooms are small even by London standards - they are also dark, noisy and hot. It was impossible to put makeup on anywhere in the room as the lighting was so awful! We stayed here as we were going out and we got back late so it was fine, but the road noise was horrendous, even 7 floors up. Also the queue for breakfast at peak times is a monster! I wasn't too impressed and would rather pay more next time for a more relaxing

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not a good deal overall”
Reviews.Author: Lara33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for four nights while moving house. We had chosen it for its excellent the location. However, everything else was utterly disappointing - in fact it was so bad that when it turned out that we would need accomodation for two more nights, we moved to a different hotel. It started when we were given a room in the 12th floor, where one cannot get to by lift from the lobby, despite the fact that we had six suitcases between us. We schlepped the suitcases to the 12th floor in a rather complex operation, taking us several trips in two different lifts. When we arrived in the room we found out that we had been given the smallest category of room they have. Not only was the hotel very noisy (we were woken up by other guests laughing and yelling in the hallway in the middle of the night on several occasions), but we were once woken up by a piece of a lamp falling down unprovoked (the person at the desk did not even offer an apology when we informed him of this). On Sunday we were woken early in the morning (half past seven) by a persistent knock on the door; it turned out to be room service who brought us a hairdrier, although we already had one. Thus, overall the hotel did not offer good value for money for us, despite the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey at night”
Reviews.Author: billmerrick
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room no 284 a corner room on 2nd floor. Room on the small side but the beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. However the noise from the revellers in the street went on until 2am then just as we were going to sleep a large air conditioning unit under our window down on the ground floor started, we could still hear this with the window shut. So no sleep for us. If you stay at this hotel ask for a room in the middle high up.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth at all”
Reviews.Author: Renga1
Reviews.Content: Worst experience with the hotel. I had to stay due to my flight rescheduling. The hotel staff were totally unprofessional and unfriendly. Rooms are very shabby. A particular staff was very unprofessional and rude and when I was looking to complain, the hotel info sheet guided to complain to the duty manager. Had a shock when I found out that its the duty manager who was rude to me. Never ever would stay here again. There are other good small hotels which are much more neat and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: julih
Reviews.Content: Good location for nightlife. My friend and i stayed for just one night. Needed something close to the Leister Square comedy Theater, as we had tickets for Michael McIntiyre. It's just around the corner from Tottingham Court tube station. Outside and lobby look very nice. Rooms were just okay. Small and basic, but comfortable for one night. Good location and great transportation links!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: JLWilliams_10
Reviews.Content: As everyone says rooms are small, TV you get 3 channels that fade in and out, bed uncomfortable, My pillow case had mold on it and the sheet had a stain on it, Rooms was very warm, had to open window to cool it down, and the was kept up all night from the noise on the streets. One pillow only nothing extra, It had room safes which was nice. Breakfast was like a round up of cattle, One lady in front of me stopped to get a bowl for cereal and was told to hurry up and keep moving by the staff, powdered eggs were available, but don't ask for anything else. Every Hotel in London is very overpriced and the rooms are crap.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: JED20
Reviews.Content: I stayed hear on business a few times- the rooms are tiny for the single traveller- usually in a corner of a corridor. Single bed with toilet and showever room at the end of the bed- very small dressing table if you lean to your right out of bed. No air con- which in summer si unbearable and you can't leave the windows open as it is too noisy. The only consolation for me was that it was near to where I was working (and the shops) The breakfast is quirky- simple things like not haveing toast??? Although I have to say I did find the crockery clean and there is plenty of it. I ate in the italian a few times- it was ok- ususally went for the specials. In summary if you want somewhere near to tube and oxford street- not bad (if you are not going to spend a lot of time in your room) - No room service either!

Reviews.Title: “Coming up to our 5th stay”
Reviews.Author: Gav99
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 4 times in the last few years on weekend trips to london and we love it. Yes the rooms are small but it is in the centre of london!! And the rooms are clean and tidy. Last time we paid only a little extra and had an executive room. These are much bigger and have floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city. We also had a great executive breakfast in the quieter restaurant. The usual breakfast is still good but in a large crowded canteen style area. We're off to London again next month and we'll be staying at the st giles again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel, Would Stay Again!!”
Reviews.Author: lou91
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews I was unsure whether to book this hotel or not but for the price that was given I decided to go ahead thinking it would only be for two nights even it was really bad. However, I am glad I booked this hotel...The location is great close to all attractions and the tube station is only about 2 mins away from the hotel! The hotel itself was fine for what was required - a bed for the night and a place to leave our things! The rooms are small but how much time do u spend in them when in London, so this was not a problem and they were clean which is the main thing! We were on the eighth floor so would have preferred to take the lift but on a couple of occassions we did take the stairs as the lifts seemed to be taking sometime to arrive but this was not a big problem for us! Breakfast was not the best have ever had but it was warm and it was filling enough! We went down around 9 - 9 30 for the two mornings we stayed and did not have a problem getting a seat. The staff we encounted were all very friendly and helpful. Overall there may be a few areas for improvements mainly the lifts but I would stay here again without hesistation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location...but not much more to say about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte1512
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in the smallest hotel room we have EVER stayed in - there was nowhere to put our suitcase so we had to step over it all the time. The bedroom had what they described as a Queen sized bed, but it was more like a slightly large single bed, and it was as soft as a hammock. There was just a sheet as a cover and a heavily stained bedspread that I suppose you would have to use on winter days if it was clean...yuk! The towels we had every single day looked like they had been through a shredder and were grey, not white as they probably once were. The breakfast is a circus...so don't go too late at weekends, and go early during the week or you will find yourself in a stampede to get a table. The chairs in the breakfast room were so disgustingly dirty - why use chairs with soft seat that can't be removed and washed?? Very odd. The staff in Reception were not very friendly at all, but the Concierge lads were always extremely helpful and friendly. Oh, and if you are in a hurry press for the lift at least 30 minutes before you need it - the 4 lifts have got to be the slowest we have ever come across. Waited 20 minutes one morning!! Not joking. This was my/our first stay at The St. Giles and it will must certainly be the last. The hotel needs a good clean and total renovation. But if it is location you are after, then I guess it is in the right spot for that at least.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful. Some say you get what...”
Reviews.Author: iang5
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful. Some say you get what you pay for and this hotel fits that category. You won't pay too much but you shouldn't expect too much. The rooms are small but they are clean. The housekeeping staff seemed determined to wake you as early as possible. Lots of noise in the corridor in the morning. The breakfast was OK, again not first class but sufficient. Good location for getting around London. Nice bar area and friendly staff. Not too bad but wouldn't be the 1st choice for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tess_bell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St Giles for 4 nights, our room was small, dark and stuffy, however it was very clean and perfectly adequate for what we needed. Sleep was fine, double glazing meant very quiet, however no air-con meant it was a bit stuffy, even though cold outside we slept with no covers, bathroom recently done up, cheaply, but very clean. Great location for meeting friends and exploring, was good value for the price (I imagine)

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KLgirls
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night break at the St Giles. Reception staff helpful and efficient. We had a double room which was a little small but had a wardrobe, fan and tea/coffee facilities. The room was quite dark even with lights on and blinds open. Bathroom was small and quite dated but it was clean enough. The bathrooms seem to all have old 'on the wall' hairdriers. They do work well but become hot quite quickly so need to take care when using on young children as they can burn! No real bad points for the hotel apart from it really needs to be updated. There was tape across sections of the carpets that were threadbare, towels are looking a bit over used, artex walls and dated looking bedding could do with an overhaul. There are lifts to the rooms, but for over 700 rooms there are not enough and constantly queued for lifts at all times of the day. The big plus for the hotel is it's location, literally 2 mins walk from Oxford Street and very close to Tottenham Court tube station. Seen reports about queues for breakfast but we did not experience any problems, would be nice to have option of toast but enough choice to fill you. Would stay here again and would recommend for the location, not the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Queuing? This could be your heaven”
Reviews.Author: FlintsFriend
Reviews.Content: Do you enjoy queuing? Then come here for breakfast any morning and you can savour your heaven; even better come on a Saturday and you will have to queue just to get into the dining area before joining an even longer queue to get your food. 720 bedrooms in this hotel; the catering facilities are just not up to that volume. "OK Apart from that, Mrs Lincoln, how was the play" There are many plus points. Most of the staff are good, some very good. Our receptionist was genuinely welcoming and took an interest in what we were planning. Brief encounters with others were also good. Even the chambermaids gave you a cheerful “Good Morning” whenever they saw you – possibly their only words of English but it was impressive. OK occasionally you meet ex-Qantas cabin crew but these are the exception. The standard rooms are compact, no way can two people move around at the same time but the bed was comfortable, the room clean and an obvious effort has been made to keeping everything fresh, carpets clean, paintwork regularly repainted – all very spic and span, If you do stay here the sports facility are good, a superb swimming pool awaits you and an array of equipment for the really keen. Something to do while you wait for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kleinetijger
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a weekend in London and stayed here. Don't expect to much, but the hotel is good value for money. The rooms are OK and very clean. And the location is fantastic. In the centre of London and near the subway. The breakfast: plenty of food and choices. However the area is to small for the amount of guests. So long lines and crowdy tables. The service is not so good. The cereal was overdate, we told the management, but the next day nothing was changed and the overdate cereal was still there. Another problem is the elevator. For the amount of guests the elevators are to slow/ not many enough. We stayed on the sixth floor and took the stairs all the time, since the elevators were packed when they arrived on the 6th floor (the hotel has 12 floors). For us not a problem, but when your not as mobile it could be a problem. All in all, good value for money: clean and great location, but don't expect to much.

Reviews.Title: “Really convenient hotel, minutes from Tottenham Court Road station and easy walking distances of west end.”
Reviews.Author: CymraesWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Rooms OK - very clean. You are in the centre of London so some noise is inevitable. Very busy hotel. Breakfast - plenty of food and choices. However, no toast was available nor facilities to make your own. One word of caution - rooms are very dark now that energy saving bulbs are used. Impossible to see to put on make-up. Next time (and there will be a next time!!) I'm thinking of taking a torch with me so that I can shine it in the appropriate place. Fitness centre available for a small fee as it belonged ot the YMCA next door.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but could be great”
Reviews.Author: cazlovebug
Reviews.Content: less than a minutes walk from the tube st. giles in in a brilliant location. reception staff friendly and even though we were early our room was ready so we could make use of it straight away. we wre on level 4 and as reported there is sometimes quite a wait for the lifts . the room was small but fine for me and my son . beds fine , wardrobe space ok, small tv with 5 channels, as no a/c a small fan was provided. bathroom was small and could do with either a really good scrubbing or a revamp . bedding and towels were clean and replaced daily. breakfast time was the biggest letdown and for us a bit of a waste of money as the food was not good , most of it cold including the strange scrambled eggs and bacon. there was only rolls or croissants and no toast, sorry i just love my toast at breakfast . my main concern with the breakfast is how unorganised and manic the dining room is . no queing system and blind corners making carrying hot drinks or milk for the cereals a little bit of a task. there are some good restaurants nearby so i would choose the room only option next time . yes i would return as the location is just ideal and i found the staff lovely and attentive making my 13 year old sons first trip to london memerable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: qhunny
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before I booked and wasn't expecting much so was pleasantly surprised. The location was perfect for me - almost on the corner of Oxford St and Tottencourt Road. The room was small but for a one person was adequate had everything I needed. No it's not quiet - but if I'd wanted quiet I would have gone to the Cotswolds!! I opened the window and soaked up all that noise and atmosphere!! The concierge and staff were helpful and friendly and apart from the lifts which were extremely slow, I enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: VadoinItalia
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because the price was good value for a centrally located hotel; just a few blocks from the British Museum, 10-15 minute walk from Leicester Square and one block away from theTottenham Court Road tube station. Ours was a twin standard room with a tight, small bathroom (a few hooks in there would be helpful). Room needed updating, harsh overhead lighting, shabby carpeting, however, it was clean and the beds comfortable. There was a very substantial storage area, safe, and coffee/tea maker but no clock. Ice maker was on the lobby floor and non-functional for the week we were there - had to go into the bar for ice. Reception staff not particularly friendly or helpful, concierge we spoke with didn't seem to know much about public transportation. WiFi available only in lounge at the cost of 20 pounds for a week! We found free WiFi at the Pret-A-Manger on Oxford Street, a few blocks away - they make great cappuccino so we had our morning coffee there. Caffe Nero also makes great espresso drinks (and yummy pastries/baked goods). If all you want is a clean and convenient place to sleep, this place is a good deal price-wise!

Reviews.Title: “ideal location-good value for money”
Reviews.Author: dreamercrewe
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from the st giles hotel& we were concerned after reading some of the reviews.We found the hotel an ideal location,just a 5 minute walk from euston station& round the corner from oxford street.We jumped into a cab outside to go to the theatre which was £6 there & back.The hotel room was basic but clean as was the bathroom, all in all an ideal base to sightsee at a resonable price,try to get down to breakfast early! we arrived at 8am on sunday morning & it was extremely busy.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the worst - don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: thefirs
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is excellent for theatre and shops the front of the hotel looks quite impressive however it's seriously downhill from there. Room was so tiny we couldn't find anywhere but the bed to open the suitcase. The ensuite was tiny, very dark and dingy with a disgusting shower curtain that had mildew mold on it. The towels were disgusting - they had a terrible smell - could not have been clean. Reception staff were indifferent and clearly couldn't care less about us - I assume they must hear the same complaints all day every day! We had booked 3 nights but left at 8am on day two, I could not have stayed another minute and couldn't wait to get out. We paid £125 per night booked through booking.com - wouldn't have paid £1.25. Do yourselves a favour and go ANYWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, some people expect 5* quality for 2* prices!”
Reviews.Author: angelicmystery
Reviews.Content: Although we were initially told we couldn't check in until 2pm, our room was ready at 1pm. True, the rooms are quite small but when you go to London you aren't living in the room, it's just a place to sleep. The room was spotlessly clean - no sign of mould or damp in the shower room. Complimentary soaps, shampoo and shower gel. Kettle with tea and coffee. Extra pillows available in the wardrobe. The window didn't open too far but if you were creative with positioning the TV, this did allow air in, although with the hotel being on Tottenham Court Road, it is a fairly noisy location. The electric fan in the room was very welcome, as there was no air-con. Could only get a decent picture on one channel (Channel 5), but this was not a problem, as we weren't there to watch TV - can do this at home at any time of the week!
