Often a bit of a wait for the lifts, but this wasn't helped by able-bodied people using it to travel one floor ..... I see there are lots of complaints about the breakfast - can I say I have been in much worse hotels in London. There are a variety of breakfast cereals, fruits, cheeses, meat, bacon, sausage and fresh bread buns, so you won't starve. Check out very easy, just leave the key in the perspex box at reception. The concierge was very helpful when I wanted to leave my case in the hotel for a few hours after check in. I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted! Seriously, do not use if you are in London for business!”
Reviews.Author: Judge2010
Reviews.Content: I was allocated this hotel through my business' corporate policy, needless to say there is a strong email to them today. The first room I was given was so small and dated; I could touch all the walls at the same time and there was a noise outside of the window similar to the sound made by ventilation drone., i realy thought they had given me an unused room by mistake. The second room I was given was also tiny and dated and not much better. It was humid but I couldn’t open the window due to the noise all night! The toilet was dirty and stained; the shower cubic was the smallest I have ever seen and the grouting was mouldy. The bath towel they provided was so old and worn that there was a hole in the middle. The Safe in the room had obviously not worked for some years and the reception on the small portable TV was terrible other than on one channel (only 5 channels anyway). What little sleep I did get was disturbed by the banging of doors during the night (probably due to the hen party I saw waiting for the lift). There was no iron in the room, not a huge problem but there was an 'ironing room' signposted near the lifts – I found a room with nothing in it! The hair drier which was in the bathroom was so old I thought it was gasping its last breath! Breakfast was another unique experience; I had to wait 10 mins to get into the ‘dining room’ only to find out is was self service cafeteria style. The food was disgusting, the ‘hot’ selection was warm baked beans, reconstituted scrambled eggs (don’t dare they say they weren’t!), bacon swimming in fat and dried up sausages which were very obviously the cheapest brand available. The best for me was the dirty mugs provided at the coffee/tea vending machines, there wasn’t one clean mug which was difficult to see anyway as they were black mugs – obviously black was deliberately chosen to hide the dirt! I asked for a clean cup and was offered a plastic vending mug – at least I could see it was clean. Check out was not much better. Having to walk down from the 6th floor as the lifts were that long coming and when arrived were all full, I had to walk down several service passages to get to reception where the young man on reception seemed to think I was an inconvenience as I wanted to checkout, I could do without arrogant staff. Please don’t believe the pictures on the website as they are not the rooms you will get. This is a very cheap hotel not concerned with ensuring people want to come back for repeat visits.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest but what do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: FenFlasher
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night (a Saturday) to see a play in the West End, and were told by the person who booked it was a 3-4 star hotel, which it's not. TripAdvisor shows it as a 3 star and this is pushing it. A 2 star rating is fair as the amenities, though reasonable, do not provide a 3 star experience. If you want privacy this is not the place, if it's intimacy your after then fill your boots because the place is so tight everyone is literally falling over each other!!! With over 700 rooms there are up to 1500 guests when it's full in a space on bigger than your average supermarket. Breakfast in the 'cafeteria' was comical... simply not enough staff or tables to cope; tip of the day..on a Saturday or Sunday go to breakfast either early or late, but not between 09:00 and 10:00. The standard double rooms are OK but again very small with no aircon. There was a table-top fan, but this could not cool the 'cooker' we tried to sleep in. For the same or less money I'd rather stay slightly out of town in a Premier Inn where I can at least stretch without touching the walls! I feel I must mention that the staff were great and hats off to them for keeping smiles on their faces when it seemed the majority of Europe had just marched through their doors. Summary - OK but not my choice.

Reviews.Title: “If you like queueing, this is for you -otherwise, forget it”
Reviews.Author: bath47
Reviews.Content: Queue for reception, lifts, concierge, breakfast, no organisation - pretty awful actually. We aren't talking short, fast queues here - these are seriously competitive ones!! Hotel needs to get it's act together and sort this out. Concierge - smart and is a good representative, shame about the rest. Forget breakfast unless you enjoy rugby scrums. Room 536 is tiny, ok, that's acceptable as you aren't spending your day there, but there's no aircon and it's stifling because the window has restricted opening - probably as they don't want you to hurl yourself on to the noisy air conditioning unit below (yes, there is one- but where does it get used?). It's on a very noisy street too, 3am bin bashing and singing outside - yippee!! Forget watching tv as it doesn't work and hurry with your shower in the tiniest one in the world - unless you are into mould. Sorry guys - never again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again....honest review”
Reviews.Author: ASR11
Reviews.Content: I was initially wary after reading some reviews, however I would definitely stay again. I stayed with my husband for 2 nights. The location is fantastic. The rooms are small and basic, but they are clean and have everything you need when visiting London. At the end of the day you don't go to London to relax in your hotel room. You go to sight-see and enjoy the nightlife. The reception area and bar area are really nice. If you get the breakfast included I would take it but there are plenty of nicer places nearby. The breakfast room is VERY busy, but the food was nice and there was plenty to choose from. We only ate one morning in the hotel. The hotel is very reasonable for its location in London and you get what you pay for. You don't pay the price of a 5 star hotel in London so don't expect 5 star quality. If you want luxury don't go to St Giles but I would have no hesitation in booking here again. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby and tube station is just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: peppermill
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for my parents as a birthday weekend gift, wanted to pay in full but the hotel would only let me confirm booking with my card and pay on departure. My parents stayed 2 nights, a basic hotel but central to Oxford Street and Theatres so no complaints about location. On departure they paid in full with their card. 5 days later the money was also taken from my account so we paid double, this was 2 months ago and still fighting to get my money back. I would not recommend confirming your booking with a different card, they are happy to take your money but don't want to give it back. Won't be booking there again.

Reviews.Title: “Have always enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: rockchick29
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time we've stayed at this hotel and have booked another stay. As I'm a wheelchair user we have to use the wheelchair adapted room (which is now on the 2nd floor). With it we get the executive breakfast on the ground floor so don't have to use the staff lift. The room is better than the other disabled room, the bathroom is bigger, it's easier to get in the door and was very clean. The staff as always were very friendly and helpful especially the concierge's. The outside concierge always got us taxi's and helped me into them and one of the night time concierge's even ordered us a pizza to our room.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NOT USE HOTEL AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: olliecat27
Reviews.Content: The single room was very small and dated, no air conditioning and the night I stayed was very humid. Could not sleep because of heat, could not sleep with window open because of noise. Breakfast was OK but very busy, reception staff were not interested when Imade a complaint.l

Reviews.Title: “Beware... tourists and business travelers”
Reviews.Author: siouxsieh
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very good - close to the tube, British Museum and short walk to shopping. However the hotel itself needs to be seriously updated. The room itself was disappointing. BIG NOTE: the rooms only have dial up - there is no wifi. This was a huge issue for me as I was in town for business and since my company doesn't use dial up, I was unable to use my computer in my room. The only other way to get internet access was to use a common computer down in the lobby which will cost you £1 (one pound) for every 20 minutes. Upon opening up the door to the room, the smell of body odor which emulated was over-powering. As there is no air conditioning in the rooms, so I had to turn on the small, two speed fan and open the window which opens about a quarter of the way. The next thing you notice is the size of the room - which is very small - which was not ideal but I could be fine in it. I had to turn my suitcase sideways to get in the door. The closet was not tall so the longest thing that you can hang in them is a suite jacket. The room had a small tv (fine) which received 5 channels but only one that was not all static and the remote had no back cover so the batteries kept falling out. The walls are also quite thin so you can hear your neighbors. I also did a test and found out that the staff does not change the sheets at all on the beds during your stay. You have to request that. There was a small desk which if you pulled the chair out hit the bed. Even their welcome package which they leave in the room was not helpful. None of the topics related to pages and I am not sure when the last time was that it had been updated. For the fitness center and pool, they are not actually in the hotel - instead located at the YMCA which is underneath the hotel. You also have to pay additional to use the facilities and you need to fill out paperwork and the manager needs to approve your usage of the facilities. Also make sure you are aware of the check-out times - which is 11am. I was up early on my last day on my way out for breakfast at 9am and the cleaning person tried to come in my room. When I told her yes I was indeed checking out today but was just going to get some breakfast she informed me that I was late and that I needed to leave. I had to show her the welcome book to prove that check-out wasn't till 11am. I wish I could have written a better review. I know that the hotel has the potential to be really good, just hoping that someone else at the hotel sees this too.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: sue1076986
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and was greeted at reception and even managed to check in there and then! Room wasn't huge but well furnished clean and tidy. Breakfast selection in the morning was fantastic, plenty of seating and plenty of foods to choose from. Coffee bar was a bonus and nice for a treat. Concierge desk and staff were brilliant next day looking after baggage whilst we went out again for the day. Two minutes from the Dominion Theatre, fantastically situated for getting around, tube 1 minute around corner. Tesco just across the street for emergency rations! Shops ten minutes down the road!! Vending machines on each floor selling cold drinks and beer - clever idea! Only down side, which is nothing really is it was a hot weekend and the room was hot and the lifts were none to quick. But other than than, brilliant hotel, would use again even if seeing another show across town! Oh the bar was good too, we sat out for a while as it was so hot but later came inside, very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: hushieprints
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe double as we wanted an air-con room as it's summer. We were grateful for the air-con as it's pretty hot when we arrived, although we'd prefer that the air-con is stronger. Hated the towels as they're old and smelly! Bathroom was small and shower area just nice for me who is petite. Will be cramp for taller and bigger size guests. Room safe looked so old we didn't want to use, no instructions how to use as well. My room phone is not working too! Hotel and room seemed aged and I think they needed renovation. Lift was extremely slow and there's always many guests waiting in the lobby. Had to pay for internet access. Average service staff. Location was pretty ok, 3 mins walk to the tube quite accessible and 10 mins walk to British museum. Vicinity felt safe, not too noisy as the hotel was located at the side street.

Reviews.Title: “tired hotel with pokey hot room”
Reviews.Author: travelightman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night which was enough. First impressions were unhelpful concierges watching guests struggle with heavy luggage up stairs to reception as they laughed and chatted amongst themselves. Reception has constant queues(allow plenty of time!) corridor carpets poor. Our room was in a rabbit warren of corridors (probably confusing in event of an incident) and the room we got was small and had cobwebs above the bed but was quite literally a sauna with no air conditioning. Small window made for an oppressive atmosphere. Yes we like others chose it for its location which is its ONLY good point. Also read the small print on the health facilities (its £4.50 extra to use them and you need a "breakfast ticket" too...presumeably you dont use if no breakfast is paid for? I didnt ask as when I saw the reception area for the health suite it put me right off going in... and looked 3rd world! Would opt for a Travelodge or similar budget type hotel chain anyday of the week over this hotel. Would not return. To be fair we stayed out of town (Docklands) the night before and were treated to luxury at the same price...I'd opt for out of town again albeit a short tube ride. better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay ...”
Reviews.Author: sallyj38
Reviews.Content: The St Giles hotel is in an excellent location, very close to Covent Garden so ideal for anyone doing a show. Yes the rooms are small but I would say the majority of people visiting London are just looking for a base . Our room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast is a bit 'canteeny', but the food was piping hot something which most 5 star hotels can't manage ! The concierge in the hotel was very informative and gave us an invaluable map ! Another reccommendation for anyone thinking of it we went to see Dirty Dancing which was fabulous . So all those considering the St Giles get yourselves booked in we all had 'the time of our lives' !

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: kitecat351
Reviews.Content: OMG!!!! I have stayed in some places but this hotel I would never recommend to anyone. On booking into the hotel they messed up our booking and gave my friend and I a double bed instead of two singles, the reception staff refused to change our booking as they claimed the hotel was full and didnt have any other rooms available, and even refused to hunt out availability in other nearby hotels to accomodate our requirements. After a row at reception we decided that because it was one night we would top n tail. The hotel had rubbish in the corridors and dirty laundry in huge heaps sporadically placed these were there throughout our whole stay..The pictures on the website are not what you get, the rooms are dated and need a chuffin good clean by proffesionals, the rooms are small and basic, and the windows only open 8 inches.....as for the air con......its a fan sat on a shelf and the blades are thick with muck and dust. The hairdryers are a throw back from the sixties and looked dodgy, I brought my own TG which was just as well. The breakfast buffett was the only thing the hotel had going for it, there was plenty of variety and was cooked fresh, no gripes there. The hotel lifts are alot to be desired for, please dont be in a rush to get to your room or if your late going out somewhere then my advise to you would be to use the stairs, and if your leaving your luggage at the hotel on your last day while you do last minute shopping before going home...be prepared to part with a pound as its not in with the price you originally paid, for your stay at this hotel......... Overall view.....breakfast ok, hotel not!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Travelr234
Reviews.Content: Great location and value for a London hotel. Clean and comfortable, and by London standards, not horribly cramped (note: All moderate to cheaper priced London hotel rooms are small). Very convenient for theatre, British Museum, Tube at Tottenham Ct. Allow time for the elevators during heavy use periods. As with many London hotels, no AC, so on warm summer days need to open windows for fresh air, but also noise. Good double glazed windows, so didn't have problems with noise when closed.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest hotel room in London”
Reviews.Author: John16
Reviews.Content: I know that hotel rooms in London can be compact, but this must have been the smallest single room in London. I could stand in the middle of the room and touch all four walls! The ensuite bathroom was very tight for space, but the room, whilst a little tired, was clean. This hotel can be reasonably priced for London, but it comes at a cost (which is still pricey) of low level service and feeling more like student halls than a hotel. The breakfast was served in a large canteen type room - the food and choice was basic, but there was a good quantity. The hotel has a considerable number of rooms - and as such at busy times the lifts are just too infrequent/cramped, so if you find it difficult to manage stairs then ask for a lower level room.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ShimiWien
Reviews.Content: Great location and close to the subway station (Tottenham Ct Road). Only a small walk away is Oxford street, Soho and a lot of restaurants. We had a deluxe room, clean and big enough. The bathroom is comfortable. We had a room close to the street - It was a little bit noisy at night. But the location is perfect for our weekend trips - therefore we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste the money !”
Reviews.Author: poptart1978
Reviews.Content: Where do I start ? After getting a half price deal we thought for £190 a night the hotel must be ok, god how we were wrong. We started off waiting for about 10 minutes to get checked in - plenty of staff standing around doing nothing whilst we waited. After eventually getting our keys we then had to get in the lift which was filthy - not the best start. We eventually found our room, however, we soon wished we hadnt. The room itself was tiny and smelled of smoke. We booked a double bed which was only slightly bigger than a standard single bed. The room had no main light switch leaving the only lights to be bedside lamps (ikeas cheapest and finest !) which had as much light as lighting a matchstick. The 20 year old TV was on the top shelf and boasted 5 fabulous channels (luckily we were tall enough to reach it to put it on !!). I have to admit it was a warm day in London, so we were pleased to see a switch which had a little fan above it, again we wish we hadnt. The air con was pathetic, no air conditioning just a mass of noise (to be honest a double deckrd bus could have been stood next to us with the engine running and it would have been quieter!). The bathroom was cheap and nasty and to top it off no extractor fan, therefore making the room even hotter after we had been in the shower. The hairdryer was at least 50 years old and cut out in seconds of it being on. The towels were hard and the 'bath towels' were no bigger than a standard hand towel, which also reflected in the pillows where we were each provided with one pillow which was slightly bigger than a cushion and no-where near the size of a normal pillow. Overall, would I stay here again - not on your nelly. The only plus point in the hotel was the bar - but no amount of alcohol could prepare you for a night in hell, and thats what it was !!

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: SB01
Reviews.Content: Enormous grotesque concrete pile in fabulous location on junction of Oxford St and tottenham Court Road. Basic rooms and facilities, but in this location and at this price, who cares?

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to get excited about !!”
Reviews.Author: millymooEngland
Reviews.Content: We arriived at the hotel too early for check in (our fault) and were told to come back at 3pm as the room wasn't ready. We left our bags at the hotel and went for lunch. When we arrived back at approx 3.10pm the room was still not ready and we were asked to wait in the hotel lounge for a few minutes. After about 20 mins we were told our room was ready and checked in. The room was extremely small (put me in mind of a caravan for available space) but it was clean. We had asked for a twin room but had 1 double bed in one small room then a single bed in another which pulled down from inside the wardrobe. The TV was a small old portable with a very poor picture that was barely watchable in the double room. it couldn't be watched from the other bed as it was in a different room. After going out sightseeing for a few hours we arrived back at the hotel at the same time as an American coach party checking in. Trying to get a lift up to our floor at this time was very annoying and we had to wait for a long time as the lifts struggled to cope with the people and luggage. The next morning at approx 8am we were awoken by the fire alarm and had to run down 8 flights by the fire escape. After waiting for 10 mins outside we were told to go back in as it was a false alarm and it had done the same thing the day before. The bathroom was extremely small (again caravan came to mind) and although the bathroom door was frosted it didn't provide much privacy. Their was a long line for breakfast but it did go down quite quickly. Once inside the breakfast room the tables felt crammed in but there was a good selection of food. The position of the hotel made it very easy to get around, either walking or on the tube, with a stop almost straight outside the hotel. Overall it was nothing special and if I stayed again it wouldn't be for more than one night. In fact I am thinking of going to London next year but I am looking at other hotels so I suppose this means I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: hammy78
Reviews.Content: What can i say about this hotel? well, stayed here with my wife for a long weekend, i had booked it without looking at the reviews first,,, read the reviews when i came home and could not believe some of these negative reviews this hotel got?????. I have stayed in many london hotels but this is by far the best so far,,,,, from the moment we set foot in the hotel till the moment we left it was fantastic , the staff were so polite, happy to help and just really nice in general, the food was good as were the prices at the bar. the room was spotless great bed and sleep not much noise,,,,(we were on the 8th floor lol),,,,,,,honestly people book this hotel you will not be regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A great Weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjeangles
Reviews.Content: When arriving quite late in the afternoon in from Dublin quite frankly you step into a factory processing unit the front desk visible by the clean white ceiling and chandeliers looming with front desk clerks rapidly move on checking in one guest to another outside the weather boasting summer’s perfection. The reception and lift queue were slow and upsetting what looked like a whole bunch of youngsters from overseas.. Anyhow we checked in to our rooms as booked in under same name as it was our niece’s wedding. The rooms were pre-allocated we were told, as two clerks dealt with us pleasantly...the rooms are small and needed an inspiration (why not go for the theme of their New York partners which the website shows as we wondered later or more like the room our niece was in the Executive they said more modern)...well we left our luggage’s and headed into the atmosphere of the warm bar, mind you the drinks are mainly expensive but service was delightful & rested to watch the world cup games and go about our Hen Party.. Mind you a lot of Norwegian ad Swedish people tend to outdo others in conversation. We ladies decided to head out in to the City in the evening and make it a good night, more thanks to the Concierge and what looked like change of reception staff whom work wonders we felt clearly more welcomed by the friendly and jolly late evening staff who must have experience dealing with mad people all over the place late into the night. They recommended several sights and things to do which we took upon before returning back in late and although the problem with my sisters husband stepping out of bed and wondering the reception in the early hours of the morning was a setback and funny moment for us. I my sister felt very pleased by the young & caring lad who returned him back to the room. Our niece now married we feel we enjoyed a great weekend away from home. We will look upon these as great moments and will be back again for more good nights!!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerseyscampi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here five times before and there has been no improvement in the standard of the rooms considering that "renovations" have been taking place. The bedrooms are small, carpets are filthy and smelly, the sink was blocked, the toilet handle loose. The furniture in the room is old rubbish and the beds the same. the first room we had was a joke, it was like someones atic with drawers piled on the bed. Our second room was as described. very expensive to eat there, and we complained to the Manager who halved our bill. We won't stay there again. KEEP AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Shame about the rest!”
Reviews.Author: PhilNewark
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the perfect location for what we had planned for the week. The cost for a central london hotel was very good. after staying there for 4 nights you understand why its very cheap. On arrival we were welcomed by a grumpy receptionist who barely looked at us let alone smiled!!! we were not explained any facilities available at the hotel. just our room number and that the lifts were over there. The room we booked 'exec double' was ok. very very basic. for a double room there was only one bedside table. the pillows were very uncomfortable but mattress was good. The lifts are a nightmare if you catch it at the wrong time, they are very small, apparently you can fit 12 people in. i wouldn't want to be in the lift with that many. you can be stood waiting for ages and 7 floors is a long way to walk i think there are further 5 though! There was a letter to state that as an executive customer we could have breakfast, this was very good. the 2 girls who served us were very pleasant and looked after all customers at breakfast very well. this was the best thing about the hotel (apart from location). The 'FRESH?!! Towels' smelt very fusty. the had obvisously not dried properly before being folded up in laundry. when we booked this hotel we noticed very mixed reviews about it but thought we would give it a go. i would possibly stay again only because of location and cost of room. dont go if you are expecting good customer service i have stayed in better youth hostels in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, average comfort, poor food”
Reviews.Author: Lucit71
Reviews.Content: Liudmyla T., Kiev, Ukraine I stayed at St. Giles for 7 nights on my vacation trip to London, chose it for its close location to the British Museum. What I definitely liked about the hotel is its cleanliness and staff efficiency. Though the rooms are two small and somewhat dated, the bathroom is comfortable. It was a little noisy at night but I could get quite a good sleep. The food at breakfast is very poor and resembles a school canteen, would recommend Starbucks cafe just round the corner. I visited Dominion theatre (two steps from the hotel) to see the musical "We will rock you" - highly recommend. On the whole the hotel is more than average and I would stay at it again if travelling alone, its too little space in the rooms to stay together with a partner.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mr_beng
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice the last 2 years. Excelent location and friendly staff. Rooms a bit small, but the price and location compensate for this. Never tried the pool, but can highly recommend the Lazy Dog bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & value for money!”
Reviews.Author: womenabroad
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be like a rabbit warren inside & our single rooms were very small, but I have to say that we were VERY IMPRESSED with the cleanliness & the excellent hot breakfast provided. Plenty of choice & very good quality. Excellent location for Theatres & Covent Garden. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a good value hotel in Central London. It may not be the Ritz, but perfectly acceptable for that long weekend theatre or sightseeing break!

Reviews.Title: “what a brilliant situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: aldwark
Reviews.Content: my husband and i have just returned from a 3 day break in london. we went to a show on tues night and did lots of sight seeing the st giles was just perfect for us the staff were so friendly and couldnt do enough to help you , yes the rooms are small as was the bathroom but hey ho we were not in london to stay in our room, the room was clean and tastefully decorated and we had the european breakfast which was brilliant, we will use the st giles again when we next visit the capital.

Reviews.Title: “terrible but good location”
Reviews.Author: jlok91
Reviews.Content: we had two standard rooms. one room with 2 single beds and one room with a double bed. the room with a double bed was a lot smaller than the one with 2 double bed. the room smelt musky, and there was no air conditioning. the colour tv was placed in front of the window. so when the window was open, the colour tv was almost falling off the tv rack. the toilet is small, and the shower area was worse. i could not even turn when i was showering. my height is 158 cm and weighing about 40 kg. when the shower curtain is being drawn, there wasn't any light coming through to the shower area. the bed was worn out, didn't have much sleep due to that. not to mention that the room was so small that we resorted to putting the bags on the bed, in order to pack our luggage. much being said, location is fabulous. other than that, breakfast was horrid in the hotel. I felt like a refugee, picking up breads from the bread dispenser. the breakfast at the hotel was more like mass production rather than quality and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Very good in all respects”
Reviews.Author: ScillyMmmmmm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a three night stay in the St Giles - we were very pleased with the standard of accommodation. Rooms very well serviced, very clean and comfortable. We paid £25 per night extra for an upgrade to deluxe. Dined in the Italian and Chinese restaurants - great value for money Brilliant location for theatreland and London attractions. Don't be put off by the poor reports!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: lynsey192
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the st giles. brilliant location and the rooms are clean and comfortable. our standard room had bedroom, separate dressing room and small but adequate bathroom. ate at the italian restaurant in the hotel, the food was gorgeous and the service from Angelo was fantastic!also tried the bar as well which had a nice feel to it. all the staff were very pleasant and the concierge were also really helpful with storing luggage before we were ready to leave. would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for shopping”
Reviews.Author: maltesefalcon32
Reviews.Content: St Giles couldnt be situated in a better spot that it is. Oxford street is literally round the corner. More centre than that. Other important and major attractions are one or two stops with the underground, or even a 15 minute walk could take you to the Trocadero, soho etc. The hotel is very clean, offering you a very good cooked breakfast. However, one downside is that a double room is very very small. So if you are looking for a relaxing room forget it..otherwise staff was very helpful..

Reviews.Title: “excelent location”
Reviews.Author: ralph1949
Reviews.Content: great position,handy for soho,oxford st,tubes etc,small rooms,very hot,but fan in room,comfy beds,and clean,all you need really as not in room to long,no bath,and tiny shower,toilet,bathroom ,breakfast wasnt included,and lifts took ages,as on 9th floor,but allin all id stay again but ask for a bath and a lower floor......9 out of 10,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - dont listen to bad reviews!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mayforher
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about 3 months before actually going to London, and then read some awful reviews and was a bit apprehensive - £292 for 3 nights is quite a lot to pay for a bad hotel! Anyway, when we got there we couldnt believe how lucky we were to have paid so little for such a great location! The tube is literally a two second walk from the front door, the Dominian Theatre is about 3 doors down which is great if youre going to see We Will Rock You (which we were). Oxford Street is literally across the road which is where you want to be if youre hitting the shops! Leicester Square and Soho are about a ten minute walk or a tube ride if youre feeling lazy! Basically the hotel was bang in the middle of everything! It was fantastic! When we got to the hotel the lady on reception was very helpful, everything was lovely and clean and we paid and got our keys in a matter of minutes. We stayed on the 1st floor which is still quite a trek on the stairs so we used the lifts (which were fine!). Our room was quite a small one but definitely big enough for the two of us! We had a nice big (and EXTREMELY comfortable!) bed, bedside units with lamps, we had an all in one dresser, wardrobe and shelving units which was absolutely fine - electric heater was provided in case it got cold, which it didnt - it was quite warm. We had windows that part opened and air con - the air con was actually really noisy but at least it was there. People complaining about the noise absolutely baffles me - its in the CENTRE OF LONDON - of course it's going to be noisy! That's the charm of London. Saying that, it wasnt so noisy you couldnt sleep?! It was general hustle and bustle, some sirens etc. Hardly worth complaining about at all. The only thing we found noisy in our room was next doors air con - again, it wasnt loud enough to stop me sleeping and im the lightest sleeper ever! The bathroom was just lovely - very modern, very very clean and really swanky!! The shower was heavenly, we had fresh towels every day if we wanted, fresh toileteries every day. The thing i have to emphasise is how CLEAN the room and bathroom were! For breakfast we had the coffee 2 go option which was fantastic. You got a choice of pastries, a choice of fruit and hot and cold drinks (you get one of each) which was great for us because we spent quite a lot of money on lunch and teas and we didnt really want a lot for breakie - just wanted to get out and about! They also have pay as you go internet access which we actually found really useful as we needed to look for places to go and find where all the Samuel Smiths pubs were!! I have to say, as i have never been to London before this trip, the drinks were so expensive. At most pubs it cost us about £9 for two pints. Sam Smiths pubs are all over London so we went on a little pub crawl between them all - for 2 pints at a Sam Smiths pub is about £5 which is a lot better than £9 on a night out! All in all, we had a great experience with the hotel, a great experience with the location and we will DEFINITELY be going back again. The price of the hotel is an absolute bargain for what you get and where you are - we saw more expensive hotels further away from the centre and they didnt look too hot. Keep this in mind!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Lslou
Reviews.Content: We were a group 24 on a theatre break trip. The location of the hotel was absolutely fantastic. The hotel itself is fairly basic but has everything you need. The staff were very friendly, although check in could have run smoother. I was given a box for group reservations with everyones name and keys in, which would have been fine but the names had not been sorted out into the right rooms so I had to do this in the middle of reception! However I think this may have been the travel agents fault and not the hotels. Breakfast was suprisingly good, its set up like a students union, but I've had far worse breakfasts at much more expensive hotels. For groups in particualr this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “+ Location, - Standard”
Reviews.Author: Tjotte
Reviews.Content: Location ++++ : The hotel has a perfect location, just a five minute walk to Tottenham Court Road Underground, and also a five minute walk to Oxford Street. A pharmacist is located across the street, also selling beatu- and helthproducts with reasonable prices. Facilities ++ : In the lobby you can find an informationdesk where you can get all sorts of help regarding your London-stay A tip: Don´t take the "Original bus tour". It costs 25 punds each and you don´t have the time to get value for your money in the 24h time limit. It´s easier to take the underground train, where you can do what you want and in your own pace. It´s also much cheeper, a maximum of 4.50 per day if you buy an OysterCard. The hotel includes a spa, wich we unfortunatly didn´t have time to explore. A Thai restaurant is located on ground floor with good Thai food. Ground floor also has a pub. Internet is avalible on four PC´s and costs 1 pund for 20 mins. Breakfast (Coffee2go) - : Includes one cup of coffee/the, one piece of bread and one fruit. You are not guaranteed to get a place to sit. Was looking forward to the typical egg and bacon-breakfast, but was really disapointed. Rooms (we stayed in room 488) + : Feels like a trip back to the 70´s. Really shaggy and without any luxury at all. Two single beds (comfy though) put together and the bathroom contained a small showercabin, a small sink and a WC. Windows towards the street let a lot of noice in, so we slept with earplugs. Summary: We think we did a good hotel choice considering what location we got for the money we spent. But if you would like to feel a bit of luxury in a modern hotel, I suggest you add up a couple of punds and chose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired outdated tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: catfos85
Reviews.Content: The overall inside of the hotel was very good. We stayed on the 9th floor, which was a long lift up! Room we booked was a twin room. After getting to it it was tiny!! two beds and a tv! bathroom was awful! needs updating! toiletries and amenities were good though!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - our third recent visit - with two more soon.”
Reviews.Author: Eigg
Reviews.Content: Overall we cannot fault this hotel. We last stayed two nights ago, on May 13th. - two rooms this time - there were three of us this visit. One of the three is a lady nearer 90 than 80. She thought it was excellent . The very helpful and pleasant Reception staff made sure our rooms were near one another on the same floor. The room my partner and I had was small, but quite adequate - and quiet!! We had noticed on our two recent previous visits how good the sound proofing is.The TV reception was poor, but we moved the aerial lead which sorted it out.. The bed was very comfortable: the room was clean: the water hot: tea and coffee in the room: plenty of wooden hangers in the closet: Adequate towels (2 per person): small safe. We liked the bar - drinks were very reasonably priced and the wine good. The small coffee bar on the Mezzanine over the hotel entrance was fine. Good coffee and outstanding, large, Danish pastries. We have not tried their two restauants nor had breakfast other than in the Coffee Shop.

Reviews.Title: “Low quality”
Reviews.Author: eld1969
Reviews.Content: Maybe it is hit or miss on whether you get a refurbished room or not, but mine certainly wasn't! Room 629 was close to the lift so I heard the 'ping' regularly. Carpet was threadbare, towels were thin, shower was cell-like, shower head was so furred up that the water sprayed everywhere, shower curtain stained so I chose to shower with it open rather than it stick to me (red bacteria at the bottom - an all-too-common site in hotels), tiles were cracked, grout was dirty, bedroom window was tiny (but nice view of BT Tower), window was hard to open as TV was in the way!, TV reception poor, bottom sheet on bed was not even 'tucked' in, lighting poor, dated furnishings, breakfast seemed extensive, but scrambled eggs were typically en masse, breakfast room reminded me of a youth hostel, drinks from machines - yuk. Generally poor - booked last minute for £111 - could have done better if I had time to hunt. Location is good - close to T Ct Rd tube, Soho, Oxford Street etc

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Caz1016
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the St Giles Hotel for 1 night we decided to stay again and make it 2 nights to experience all the good reviews we had read before. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay and met our needs when required. The room was on the 8th floor and not to far a distance away to get around the hotel. We had a nice view and a refurbished room which had a very comfortable bed which provided us with a good night's rest despite being in the city with all the overnight noise and marble bathroom with shower. No bath but the power shower sure did its job effectively and had hot running water. The location was perfect for us as we were going to see We Will Rock You at the Dominion Theatre. Also, Oxford street is just around the corner and Tottenham Court Road Underground Tube station is very close to access all underground networks. The best thing with the hotel for us was the location and the comfort of the bed. We would certainly recommend this hotel to our friends and family and we intend to stay there again when visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “location +++”
Reviews.Author: brit-oz-lin
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the West End with many theatres nearby, including 'We will Rock You' a couple of doors away. This is a BIG hotel, slickly operated - a bit like being on a conveyor belt. The rooms are smallish but perfectly adequate and we actually had a good night's sleep. It is ideal for a city break, being a short walk to so many attractions, including the National Gallery and Covent Garden. The 'Breakfast 2 Go' consists of a small counter where guests are handed a drink, a pastry and a piece of fruit to start the day - unusual but it works as it fills a gap and takes up so little precious sightseeing time. Nearest station is Tottenham Court Road - about 5 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: JaneBCardiff
Reviews.Content: I found some of the reception staff quite rude and dismissive. However the Manager took over and apolgised for the language barrier. My friend's room smelt of sewerage/drains and the rooms were cold. Breakfast was ok but I would never stay here again - stayed in much nicer hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Basic”
Reviews.Author: tommybravo2003
Reviews.Content: Booked for one night due to central location. The room was small but clean and the bed was comfy. The staff were reasonable. The bar stayed open till 2am and drinks were average price for London. Breakfast is a crowded self service affair but reasonable as it is included in the price, continental or cooked is available and there is a coffee machine doing the fancy coffees. They advertise the use of the pool (Part of the YMCA) but this is at extra cost approximately £4. Overall I was pleasantly surprised! Good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad I was expecting....”
Reviews.Author: alr837
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights for business. Given all the reviews I did not have high expectations, and hal thought I may have to look for somewhere else to stay! Upon arrival, my bags were quickly taken inside whilst I paid the taxi driver, and then there was a very long queue to check in - although it was only just after 2pm (their check in time). I seemed to be the only person who did not have a problem checking in - had been done via the works travel agent. Every other person had problems with their bookings - had been booked online on various websites but those bookings had not been processed by the hotels reservation team, resulting in many people sat on the mezannine level, and some very unhappy people. I was on the 6th floor, which seems to have been refurbished. As expected, the single room is tiny - but was ok for what I needed. The bathroom was quite special though, I don't think I have ever seen such a good/ bad use of space! - I have been in bigger broom cupboards! The bathroom seemed to be one area which had not been decorated recently. Bed was reasonably comfortable. Usual inner city noise with window open, but couldn't hear anything with it shut, so slept surprisingly well. Breakfast - wouldn't bother paying the extra for that again, would either go for breakfast on the run, or pop into a nearby shop/coffee place to get something. Wifi is available on the mezannine level - at a cost of £10 per day! Speed is ok though. Access is not available in the rooms - although it did say you could connect via a cable - didn't see this though. Tv reception - incredibly dodgy, usual 1-5 channels, plus the odd periodic appearance of a couple of freeview channels. I didn't try the bar/restaurants, I grabbed tea from an m&s a short walkup the road. If you are only staying a couple of days, and have a small bag, then there shouldn't be any problems, as other people have said, its not like you spend that much free time in your room. The biggest negative was the constant smell of cigarette smoke. It was so bad at some times I was expecting a smoke alarm to go off! - this seemed to be coming from neighbouring rooms. I didn't actually see any signs in any of the rooms, or in the hotel to indicate no smoking, so I can assume that tourists were not too familiar with the smoking ban here!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - and that's it...”
Reviews.Author: Bmews
Reviews.Content: Just back from the 'St Grotty Hotel' as we dubbed it. Like a mass transit camp for evacuees, full of 'today is London, we stay here' coach parties. My SO was appalled at the room, me, well I've seen worse in time spent overseas. Reception and flunkies on the door look fine for clicking fingers for taxis, but go beneath the glitz and this place needs serious money on it. The room was a dingy lit double, so small with a bed, nothing else could fit in. The lifts are so slow (5? of them) we used to walk down from 8th floor. Shower needed serious deep cleaning / retiling, bathroom not painted for ages, room/bed linen smelt of smoke or just unlaundered for quite a while, the hot water took ages to come through - but hot when it arrives.The bed was past its prime, you could feel the springs digging in. Breakfast was like a military cookhouse or school canteen (they are cleaner and more organised) with help yourself in the teeming masses to overcooked scrambled egg and burnt bacon etc. The dining furniture should have been thrown out, it was that bad. The pool is near the hotel, not in it, you find out when you arrive, so we never made use of it. Fantastic for 5 mins walk to British Museum, tube 1 min, Oxford St & Soho 5mins. And that is its one redeming feature. If someone bought this place and upgraded it, they would have a real jewel in the crown, but either the current owners cannot, or do not have the dough to spend on it. If you want comfort, go elsewhere, if you want no frills fare just to crash out in and use as a base, then it suffices. Even a Travelodge is 5* in comparison with this. Would I use again - only if I had no other options.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: patwestham
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel via a website and it was a secret saver hotel. One night was booked with 15+ days parking for a little over £100, no complaints there. I checked the hotel once we were aware of its identity and found other reviews to be accurate; clean, convenient to Heathrow, quiet but probably not somewhere you would want to book in for more than a few nights. The restaurant in the hotel was good standard and not too expensive but for me the best bit, having been stranded for eight days due to the volcanic ash fiasco was that I did not return home to yet another bill. Our car was at the hotel for an extra 8 days for no extra charge and little things like that can make a big difference when every other company you have dealt with have used the situation as an opportunity to make a quick buck so Thank You St Giles Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: Dizzyelmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3nights for the London Marathon 2010 with a group of fellow running friends & their supporters. The location was perfect - great transport links for the marathon start and finish, and for the 'touristy' stuff after - close to the theatre, shops, lovely cafes, restaurants & other attractions. However think it may rely to much on its location and lets other items slip... Check in/out staff rushed and rude - manners cost nothing! Rooms were very small and I'm pretty sure it wasn't a standard double bed. However, it was clean and the cleaners friendly & polite. Room had very little daylight & poorly lit (good luck doing your hair & make up). Terrible reception on the 5-channel TV (but hey, we weren't staying there to watch the TV). Italian restaurant is meant to be good.. but sadly closed at weekends! (Serious money-making opportunity missed there - a hotel full of runners craving pasta??) I'm no Londoner, but the price didnt seem that great value for what we got. Price for using room phone is ridiculous! £2 to transfer an incoming call?? But my biggest complaint had to be breakfast. Our rate didn't include breakfast, which was fine. I'd phoned ahead and asked if on marathon morning I could possibly use a microwave to heat some milk & porridge - no problem, i was told. But on marathon morning I was disgusted to be charged £9.95 for heating up MY OWN porridge! The catering manager was rude and obnoxious and instead of diplomatically settling the situation, preferred to argue it out infront of a packed breakfast room. Absolutely no customer service skill what so ever - and that goes for the majority of the staff in the hotel. If you do decide to go to this hotel - make sure you don't get breakfast included with your rate - there are so many lovely cafes close by you will get a much better deal and quality food! [Porridge situation excluded] the food choice is poor and not particularly fresh - and you certainly won't get service with a smile! yuk See my other reviews - I'm not a persistant complainer! But this hotel really took the biscuit (or porridge perhaps?? haha)

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Time Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeeSee99
Reviews.Content: Please be advised you don't get your money's worth at this Hotel. Rooms are cramped, noisy, poorly cleaned, no hot water, breakfast is poor, no air con, staff are unfriendly. Only thing going for it is the location. I complained about the lack of hot water and cleanliness of the room, and the staff didn't care a hoot. Spend the 50 quid extra and stay somewhere more comfortable. BIG NO NO HOTEL.Luckily I only stayed one night

Reviews.Title: “Ideal City Break Stay”
Reviews.Author: flip_flik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St.Giles when we went to London for a New Year weekend break. It's a great location, just off Tottenham Court Road near the Dominion Theatre. The room was cozy but comfy and more than adequate for our needs. The bathroom was nice and roomy and clean. We didn't have breakfast but the menu looked good, there were also a few restaurants attached to the hotel that provided a wide range of cuisines - Italian, Chinese, Australian! Because of being in the capital we didn't really use these facilities, but the staff at reception were very welcoming and the concierge staff were helpful as well as entertaining!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: karatekat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a perfect neighbourhood if you want to do some shopping, go to the theatres or just visit the city. Breakfast is good, but the only problem is that there are so many rooms for a smaller place to eat. If you want to make sure to have a bit of room for sitting you should be at the breakfast room before 8.30 AM. The rooms are small but ok, the bed is good. There isn't much place to put your things away. I've been there a few times and it was always good, i didn't have any complaints. The people were friendly and helpful. Everything was fine. It's a nice hotel if you want to be close to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of sleep, due to noise from main roads”
Reviews.Author: TiaStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel as we were visiting the West End for a show. The front of the hotel is very dated, but once inside we were pleasantly surprised by the reception area. It looked quite grand and staff seemed very polite. All in all we were delighted with the initial appearance. This changed when we got the keys to our room. We stayed in room 509. The room was very small, smelt damp and was extremely hot. I am always very cold and find it hard to get warm, but the heat in the room was incredible... it was like sitting in a sauna. It was so bad we had to sit in our underwear to cool down, the sweat was running down our faces. There was a small window in the room, that opened slightly but didn't make much difference. Also ALL the hotel rooms face a very busy main road. The noise was awful, there were police sirens going off all night, loud music and taxis passing our window. At night with the heat, we tried to have our window open to cool down, but the noise through the triple glazing was bad enough, yet alone having the window open. It was liking sleeping next to M6 motorway. We both tried to sleep with cotton wool in our ears but it was impossible. The best thing about this hotel was the 'coffee to go breakfast', the coffee and baked goods were lovely. We have stayed in London numerous times at various locations and this has got to be the worst hotel by far.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: cabwoman
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of its convenient location. Pleasant and helpful staff but room bore absolutely no relation to pictures or description. Just enough room for double bed, only 1 bedside table/light (no central light) and a tv. The additional seating area, for which we paid a premium, was in another small room, with no view of tv. Hanging space not long enough to hang a skirt, let alone anything full length. No mirror over the dressing table so hairdryer not well placed. Safe and fridge useful additions. Almost impossible to sleep due to noise from street and airconditioning unit. Can't comment on food as didn't try any. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and cramped...”
Reviews.Author: Skygirl81
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single room that was so small that it was difficult to open my suitcase. The really bad thing was, however, that it was very noisy. Noise from corridors, traffic noise and noise from a fan in the room. I am usually not bothered by noise, but here I could not sleep at all. Tried on day 2 to talk to the reception to get a decent sized room that was less noisy. The receptionist only told me that I was lucky, because my room was probably better than most. I accept that there must be some noise in a London hotel, but this was too much for me.

Reviews.Title: “Small, noisy but well located”
Reviews.Author: teresa40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for on night, did not spend much time in the room except to shower and change for a night out. Small shower, small room, small tv with a terrible signal, small bed with just a sheet and bedcover, the towels were a bit threadbare and it is very noisy because you can here everything from the other rooms and the halls where even the corridors are tiny, cost us £110.00 for a double room but it is very well located and £110 in central London is cheap, not the sort of hotel we would normally stay in if we were to stay for more than one night as you would not want to spend any time in the room. After reading some other reviews it seems that you can get an even cheaper price. OK if all you want is location and are not a light sleeper who likes to watch a bit of tv with a choice of channels!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location but give breakfast a miss !”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetCambridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my better half for two nights 2/3 Arpril , we chose the hotel as we used air miles and we knew location to be good . Double room very cupboard like with a small double bed ( why are double beds in European hotels so much bigger ?!!) Room was clean ,tea ,coffee making facilities ,usual riubbish hairdryer in bathroom ladies best take your own ! The main problem was breakfast ,with such a vast number of rooms you would expect to find a large enough area to eat ,sadly this was not the case .At 830 the place can only be described as like Piccadilly Circus in rush hour full of lots of overseas students taking up most of the space! The breakfast was average but as there was no space to eat i ended up grabbing a box of cereal and eating while standing up in lounge area not a pleasant experience ! The next morning we decided on a more relaxing start to the day and ate at Cafe Rouge next door to hotel . If you are on a tight budget and can cope with hot bedrooms ,small beds and not doing breakfast then location is all !!!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is well positioned for a theatre break, the rooms are good and the breakfast is plentiful.”
Reviews.Author: knocker28
Reviews.Content: We booked through Show and Stay and would recommend that agency. We wanted a hotel that was near to the theatre so that was why we chose the St Giles on Bedford Avenue. We had two twin rooms and whilst not massive the rooms were clean, well furnished and the bathrooms of both were a good size. The only complaint on the rooms was the television, as the picture had constant interference and it was the same in both rooms. We had the European breakfast and this was a buffet style with cereals, fruit, coffee, tea, juice, yoghurts, bacon, egg etc. All you could expect and in plentiful supply. It was very busy in the breakfast room and you had to be nimble to avoid fellow guests on their way back to their table from the buffet bar. Perhaps not a good place for young children to be. During our visit with teenage sons the residency tended to be older guests or groups of overseas teenagers. The staff were helpful, check in very good and the concierge service professional in looking after our bags after we had checked out on the final day. All in all we would recommend the hotel. The theatres are in easy reach and you can walk to trafalgar Square in fiteen minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and for the price can't be faulted...”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: I was staying in central London for one night on busines and the priority was finding somewhere central, cheap and cheerful. That's exactly what the St Giles is. The room was tiny, but that was fine. The hotel was reasonably clean although a bit shabby and outdated. For the price I paid (about 80 EURO) it was excellent value with a great breakfast and even a free newspaper thrown in.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, double rooms good, single rooms like cupboards!”
Reviews.Author: nbrose
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central, The double rooms were good and clean. The single room I stayed in can only be described as a 'box room' or a 'cupboard'! It reminded me of the halls of residence I stayed in as student! The bathroom is tiny. Dont go in the shower if you are claustrophobic as it is very small and dark, and take care when stepping out of it as your are stepping onto the toilet! Breakfast was good - no toast though, only croissants or hard rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Good in many ways, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: enchanted79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in London. The twin room I stayed in was clean and tidy, but rather small. I liked the city view from the 10th floor, but it might not be everyone's idea of a good view. Reception staff were friendly and helpful, and I was able to book a "boxed up" breakfast for collection at reception early in the morning, since I was checking out before the breakfast hall opened. Bad points were erratic lifts (that sometimes cancelled your floor selection on the way, and returned all the way to the bottom), luke warm shower, and the small rooms. Personally, I'd rather stay in a similarly priced hotel slightly further out, with better rooms, and use the tube to get to central London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel close to most theaters waking distance of centre.”
Reviews.Author: springchick2010
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, resonable room - good breakfast - ideal base for theatre break or sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marsam1969
Reviews.Content: Have read other reviews deriding this hotel and found them to be incorrect. Rooms are on the small side but you are in london to go out and see sights not spend all day in your room!. Hotel spotlessy clean ,food more than adequate all hot and fresh. staff very friendly and helpful. hotel is excellently positioned for theatres and sight seeing,only a short walk from tube station and oxford road shops. will definately stay again when we go to london to see another west end show.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: summersunny
Reviews.Content: Was taken here by my daughtrer for my christmas and birthday present. What a great hotel, room was good and clean and neat ,breakfast was very good a lot to chose from, We got a day ticket for the tube which was £11.20 for the two of us which we used all day the tubes we frequant . We would love to come back to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Awful rooms, so bad we decided not to stay”
Reviews.Author: baldyl0cks
Reviews.Content: Well what a disappointment this hotel is, the nice foyer and entrance are very deceiving, the rooms certainly do not look like the ones on their website. My mother daughter and I were allocated a triple room on the 7th floor, we opened the door and couldnt believe it, the tiniest room divided by a partition with prison like windows. It was dark, where the double bed was there was zero storage, my bed was a pull down out of a wardrobe which left us with half a wardrobe for clothes, not enough for 3 nights stay. You could not walk around any of the beds it was so small. There was no way that we could stay there so we cancelled our booking and found a room at the Travelodge on High Holborn Road around the corner which was 10 times better. Location might be good but the room we were given was the worst I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: loulougil
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel at 10.30am. No queues at reception and our room was ready straight away. Room was on no 265 2nd floor and was standard twin room. Room was quite small but there was a separate area with table & 2 chairs and work table. Bathroom and shower were good size, no problems with mould or smells like other people have said. Breakfast was lovely just try to get down before 8am or leave it until 9am or after - gets very busy and hard to find a table in between times. Conceirge were helpful in getting us taxi to train station and providing us with any info we needed. Lifts were slow but we used stairs so best to try and get a room on the lower floors. No problems with outside noise at night and beds were comfy. Brilliant location, only 1 min from tube and at end of Oxford Street which was good after a days shopping! Walking distance to almost everywhere, we didn't have to use the tube. Would definately stay here again and reccommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hideous!!”
Reviews.Author: LandDEssex
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness!! i can't believe i spent almost £100 on this hotel!! We stayed one night in a standard room whilst out for the night in London. The entrance was fine and check in was ok. We were on the 12th floor. You take a lift to the 11th and then another to the 12th.....that lift is the smallest thing i have seen....me and my hubbie just about fitted, and when we took our friends up to see our terrible room, we couldn't all fit in (we are not big people). The 12th floor stank of smoke!!! Our room was the smallest room i have ever been in, just room for the bed, which only had a sheet, a tiny window, a cupboard with a safe but no room for clothes and a small shelf for the kettle....the room was damp and had horrible artex walls. The shower room was even worse with horrible tiled walls and the tiniest shower ever!! well...our room made our friends feel a little bit better about theres.....they were on the 7th floor....room was tiny and damp, but it did have an extra small room with space to hang clothes and dressing table. still a tiny shower but they had nicer tiles!! I would have complained if it wasn't for the fact that we were literally staying to sleep and it actually gave us a good laugh at how hideous the place was....my husband dropped the shower gel in the shower and didn't actually have any room to bend down and get it and smashed his head on the tiles!!! I would not of stayed here if i had have to of spent more than one night or any amount of time in the room when i wasn't sleeping. Location is good though and i guess thats why it is expensive. So glad we chose not to have breakfast at thie hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: audbabe14
Reviews.Content: The Location is OK, near to the underground. Staff were fine room was small & cold , had no sleep from the noise of the traffic & air conditioning was humming from outside all night. Lifts were a long time to come waited 10 mins for it to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: IrelandSammy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so central.Oxford street is on the next street.Tube 1 min away.Stayed here last weekend with my daughter.Staff couldn't have been more helpful.Rooms were spotless,lovely & comfie.Rooms are not huge but this is to be expected in London hotels.Breakfast was buffet syle and was brilliant.Could not ask for any better all round.Higly Recommend this hotel. Tip:if going to a show the Dominion Theatre is literally around the corner (We will rock you) is on there at the moment.We went to see Dirty Dancing....brill....has to be experienced!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Elena Z
Reviews.Content: I came to London for NY, or should I say sales :) Stayed in this hotel for 9 days. Yes, the room was small, but I wasn't planning to have a party in it for 20 people. Very comfy bed, tv, heater, fan, small kettle, chair, enough room for couple of suitcases, it's own safe, a great view (I stayed on 11th floor). What else would you need? This is London, so don't expect big rooms in hotels, this one is not an exception. So I don't consider the size of the room as a negative. The hotel itself is nice and clean. 0.5 minute from Oxford street and the tube. Exactly what I needed. A grocery store right in front of hotel. I got a very nice room with recent renovation. I was right near the elevator and at times it was too noisy (but I don't mind the noise). But you should ask for a room away from the elevator, cause it gets quite noisy when the elevator moves up and down. Also, 2 sides of the hotel are facing pretty busy streets with a noisy intersection. But it'll bother you only if you open windows. I didn't hear the street noise with windows closed. The receptionists and consierge where welcoming and helpful. I asked for a possibility of a late check out (at 2 PM) and they even offered me to stay until 3PM if I needed (i was leaving for the airport at 4pm). You can also leave your bags with the consierge if you are checking out in the morning but leaving later in the day. It'll cost you 1 pound per suitcase. I don't know how's the food in this hotel as I booked the room without breakfast and didn't use their restaurant. But there are lots of small cafes and restaurants nearby. My personal favourite was (and still is) a small chinese place at the begining of Oxford street. Bottom line is I received everything I expected - good service, great location, clean comfy room - for the money I wanted to spend vs. location. I travelled alone and didn't have any problems. I'm definelty coming back to London for winter sales and will be staying in St Giles again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory hotel, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: glosgirlScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as it is very close to the British Museum. This and its poximity to Oxford St were its best features. The hotel room was adequate, but the shower room was horrible. The grout between the tiles was mouldy and anyone of above average build would not have been able to use it as it was minute. Reception was a nightmare. We queued for 20 minutes to check in, and then for two further 20 minute periods during our stay when we had queries about our room. (No use ringing reception as no-one answered). Surely they could have arranged things more efficiently. I also resented having to pay extra for the swimming pool, (which was advertised as part of the hotel on its website), for leaving my luggage with the conciege, and for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Fabulous Price”
Reviews.Author: ChineseRN
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Location is best- 1 block away from oxford st & 1 block away from tube. Saved some $$ for taking tube. Takes ~20min leisurely walk to Piccadilly. Good selection for free breakfast...just go early to avoid line up. Concierge is helpful, as they helped us find a cheap car service to airport (as tube not in service early in am)

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in the heart of london”
Reviews.Author: scaleytrout
Reviews.Content: Good checkin, room small but had everything we needed and was clean. We asked for an extra pillow and it was delivered to the room straight away. Breakfast was good and always hot,but no toast or fried eggs. Staff very friendly and always helpfull. The only negative was the lifts, they were often busy, and full by the time they got to us, we were on the 6th floor, still we were on holiday, so had the time to wait. The position of the hotel is fantastic, walking distance to most places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem !!”
Reviews.Author: travellingpaddyo8
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel , within walking distance of so much and tube station only across the road . Rooms are a little on the small side but how long do you plan to stay in them ? . We were on the 9th floor and yes you can hear the usual city noises but doesnt stop you sleeping . The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful !! The hotel was full over the weekend so they must be doing something right !! Wouldn't hesitate in recommending this Hotel to anyone or returning to stay .........its a gem !

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FandOCarlow
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. It's located reight beside everything you's want in London - West End, Oxford St., museums, sights, theatres, pubs etc. Easy access to the rest of the city either by tube or walking. The hotel itself is functional. You get a decent breakfast. Service is good. The rooms are very small but clean. We;ve stayed there twice so we;re happy with it. The street noise can be a problem but it would be the same in any other city hotel. The aircon might be a bit inadequate though.

Reviews.Title: “Very But Very small room and the staff very unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: chiotisAthens
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay more but the room was very small so small that the door touched the bed and we could not move..when we asked for changing room the staff at the reception were most unhelpful and said no other room was available, we stayed despite the argument we had one night and left the next morning

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel which I would use again without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: itsalltrueforyou
Reviews.Content: Having read some Trip Adviser reviews I was a bit dubious about staying at this hotel expecting it may be noisy, the room inadequate, and unfriendly staff. My friend & I had none of these! The room was very clean, small but had all the facilities expected & required, and very quiet. The service at reception was efficient and friendly. Whilst the breakfast room was very busy, it is only what to expect with a large, fully occupied hotel! The choice of food was perfectly acceptable and there was always somewhere to sit. Overall a thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: traveller915
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel around 3pm and rooms were not ready had to wait an hour for some rooms to become available. Once I opened the door to the room it was the size of my living room. Now I have a decent sized living but I dont want the whole room to be the size of it. The lighting was dark in the rooms with all of them on, tv was a small 13 inch, no irons in the room you have to go to a floor to iron in a room. Bfast is available but its the same thing everyday. On the up side it is in the middle of everything, you can walk to all the restaurants, clubs, stores, movie theaters, and broadway shows. The hotel has a lounge in the lobby and they can charge drinks and food to your room but it is not part of the hotel, the system they used to charge stuff to your room was constantly not working. The tube is a block away and can get you where you need to go quickly, if you want to get to Picadilly Circus it can be walked in about 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “if you want 5 star then pay 5 star”
Reviews.Author: andyevans44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not 5 star but it is ,for a central london hotel an ideal place to stay. We stayed in a double room,yes they are quite small and the bathroom was also quite small but it was clean and warm.The breakfast was not Gordon Ramsey but the quality was fine, more than enough to set youself up for the day.The hotel seemed to be very busy all the time but at night it was very quiet. Location is superb 10mins walk to Leic square and covent garden Oxford Street on the door step,1mile from Euston and most thearters on walking distance. To sum up we stayed for 3 nights and yes if we stayed for more than a week then this room would have been rather small,but if you stay for a short time then this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Triviality
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights over New Year and were pleasantly surprised. Reading the reviews online made us expecting far more less. Location is excellent and central. A couple of minutes walk to Tottenham Court Road tube station, British Museum around the corner and Oxford Street just 100 meters away. Check-in was fast and friendly. The room was on the smaller side but clean. In the winter I suppose you can find it a bit cold, but that didn't bother us. A hint of mould could be found by the window facing the street, but nothing disturbing. Street sounds were minimal. The room was attended daily. Breakfast was a positive surprise to me. I had read about how minimalistic it was, but to us it seemed ok. You could eat as much as you liked and we left satisfied every morning. Good value for the money if you're not expecting luxury. I'd recommend it for anyone going to London and want a central location and a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but great location”
Reviews.Author: incrociate
Reviews.Content: I have been to London many times and have yet to find a good, centrally located hotel. Having said that, St. Giles Hotel is definitely one of the better places I stayed at. The hotel in itself is nothing special. It's massive and the breakfast area reminds you of a high school cafetaria. The rooms are a bit outdated and small (it's London, what do you expect?), but clean. The concierge was pretty helpful. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It's right on Oxford Street, so if you're up for some shopping, I can definitely recommend St. Giles Hotel. Halfway through our shopping spree we stopped to drop off our shopping bags, without losing too much time. The hotel is also within walking distance of Leicester Square, with loads of restaurants, bars, theaters, coffee shops and other shops around. The nearest underground station is just around the corner. If you're not looking to spend too much time in the hotel and would rather go out, St. Giles is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel with parking, easy access to London”
Reviews.Author: ally12345
Reviews.Content: Nice clean modern hotel, reception was nice, rooms are fine, much like a holiday inn, breakfast was good. Parking is £6 for 24hrs but the hotel is 2 minutes walk from Feltham station so onwards travel into London is easy. We paid £38 inc. breakfast which was a bit of a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Allrounder”
Reviews.Author: newboots
Reviews.Content: Pleasant and polite staff. Small but very adequate room and shower ensuit but Quite, warm and clean, with comfortable beds. Think that the TV was only pay for films? Great breakfast, full english, cereals & continental, now called european breakfast, and plenty of it! Busy but plenty of staff clearing tables, did not have to wait for a table, even at a popular time. Fantastic location for oxford street, st pancras, tubes and theatres, walking all the way! Would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: grazb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the night when out in London. Great location just of Tottenham Court Road, the place is clean with nice staff and is really good value. Rooms are small but clean and with basic facilities but the bed is comfortable and as long as your not staying for too many nights then it's all fine.
