The hotel room was a twin and wasn't small or smelly it was very clean, the window was a bit small so during the summer months i can imagine the room be very stuffy! The only problem we had was a bit of noise on the Monday morning from some construction work but other than that i enjoyed my stay and will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it was”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlustiger
Reviews.Content: I booked the St Giles because it was convenient for where I was going and I'd stayed there before several years ago. On arrival, it took ages to check in because there were only three staff on the desk and a crowd of about 25 wanting to check in. They didn't seem to have the people or systems to process guests quickly. I'd provided all my details (name, address and credit card) on the website when booking, but I still had to complete a manual form. They still take prints of your card and don't have chip & pin equipment for cards. Checking out was also slow. They claim to be the biggest tourist hotel in London, and they have four very slow lifts. When I was there, it seemed like only one or two were working, which is poor for a high-rise hotel. I stood in the lift lobby on floor 5 and, having seen one lift go up from 5, had to wait for the same lift to come down again. I'd use the stairs, but not with my luggage. The single room was tiny, which is fine, but warm and stuffy. You can open the window (there's no air con), but the traffic and street noise is loud, until after midnight. Fortunately, they had provided a desk fan, which I left running all night. This hotel was fine when they were charging GBP79 per night, but it is now overpriced for what it offers in terms of comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “worst rooms ever !!”
Reviews.Author: freewilly
Reviews.Content: worst rooms have ever stayed in,small is an understatement,dirty,cold shower and noisy!

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Cosmopolite
Reviews.Content: My my my - isn't London a big place? Yes, of course it is. So you will be pleased to hear that you can stay right in the very center (well almost) of it at a reasonable price. Provided you choose the St Giles. The hotel is located on Bedford Avenue (between Holborn and Camden Town), the intersection of Tottenham Court Road and Oxford Street is a mere 100 meters away. You have access to the Tube via Tottenham Court Road Station (Central and Northern Lines). Oxford Street, Soho, the British Museum, Leicester Square, and even Piccadilly Circus are within a comfortable walking range. There is a variety of restaurants and snack bars in the vicinity, athough for a REALLY good meal I recommend the Marsala Zone, which is a bit further down Oxford St (on Marshall St, off Oxford Circus) and serves an amazing range of Indian specialties at a competitive price. Staff at the St Giles are generally helpful and the concierge service is above par. Breakfast is served buffet-style in a large breakfast room not unlike a company cafeteria or college dining hall. A good choice of hot and cold breakfast options, cereals, hot and cold drinks. So why have I not given the St Giles an "above average" rating? Simply, in one word: the ROOMS. Now, if you've read any of my other reviews, you will know that I'm not the kind of person who pays for budget accomodation and expects the Ritz. I also basically need my room for sleeping or napping, but not for much more. However, I do take offense when I check into a room and find the previous occupant's humongous TURD swimming in the toilet bowl. Ok, water pressure can be a bit low in London but this just tells me that room service did not bother to have a look (and probably didn't do a very good cleaning job in the first place). However, during the rest of the stay room service was ok. Maintenance staff also went out of their way to fix the door of our in-room safe and were very quick about it, too. Sheets were clean but there was a slightly musty smell in the corners of the room. Which leads me to something else: The room felt stifling hot (and this in April). I can't bear imagining what it must be like in August as there is no a/c and the windows do not open all the way. Wrapping it all up I do believe that the St Giles is a very good deal if you want to be in central London and are not willing to spend too much money. Just bring a fan and some air freshener and you'll be right as rain.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kemsley
Reviews.Content: Mar 31st -April 2nd We stayed in the St Giles Hotel for 2 nights mainly to see We Will Rock You at the Dominion Theatre which is a stones throw away. We found it to be very clean with good service from staff, the location is excellent for central London and we were able to see many sights easily on foot. We had arrived at the hotel with a good deal of trepidation having seen dreadful reviews on several websites claiming the hotel was dirty with bad service, these could not have been more wrong.The only things if we were being picky were noise at night especially Saturday from passing revellers which you expect in central London and breakfast a little chaotic on Sunday morning, (it was better on Monday) but quite adequate with a good selection of choices. B Rose Sittingbourne Kent

Reviews.Title: “Very central and good value for money in rip-off London”
Reviews.Author: GordonWorcester
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very good and the only real complaint was that the pool was closed for maintenance, which was very annoying as this was one reason for booking the hotel. Our room was spacious and practical and had everything you could want. Reception staff were courteous and helpful and soon arranged for a blocked sink to be repaired promptly. This is a very big and very busy hotel, so breakfast was very busy, but there was a good range of food and staff worked efficiently to keep the dining area clear and clean. Because the hotel was so central we walked everywhere but were rather stunned that on the one occasion we did use the tube( when arriving from the station) it cost us £4 each, £4 being the minimum fare. Needless to say we walked back to the station!!! I know that a travel card costs just over £5, but we didn't need one. Cannot echo any of the criticisms contained in previous reviews. This visit confirmed for us that London truly is one of the most expensive cities in the world, but the St Giles is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRu
Reviews.Content: Staff at reception were perfectly polite and efficient. Room was small, but clean and comfortable. Bathroom smelt of wee. I don't know why, but having been visiting a relative in an old people's ward for the last week I know what it smells like. When I got back from my meeting in the late afternoon to have a bath before going out for the evening there was a note under the door from the hotel management to say Thames Water were working in the area and the hotel's water had been turned off. It wasn't their fault, but it meant I couldn't have a wash before going out for the evening. As I walked out of the room I could hear the cistern beginning to fill up as the water came on again. Let's hope it was a one-off and won't happen to you... This is one of the most convenient hotels, for the price, in the whole of London: to be almost at the junction of Oxford Street, Charing Cross Road and Holborn is almost as good as it gets if you're wanting to do things in the area. I've stayed here four or five times in the last five years and it's always been okay- good value for the location. I would suggest holding your nose in the bathroom and if £104 for a double room to be in the centre of London sounds about right for you then you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “good weekend”
Reviews.Author: viewrock
Reviews.Content: Just stayed Friday 23rd to Sunday 25th March 2007. A little apprehensive after reading reviews on trip advisor. Arrived at 5.30 pm, hotel reception not too busy and check-in staff very pleasant. Room in west tower on floor 6. Clean, good sized twin, plenty of wardrobe/cupboard space. Small but adequate bathroom. Good selection of hot & cold food for breakfast but VERY busy breakfast room after 8am. Superb location for theatre land, Oxford Street etc and straight down the Northern line tube from Waterloo to Tottenham Court road then 2 minutes walk to hotel. Good value for money in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Rooms”
Reviews.Author: flann
Reviews.Content: We booked 6 rooms for the 17th March 07. First impressions were ok. Check in was awful, staff unfriendly and not helpful. Rooms were a joke they smelt awful and unclean. Location was the only good thing. We are coming back to london in May but will not stay here again!! Under ground car park was almost impossible to get in and out of.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling, absolutely appalling!”
Reviews.Author: BethGreen
Reviews.Content: I had booked a twin room and ended up with the smallest single room I have ever seen, apparently there was no availability even though I had the booking details in front of me. The staff were rude and unhelfpul, not to mention untrained. The check out procedure was an utter nightmare and took around 15 minutes. Another piece of advice... check you credit card / bank statements after you have paid. I was charged twice for the same stay. Apparently this was normal procedure as they take a guarantee from your card.... however a week after checking out the money has still not been refunded into my account even though my bank tells me this is something that can be done instantly. I really recommend to stay away from this hotel.... much more hassle than its worth.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: dangerousdave
Reviews.Content: we spent two nights here 15-17 march. booked a double and a single room we had a great time, both rooms were clean and smelt fresh. good showers we booked through HOTELDOORMAN.COM they were very helpfull when i rang them and they rang me back quickly with a solution, and had a good rate £98 per night with full breakfast. breakfast was reasonable, pleanty to fill up on. quite busy at times. The location is perfect for west end, and oxford st. the tube station is just there so you dont have to walk to far. we would certainy go there again in fact we wouldn't bother looking any where else. Dave

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: MsRobynG
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely disgusting. The reception is not bad and the hotel staff are very friendly, but when I went up to my room, things went wrong pretty quickly... When I got out of the lift, I was greeted by an overwhelming smell of urine and had to walk through stained halls before I got to my room. When I walked in, my room was incredibly shabby. On my bed, the sheets had not been washed, and appeared to have urine stains on them. In addition, the towels in the bathroom had not been bleached, and you could see faint stains on them. The room was so sickening, I went straight back down to reception and immediately checked out, refusing to pay. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DubCM
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with some friends for one night, the location is great, and we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. When we arrived the lobby looked well, but as we arrived at 11 am everyone was checking out and the queues were long and slow, it seemed to be very badly organised. However they did have rooms ready that we could use, although check in wasn't until 2 pm. The rooms though are tiny, we could put up with it as it was only one night, we were in twin rooms with a small overnight bag each but if you were staying longer these rooms are not suitable. In one room the bathroom was an ok size, in the other it was just absurd, you had to turn sideways squeeze past the loo to get to the shower and there was no bath. We didn’t have breakfast in the hotel so I can’t comment. We had a drink in the bar, the prices were ok for a hotel bar however the service was very slow and they couldn’t make two of the cocktails we asked for, as they didn’t have the ingredients. The hotel is very reasonably priced for a central London hotel, and is clean so if you want to spend your money on the rest of your weekend’s entertainment and simply sleep in the hotel, then you should book here.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better!”
Reviews.Author: och_i
Reviews.Content: I stayed at St Giles on 24th February 2007 with my mum for one night. Generally ok, but a few problems. 1 - The service at reception was slow and a little infuriating. We were sent back and forth between reception and the luggage storage. After waiting for about 15 minutes to be served in a very hot reception we eventually got checked in and were then able to leave our luggage. 2 - The room smelt slightly of a chemical toilet. The size and decor were standard for a hotel in the centre of london and the bathroom was average, shower was nice. 3 - When we returned to the room after dinner the room was very hot. I had to open the window all night to keep the room at a normal temperature. Unfortunately, as it was a saturday night, the party goers were out in force and seemed to camp outside our window and scream for no reason until 5am (we were on the fifth floor), I of course do not blame the hotel for hysterical drunk people, but had the room been a normal temperature i would have been able to keep the window shut. Luckily I had earplugs and managed to get to sleep about 5.30am. 4 - Breakfast was varied, lots of different types of cereal, cooked breakfast and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cheshireguy
Reviews.Content: I was able to check in at 12noon, my third floor room was overlooking Tottenham Ct road but was very quiet. Twin Room was fine for myself, very comfortable and spotlessly clean. Good reception team, excellent pool (ymca) below the hotel for £3. The buffet breakfast was superb. Location ideal for the theatre ( i went to see Equus ) a short 5min walk from the hotel. I will certainly book the St Giles again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell68
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a theatre weekend break and stayed at the st giles hotel. it was very clean. excellent service with check in porter took our cases up to our room could not ask for better location every thing was on our doorstep, oxford street theatre, and soho, china town hotel will arrange taxis for you if you need them the restaurant was very reasonnable and the bar was always full the rooms were small but pleasant. cleaned when ever you asked them to be i would defernitly stay at the st giles hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Never Again! Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: jenni1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in London and we were extremely disappointed with the St Giles a pure disaster! 1. We arrived on Friday at approx 12.00 and upon check in there was no rooms available the receptionist was on work experience and took about 10mins to find our booking she finally found it and then we had to store or luggage with concerige who I have to say were very helpful. 2. Arrived back at hotel at 5.00pm to be given our room. We waiting approx 15mins for lifts then we went into our room and I have never smelt anything like it the fusty smell, the dirty stains on the carpet we were afraid to take our shoes and socks off. and there was no room to even open our suitcases such a squash. Then as we were heading out to theatre for a show we had to get ready the shower was luke warm and then would not turn off we had to call maintenance up, then the toilet would not flush and there was 1 plug in a room for 3 people - no plugs for hairdryer, laptop, phone charger a bloody joke and the power kept on cutting out, the towels were stinking just not acceptable at all....at this we called reception and demaned another room and they arrived up in 10mins and gave us another room which to be fair was cleaner and the smell was much better than the last hovel. Went out for our night out and dreaded going back to the hotel, I have never seen the likes of this before maybe we just got a few bad rooms as they were triple rooms and in what looks like an old part of the hotel. 3. At 8.30am on Sat morning there was the hammering of nails and a drill going that really finished it for us we simply got up, got dressed and checked out and went to a hotel in Mayfair 4* and only cost £20.00 extra in comparison to St Giles. The hotel lobby was busy and this hotel must do well but it really was a horrible place I really wished I had booked into a travel lodge as it would have been half the price and clean.. basic but clean the the St Giles is very basic and a dirty hole at that. Very disappointed and we have stayed at many 3 star hotels but you would really be better in a hostel or a travel lodge this hotel is definetly one to be missed!!!!!!! To be fair the staff were very good its not their fault the place is so run down the hotel just needs bulldosed and these people given jobs in a decent hotel. Thank god we got another hotel cos if we had to stay here all weekend it really would have spoilt our whole weekend!

Reviews.Title: “First Visit West End”
Reviews.Author: springcroft
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights, because my daughter had booked tickets for a show in the West End for us as part of a Christmas present. This hotel is in a prime position in the West End. We where looking for a budget cost hotel. We found the rooms small but very comfortable with good beds, the breakfast was plentiful with good selection of food. We decided to use the hotel for our main meals at night (before going out) and we where not disappointed .This was our first visit to London, we managed two shows and a bit of sight seeing. We will return later in the year to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Polyesther
Reviews.Content: Great location - just off Oxford Street. 10mins walk to the Palladium and just 10mins on Tube from Victoria. Staff were exceptionally helpful and place was very clean. Rooms on the small side but what else do you need when you are in London!! Breakfast - wide selection - something to suit everyone. The hotel also hosts 3 restaurants - Italian yummy - Chinese slightly overpriced but good food nonetheless. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, great location”
Reviews.Author: druidscross
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in The St Giles lots of times over the years. The rooms are tiny but fine if you're not going to be in the room for long - and as long as you're not too big and bulky and neither is your luggage! The position is great - right on the corner of Oxford Street/Tottenham Court Road and one minute from Tottenham Court Road tube. The bar and 'restaurant' are pretty dire but you're five minutes walk from Covent garden - why would you eat or drink in the hotel?! One BIG benefit - the biggest gym and pool complex in London (I think) is under the hotel and you get direct access for only £3. Note though: The gym is very gay friendly - if an appreciative glance (or stare if you're attractive!) in the showers is going to upset you - steer clear - or go back to your room to shower!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: happytoshare
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room with [--] - £50.00 inc breakfast in central London - midweek......I have to say I was dreading what I would get for the money.....however I was more than pleasantly suprised! 1. Location - perfect - couldn't be faulted. Two minutes from Tottenham Court Road tube station - buses running past every few minutes - most central locations easily accessible on foot. 2. Check In - fast, courteous, friendly. 3. Room - a single - probably best described as compact, but nicely furnished with tv, phone, tea & coffee facilities - and lets be honest...I wasn't planning a party!! Bathroom was a shower only, but again - absolutely fine. 4. Breakfast - as much as you can eat buffet - tea/coffee, cereals, fruit, juices, croissants, danish, plus of course the usual fry up. I couldn't say it was cordon bleu, but it was absolutely fine. The breakfast room was hugely busy, but plenty of tables, and speedy clearing away meant that you weren't hunting for a place to sit. 5. Great leisure facilities - pool, gym etc...available for a token fee ( £3.00 I think) however not for me...I preferred a stroll to Covent Garden and a nice meal in a little bistro! Overall - highly recommended for a good, cheap, clean, safe and comfortable hotel in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: judet
Reviews.Content: Just returned from St Giles, Went for my 45th birthday treat, just hubby and myself. Room very compact, didnt want to spend to much time in there.. if you know what i mean !! Went to the London eye that was great stopped in a pub in westminster for a drink en route that was good too ! Had alovely evening meal in one of the Angus Steakhouses good too ! Then returned to St Giles - Had a drink in the very smokey bar which was full of kids with loud music playing, went up to our room, couldnt get off to sleep because of the noise coming from outside. We were on the 7th floor and it sounded like the traffic shared the room with us, Anyway if you are going I hope this is an honest review for you to read.. I sound like I didnt enjoy our break but Honestly I did!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend St Giles”
Reviews.Author: jaonyc
Reviews.Content: The St. Giles in centrally located by Tottenham Court Road underground. You can walk to the theatres in soho, the British Museum. There is a Boots pharmacy and Sainsbury supermarket across the steet. Staff were extremely helpful. Eventhough it is on a busy street, the double paned windows really work. Only problem that the room is not well lit. There are two small desk lamps with low wattage. Had to ask for an additional desk lamp to work and they accomodated me instantly. Would recommend this hotel. Large room by UK standards. Book through their site for great deals.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: santafe-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in Jan, and have done a couple of times previously. The rooms are small but its central London. The staff are friendly and helpful - sometimes you have to queue at peak times to check in or out but I have found if you avoid these times its very quick.On the one occassion I had a problem with the shower I spoke to a very helpful duty manager who moved me straight away to another room. These managers I am informed are on duty 24hours a day to assist with any problems. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “St Giles is fine”
Reviews.Author: exman
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews I was a bit apprehensive but it seemed to be well-located for the west-end and for general sightseeing. Some people are obviously hard to please because I found the hotel to be fine, staff helpful and general standard good. Yes the bedrooms are not big but ours was on the 11th floor and was clean with a very comfortable bed. We were booked on a B&B basis and while it can be a bit like a school canteen there was a good selection of fruit, cereals and cooked breakfast. The dining room was particularly busy on the Saturday morning but a little patience goes a long way. Our room was serviced each day and we had no complaints. The location on the edge of Soho, close to theatres and shopping, as well as the tube and buses was really handy. All in all a very good value hotel for the price and one which I would have no difficulty recommending to anyone. I intend to return. By the way dont miss "We will rock you" in the Dominion Theatre beside the hotel.In a word Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and good value”
Reviews.Author: Ricardodesantaalbana
Reviews.Content: This is a large, busy hotel with compact rooms and a frenetic but ample breakfast. Everything ran smoothly and we were quite happy with the 80 pounds per night including breakfast tarrif from Easy Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could not wait to get out of there!”
Reviews.Author: Joannam27
Reviews.Content: After spending what seemed like an eternity checking we were horrified when we got to our room. Ok we had heard the rooms were small but it was beyond a joke. The room had a disgustin smell to it (we were staying in a non smoking room) that we could smell from outside the door and once we got in it took a whole lot of deoderant to make it bearable. There was mould in the shower, the toilet had not been bleeched in years and the water would not drain from the sink due to a mountain of hair in the plug hole which i refused to clean. The pillows on the bed were so old they were practiclly as falt as pancaes and with only one each i can tell you i didnt sleep much. After waking very early with the most horrible back ache we decided to go for our breakfast which was very much like a school canteen with no one speaking english and the food not very apertising. Sorry to anyone who likes this hotel but this was booked as a birthday present from my boyfiend who spend the reast of the next couple of days apologising for ruining it for me. The only good thing about this hotel is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Soho experience at the St Giles”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDutchman
Reviews.Content: We (party of 4) stayed at the St Giles over New Years for 2 nights, having booked directly through the hotel's website for 89 pounds/night. Main reason to book this hotel was location - you can't beat its proximity to the theater district and rest of Soho. Check-in went smoothly with friendly and helpful front-desk staff. We were given 2 rooms on the seventh floor. Room was quite small (but I've seen much smaller in London) but hey, what do you expect in London at these prices.. More importantly the room was clean and looked new or at least recently renovated. Bathroom was very nice, marble and impeccably clean. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, partly since we understood it would be very busy (staff even posted in the elevators mentioning this!). Instead, we opted to go out to one of the many Pret A Manger and Starbucks places, closest of which are only a 5 mins walk away. Regular concierge service was available, which proved very useful for storing luggage on the day we left, arranging taxis etcetera. Main disappointment at the hotel was the (un)availability of the elevators. Morning, day and night - there is almost always a queue at the ground floor elevators. That, and the fact that the elevators are quite small was a bit annoying. My overall experience with this hotel has been positive and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great location”
Reviews.Author: LeeDixonChicago
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice. Stayed in a double room with my wife. While definitely small, private bathroom was much appreciated. You can get breakfast as well, which is good if you're hung over! I will say that if you're 6 feet tall or taller you will have to stoop kind of low for the shower head. The concierges are very helpful and can arrange for theater tickets for you. Also, the location is outstanding, right near the Tottenham Court Road tube stop and near the British Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: EeyorePontefract
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of theatre break. Despite some of the reviews i was optimistic. I neednt have worried the hotel was lovely, the room wasnt a palacial suite but who needs that when your in london, it was in an excellant location right next to tothenham court rd tube, the breakfast was fine and everything was clean. They also let you keep your bags there after you have checked out with no charge. I will definately use the hotel again and recommend it to any friends.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here!”
Reviews.Author: guernseyboy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the St Giles 3 times this year. The location is fabulous, the rooms may be compact, but you are in the west end FFS! I have stayed a couple of streets down, in the Berner's Hotel, which is more expensive, and still tiny rooms. The hotel allows you to pay £3 to use the gym below for the entire duration of your stay. The breakfast is good, as long as it is included in the price of your stay. This hotel is so busy it does take a while to check in and out, but that is the price you pay for budget accomodation in the city. I have recommended this place to loads of people, and they have returned too since their first visits. Absolutly fabulous base for any london break, right next to "we will rock you" and close to the rest of the theatre discrict, and soho, and a 2 min walk to oxford street.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: johnnymacSwindon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the Thursday 14th December for a works christmas night out in Mayfair ideal location for central london. The hotel reception was very busy for booking in and booking out, but I expected this. The room we stayed in was an average size for a twin room the bathroom was small but as you dont sleep in the bathroom who cares however on the subject of the bathroom the shower was slow and the tap to turn on and off the shower was loose or broken I think broken. If this is my only moan which it is that aint bad The Hotel in general its ideal for no more than a couple of nights stay the bar has excellant facillities it looks trendy and modern and the range of drinks are plenty to chose from the actual bar itself is small and service when busy is slow However you would of thought running up to the xmas week and call me old fashioned the idea of more bar staff would be good idea and English is a good language to kick off with but hey ho I got served eventually so if your thinking of staying here give it a go its clean and very pleasant and for central london the prices are very good

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!! Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: uni-bubbles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Giles the other night for 2 nights and I could not have asked for a better stay in such a prome location. The hotel is located on Tottenham Court Road bu walk through Virgin and you are on Oxford Street so in an excellent location for shopping. The Dominion theatre (showing 'we will rock you') is located about 3/4 doors down from the hotel and about 5-10 mins walk from such shows as the sound of music and mary poppins. I stayed at the hotel a part of a weekend of shopping and to see Dirty Dancing. The hotel is about 20 mins walk from Aldwych where the show was which was fine for what I wanted and the short walk from Oxford Street (literally across the road) was idealic. My sister and I had a twin room and the size was on par with alot of London hotels that I have stayed in and compared with the numerous hotels that I have stayed in (which is loads as I work for a travel firm) was of a good standard. The rooms were clean, warm and the beds comfortable. Check in/check out was quick and efficient with no problems. The breakfast was fine, it is a bit like canteen styley but the food tasted fine and was plenty for what I wanted with a choice of cereals, croissants, rolls, hot breakfast (eggs, sausage, bacon, beans, hash browns), fruit, cold cheese and ham, yogurt etc. We got the original sightseeing tour bus from round the corner frrom the hotel in great russell street and for £18.00 for two days worth of bus travel around london (winter offer) was fantastic. We did not use the tour for the sightseeing but for our main transport around the city as it goes to madame tussauds, london dugeons, london eye etc etc. Not only do you get 2 days worth of travel for the price of one at the moment but you also get a free river cruise up the thames which was a nice relaxing trip to end one day. The hotel uses Great Russell Street underground car park. If you drive into London an park there give your parking ticke to he concierge and he will put an extra barcode on it to get you the prking half price!!! Well worth knowing considering it is around £30 per day normally. The hotel was an all round good stay and I will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Third time around ....”
Reviews.Author: mugs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Giles for the third time, for 3 nights last week. Our double room was pretty small - I think it's a bit of a lottery as to what size your room is (last time I booked a single and was put in a twin room, which was about 3 times the size of our double). The bathroom was also tiny, but it was clean and adequate, seeing as we only really wanted somewhere to sleep and shower. Checking in and out was quick and efficient; didn't really have any other contact with the staff. Two complaints: the kettle didn't work, but we couldn't be bothered to complain about it. Second, the shower wasn't great - it was never hot, usually warm, and once was barely lukewarm, which wasn't very pleasant at all! Again, couldn't be bothered to complain. Despite this, every time I go to London the St Giles will be the first place I book. You absolutely will not get a better location for this kind of price.

Reviews.Title: “location, location , location!”
Reviews.Author: topcat72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St Giles off Tottenham Court Road in mid november. The location cannot be beaten for access to oxford street , the west end and central london, being about 60 yards from centrepoint tower at the corner of oxford st/ tottenham ct/ charing cross. The hotel looks a bit forbidding, being as it is a bit 1960's multi-storey brutalist architecture, but the lobby and bar downstairs are more welcoming. When we arrived, the hotel was booking in a conference (i gather they do a lot, by the notice boards) but we were quickly booked in to our room on the 9th floor (the hotel has 11 floors) As other reviewers have noted, the rooms are small. But then again, i've never syated in london for a reasonable price in a room that wasn't. That said, the room was clean, in excellent condition, we had a view out over the city to the southwest, the bed was comfortable and the shower/ bathroom excellent (another common complaint in some london hotels) The bar downstairs (along with the restaurant) was modern, staff were friendly. When we were leaving, the concierge (who was portuguese) very kindly carried our bags up the street, got us a taxi (at rush hour). The room was cleaned well every afternoon while we were out. TV in room could use more channels, it only has the basics. However, overall, i would reccommend this hotel, ands will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No visible improvements”
Reviews.Author: JohnMaynard
Reviews.Content: I stayed here again in November, but only because the hotel had already been booked through an agency. My complaints this time are that there was no hot water in the shower or wash basin and that one of the two intrenet outlets wasn't working. Breakfast was worse than before - still like a canteen, but with half the self-service coffee machines not working. Reception staff are smashing, but I want a decent room, a hot shower and a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Never. Ever. Again”
Reviews.Author: NowYouSeeMe
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin. Oh yes. How about...with the smell. The good news is that the smell of mold overpowered the smell of the dust. Stay here only if you are allergy-free. Or if you are anosmic. Speaking of mold -- back in college we wore flip flops to the shower. I should have brought mine for this stay. The size of the room: There was once an old lady who lives in a shoe: I now know how she felt. The temperature of the room, as well as the water in the shower, was luke-warm at best. The room heater is located under the tiny dressing table, allowing a miniscule amount of the heat to escape to the tiny closet that is the atrociously overpriced quarters you have purchased. Funny, you would think the heater would be able to cater to the entire 4m x 5m area. That is, unfortunately, not the case. Which doesn't matter so much, given that the equally as tiny window overlooking...the west wing of the hotel..opens a fraction of an inch. There is no room service available. There is laundry service. There are 6.5 channels on television. (The .5 is the channel with the lousy reception). The decor is a delightful blend of both puke-brown and elephant-grey, with little touches of black-shaving-like texttures peeking out from the tears in the wallpaper towards the bottom. Oh yes: You will be lucky not to wake up with spring marks on your back. Bottom line: Great location, but that's all you're paying for. You will do best to choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. You couldn't swing a cat in the room.”
Reviews.Author: Rainbowkitty
Reviews.Content: We had such high hopes for our stay in London for my 30th birthday but it all came to a bit of a stop when we booked into the St. Giles Hotel. You can't fault the location being 1 mins walk from Tottenham Court Road tube station; but that for me was the only good thing about the experience. Do not stay here if you want to spend much time relaxing. The reception hall looked promising but once in the lift listioning to the lift music warblng I started to get worried. On getting to the room we were shocked as it was so small that the queen size double took up the entire room. There was no where to standup, let alone sit down. I have to say that it has to been the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. I stood next to the bed and tried to put my coat on and banged my elbow on the wall. We were not able to open the window properly and the waft of urine was unpleasant when walking through the door. The breakfast room was like a Motorway Service Station and the food was cold. Needless to say we spent as little time at the hotel as possible during our two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “The St Giles was fine!”
Reviews.Author: carly123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the St Giles hotel as a short break in Aug 05 and thought it was fine, the staff were very friendly, the rooms were small but who actually stays in their room all day in London to worry about the size?? I just used the room as a base. The breakfast was yummy and it was a self serve buffet with hot and cold food to chose from and was eat as much as you like. I went to London for a shopping break and to see some sights, and the St Giles is great for this, its ssoo close to Oxford Street which is amazing for shopping, its also very close to all public transport such as train, tube and bus stations The rooms wern't hot and stuffy at all and the batroom was fine- nice and clean. I'm a travel agent and can be fussy about where i stay and I found the St Giles to be just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: KOHG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Giles hotel for one night with work in September. I looked on Trip Advisor as soon as I found out which hotel I had been booked into and I have to say I was a little apprehensive as a result! However, I didn't encounter any of the problems that other people have complained about. The staff were friendly and efficient. The room was small, but was adequate. From the look of the floor plan in the corridor, my room was the second smallest in the hotel but it was still big enough to fit two single beds with space in-between. The bathroom was very small, but again was sufficient. There was a shower rather than a bath, but the water pressure was good and the shower didn't flood the bathroom as another reviewer found. The room was very clean and rather than smelling bad it actually smelt quite strongly of air freshener, right through to the next morning. The bed had sheets and a duvet on so I was able to sleep with just a sheet as it was a hot night. The restaurant didn't look great and I decided not to eat there but the location of the hotel means that there were numerous other options for evening meals all within a short walk. All in all the hotel was better than I expected based on the reviews here and at the end of the day you get what you pay for - the hotel is good value for money and in a great location. It isn't luxurious by any stretch of the imagination but I won't complain if I'm booked in there again next time I'm working in London.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jessicabev
Reviews.Content: We booked the St. Giles as part of a theatre break despite the reviews on Trip advisor. My view is if your in London sightseeing how much time do you want to spend in your hotel anyway. The hotel had everything you would need. Clean bed, clean shower, lovely breakfast, good food in the restaurant and very nice helpful staff. Yes the rooms are quite small but had everything we needed, bed, bedside tables, t.v. safe, tea/coffee, hairdryer. You couldn't get a better location. We walked to Oxford St. Covent Garden, Soho, British Museum, Trafalgar Square and the Thames. I have recommended the St. Giles to friends who are visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “For the price and location the hotel is very good value.”
Reviews.Author: dkl19469
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a standard double room for two nights. The room rate was £73 per night, booked with hotelsrus.com. The hotel itself is very busy, and the location is fantastic, the standard room is very small and does not have air con so it can get a bit warm, but as we had planned a busy few days with shows etc. we only required a room for washing and sleeping in and the room easily catered for our needs. Although the room was fairly clean, the same parts did get missed, so there was lots of dust on the top of the units, and rubbish between the bedside table and bed. Reception and shared areas smelt of sewage, the gym/pool was out of use due to a technical fault. The breakfast (from 6.30am - 10.30am) was plentiful with a good choice available and you could eat as much as you like as it was all self service, but the restaurant is far to small for the size of the hotel and finding a seat was difficult. Would I stay here again? Yes. Would I recommend it for a short break? Yes all in all for the price and location the hotel is very good value.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, great location, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: tordis
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for 9 nights from August 23. to September 1. We had a great vacation in London. Our room was facing the street in the 6.th floor of the hotel. It was a twin room and knowing the size of rooms in London it was a normal / average room - not tiny and not large. It was clean! I normally would not have booked this hotel because of all the bad reveiws and ratings here but since I had to book the hotel through a tourist company in my home town I had no choise. I was expecting a horrible hotel but was pleasently surprised! Yes there is a lot of noise coming from the street. What do you expect in the middle of London. If you close the window like we did it it will not bother you. Ofcourse in very hot weather things wiil be different..... And Yes there really are a strange smell of urin in the room......My brother and I was joking about it before we went that we most likely would have to breathe through our mouth. Since we had been warned about it it acually did not bother us that much all though it was rather strange. We kept the windows open while we where out during the day and that kept the smell down. the breakfast was swell - I really cannot complain. scrambled eggs, lots of bacon, beans and what have you. cereals to your hearts content and coffe / cappuchino machine and fruits for dessert. The seating area can resemble a cantine but remember that the hotel is huge with 600-700 rooms The staff at the front desk was very helpful and booked us a guided tour to Stonehenge. I have no complains at all conserning the service. My brother and I wanted to see lots of shows when in London. We love theatre and was able to get great tickets at the tickets office at leicester square (look out for scams that want to sell you really bad tickets - there are so many of them and i have been set up at prior visits to London - make sure you find the roundshape ticket office next to the park. That is the real ticket office) We got great tickets for both Stomp and Fool for love ( 25 pounds for stall tickets) with Juliette Lewis.(my brother really likes her) and strangely enough we passed by her in the hotel lobby one night......kind of cool All in all a good tourist hotel. It is close to everything from The british museum to shopping in oxford street. The tube station tottenham court road is a few minutes away wich takes you directly to Liverpool street station where trains to Stansted airport depart freqently.

Reviews.Title: “Executive room stay”
Reviews.Author: neilh2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive double room for two nights. The room rate was £129 per night, booked directly on the hotel website. GOOD POINTS: The hotel itself is quiet, the location is very busy though, so I wouldn't of slept well with the window open, hence I went for an executive room with air conditioning, which is very effective. The ensuite shower room was excellent, a good shower and clean. The room had a double bed which was a bit soft but slept okay. The pillows have a polyester filling, so ideal if you suffer a feather allegy like me! The room has a good LCD tv, but only five channels. The room is double glazed, window the whole width of the room, covered with fixed horizontal slats. DISLIKED: There is not a lot of storage space, wouldn't fancy staying there any longer than two days. The rooms aren't particularly spacious. Although the room was fairly clean, the same parts get missed, so there was lots of dust on the slats covering the windows, and rubbish between the bedside table and bed. Reception and shared areas smelt of sewage, even on the 7th floor. The gym/pool could not be used due to a technical fault, although this is provided by a third party independent of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aliree
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel as part of a theatre break. Having read the negative reviews, I was really worried about staying here but was pleasantly surprised. We forgot to take the address with us and couldn't remember where it was. Having got to the general vicinity, we phoned the Concierge (via directory enquiries) who gave us fantastic directions to the hotel. The check in staff were helpful and the room was on the 8th floor. As we had requested a quiet room, high up, we were very pleased. The room was clean and well equipped but compact. How much time are you honestly going to spend in your room though when you are in central London? As the hotel is literally 30 seconds walk off the Tottenham Court Road, the location is excellent. The room was also well sound proofed. From the corridor we could hear the next door room's television but from inside our room, we couldn't hear a thing. We didn't surface until 9.45am and certainly weren't disturbed by any cleaners, even though we didn't hang the do not disturb sign up. The breakfast (from 6.30am - 10.30am) was plentiful with a good choice available and you could eat as much as you like as it was all self service. The guest lounge also has a free coffee machine. There are vending machines on all floors and my top tip is buy your bottled water here. At 50p for a chilled bottle of mineral water, you won't find cheaper in central London (well maybe in Sainsburys Direct 30 seconds down the road). There is also an ice machine by the lifts in the lobby which is useful. Would I stay here again? Yes. Would I recommend it for a short break? Yes. Having stayed in countless hotels all over the world, this really wasn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “ok for a short visit!!”
Reviews.Author: f100zardoz
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is sold as a three star hotel. Don't expect anything more than a 2 star+. On the plus side the hotel is in a great loction, two mins from oxford street and the tube. You can get the tube directly from heathrow almost to the hotel. I found the hotel staff fine. The overall impression of the hotel is that it is a little run down and in need of refurbishment. When we entered our very small room the smell of aerosol air freshener nearly knocked us out, never a good thing...what smell are they trying to hide? , we actually had to open the window and go for a walk!!!. The bathroom/shower was a little dingy and far from inviting. We thought the breakfasts were good with pleanty to go around. I would recomend this hotel as a place to sleep on a short trip, but not for anything more than two nights. Cheap, good location, ok breakfast. Could be cleaner, small rooms, needs a revamp.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, never again”
Reviews.Author: Hitman1
Reviews.Content: This has honestly got to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Right from the moment we stepped through the front door, it was awful. The first person we spoke to was at reception and they could hardly speak english. We had to repeat ourselves 2 or 3 times. When we got into the room we couldn't believe how small it was. You literally have to walk like a crab to get around in the room! the cleaners are very rude as well. every morning she would batter the door at about 8 o'clock then when we replied with the obligatory 'we're sleeping' we got a tirade of abuse!! The whole hotel has a funny smell about it that is quite something. To top things off, when i returned home and checked my bank account i discovered that the hotel had charged me twice for my stay!!! The only good thing the hotel has going for it is it's location but that is it.

Reviews.Title: “Actually, surprisingly not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: Somerset_traveller
Reviews.Content: OK, first i booked the hotel for a 3 night break to surprise my boyfriend on his birthday, and THEN i read these reviews!!! BIG MISTAKE! So, i thought, it cant be that bad can it??? After our 3 hour train journey up there, i was dreading the shoebox rooms etc etc. But we finally arrived at the hotel, and we were greeted with the lovelyest conceirge staff who whisked our bags from the taxi up to check-in. Good start! Then got to our room and i was prepared, so i was actually pleasantly surprised that our room had amny luxurys of a 4*, the small things, such as a tv/radio, kettle (+ free sachets!!) Shampoo/ showergel etc! Shoe shine wipes, shower cap, hairdryer. The only complaints i really had were the shower- it flooded the floor, which was just annoying. The heat- but come on, lets face it is the middle of July, and i was delivered a fan. And the lifts- 4 for 11 floors. But when you book this hotel, we are all fully aware that this is somewhat a budget hotel, so what are you expecting??! The Hotel and bar were lovely and my Cannelloni was the nicest meal i have had in a long while. Maybe we were just lucky and had one of the best rooms, who knows?

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: dkt.r
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night in June. All the other hotels my company uses in London were fully booked, due to Wimbledon, but this one wasnt...surprise, surprise....now I know why! At check-in, the queue was 20 deep, the wait was 15 minutes. Lift out of action twice because of fire alarms, so wait again. One ice machine with plastic cups by the lifts was for the whole hotel, I understand because I was refused ice at the bar. The room was so very small, with an overpowering smell of urine. I had work to do, but the workspace was a small shelf, and the lighting was poor. Back to reception. I explained my company had booked a superior room, but the receptionist said that was a superior room ! I hate to imagine what their standard rooms are like. Got a room change. This one was SLIGHTLY bigger. It was a hot day, and as the hotel does not have air conditioning, I opened the window. This room faced directly onto Tottenham Court Rd., and the noise was deafening. Police sirens etc. I couldnt concentrate on my work because of the noise, and knew I wouldnt be able to sleep, so went back again to reception. Room change was worse than the first one! This one also stank of urine, and I had to work on this "shelf". Lighting again poor, bed rock hard, towels threadbare, carpets dirty and smelly, but at least it was quiet. Never seen shower gel and shampoo in tiny plastic sachets before either. Breakfast was like going into a canteen. Tables bare, you picked up your food, and cutlery, and found a space....never met this before, either. Lukewarm bacon and beans, dried up sausages and no fried eggs. The strangest thing was NO TOAST!!. Apparently they dont serve toast at breakfast!!! The good thing was checkout was quick, because I couldnt wait to get out.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own eye mask !”
Reviews.Author: Bob 1944
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Giles Hotel as part of a three-night hotel and theatre package. This hotel seems to cater for groups, coach parties, and for individual travellers on a budget. It is in the same massive tower block as the YMCA and the bedrooms and dining facilities reflect some features of a YMCA hostel. The standard of the accommodation is fairly basic – and is substandard in many respects. This hotel certainly does not merit the three-star description, awarded by our travel agency. Our bedroom was very small but appeared to be clean. It provided the basic necessities for a short stay - with an en-suite bathroom, TV, telephone, closet, a safe, and tea & coffee-making facilities. However, there were several holes in the bedding. The tiny bathroom offered a shower only – but no bath. The washbasin taps dripped continuously and the shower had very basic controls only – so the temperature of the shower fluctuated from "rather cool" to “almost warm”. Our bedroom window was triple glazed, which provided good protection against noise from the street - provided we kept the window closed. Our visit coincided with a period of hot weather - so the resulting lack of ventilation meant that our room became hot and stuffy. The only bedding comprised top and bottom sheets, with a winter-weight duvet, which was far too heavy for the month of June. Consequently, we did not sleep very well. Furthermore, our bedroom had no curtains (drapes) – only translucent Venetian blinds, which did not prevent bright sunlight from waking us at sunrise. On a more positive note, we were very happy with the hot buffet breakfast (included in our three-night package). The breakfast room was not luxurious and was often very busy – so guests sometimes had to wait for a table to become vacant. However the rapid turnover meant that the food was always hot and fresh. The quality of the tea, coffee and other beverages was excellent – and far better than in some four-star hotels. The hotel invites its guests to use the YMCA gym, fitness centre, and swimming pool complex in the basement. Not many hotels in this category offer leisure facilities of this calibre – and the charge of GBP3 per person (which covers the entire duration of the guest’s stay at the hotel) is very reasonable. The facilities at Hotel St. Giles are rather similar to a Travelodge or other budget chain. However, the nearby Travelodge is not prepared to offer luggage storage facilities following checkout. Hotel St Giles is happy to provide secure luggage storage for up to 24 hours, free of charge – which can be a major bonus, particularly if a visitor wants to explore London following check-out. This is a mixed review. Some aspects of the hotel were good – others were very disappointing. However, the location in the West End of London is ideal for a theatre package, shopping, and sightseeing. So would I stay there again? Perhaps – but only if the price was right! And I would certainly recommend the use of an eye mask – to compensate for the lack of bedroom curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with problems but I could stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Isopor
Reviews.Content: The plus side: the most important thing is the excelent location (room over the back streets are less noisy). Prices are ok (their website is the best bet), breakfast is plenty and quite good. The minus side: very small rooms and bathrooms (shower room in fact), unwelcoming, a bit too old, over used. Rooms tend to be hot (I went there in June) and there was no bed sheet (only duvet). I had to leave the window open, but couldn't sleep because of the noise. (Then I learned to open the double-glazed window fully, sometimes the door too to let the wind thru, to cool off the room before sleeping.) I have stayed twice at this hotel and I had problems with the staff on both times. I had to wait three days for them to fix a broken basin sink. Also the porters charged us to keep our luggage for the rest of the afternoon (£1 per each suitcase). This was quite unexpected. All in all, we survived. I could stay there again, aware I would be trading comfort for location. The hotel is crowded, breakfast is stressy, there are queues, music elevator is awful :-), the rooms could be better (if they only could enhance their bathrooms.), but you save a lot of time in getting fast to London main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Price, Good Hotel, But Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You need to be careful sometimes when you are in London because you could over pay for hotels that are not as good. For the St. Giles, this is the bottom line: - Location is great, wow .. prime location close to Oxford St and shopping areas, great for folks looking for Computer stuff, dozens of shops next door. - Service is average. - This is a clean hotel, but not very clean, it is not a new hotel, but not bad over all. - Rooms are small, this is what i didn't like - The hotel staff are friendly and helpful, if you had to check out, you could leave your stuff at the hotel - No A/C in the rooms, that I did not like at all. There was a fan. - If your room face the street, it is very noisy all night, try to get a room away from the street - there is a bar that is open until after midnight, nice ... - Internet access available in the lobby with HI-FI but it is expensive, better to check internet cafe across the street for GBP 1.00 / hour. - Ideal for young people who enjoy dynamic and active time in London - The best way is to book online because they put very good prices on their website, better than going through an agent. But, please note the online price does not include the breakfast, you will need to pay GBP 10.00 or better yet, go across the street. - This is a busy area in London and there many places to check out, within walking distace. 2 Borders stores within 5 and 15 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on 15th May 2006. I had a single room which was more like a shoe box, the room was on the 6th floor and the floors were like a rabbit warren. Breakfast was basic to say the least. Would definately NOT stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, great gtm”
Reviews.Author: belmontdon73
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on 22nd May and it's a case of somethings are very good, and some things are very bad. The staff are very friendly and the location is very good. I paid £78 per night through my company's deal which is great value for central London. My room was clean as was the hotel, although it could do with a little refurbishment. The gym / swimming pool / squash court / cliimbing wall / badminton court area is really good. It appears to be part of a larger gym that happens to be attached to the hotel. You have to pay £3 to use the gym but it's worth it. Not so good. The queues. I know you think 'so what, I'll wait 10 minutes max'. However, the queues were always really large (10-15 people) when I was there. My room was dark with no central light, only lamps around the edge. Also, I had no bath, only a shower. As with most central London hotels it was was pretty small too. Overall, a good price for an OK hotel in a great location (with a superb gym)

Reviews.Title: “Greaty hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and after reading other reviews we were not expecting it to be very good so here is our opinion. The room we had was clean and tidy and the bathroom was fine. We did not hear any noise on a night time, but then again we were sensible and took earplugs! . We did not have breakfast in the hotel as we found some really nice cafe's nearby which and we did not fancy the hassle of dining with 600 + guests . Basically If your looking for a cheaper hotel in a great location and a hotel where you are not going to spend a lot of time in your room this is the place to go. The staff are also very helpful. On the eating front there are some good restaurants and pubs near the British museam which is only 5 mins from the hotel. I would definatley go back to the St Giles.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, But Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: Sonogal
Reviews.Content: I agree the rooms are very small and not all rooms are the same size. We had 3 rooms and one was twice the size for the same price. This was our first trip to London and did not know if the quality of the room was what we were suppose to expect as we are used to rooms in the US. Given that, the breakfast was included in our room as we booked on line and who can pass up a free breakfast. Different types of food, but it is a different country. The LOCATION was what made us book and it is very close to the subway. If you are going to use the subway (TUBE) alot, this is a great location. Alos beware that a family of 4 has to have 2 rooms as they do not have rooms with 2 doubloe beds, and you pay extra for a double bed verses 2 single beds. (I have never been a shower quite that small......don't drop the soap, because you will have to get out to bend down to pick it up.....!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: LittleOl
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent and all theatres etc. are within easy reach. The rest of the hotel is basic to poor. The rooms are extremely small (not much like the pictures on the net). They were slightly smelly - the towels were extremely smelly. The bed was vaguely comfortable. The hot water tap in the bathroom did not work at all and any water drained away very slowly. The shower was powerful and quite good. Breakfast was average and the pipes in the drinks machines were dirty so the drinks weren't always fresh. There are vending machines on every even numbered floor but the one on my floor didn't work! The area is generally noisy and the police etc. went screaming passed the hotel day and night. Generally for the price there are much better hotels in London and if it wasn't for the location I wouldn't really have much to say.

Reviews.Title: “At this price, people should stop moaning!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St. Giles last weekend. Let's be pragmatic: look at the hotel's website; look at the reviews on this website; look at the price. Now, it doesn't claim to be the Dorchester or the Carlton Park Tower, nor does it say that rooms have air conditioning or that they are so many square metres. I really feel that with the St. Giles you pay your money (what - 75-95 GBP per night) and you take what you get. Yes, the lifts are slow. Yes, the breakfast room can be a little crowded - but there is a notice in the foyer that refers to this... Yes, the rooms are small (but see above). Yes, they might be a little warm (but see above). But come on, folks. For this price, what on earth do you expect?! Important factors are cleanliness: you can survive a little heat, but maybe not the embarassment of an attack of the dreaded bedbugs and the attendant red spots. I'd rather stay in a clean room, and the St. Giles provides. Look at the location, my friends. And if you want to be in the centre of things, you'd be pretty naive to think that even double-glazing could drown out all noise. Yes, perhaps the staff may have been a little surly during other members' visits, but in my experience they've always been quite helpful. Yes, I know, subjective...!! In summary, if you want to pay more, then fine. I'd agree that you would expect more from the rooms costing £100+ per night. But for the price and the location, the St. Giles, cannot really be beaten. And no, I don't work for the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Neither quiet like booked nor comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a quiet and comfortable room. What I got, was a very small and rather old twin room with uncomfortable beds and a noisy ventilation of an air condition a view floors below our window, stopping at midnight. Then you heard late and loud guests on the hallway till after 2:30am. The breakfast Food quality was intermediate, but the options poor and the atmosphere was like in an Youth Hostel. I had better hotels with less stars, and I also had exellent hotels with 4-5 stars in German hotels in Munich and Hamburg for less money. Over all I must say: never ever!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but tiny bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: SianP
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel in December and postion is ideal. The bedroom was really tiny and the street noise was very loud during the early hours. Would stay there again at discounted price ie Laterooms etc because of its location but attitude of check-in staff left a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: michellin
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel on our first trip to London back in 2003. The room was nice and clean but very very small and with no airconditionning. We managed to stay there while there was a heat record in london, the temperature outside was about 100 degrees...the temperature inside our room was even hotter due to the lack of airconditioner and the fact that the window wouldn´t open more than an inch or so, although i don´t think it would have made much of a diffrence if it could have been opend more as it was so hot outside as well. The exterior of the hotel is really awful, it´s just a big gray building, the inside is alot better, the staff is friendly and the service good. The ice machine was broken during our entire stay (4 nights) but you could just bring the ice bucket to the bar and they´d fill it up for you. Breakfast was good, they had most everything you could want from a breakfast buffé. We ate at the hotel restaurant one night and the food was excellent and the service was great. The best thing about this hotel though is the location because you´re quite literally right in the centre of everything, oxford street is just around the corner and there are several tube stations close by to take you anywhere you want to go. I´d defenetly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, would definatly go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Gemmyl0u
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from the St.Giles and i thought what a really good hotel and good value for money. I took my mom and sister for their birthdays. We only stopped one night but i thought it was more than adequate. The breakfast room was busy but we still found a table and had a lovely breakfast. The location is brilliant, about 2 minute walk from Oxford Street and the West End. The staff were polite and friendly and i havent got anything bad to say about the hotel. I would definatly go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is ABSOLUTLY DISGUSTING! check in was odd but quick our bags were snatched out of our hands. as we made it up to our room the hallway smelled of tea rose perfume, if that wasnt bad enough, upon opening our door the room had an overwhelming and putried stench of urine! The breakfast offered was terrible, and gave my girlfriend diarrhea for 2 days. London is great, but this hotel is beyond AWFUL!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sillymidoff
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the St Giles Hotel in London and it was one of the best hotels i`ve stayed in. It`s situated just off Tottenham Court Road so it`s a fantastic location, restaurants and Oxford Street on the doorstep as well as the Dominion Theatre and Tottenham Court Road tube station. The hotel itself is huge and spotlessly clean. Our room was a triple with a double bed plus a pull down single bed in another walled off area of the room which is handy. We had 2 tv`s, tea/coffee and all the stuff you expect like phone guides etc and other nice touches like a dry cleaning bag provided. The bathroom was also spotless, shower lovely and in there they provided soaps/shower caps etc and even shoe shine wipes. The room was lovely and warm and a pleasure to go back to after a day of shopping and sightseeing. The rest of the hotel is wonderful, the bar is excellent and modern and not very expensive and the breakfast room is huge, always plenty of clean and vacant tables and the food is out of this world! Absolutely the best hotel breakfast i`ve had! They offer so many choices and it`s all cooked to perfection and you can eat as much as you like. All the staff i came across (from bar staff to reception/concierge) were really friendly/helpful. I honestly can not recommend this hotel enough, it`s simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great location not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: NB1957
Reviews.Content: This is an hotel that I stay in very frequently due its proximity to an office that I regularly work in when visiting London. The location is very good for the West End and various sights, British Museum 5 mins away. On the down side the check in can be slow, the piped music in the lifts is infuriating (in over a years worth of very regular visits I still get the theme from Titanic which I wish would go the same way as the ship) and the single room makes a shoe box appear spacious. On the plus side, for London it is very reasonably priced (shop around), the location as I have said is excellent, breakfasts are pretty unimaginative but filling and tasty and the rooms always well maintained. I suppose that as I have become familiar with the local area I have become much more comfortable with the hotel. If you want a reasonable price and a great location the St. Giles fits the bill perfectly well.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buckie112
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went on a citytrip to london and selected the St Giles because of its location and pricing. St Giles is a decent budget hotel. Don't expect to much luxury. We knew the room was going to be small, and it was, but it was not a problem for us. If it is for you, don't go there. We did not eat in the hotel, so no opinion about that, the same for the pool & fitness which we did not use. We were there to explore london, not to swim. And for exploring London, St Giles is a super starting point. Underground stations are nearby so you can easily get everywhere. Lots of stuff to do within walking distance (picadilly, leicester square, theatre district, ... heck, the hotel is practically on Oxford Street! ). So if you're looking for an affordible hotel that is centrally located to visit London, St Giles is a good choice. If you're looking for luxury, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and good price”
Reviews.Author: louchie
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend stay at St Giles hotel. The location was fantastic (we got it through expedia which was the cheapest - £70 per night for a twin room). Its about 2 minute walk to Tottenham Court Road tube station within walking distance of Oxford Street!!! The room was slightly noisy (but only to be expected as it is on a main road), its not too noisy just traffic going past! The room was small and the shower was rather small as well but the price and location more than made up for it and I would definately recommend this hotel if you're looking for low budget central hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Returned today, every bit as good as we expected!”
Reviews.Author: dramaqueen86
Reviews.Content: This trip was a special treat for my mum, who celebrated her birthday while we where there, and my auntie, who I took as an xmas present for her. As I am a poor student, I couldn't afford to spend in the range of thousands like some people may, this was the cheapest, and my thought was "we'll be out most of the time, just using the room for sleeping" this was just a 2 night break. The location couldn't have been better! Someone even complained about the noise on one review! Well you can't have both! You can either have a busy location or peace and quiet. I didn't experience any problems with noise! And had 2 peaceful sleeps! On night 1, we went to see the lion king in the lyceum, that was amazing! The breakfast was nice. I have been to london before, but my mum and auntie hadn't, so I knew what to expect, although they had a full cooked breakfast. The staff All brilliant and willing to help! we where right in the middle of everywhere, and couldn't have got a better deal!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay at St. Giles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend just got back from a week stay at St. Giles. After reading some of the reviews here I have to say I'm quite surprised. This hotel was great! The staff were so friendly and helpful and assisted us with a smile on their faces. Hugo's restaurant was terrific and the staff there was the nicest one I've ever met. If you go there, please say hello to Johnny and Giovanni from Eva and Sonja, the Icelandic girls. The bar was excellent, friendly staff and good drinks. Yes, the rooms were a bit small but clean and the sheets and towels were changed every day. The maids were soooo nice and helpful and offered us coffee in the morning. When we left some of the staff followed us outside to our taxi to say goodbye. We'll definitely be going back next year to meet them again, so lovely. Come on, you guys who are complaining about the noise. This hotel is situated in the center of London, and London is not a small quiet city! Everything is within short walking distance; restaurants, shops (Oxford Street), clubs, cafés, a netcafé and some tourist attractions. I'd reccomend this hotel to everyone who's looking for a nice, cheap hotel. The location is great!! Of course, it's not the Hilton, but I found it lovely all the same. I'm looking forward to going there again.

Reviews.Title: “A big fat No for customer service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a budget hotel in the heart of the West End, this hotel serves as a good location and is handy but for quality of customer service, room, cleanliness and general hospitality then it would be best avoided. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION... The one saving grace for the St Giles is the location, which all said and done is bang slap in the middle of the West End, with both Charing Cross Road and Tottenham Court Road a brisk 5 minutes walk away. Tucked neatly away on Bedford Court, the hotel does serve its purpose well for tourists on a tight tight budget or for overnight business stays, though I am not sure I would consider this hotel for a romantic weekend with a musical and meal! A taxi ride to Euston Station is about £5 which is good value for money in anyones book. ROOM WITH A VIEW? The worst room I have stayed in in a European city EVER! It is simple as that. London rooms are never large or spacious so my expectations were not high however... Single bed, pokey window that barely shuts out the road noise, a bathroom no bigger than a rabbit hutch (don't even look at the shower tray) all in a prison cell space no more than a broom cupboard. A big disappointment after walking the many miles around the warren of corridors in trying to find the room. Good, power shower doesn't make up for lack of space, comfort or cleanliness though. Saving grace is that there is a hard bed to fall into after a day away from the room! No incentive to stay more than the night hours require. I assure you you will want to get up and out asap in the mornings. FOOD FOR THOUGHT... Breakfast was ample, with a warm buffet choice of full english or continentental if required. Staff were preoccupied and didn't offer anything other than to point me in the direction of a table however. It is a free for all when it comes to food in the mornings and the queue is quite substantial between 8.30 and 9.15 so get in early. The restaurant and bar areas are both very modern with reasonable prices, plenty of seating, good lighting and a nice atmosphere. The evening staff are much more friendly, welcoming and service oriented than the morning staff though. IF I COULD OFFER YOU ONE PIECE OF ADVICE THEN... Only deal with reception when you have to. Very disorganised, not particularly welcoming and not forthcoming if there is an issue with room, rate, booking etc... Not at all customer focussed. Additionally, the lifts - going up no problem, nice and swift. Coming down (you are in a rush to check out with luggage or for breakfast) - forget it - 20 minutes is not unexpected from the 7-8th floor and even then it is tough going (the Titantic tunes don't feel you with confidence!). Take the stairs, sorry, risk the emergency exit stairs which are unmaintained, concrete and more akin to a public NCP car park than a London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “St Giles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the St Giles in London. After reading some of the posts I thought it worthwhile to add my two cents. While the rooms are a bit small compare to American standards, I found them to be very reasonable for Europe. The staff was very helpful, friendly and politely answered all our (ridiculous) questions. The breakfast was American continental buffet including ham/eggs/bacon/cheese. The hotel is in a great location, easy access to the underground and buses. The rooms were clean and reasonable quiet considering we were on the back side of the elevators. The entrance was brightly tiled and provided a warm reception, even though there are a few steps to climb (as one review mentioned) which is very common over there, besides the concierge offered to carry our bags which we politely refused since we could use the exercise! All in all I was very pleased would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad, bad, bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel oct. 2000. It is sad to see that nothing has changed to the better: "Stay here if you like tiny rooms, rooms with no air conditioning, no ventilation, front desk personnel with attitude, bellmen with attitude, and having to carry your suitcase up and down 6 steps just to get into the lobby. There were only two good things about this hotel... the location and one very helpful concierage-- the only staff member who knew how to smile and be of assistance. I read the other reviews and was ok with no A/C but didn't realize that there is no ventilation and a tiny little window which lets in noise and hardly any air. Even the doorway to get in your hotel room is tiny. Bathroom does not have any type of vent either so it is very claustrophic. I stayed here at the end of September so I figured it wouldn't be too warm without A/C. My mistake because it was cooler to stay outside of the hotel!"
