This is one of the few hotels I have visited where you had to put your suitcase on the bed to be able to open it - there was simply no other place! This was a business-trip, if I had payed myself I would have been very upset.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinebound
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you like tiny rooms, rooms with no air conditioning, no ventilation, front desk personnel with attitude, bellmen with attitude, and having to carry your suitcase up and down 6 steps just to get into the lobby. There were only two good things about this hotel... the location and one very helpful concierage-- the only staff member who knew how to smile and be of assistance. I read the other reviews and was ok with no A/C but didn't realize that there is no ventilation and a tiny little window which lets in noise and hardly any air. Even the doorway to get in your hotel room is tiny. Bathroom does not have any type of vent either so it is very claustrophic. I stayed here at the end of September so I figured it wouldn't be too warm without A/C. My mistake because it was cooler to stay outside of the hotel! We would get back at the end of the day and the room was like a sauna. On the 2nd day we realized that our room safe did not work so they said we could place our things in the hotel safe. When we went to retrieve it they said the person who could open the safe was not around, and was told "do we really need it now?" We had to wait a couple of hours to get our things at which time I requested a room with a working safe. After being here for 3 days, suddenly, our key did not work. My friend waited in a long line at the reception to get some help and when he told them it did not work, they just reprogrammed it. No apology for our inconvenience, no reason why it happened. Just another irritating task for them. After spending 4 nights at this hotel I can only guess that the staff must really hate their jobs. I've never seen such hotel staff that doesn't greet you, smile, or show any type of personality. Of course, the exception was that one concierge staff member. I couldn't wait to leave this place. Proceed with caution.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service - ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awful, awful, awful. We had to move rooms twice as the triple room we booked didn't actually excist and they tried to put myself and my 2 female friends in the smallest, pokiest room I had ever seen, it had 1 double bed and a single bed which folded out of the wall. There wasn't even room for our bags. It took over an hour to get a different room, which was only marginally bigger than the first and had a single camp bed wedged beteen the double and single bed. The rooms were dirty, hot and smelly. The staff were rude, arrogant and unhelpful. The hotel was filthy, with food on the carpets by the lift which was still there the next day. What more can I say except......do not stay in this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not brilliant, but not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: GMG74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not luxurious by any means. The rooms are small (but most rooms in London are), there is no air conditioning, the wing that we stayed in was looking a bit tired and the sound proofing (or lack of!) means that you can often hear other guests arriving back to their rooms late at night. However, it's cheap, very clean and in a great location. The staff were friendly and efficient and towels and sheets were changed every day. In general I would say that it is value for money, but understand that you will get what you pay for. You just have to weigh up what you want from a hotel in London, given that you probably won't spend much time in it. One thing to avoid is the breakfast. The food itself was fine, but at weekends the queue's are ridiculous and when you do eventually get your food, you most likely wil not get a table.

Reviews.Title: “Location vs Other Factors”
Reviews.Author: RiverCherwell
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews before staying in this hotel. I have to admit that almost all of them reflect a true picture of what this hotel is like. No air-conditioning(considering it's August!), long queues for everything e.g. check-in, lifts and breakfast. However, considering I was paying 67 pound (incl. breakfast) and I was staying in the middle of london, it's a good deal. Good Side: 1) location (Just beside Dominion Theatre, 2 Mins to nearest Metro) 2) a small but tidy and clean room 3) low-mid range budget Bad Side: All those mentioned before. Overall, even in August, my stay in St. Giles was still satisfactory. I will definitely consider to return again.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is - Clean, Cheap, Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: babair
Reviews.Content: We picked the St Giles based on location first, then price, then the reviews. We were pleasantly surprised to find that it is a nice, modern high rise hotel about 15 minutes away from Heathrow. The staff was very nice and got us checked in quickly. My colleague got a handicapped accessible room and raved about its size and ammenities. My room was average, probably on the large size for Europe, but not for a modern hotel. We enjoyed a very palatable dinner at the hotel dining room. In the morning, the cab reservation that I had made the previous evening wasn't there. The staff really ran around frantically for about 15 minutes trying to find me another way to the airport. They were completely freaked out, so I was able to relax. The only downside to the visit was that the cost of an overseas phone call was about 20 times higher in the room and lobby than it had been anywhere else during my visit to the UK. I still don't know why. But it would be advisable to buy a phone card down the street and make your phone calls elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, Noisy, and Smelly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The good: Location, price, breakfast included The Bad: No ventilation, window opened 6 inches with no cross ventilation even with the door propped open. Ask for a fan IF you dare stay here. Since there was no ventilation, the room smelled of the last occupants alcohol and smoking laced sweat. It permeated the carpet, matress, and headboard. Only after 3 days did it abate somewhat after I placed scented soap cakes around. The Ugly: Since there was no A/C and no ventilation, the window had to stay open. This location is known for the street hooligans who party all night in front of Virgin MegaStore, so we asked for a "quiet" room. Our backside 8th floor room was unfortunately over the hotel's Hugo's Rotisserie Bar which was open past 3AM on Friday and Sat night. Most Brits drink in front of the pubs since its too hot inside and it sounded like the party was in our room until almost 4am. Do yourself a BIG favor and DO NOT Stay here under any circumstances. It is the worst hotel in all my world travels including the Barrio in the Phillipines.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited the St.Giles for just an overnight stay, for which my employer paid £89 for bed & breakfast. On arrival the male receptionist for whom English was clearly not his first language had trouble finding my booking and called over a female supervisor who was very helpful. My booking was on file but neglected to include breakfast as requested. However, when I showed my copy of the corespondence sent to the hotel by my employer the booking was changed. Check-in was very slow, which was surprising as I was being attended to by a senior member of the team. As mentioned by other reviewers the lifts take forever to arrive which seems strange as there are about six of them. My swipe card stubbornly refused to open the door to my room so after 5 minutes of trying I returned to Reception where the supervisor reprogrammed it. Being told there was "no problem with the card" whilst watching her struggling to get it recognised by the card reader was irritating but she was polite throughout and the card finally worked OK when I returned to the room. Frankly my room was the smallest I have ever stayed in and although it was clean enough it had seen better days. The coffee provided comprised two sachets of Nescafe, two of whitener and one small plastic stirrer (no spoon). The shower was great as it comprised a walled-in cubicle and it worked well. The only drawbacks were that it took up one third of the bathroom and the combined on/off & hot/cold control was unmarked and setting it was a bit hit & miss. The restaurant (Hugo's) is in fact a pizzaria, with high prices for unexciting food. To give you some idea of how unimpressed I was, I actually went to the Pizza Hut in Charring Cross Rd for my pizza (which was great!). Breakfast at the St.Giles is 'buffet style' and whilst the surroundings are tatty and the food produced on the conveyor belt principle there is plenty of choice and you can help yourself to whatever content and volume you require. I won't be visiting the St. Giles again as I have spotted better hotels in that area recommended on this site. However, I found the St. Giles staff I met to be helpful and polite, and the location of the hotel is ideal for the High Holborn area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Twitch
Reviews.Content: The only thing they have going for them is the great location. My wife and I were with a group and when we arrived the hotel was working from an old list, so after some twenty hours of travel we found ourselves without a room temporarily; not necessarily their fault but they were smug about it and seemed to enjoy our predicament. Over the next three days of our stay, a mysterious charge would appear on our bill that we would have to refute daily. The concierges seemed to have better things to do than accomodate guests and their silly questions, the rooms were cramped and hot, little items like replacing a light bulb or clearing a slow drain in the sink were impossible to remedy, the ice machine never worked and the bar staff became surly about filling ice buckets, the vending machines took our money, the list goes on. I will never stay here again. Thank goodness I did not have to use my credit card because the front desk is so incompetent that there is no telling what havoc would have been wreaked on my credit line. I would gladly pay more or accept a less advantageous location.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Markyboyt
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from one night at the St Giles hotel and have to say i had no problems with it at all, hotel is great, easily in walking distance of euston station as well, location good. We stayed at the St Giles as result of the london bombings changing the date of the Queen + Paul Rodgers gig at hyde park and our hotel being unavailable to accommodate us for the following week. No problems encountered with rooms, staff or anything all clean and well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and the breakfast was lovely. Your allowed to eat loads. The room was small and the hairdryer older than the Queen but was clean and cosy. definatley worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: Horty
Reviews.Content: Having read previous terrible reviews, I have to say that it really is not bad at all. The room was on the smallish side but I've been in smaller. The room was clean with all the amenities one would expect. The breakfast was excellent with a wide choice. The location was superb. You have to bear in mind that this hotel has over 600 rooms and is in one of the most central spots of London, so breakfast will be busy and there may be slight noise, but please give it a break - it doesn't say its anything other than a tourist hotel, and is excellent value. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: bigu09
Reviews.Content: The St. Giles is located near Oxford Street, Covent Garden and Soho. Very easy to find good restaurants within a walking distance, as well as going to the theaters. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff friendly. Some rooms are rather noisy, but then you are right in the center. The only drawback is that it is very big and you may have to wait to find a table for breakfast. The breakfast buffet is very good. There is a fitness and a swimming pool which we did not have the time to use.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, location was excellent, only a few steps from the Dominion Theatre and Oxford Street and Tottenham Court tube. Short walk to Leicester Square and all many attractions. Breakfast was reasonable although the breakfast room was very busy and difficult to get a table sometimes. We learned to go earlier rather than later. On the negative side we found the room quite small and hot over the warmer months. Quite noisy overnight with roudy people and rubbish collection. The worst experience was the staff at the gym and pool. I wouldnt say it was the worst place we have stayed, it was adequate given the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad - great location”
Reviews.Author: Luvtoholiday
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this site regarding St Giles Hotel, I was a little concerned about what kind of hotel I had booked. My daughter, her friend and mother, and myself stayed there over the May day weekend and it wasn't that bad. First impressions were very encouraging. Reception staff were very helpful and polite. We were able to check in, but as our room wasn't ready we could leave our luggage at Conciere, foc, so that we could be luggage free to shop! The lifts were okay, but there was the odd foreigner who pushed their way in front, instead of waiting like the rest of us. The rooms were small, but adequate for our needs - somewhere to freshen up and sleep. There was no hot water in the shower, but a quick phone call to reception, and five minutes later I had hot water!! Nice clean towels and sheets, your own kettle, tea and coffee available in the room. There was a very small window, and because we were on the top floor (floor 12!) there was a lovely breeze to freshen up the room, but no views! Queuing for breakfast was a little annoying. As soon as a table became free some people from the queue would sit at the table, to hold it for their family/group they were with. That meant that those at the front of the queue would have a tray of food, but no where to sit. Why don't people use their brains!! It was just like the Germans putting towels on their sun beds!!!! However, the food was pretty good, and there was lots of it. When we checked out, we were able to leave our luggage at conciere, but this time we paid £1.00 per bag - which was fine considering the convenience of not having to lug suitcases around with us while sight seeing. Overall, great location (5 mins from Tottenham Road tube, Northern line & Oxford Street, central line) and great service. Great location for getting to the theatres around Covent Garden and Charing Cross (Northern line) areas. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The St Giles Hotel in London is quite simply the worst hotel at which I have ever stayed. I stayed whilst visiting London on Business. My company had paid for the room in advance but the staff were adamant that they hadn't. In fact the Hotel charged the full cost of the room to my credit card before I left. When I return to work my secretary had to handle the matter and get a refund. On to the room itself - too much noise from the street below (actually sounded like the window was wide open even though it was tightly shut), loads of noise from inside the hotel too - school kids and students running around into the early hours!. I asked for a non smoking room yet when I got into the room it smelt so bad I had to buy an air freshener! They also mix smoking and non smoking rooms on the same floor so even if you are in a non smoking room you will still smell smoke. I stayed five nights and never once had hot water in my room in the evening. On two days my bed wasn't made and on one day I was given towels with holes in them! I think the lift system is a joke, you can wait ages for a lift to arrive. In short, don't book this hotel unless it has the last rooms left in London and even them I'd suggest you think about sleeping on the streets first!

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: Knight82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in March 2005 with my Fiancé. We booked a non-smoking room for the weekend through Superbreak. The hotel is easy to find and was just 50 yards from Tottenham Court Road Station, and around the corner from Oxford Street. CHECK-IN On arrival we were told that they were re-doing all the locks on the doors of the non-smoking rooms, and that we’d have to have a smoking room, but they’d upgrade it to a bigger room. And they also said that if the room was too smoky, we should call for housekeeping and they’d come to freshen up the room. Check-in was very slow, but we had a British girl serve us and she was very polite. Eventually, we headed off to our room on the first floor. And its true what everyone says…..the lifts take FOREVER to come! THE ROOM Well, the room absolutely reeked of smoke, but luckily I’d brought an air freshener with me! If this was an upgrade, I’d like to have seen what the standard sized rooms were like! The window only opened about 2 inches, as the television was stood directly in front of it! The bathroom was the smallest I’d ever seen! The shower cubicle was built into the wall, so the entrance to the shower was only half the cubicle width! Having said that, the shower was one of the better I’ve used – good water pressure and constant temperature. There were 2 glasses and a basket of complimentary soap, shower gel, shoe shine and shower cap. The toilet roll was cheap and horrible, but I’d envisaged this after reading other Trip Advisor reviews and had brought some of my own along. Also a very old looking hairdryer, but again, we brought our own.We had a kettle with 2 sachets of tea / coffee / milk / sugar etc on the dresser that had a mirror, shaving plug and light above it. We had a cup of tea each on arrival, and when we got back from our shopping asked at the reception for some more teabags and milk cartons, which was no problem at all. (You might want to note that there is a Tesco just across the road from the hotel, and we got some biscuits and snacks for the room when we got back late). There was a full-length mirror in the room. There was also a small wardrobe (one door!) with a safe inside. Bring your own hangers though! The television was a good size, and had several satellite + radio channels. There was no air conditioning and the room being so small got very hot. We didn’t risk having the window open at night as we were situated next to a rooftop. I wouldn’t like to stay there in the summer. RESTAURANT / BAR Breakfast was a complete nightmare! There weren’t many tables available, and the queuing system was appalling! If you wanted to get a top-up fruit juice or hot drink, you had to go back to the end of the queue and wait what seemed like an eternity to get to the drinks at the end of the line. The glasses for the fruit juice were more like shot glasses so we filled up a mug instead! There was a fair choice: croissants, bread rolls, slices of ham & cheese, butter, jam, marmalade, cereals + milk, fruit and fried breakfast. The hot drink machine was better than the normal choice and had tea, coffee, latte, hot chocolate and more. The fruit juices were apple, orange and grapefruit. Once you’d got your breakfast, you had to find a table! You either had to share with others, or wait until a table became available but have cold breakfast. We didn’t have any meals other than breakfast here, although we did visit the bar for a cocktail before going out one night. The bar staff were friendly, although I felt the drinks were a little overpriced. CHECK-OUT We wanted to checkout early, around 10am so we could get some final shopping in before going home! As before, the queues were incredibly long and we decided to post our key cards into the ‘express check-out’ box, as we had nothing extra to pay. We then made our way to the concierge to leave our cases while we went out. We were dumbfounded to be given our collection ticket and a charge for the 2 cases at £2.00!!! I’ve never had to pay for that service before, and was quite annoyed. CONCLUSION The location of this hotel was great. Just yards away from Tottenham Court Station and being so close to Oxford Street made it ideal for shopping and bringing bags back to the room. The staff I encountered were all very friendly and polite. If you are only going for a weekend like we did, and don’t plan to spend much time in the room then this is definitely a good place to stay. I’ve stayed in several other London hotels, and this was no better or worse. If you are claustrophobic or plan to spend a fair amount of time in the room though, or it’s during summer I wouldn’t recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: DublinDubliner
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 day break in London. We were booked into the St Giles for the 3 days but only stayed 1 day! There were 3 of us (myself, hubbie and daughter aged 8 years). Everything was wrong with this hotel. As others have said the rooms were very, very small. We had a suite which consisted of a double bed and behind a partitioned wall a bed setee. The bed setee was so uncomfortable that my very tired daughter found it hard to sleep in. Also the noise from outside kept us all awake. The main reason we chose this hotel was for the swimming pool but when we asked about opening times etc. we were told it was closed for maintenance! We were not told this when we booked it a few days before travelling. The breakfast was an ordeal. A very long queue, sitting at a dirty table, hard rolls, cold food and a dirty mug. The card to open the bedroom door didn't work properly so it was hit and miss if we got into the room or not. After complaining we were offered another room in a quiter part of the hotel with a proper single bed for our daughter. We managed to find an alternative hotel and checked out of the St. Giles. The new hotel (Grange Holborn was 5 star and cheaper than the Giles!) It was Heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Aztec_Blue
Reviews.Content: Reading previous reviews it seems that folks either love or hate this place. I have just returned from a two night stay and have to say that the hotel represents very good value for money. Yes, the rooms are slightly small but that said, ours was very clean and in excellent condition. Visitors need to remember that this hotel is in a fantastic location (walking distance of Trafalgar Square, Oxford Street, Covent Garden, Leicester Square and many more), and the rate we paid was very reasonable given its location. Everything was in working order and to be honest we had no problems whatsoever. The only initial concern was checking in when we encountered a trainee, but hey, we all have to start somewhere, and he was very friendly and very helpful. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel again and in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Crypt With a View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived at the St. Giles, we were informed that all that was available "is a blah blah blah... would you like to upgrade?" We upgraded. First impression: a previous guest must have had a very bad night. The entry door had been worked over by a heavy and sharp implement of destruction. I wondered if "The Shining" had been filmed in my very own hotel room. We had elected to upgrade to a "suite" from god-only-knows-what. The bedroom (the one with the alledged "double" bed) was so small that I could stand on the bed and touch opposing walls with my fingertips. I could (and did) change the TV channel with my feet. Room number 2 of the "suite" would be better described as a crypt, and the single bed a gurney. There was a small table in this room as well as a wooden stool. The hotel was nice enough to leave stationary and a pen on the table. A previous guest had apparently written a heavy-handed note on the stack of stationary, and although the original letter was no longer there, the impression of the despondent writer's last words remained on the remaining leaves. In short, the poor man was NOT a happy camper either. One can only hope that he was granted his final requests. My wife checked the closet for a body but GUESS WHAT! The "closet" wouldn't hold a body, much less our clothing and/or suitcases. The "bathroom"? It was so small that the bathroom door had a cut-out in it so that it could swing inwardly and bypass the sink. I wished that the wall opposite the toilet had similar accommodations for my knees. I have been on small airplanes whose lavatories were luxurious by comparison. Let's put it this way: it would have been easy to mistake the shower curtain for toilet paper. (Okay, maybe not, but the shower curtain was much easier to reach than the toilet paper). The shower? That must have been where that nozzle projected from the wall above the toilet. So much for the bright side. On to the bad news. If you live in the UK and EVER have the urge to visit New Orleans, USA during Mardi Gras, stifle it. You can save a ton of money by staying not in New Orleans' French Quarter but in London's own St. Giles Hotel. Why wait for Mardi Gras? You can do it 24/7/365 at St. Giles! (Whether you like it or not). At night, the street below has it all: freaks, goons, street performers of all sorts and stripe, public debauchery, and NOISE. Virgin Records stages promotions which attracts gaily-clad lads and lasses sporting brand new dermagraphics on various parts of their bodies. And oh, you'll be moved to tears--- literally--- by the morose, mulitply-pierced-dressed-in-mourning Goths. Somebody PLEASE safely store all sharp and pointed objects! The concierges? Well, let's just say that they understand only one thing. I never did determine what that one thing is, but it's probably a word spoken in a language unknown to the live-bearing world. And the pizzeria! Hey, it would have been nice to have had some cheese on my cardboard hubcap. And why did the "bottled" water have a disturbingly sunny look to it? And why wasn't it opened at the table? And why didn't the restaurant have another, UNOPENED bottle of water for us when we asked for one? Breakfast will be an experience of a lifetime (provided, of course, that you survive your overnight stay). When ate at the St. Giles, the fare was interesting. Breakfast came in various shades of yellow, brown, and gray, and it had much of the taste and texture of food. It was a correctional-facility buffet-style breakfast without all the frills like forks, spoons, napkins, and elbow room. The lifts: by the time I arrived from the first floor to the fourth floor, I felt that I had aged considerably. The front desk help: see concierge. All for now. Ta ta!

Reviews.Title: “tiny room, great location”
Reviews.Author: rinati
Reviews.Content: The room was TINY, a bit shabby, but clean. The bathroom was very clean. Fine for a stay of a night or two - more than that and you'll feel claustrophobic. Breakfast is nice. The location is great. All in all, worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience, ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would like to say that me and my husband travel a lot thoughout Europe and this means that we have stayed in many many hotels. The experience we had with St. Giles, London was the absolutely worst and let me explain: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August 2003, mainly because it was located in walking distance from the Dominion Theatre. We had a reservation for a double room, great deal booked from the hotel's web site. We were assigned a room that was so small even our luggage was hard to fit. You have to see this room to believe it! Apart from its size the room was so noisy all the time it was impossible to stay in. The bathroom was unusable, it was so small that only a child could fit in there and apart from this there was no water! The only complaint we made, since we were on a "great deal" and couldn't argue much about the room size was about having no water and after 20 minutes the problem was fixed but the water that came out of the sinks was colored brown, it was disgusting! The frontdesk was rude, unhelpful and couldn't care less. It was a terrible experience, absolutely terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reasonable prices (for London), great location, walking distance of all the sights. Like a lot of London hotels though the rooms are very small. Lying in my bed my feet were practically touching the television at the end of the bed. Stepping out of the shower I stubbed my toe on the bedside table. It was THAT small. The breakfast was good though, the staff helpful and the gym facilities good too. Everything everyone says about the lifts are true...

Reviews.Title: “just go for the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not the hotel for the summer months. I was here in August 2004 here and it was harsh during with the summer hear. No air circulation in the room, shower stall had dark stuff in the tile-- I commented this fact to the front desk, but nothing was done. Key card did not work and it took an hour for management to let me into the room. Good thing about this hotel, is that it is close to everything.

HotelInfo.Name: St Giles Hotel London
HotelInfo.Address: Bedford Avenue, London WC1B 3GH, England
